oYrmXCWaIURFThTnpwdgAQ.text: Pork was very tasty, but way too salty.  I hate it when food is over-salted, because there is nothing you can do.  If it's under-salted, you can always add more at your discretion.  In general though, food quality was pretty good.  Cole slaw was not good though.

5oYXpuKE8Hj-QFdhzAFFgQ.text: Can you say FOOD POISONING? OMG last Friday 04/18/2014 we decided to go there for the first time, the service, food and atmosphere was awful. Never would I suggest this place!

h6M55HjF9PJMJ6RYe6gfGw.text: EDIT: So I've been back since my first review. I didn't edit it, because it still wasn't all that great to me.  I got a call from some friends to come out for lunch. "Sure, where to?" I asked. "Midwood," they said. "Ugh. Well, ok," I replied. I went back begrudgingly, but with an open mind to try something new. This time I got the Red Neck Cobb. It was lunch, and I didn't want a sandwich or anything too heavy. The salad was a good portion, with plenty of smoked turkey, bacon, and other goodies on top.  Much to my surprise, I really liked the turkey! Just enough smoke flavor, a bit dry, but very tasty nonetheless.  One friend had the special of "Burnt Edges" with a Dr. Pepper barbecue sauce. This was very good, too. I could tell it might get to be a bit rich, but again another pleasant surprise.  I will go back again and be more open to trying other items on the menu. --------------------------------------   Hmmm, I wonder if I ate at the same place as the other reviewers?  Took the fam there to try it out. Right away I was excited because the service is great!  I ordered the small bbq plate, with mac & cheese as my side. Well, for $9.95 I expected more. I got a very small portion of bbq, 3 very tiny drops of hush puppies, and an appropriate size of mac & cheese. (Is this the americanization of large portions in me to expect a bit more? Perhaps...) But truly I don't think it mattered. I was unimpressed with the bbq.  Hubs ordered the appetizer wings as his dinner. And he was unimpressed, too. The wings were dry (both in texture and no sauce). I gave him my eastern style bbq sauce to dip them in, and that helped.  However, the surprise dinner we both thought was really good was for the kid - the sloppy joe was really good. (Made with the brisket.)  All in all, I might give it another shot. But only until I see some more yelpers out there saying that the food cost is more reasonable to the portion. And that the bbq has gotten better. Will probably go back for night beers with friends, and maybe some apps (I heard the bacon wrapped jalapenos are good...).  I give the food 2 stars and the service 5 stars.

OBlM2zhC3QnAUjLB59QBQw.text: If it wasn't so expensive, I'd hightail it back yonder. Great portions for just one person (for God's sake, it was big enough for you to be full for supper and have a reasonable lunch for the next day)!

cH-hNyXaVPHcHnYgLuz6Pg.text: The Burnt Tips had me sold.  Everything was really good and seems like a fun little joint but the burnt tips were to die for.

PkqJzhTsIZU4cGDvIoBafA.text: As a fan of all things BBQ and a resident of the Elizabeth neighborhood, I was thrilled with Midwood opened. I wish my enthusiasm for the the place could have been maintained following my 3 meals there.  The food is on point over all. My only real beef is with the BBQ beans which lack the sweetness and bacony flavor that I expect with BBQ beans. There's are mushy and taste too much of green and red pepper for me. The 'cue is solid from the sandwich to the brisket, to the chicken.   Why only 2 stars then? Well, the easiest answer is the service is borderline terrible. While generally friendly enough, they tend to disappear for unacceptably long periods of time and when they do return to grace you with their presence they have usually forgotten something you requested, like a drink refill, or have delivered the wrong food. If you are gonna charge $8.00 for a chopped sandwich I don't think its unreasonable on my part to expect a consistent service to go along with it.   If you ask me, they seem all too aware of their owner and his other success and are resting on their laurels a little bit too soon.

n64fK4pH9NWE9sp-DfTsHQ.text: Smoked chicken wings, Cuban sandwich, as good as it gets!  I could eat this everyday.

GwrHyVWr0nFJJLJKQhHy8g.text: I went for lunch the first time and decided that I would go with the small Carolina pulled pork BBQ and a side of cole slaw.  If you are going to a smokehouse, I thought I should start there.   Delicious!  Finally, good BBQ in Charlotte.  Smoky and tender.  The slaw was good and homemade.  A few tiny hush puppies the size of Tater Tots that were also tasty.  Some pickled onions to set it off a bit.   I got a small platter, and while I wouldn't call the portion generous, it was certainly enough.  But no leftovers :(  Service was very good, quick and responsive.  Friendly and well tended on drinks and checking to see if we needed anything.  I liked the presentation on real plates, vintage retro diner type, a nice touch.    I didn't realize that this was another Frank Scibelli restaurant until I signed on to write a review.   I am a big fan of Mama Ricotta's, Cantina, and Bad Daddy's Burgers formerly Big Daddy's  (great breakfast, if you haven't tried them).  I have high expectations for anything he is associated with.  Midwood didn't disappoint me.   I expect that it will only improve as they settle in.  I can't wait to try the rest of the menu.    We were lucky not to have to wait to be seated, but as more folks discovered this place sometimes there is a wait.  We sat outside at the picnic tables under umbrellas, which was really nice.   Bravo..  Maybe I should give it 5 stars after all.  Just for getting the Q right.  Okay - changed.  I originally gave 4 out of 5 only because I hadn't tried more of of the menu and based it  on one meal.   Sometimes I am disappointed because I know the BBQ can be superb, and sometimes it is too salty.  I raised it to five because I realized that since it opened, it is one of my favorite places for casual and the only place I want to go for BBQ.    I say it is the best in the area for BBQ.

uSUtnJhren4_JpIWeox4iw.text: Awesome North Carolina BBQ!  My family and I are down here from Iowa at our nieces wedding and I wanted to experience some traditional NC BBQ as opposed to the traditional sweet and saucy Kansas City BBQ we are used to in the Midwest (which is also awesome by the way).  We did not leave disappointed or hungry.  The service was outstanding and friendly.  The outside seating was great.  The fried pickles left my fried pickle fan daughter impressed.   My vegetarian daughter even crossed over to the "dark side" for an evening with the moist pulled pork dinner.  I must say I am a fan of the spicy/tangy North Carolina vinegar based sauce and the baked beans were the best I've ever had.  Spicy and meaty.  A definite winner!

tlAjMh-J4scQNJYqigHskg.text: Great restaurant, quality food and friendly staff. I highly recommend their food! Consistently delicious food that will not let you down. If you're wanting something specific call to make sure they have not run out because that does happen from time to time.

AnPvjtANvnsq4T5IFxE2_w.text: Got stranded in Charlotte for the night and had to try some BBQ, made the cab ride out to experience it. There is a wide selection of local beers, guest beers, and bottled beers. The food was delicious and the atmosphere laid back. Worth the journey!

TwMxaB21klpjazRA_vo8Tg.text: Definitely one of the best BBQ restaurants I have been to! The brisket burnt ends are amazing. All of the sides are delicious too.

67kU3Rd0-emBFsLdw_yA8A.text: What a great new local restaurant for the Midwood hood. The server explained that the menu will be enlarged soon to offer more vegetarian and healthy meals. But even the way the menu is now is great.   The Saint Louis style ribs were absolutely perfect--very meaty, smoked to perfection, and very tender. The special Plaza Midwood bbq sauce is a perfect compliment. The baked beans were very flavorful. The outdoor seating is very nice, though the indoor seating seems a little cramped. Overall, this was a great experience, and I will be going back tonight for more!

B3cGVkTNb1ObhnNHws5XfA.text: Pros: Good music on radio.They played Todd Rundgren during dinner  Lots of server attention  Decent selection of draft beer  Pulled pork was good  Corn side was good  Portions were large  Cons,  Hush puppies were unbeatable.Awful  Beef brisket was waaaay too salty  Mac and cheese was a fried puck with cheese sauce   Tiny serving of vinegar sauce  Expensive$24 for two meat platter with one beer.NYC prices

JmOGfAzD3h3b8bNIgK7-PA.text: Great BBQ place. Everything we tried was delicious. The burnt tip, ribs, brisket, fried pickles quest dip was excellent. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good BBQ place.

Auqbze7iS3qukgC7kl0x-g.text: Visited here around dinner hours and it wasn't too busy.  Ordered the fried pickles and they were actually the best that I had eaten in quite some time.  Wife wanted a mix drink and she ordered a Mai Tai.  Big mistake, the bartender wasn't at all experienced.  The waiter brought a small shaker glass full of this blue mess.  It tasted as if they just poured the two rums in a glass and sent it on its way.  I asked the waiter to take it back and put it in a bigger glass with some pineapple and orange juice.  When it came back it was sour and did not taste at all like a drink should be.  Told the waiter it wasn't good at all and he did nothing about it. My wife ordered the BBQ sandwich with slaw and hush puppies.  I ordered the small chopped plate with fries and the plate had some kind of onions soaked in vinegar and hush puppies.  This place had to have the worst BBQ that I have ever eaten.  The BBQ was mushy and just didn't taste right at all.  The hush puppies seemed doughy and the fries and slaw were actually good. The atmosphere of the place was cheerful and upbeat.  The staff was super nice.  Too bad the food wasn't all that good.

SM1hEk2lhiEcsxG_ez9hcQ.text: Food was good to great, good beer selection.  Service was great.  had the brisket because they sold out of ribs and burnt ends.  then went back for the ribs.  both were good. I can't give them 5 stars though because the ribs.... something not quite there for me.  good place to go sit outside and just enjoy some good food though.

NViEQnGt6hntiThfY7EDIg.text: I have eaten here 3 times and have enjoyed it everytime. The place is usually packed and the food has been great. The only issue I have with the place is it is a heck of a time to find parking!

vCBODYr2QpeU-jVYAGPZWQ.text: Great BBQ and Service We went here on a very busy Saturday afternoon. Got seated very quickly. We ordered one of the combo plates. It was just enough for the 3 of us. Turkey was a little dry,but the pulled pork and ribs were great. Good sweet tea as well. Everyone was polite and attentive. Parking can be challenging.

O6vuwNZDNsWFw8K_drm5wg.text: This place smells good as ignites your taste buds as soon as you step out of the car. It's that heavenly smell that makes you want to order everything on the menu! Definitely get the fatty brisket and the pork ribs. Burnt ends sound better than they turned out. The combo is a good deal because you get to try 4 items. Easily shared between 2-3 people!  Stop by if you are in the Charlotte area for ANYTHING! They come out with a plate of sauces that are suggested for each of the meats that you order and most of them are DELICIOUS! Restaurant was very full and the tables were very close together.   We sat outside on the covered patio and it was perfect.

0LAHLk5bYH8fbyEjQlYWHQ.text: The fiod was awesome. My first time going friendly staff good vibe. My and hubby went for date night. He had the chicken and ribs and I had burnt ends. We will definitely be back.

rxYiAX4sZF21kJ1nIHdmKw.text: As far as I'm concerned this is the best bbq in Charlotte. The service is great and the food is impeccable!! They also have a great beer selection. Whenever we have friends in town this is one of our go to places.

0l0SYmwhU0DReVqrqoFIvA.text: omg this place is so yummmm. i had a great time. lizzie and the rest of the waitstaff was fanfreakintastic. but the food is off the charts. we never get eats like this up here in ny. this is a destination not to be missed!!!

arlGcnLUvsG63TKCT0k1rA.text: The meat was amazingly tender. I got the giant beef rib and my bf got the pig out platter. We got a lot of meat and it was all fall of fthe bone tender. Even the burnt tips were tender which was amazing and you could definitely taste the bourbon they used in the sauce for it. Even though it wasn't the most flavorful bbq I've ever had it still acquitted itself admirably. The pork brisket was also amazing. Total came out to be around $60, about $30-$25 for each dish + tax&tip.   There is parking in the back and this place is a pokestop haha. Be careful coming on weekend nights though because the line can get pretty long.

zrannHY8RcSpIOF9cyGYMg.text: So worth the hype! Burnt ends, yum. The Mac and cheese is amazing, not flavorless typically barbecue joint stuff.

x6nOneqQ6KFIHPlYMvvfmA.text: My annual trip to Charlotte and Midwood did not disappoint as usual. We had the Pig out and the burnt ends. They were out of this world as usual. I'm am a little disappointed that there is no more fried pickles on the menu. I hope they bring them back.

miGWAGfQPn5cW_PlzrldpA.text: My companion says it's the best BBQ she has had.  The sauces comes warm.  That little touch makes a bid difference.  Amazing bread pudding.  No pic as we devour it.

UZoPAfYIQhnTUiFDMjrI5w.text: Food: the food was good, but way too small for the cost. The restaurant had a large variety of options, yet everything I saw was too pricey for the size of the entrees. Whenever I think of a BBQ joint, I think large generous portions, not 4 strips of brisket and a side for $14. The food was good, but I had to go to ANOTHER restaurant afterwards to be full. I will not be coming back or recommending.  Atmosphere: the restaurant had a good feel to it, very relaxed.  Service: service was VERY slow at first but we were able to get food quickly after ordering.

uYQxC6mRjWKvx7EOYZvqgQ.text: I absolutely love this place. This is my favorite BBQ in Charlotte. Their burnt ends and all of their sides are always delicious, especially their mac and cheese. The salmon is very delicious as well. I have also enjoyed their drinks. The service has always been great and I will definitely return.

pXFvrCKPGNTPt2yBmSeyrQ.text: One of the best BBQ places in Charlotte! Ordered the nachos with BBQ chicken and the pulled pork BBQ sandwich. BBQ is nice and juicy, not dry. Great patio seating and service was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Sandwich
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Chicken Nachos

rllKr0G-uRvXKJgUMzymHQ.text: My first experience wasn't a very positive one. Meals were cold, service was slow. We ordered the popular bacon wrapped jalapenos and they were extremely cold and soggy, not good at all. The only upside to our visit was the manager on duty was very understanding and took off the plates that were cold. We were very excited to try this as we saw many positive reviews, sadly we will not be returning. Def not the best BBQ.

XYZ3UNEsZMcmdR2WpKEuGQ.text: This is where we bring all our guests when they ask for good Charlotte BBQ!

ZJ_3xZ61dlAAseTjWO2rIw.text: My wife and I went here during the week around 8:00 or so and it was still pretty busy, so that speaks for itself with how much folks like the place.  Atmosphere was nice and it was cool to see that former President Obama once even ate here as can be seen by a couple of pictures near the front door.  I thought that was pretty cool too. It was a laid back place and casual attire is acceptable.   As for the food, it was recommended by the waitress to get the brisket since she said it was her favorite things there.  Worked out well because that's actually what I came for and let me tell you, it was some great brisket; some of the best I think I have ever had. It had a perfect smoky taste to it and I enjoyed it without even using any sauce on it since it tasted so amazing on its own. We will definitely be returning and I highly recommend coming here if you are in the Plaza Midwood area and want some great BBQ.

kLdUGh9rrosIQvknChWk_A.text: I have never been to North Carolina before and when the opportunity presented itself to visit one of the barbeque staples in America, I could not resist. After speaking with a few locals on where the best barbeque was, Midwood Smokehouse was always mentioned. On a peaceful Labor Day afternoon, I called an Uber and directed my driver to this location.  After entering the premises, I was quickly greeted and offered the choice of indoor or outdoor seating. I chose indoor seating given that it was going to rain. My waitress came up to me within a few minutes and asked what I wanted to drink. I settled on the sweet tea, one of the most sought after beverages in the South. I large cup of ice cold sweet tea was brought to my table, and I told. the waitress that I decided on the Well-Fed Combination plate, complete with beef brisket, hickory sausage, ribs, hushpuppies , Carolina chopped pork, and bacon wrapped jalepenos. Unfortunately, they did not have ribs today, so they gave me the option of chicken or doubling up on another meat entree. Figuring that I should try all the meats, I opted for chopped chicken bbq.   I was dining alone so I spent a few minutes on my phone enjoying sips of the sweet, sugary iced tea. However, within a good seven minutes, my large whopping order presented itself in front of me. The waitress asked if it was my first time and proceeded to explain the different sauces. I was barely listening as I was salivating over the piles of meat. I dug in and fell in love with the brisket. They gave me a mix of both lean and fatty brisket and the combination of both, literally melting in my mouth, was enough for me to keep eating more. No sauces were required for the brisket. The hickory smoked sausage was perfectly grilled with that snap you would expect with any perfectly smoked sausage casing. The pork and chicken were equally tender, but the beef brisket was the star of the meal. All the meats were a wonderful pair to the collard greens, bacon wrapped jalepenos, and hush puppies.  I'm said to say that I am only in North Carolina for a month, but I will definitely be back for brisket!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Well fed with collard greens, sausage, brisket, pork, and chicken.

3Uw82IHAPstcLe48sN-NrQ.text: Was visiting from Durham, NC and went on a Saturday @6. It was packed but didn't have to wait too long. Obviously a very popular local joint which is always a good sign. Overall good vibe/smells. Staff was very friendly and upbeat. I ordered the Cuban sandwich and my wife ordered the brisket plate. You can get lean, fatty, or mixed which I had never seen before. The waitress strongly recommended the mixed as being more flavorful. I was skeptical that you would ever order meat as "fatty". My wife ordered the mixed and my skepticism proved correct. There was not much mixed about it as it was mostly fatty and inedible. The flavor was merely OK. We had eaten brisket a couple of nights before at Maverick's in Durham that was fabulous; lean, fork tender, and smokey. She was wanting the same kind of experience. Not so. The Cuban was very good however. Wonderful taste, delicious Cuban style bread which they apparently have shipped in from Miami. So, overall would recommend just DO NOT get the brisket.

Ofp7M0sNU4sOBGUTJKkWJg.text: Top spot for Barbecue in the Queen City.  Hands down probably one of the best barbecue in the area. Let's just jump into the food since it is well deserving of the 5 stars.   I ordered the beef brisket that was cooked to near perfection. It was all the juices and literally melted in your mouth. The brisket was not dry and carried a mild smoke flavored. The brisket had a nice smoked ring on the meat. My sides included baked beans and smoked veggies which were nicely prepared. The bake beans were prepared with a nice balance of spice, sweetness and smokiness. The veggies had a nice smokey flavor but still were crunchy and fresh.   My wife ordered the half of chicken and ribs (large portion)!! The chicken was tender and carried a nice smoked flavor (well balance). The ribs seemed to be amazing since she left no visible signs of the once ribs.   The server did a great job being on top of everything and made up for our food being late (free hushpuppies).   But there is one small suggestion that we would like to make; change of ambiance. This involves a lighter dinning room area (more light to dark) and patio area that can provide some shade (yes I know its the south and get over it, but it would have been nice for shade.)   However, the food was overall to epic to give a rating lower than a 4 star.   Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Art work, nice touch
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and ribs

DvFerrvxk1PCCwQ-4x5GTg.text: Had a few dates here a few years ago.  Food was ALWAYS good and wait staff as well.

pXKliGvZLwqZBnaPLSS0aQ.text: Wonderful place to eat and chill! The bbq brisket is a must. Food is great and the atmosphere is even better. Love this place..

fwiGTOOES_a3NPyzpBLtfg.text: Been here several times and it was OK. Somewhat overrated. Tonight the ribs were way, way too salty (maybe they ran out of rub and used salt instead) and it was hard to find the brisket on the brisket sandwich. More like an English sandwich than an American one. We've been coming by here for 18 months and it's gone steadily downhill. I think we're done. We can do better at home.

cOXYE24CyQTlHIVB3DPQzA.text: Why do BBQ joints think that salty and spicy equals flavor.  Let the wood do the work.  We ordered the sample platter and it was disappointing to say the least. The rub used on the ribs was too spicy and had the consistency of sawdust. The fatty Brisket was just fat. The pulled pork was sauteed in cayenne pepper and habanero as well as some kind of mystery spice. (It may have been hippie strength pepper spray). The management seemed very defensive when we tried to ask questions.  The servers seemed ok. All in all we won't be going back since there are many truly good BBQ places around and we don't have to lower our standards by going to Midwood Smokehouse.

QLpBUnYD4nFLArDLjqGhog.text: For all of Charlotte, you cannot beat the barbeque at Midwood Smokehouse. The service can certainly leave something to be desired, but the fare is unmatched. Favorite is definitely the burnt pork ends with Cheerwine sauce with creamed corn and bacon-wrapped jalapenos as sides. Great local craft beer selection as well.

SeJRU4iR8Md8J6OtAB5pjw.text: This was our first stop of our BBQ weekend in the Carolinas and it didn't disappoint us.  We ordered the well-fed BBQ combo and was worried we might not have enough food, but by the time when we leave, we're indeed very much well-fed. We ordered ribs, brisket, pulled chicken and chopped pork. In one word, delicious! or in two words, not disappointed! We even ordered some extra meats to take with us. It's a long drive from home, but we will visit the place again.

kAHhpg606KVGi06C5RCmOw.text: Wow! Had the Carolina Pork with a side of the smoked sausage and Mac n cheese. It was amazing! Tender and oh so flavorful! Had the hot BBQ Sauce on Iran's had the perfect balance of heat and bbq sweetness. Highly highly recommend, a must if your in Carolina!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. So beautiful!!

_VGjHU8rWakVwBQzMSkfmg.text: All I have to say is YUM!!! THE BURNT ENDS ARE AMAZING !! It is so tough to find BURNT ENDS that are done right and these guys know how to do it!! Thank you for awesome food and great customer service.

MxxjhGd0PDp0uX-NJ-XOeg.text: Good traditional BBQ. Plenty of beers on tap. Outdoor patio that's covered and heated. When I was there the smoke alarm kept going off but hey it's a smoke house after all right?!?

_28H9AGSJSqpqSYHH70cgA.text: I've got mixed feelings about Midwood. It's a cool place and I was looking forward to it based on reviews. I was given a gift card which I wanted to use but I didn't know Bad Daddy's and Midwood were no longer connected. So beware. It ended up being more expensive than I would've like to pay. $50+ tax for one plate of BBQ, one salmon, wings and a drink. The wings were good; I'd recommend those. All flats is extra. I ordered the brisket ends with fries and coleslaw plus a side of pulled pork. They don't do combo platters but sides of meat for $3-4 extra. My plate ended up being $22.50. Yikes. The brisket ends were kind of fatty, the pulled pork comes without sauce, crinkle fries were ok, hush puppies were good and coleslaw was plentiful. I ordered the honey/moonshine/tea cocktail. It was good; something I'd recreate at home. I'm not sure why other reviewers are so in love with Midwood. Maybe I just miss the sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends plate - 18.50
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork side
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon plate

znndeUvDmAAj_7jsFW_yaQ.text: Had the brisket with hush puppies and bacon wrapped jalapeno peppers. The brisket was tender and pulled apart with just a fork. Sat outside and really enjoyed the atmosphere. The music playing in the background was good and just the right level.

EHcDtCk7Yr7PoH3P26hV8w.text: What have you been smoking if you haven't given Midwood Smokehouse a minimum of four, but perhaps even a five star rating? I knew the Charlotte area had some great BBQ places, even had a couple of go-to's myself. Well, I thought I did! Until today, March 25th, I realized that I hadn't experienced the area's best BBQ! Midwood does it all and does it well! From the start you notice every server with a upbeat, charming, and eager to get you anything kinda attitude! Mine, Lorilee, was incredibly prompt, charming, and personable! From the time the Smoked Wings hit the table I knew this was special! Ordered dry with sauce on the side, these wings were smokey, plump, juicy, and the best wings in Charlotte hands down! To not feel too guilty, I ordered the Brisket Salad which made me feel ridiculously guilty! Full of tender brisket, smokey corn, real bacon, black beans, avocado, fresh lettuce, and fresh tomatoes! Incredibly good it was indeed! Then came the small Pulled Pork platter which had more meat than I'd first thought. Tender, juicy, flavorful, and though tossed in Eastern sauce it didn't disappoint. The side of Baked Beans had some pulled pork, possible bacon, and perhaps burnt ends in it which made it the highlight of the meal. Yes a side item stole the show which should tell you that they aren't just concentrating on the meats! I regret that I'll never step foot in my two favorites in Charlotte again, but hey, step up to Midwood's game!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork w/ phenomenal Baked Beans!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Incredible smoked wings!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket Salad that&#39;s top notch!

cawN63qjsEYYUUeW2q0ifw.text: I just ordered their new salad with smoked chicken and it was amazing. My waitress kathy was awesome, very personable and knows customer service. I will definitely be back cause of her, if you go here you must request kathy krooz is her full name.   If i owned a restaurant she would come work for me.

1Yrq9doQe2_CgS2iBmi6BA.text: Some of the best BBQ you can find in Charlotte. I always get the Beef Brisket, the small plate, with sweet potato fries and almost am never able to finish it with all the food. The jalapeno bacon appetizer is incredible and is also a must try. The restaurant also has a great selection of craft beers on tap from the area.  Atmosphere is great and not too loud for large groups. If it's nice out, try and find a spot on their outside patio.

kvUvB6VEOqwnm2sWLC1UTA.text: Being from the Midwest I grew up on Memphis, KC and St Louis BBQ and have never really liked the vinegary style of NC/SC q that I've had before. Since I'm in Charlotte I felt like I needed to revisit it and hit up Macs my first night out, got a tip from a local yelper (thx Greg) and made our way up to Midwood.   So I order the sample platter with the choice of four meats, we get the ribs, pulled pork, beef brisket and chicken instead of the sausage. Wife and I got the same meal (almost) at Macs. Can I settle the score? Just like it takes an out of towner to decide between Genos/Pats (it's Pats) Midwood is the better of the two. Not a blowout, but enough to pick a winner, would have picked the sausage over the chicken as neither of us were crazy about it. As people have noted, get those bacon jalapenos as both of your sides. Yowza.  Why not 5 stars? Sorry pal that's reserved for Pappys in St Louis or Central BBQ in Memphis. Midwood is a solid pick and am glad we got to hit it up during our stay here.

muFi9GToQmmhQgcg_SZghQ.text: Excellent value for money in this friendly BBQ joint. It was packed out for our weekday lunch, which is always a good sign. The food took a while to come out but with orders for eight people that's totally forgivable.  The pulled chicken had decent texture but not a great deal of smoke flavor to it - the SC-style mustard sauce had a real acidic hit to it that worked nicely with the meat. BBQ beans were on the sweet side but well-made and packed with flavor. Hush puppies and pickled onions on the side were fine. $8 for this.  I will happily go back and sample more of their meats and sauce styles - they also have 'traditional' BBQ sauce, East NC vinegar-based sauce, and some habanero effort.  This place came highly recommended by locals and I can understand why. Very impressive at a low price point.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled chicken, South Carolina mustard sauce, BBQ beans, hush puppies, pickled onions. Midwood Smokehouse, Charlotte NC

652HuviNrSOoQGDXGMGPiw.text: Found this gem thanks to Yelp it was amazing BBQ, all my colleagues were pleased.... Had a Bee Sting drink with sweet tea and it was amazing. The Collard Greens were some of the best I ever had. Must visit if your in the area looking for BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken BBQ plate!!!!

XwET8r3Cn9FfWu8jA4Ml-A.text: We ordered takeout from here a while back, ordered a large BBQ chicken plate for $12 with mac and cheese and BBQ baked beans as out 2 sides. Ordering was easy, we actually ordered about 30 minutes before closing but whoever answered the phone was extremely understanding and polite. He said the plate would take about 20 minutes to make. We ended up picking up our food 10 minutes after close, they were still very pleasant about it. We brought our boxes home to find a crazy amount of BBQ chicken, score! It was delicious too, the South Carolina Mustard sauce it is tossed it is delish! There was so much, that we used the left overs to make BBQ chicken sandwiches the next day. I wasn't a huge fan of the mac and cheese, it was kinda dry, but I blame myself for ordering so late. I assume it was the last batch of the day. Will have to try it fresh, I'm sure it won't disappoint. The hush puppies were also good as well, love the jalapeno addition, I wish we were given more lol. The large BBQ chicken plate really was a large, the two of us couldn't even finish it in one sitting.   Although, they really need to make it clear that there is red meat in the bbq beans. I was a little disappointed I couldn't eat them. But, we will be back for a sit down because the rest of the food was soo damn good! The salmon entree sounds soooo good. Cheers!

eIraz43knUF1uNOFkBlVIw.text: Unreal. Food, service, ribs, Mac and cheese, atmosphere... 100%  Our server Kathy was nice and fun and playful, but always kept our drinks full and was great with my kids.  The food... wow... we had a Pig Out plate and it fed 4 of us. So so good! And the banana pudding was amazing!

W20VHWexeadICSoAfQDnRA.text: The food is really good and really reasonable.  I prefer the brisket sand which with blue cheese.  I also think their baked beans and collard greens are their best side items.    Mac and cheese was just mediocre.  Beer prices seem normal and service is always good.  I haven't had to wait for a table many times either.  Parking absolutely sucks though.

wLVcw5sHV9fLKoPsg9iIkQ.text: Midwood Smokehouse seems to be the quintessential Urban Bro Restaurant.  Every big business town with lots of transplants has to have at least a few.    The large crowd on a nice Sunday evening was probably about 70 percent male, which sounds about right for a restaurant serving this much meat.  A sizeable minority of the clientele consisted of the following two Urban Bro subspecies:  (1) dudes wearing pressed khaki shorts with overly bright tucked-in polo shirts, loafers without socks, and snappy golf visors (looking like they just stepped off of a Southern college campus circa 1987), and (2) dudes wearing baggy athletic shorts, athletic sandals (with or without socks), and t-shirts with logos from athletic companies (looking like they'd just stepped off a college campus circa 2014).  There were also a small handful of heavily tatted-up goateed dudes with backward baseball caps and wife-beaters (looking like they were trying to channel Fred Durst circa 2001).    Everybody else looked pretty much like normal adults.  To pull in the Urban Bro demographic, Midwood Smokehouse has even more giant TVs than average--most tuned to tuned to sports, of course--than the average meat-centric restaurant.  (But to confirm that we were in a sophisticated urban environment, and not some exurban barnyard, the TVs tuned to all-news showed vanilla CNN rather than Fox News!)  There is also an unwritten Midwood Smokehouse rule that any dude having a beer and/or BBQ solo at the bar, or waiting for a take-out order, is required to have his attention glued to a smartphone at almost all times, with small breaks allowed to eat food or catch golf action on the nearest giant TV.  The music?  Classic rock.  (What else would be possible to balance the various Urban Bro demographic subgroups?)  Besides the social anthropological amusement, Midwood Smokehouse serves up good food, too.  Chopped pork was certainly better than average, although not in the same league as the whole-hog stuff you can get in some small towns in this state.  Frankly, it was a bit salty, and the pork flavor just wasn't all that bold.  (Before you blast somebody with an Ohio address for even daring to talk about NC BBQ, I present the following defense:  I was born in NC, my dad's family is still anchored in this state, and both sides of my wife's family hail from this state.  But at the same time, I don't pretend to be any kind of BBQ expert.  I only justify my right to opine.)  Before we left, I got the impression that the burnt ends are what you get here, but they were sold out when we got there.    More impressive were the sides, which are just an afterthought at too many BBQ places everywhere.  Smoked veggies are a nice idea, and the collard greens were just the way I like them:  leafy, not overcooked, and suffused with plenty of smoky meat flavor.  Because this is a big urban restaurant, serving only BBQ won't do:  The menu also features burgers, sandwiches, salads, tacos, and more.  Decent selection of draft beer, too.  A word to the wise:  The $13 large BBQ plate might sound expensive at first glance, but it is a very generous portion of food.  You probably don't need to go that way, unless you're very large and/or haven't eaten all day.

ZfJF7CUnew1BQTcWTTyISA.text: Burnt ends are the best. This place was one of my favorites when I was in Charlotte

zJhqedp0rGInMenB07QkHw.text: Good BBQ with a bunch of different cuts. Sides are good too.  This is more of a casual dining spot rather than a real authentic, paper plate BBQ place. The inside is really nice the staff is great. In a really neat part of town (Plaza Midwood) so you can walk around to some shops after/before your meal. Combine the food and the environment together and you have a really nice dining experience.

2w9OPDWIZ4Jh_T-_378IdQ.text: Delicious, but not the best BBQ I've ever had. They definitely have some of the best brisket in Charlotte, but that's not saying too much. Their portions are adequate and the price is decent. Their sauces are pretty good. I like their North Carolina BBQ sauce.   It's no Texas BBQ joint, but it's decent.

CqBbp-lzjH47_ZGHSF97YA.text: Be ready to wait in line but the food is great. The bacon wrapped jalapeno's are so good and the Cuban sandwich is one of my favorite things on the menu.  I love the crispy ends brisket but they were about 2/3 fat when I ordered take out and was a bit disappointed. It is a fun restaurant with slightly challenging parking but that is to be expected in that area.

tMDxey7zCm0sRU-Rj9dCdA.text: One of the better BBQ places in CLT.  One of the few that actually have turkey and sausages, and don't rely on pulled pork with gallons of sauce.    Service has always been average, but the food is consistent.

zjsIlu-4npvpwfgTTfuOZw.text: Yelp helped us find this place and --whoooo boy, were we in for a treat!  Ordered the 4 meat + 2 side platter.  All the meats were great.  All the sauces, too.  But here's why I really appreciated Smokehouse and gave you 5 stars.  The coleslaw and hush puppies were fresh, delicious and had some thought behind them.  I feel like with lots of BBQ places they spend so much time on the meat that the sides and (god forbid!) the hush puppies are a ho-hum afterthought.  Not so here.  Bravo.  --Oh wait, but I didn't give you 5 stars and here's why...  The reason you don't get 5 stars from me is because of the kid's food.  We ordered chicken fingers and mac-n-cheese for our 3 year old.  My food philosophy with kids is that they are basically small adults and shouldn't be coddled to with garbage, dumbed-down, obviously-from-a-bag chicken fingers.  You guys clearly respect meat so how's about making something good for the kiddos? --Something less spicy and less seasoned than the grown up choices but still actual good food...not frozen junk.

wW0lkNJsbIrMRNinnxJgyA.text: I ate here a few weeks ago. After moving back South, I've been looking for a good BBQ spot and was not disappointed. I had the Carolina Pork BBQ plate with bacon wrapped jalapenos and mac & cheese. Everything was delicious and the service was great.

RFdh9OFdOKIow8HyYlPOAQ.text: My favorite barbecue spot in Charlotte - and not because of the meat! If you anything like me, you love sides. Mid wood has the option to create a meal entirely comprised of their side dishes (aka my dream come True.) Their macaroni & cheese and baked beans alone keep me coming back for more.

tN_VExgQtGxFY37xCHe8oQ.text: Look, I am someone who actually knows what food is supposed to taste like.  I have read some of these reviews and wow, maybe they have been eating Mickey d's mcrib  for years to have thought this was good bbq.   Ribs came out with almost no meat, it was all like burnt and sauceless.  We sent them back and they came out  A LITTTTTLE bit better.  Sides were good (forget which ones we had since this was a couple months ago).  All in all, sucked and go to BOBBIE O'S on old statesville, it blows away this joke of a place as well as macs or lancasters.  it only seats like 8 people tho and is hot as hell inside so do takeout if u have a few people.

bzHK-RkpCK-bFsMvvvVd-g.text: Great food and great service... the South Charlotte needed a good BBQ place!

hpYUqMcNkpCNgwOQhNvfaA.text: THIS IS THE BEST BBQ IN CHARLOTTE.. I love this place and everything about it. can't go wrong with anything on the menu  Bubba

9LxhPj6t3bgeVGtEn_msvQ.text: How have I not reviewed this place?!?!?!  Well here its; Brfisket Burnt ends with jalapenos wrapped in bacon as your side.  This is a game changer.  As originally frequenting Mac's and Queen City Q I thought i would give this place a shot.  My god thank god I did,  This bbq is my favorite in all of Charlotte.  The burnt ends are seriously out of control.  The ribs are great and so is the pulled pork queso.  Their draft selection is pretty decent offering a bunch of local and national options.  If you want to show your out of town friends BBQ bring them here

iD9PPXkIzkf5vwgG-Tn5JQ.text: I didn't really like this place. The BBQ was cold, servers were not friendly. I wouldn't come back.

1ZKW0z44_mT8-SzdbidfGg.text: Can't believe I'm just now reviewing Midwood Smokehouse. Having BBQ aplenty in Crown Town, you've got competing businesses who want that coveted, smoky place on your palate. I'm happy to say that Scibelli has done it yet again!  The locale on Central Ave is a bit tricky for parking. Pulling into the compact lot amongst other cars whizzing by on their way to Uptown can be a bit of a hassle, but it's all worth the struggle. Parking on the street is available, too. Be mindful of your space. Be sure you don't inhabit private spaces or any of the adjacent businesses lots as it my result in towing.   Venture in to the cozy dining room, patio or rooftop and treat yourself to the bacon-wrapped jalapenos. I can barely muster enough words to describe their culinary beauty. Smokey, cheesy, spicy, bacon-y glory. If you're sitting at a table amongst bacon lovers, more than one order will be required. They go fast.   If you're in the mood for a sandwich, the Superbird is wonderful. Smoked turkey, ham, bacon, avocado mayo, tomato on a texas toast. I'd get it again in a heartbeat.   The brisket is great. You can order a lean plate, if you're not wanting the fattier, yet more tasy, cut.   The sides are where it hits home. Creamed corn that is out of this world. Spot on mac n' cheese, greens like mama used to make and smoked veggies. You can even order 4 as a meal for $9!  Do yourself a favor and order hush puppies, too. Fantastic flavor and crunchy texture paired with their tangy BBQ sauce.   The service is splendid. Friendly, fast, and very knowledgeable of the menu. Great job to our server Ben!  Look forward to each visit. These guys are making a name for BBQ in Plaza! Cheers!

oPVuYhaoliBMBhW2IZxKLw.text: Pros: Quality food and drinks.  Hefty portion sizes.  Excellent prices.  Great decor.  Cons: Waitstaff becomes pushy nearing closing time.

oNf-J9e8ppVVYuzmgH80Tg.text: Delicious with good service and a great patio situation should it be busy inside. But the parking is not fun. Did I mention the food is delicious? There is only one other place in Charlotte that I have had BBQ that can compete with Midwood Smokehouse...and I will gladly keep comparing to see which is best lol

-Ox6AOSN0pPDsmMtk-HF5g.text: I left a 1 star review for the South Charlotte midwood location so I wasn't particularly looking forward to trying out this location.   But my wife and I were shopping in the central avenue area and since we parked behind the building and didn't want to walk far we decided to try midwood out for lunch.    Wow what a difference!  It was very busy so we sat at the bar.  I had the pork sandwich with cole slaw and fries.  My wife had the brisket with hush puppies.  Everything was great!  Fast service too.  We took a few hush puppies home and our dog loved them too.  My only complaint is they don't have a variety of sauces available in self service bottles.   I like to mix and match my BBQ sauces and try different combinations.  That's part of the fun of a BBQ place imho.  Nevertheless, the food here is delicious.   I'll try the other location again since it's much closer.

pRNdN4S-JbGfKaiE9ySpCQ.text: My husband and I stopped here on a cross-country drive that took us through Charlotte.  It was recommended by a friend, and neither of us were disappointed, but I've had better NC BBQ in my day.  The pulled pork was a little too saucy for my taste (not vinegary enough), but the burnt tips were delicious.    The mac 'n cheese gets 5 stars.  I would go back just for that.  The queso with brisket was a little disappointing--tasted like fake cheese.  The service was great--they even allowed us to eat outside with our dog.     Overall, very satisfied with this stop.

pcuQ1xD65EwwfbipH2hodA.text: Decent BBQ spot off of Central that has gotten lots of buzz, it's evident from the crowd and the reviews they're very popular but I didn't find the food to be more than average.  I had the pulled chicken with hush puppies, creamed corn and Texas toast.  The chicken comes with a mustard sauce that was really good and you can't go wrong with Texas toast but other than that there was nothing memorable about Midwood for me.

_w7GJTHQbwl6puMo01K_yA.text: To preface, I don't like southern food that much to begin with so my ratings may be biased. The food was fine.I had the pulled north carolina pork which was good but just a lot of meat. It had good flavor and the sauce was tasty. Highly recommend the bacon wrapped jalapeno's stuffed with cheese. They were definitely the best part of the meal!

YqdmA8loTuUO0YidinAqDQ.text: Best BBq I have had. I've been to other states but NC was where I found mid wood smokehouse . Had the brisket, ribs and pulled pork and all were amazing. they even give you fat option on the brisket.

OAko8dIt9_iBCbuRrO-QmA.text: Excellent food and service. The brisket is awesome , full of flavor . Can't go wrong with anything in the menu .

8mQiYnTUJ4JBaaGDoQ_5WA.text: Yummy food and friendly service. Good value. For your first time, bbq sampler is a good option, but the ribs are the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

QruP77M3JYgoVw4RbIEnwg.text: I'm from the west coast so I was excited to try Carolina BBQ. This place did not disappoint. The pulled pork was great and the sauce was excellent. I just wish it was closer to California.

WUtLFRIIxtIRgQgaL7P9ng.text: Best BBQ/Smoked brisket I've ever had! Plus the sides were just as tasty as the meat! Delicious!   Brisket, smoked veggies, coleslaw and hush puppies.  Service was friendly and fast! Worth the trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

XmuIUKwUEPzyY4OFlWfBrA.text: What can I say about Mildwood Smokehouse other than it is the best BBQ I have ever had. Period. Seriously, we had ribs and brisket... best ribs... best brisket. If you like BBQ and happen to be in NC, come here now. That's all.  PS: The pecan dessert was also amazing and I don't even care for pecans.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

PMVrGCSDTHoaOD9EK99ohA.text: Great BBQ.  Love the bacon wrapped jalapeno app.  Service is always good.  Brisket is my favorite by far.

2rPMXiRLIE4ogP4POsN7jA.text: We stayed a night in Charlotte and naturally wanted some southern BBQ. This place showed up as highly rated so we went! The parking lot was packed but we found parking on the back side of the building. We decided to split the 'Well Fed' combo with ribs, pulled pork, pulled chicken, and brisket. It didn't look like much food at first but ended up being enough for 2. The ribs were definitely the winner of the day. So tender and tangy; bbq'ed to perfection! Next up was the brisket, a little fatty but good nonetheless. The pulled pork was next; very tender and flavorful. I didn't really care for the pulled chicken. It lacked tenderness and flavor in my opinion. The Mac n cheese was delicious! Very cheesy! The sweet potato fries were tasty and crunchy. I definitely recommend giving this place a try. Our waitress was great. The space was great and there looked to be a rooftop deck as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Well Fed Combo for $24.00: 4 meats and 2 sides

b3f-1X4am7RgNyCNUy-LiA.text: Went here with friends a bit ago. I like that you can play corn hole with friends while u wait. The food and smells were fantastic. I tried the smoked wings for something different and they did not disappoint. The wait wasn't terrible especially with the long list of bar items. It's nice that it's so close to my friends apartment that we just walked. Will definitely be back for sure!

vXvCbUf0bSqseBkDPIth1Q.text: Once again, it's All-Star weekend and I have made it a right to ask the people in Charlotte what's poppin for the food here. This time I thought I'd ask an Uber driver and pointed us into the direction of Midwood Smokehouse. The smokehouse in Charlotte did not disappoint! They have some well cooked food here. If you're in town and you want some pretty good BBQ, you can definitely come out to here and check it out. I had the combo with Ribs, Chicken, Sausage, brisket with a side of Mac & Cheese with collards. It's cooked and seasoned well and you will be happy to have tried there!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs, Mac &amp; Cheese, Chicken and collard greens, Hushpuppies

AfzIRquoIZvt4N3O0fyYuA.text: I am in awe that I gave Midwood 3 stars almost 4 years ago. Time to correct that! I must've hit them on the wrong day. Since my initial review, I am a regular at 3 of their locations. I can always count on their brisket to turn a bad day into a perfect one. Bacon wrapped jalapenos are my fave as is the whole entire dessert menu. Check this place out! They have amazing BBQ despite being a "chain" and are consistent across locations.

u4Qnh8bwgRERF_Mdkpx2fA.text: This place is AMAZING!  So good that we actually chose to eat dinner here two times in our four night visit to Charlotte.  The second time we brought two other people with us.    First night we sat inside at a big booth and the waitress was absolutely fantastic.  She was friendly and accomodating.  One of the best!  We shared a big pig out combo platter with pork burnt ends, jalapeno/cheddar sausage, mix of lean and fatty brisket and Carolina pork.  The Carolina pork is actually what brought us to this place to begin with.  Which is funny because the restaurant is more Texas style and the Carolina pork is much smokier with no real mustard/vinegar flavor on the meat itself.  As sides we had bacon wrapped jalapenos and baked beans.  Everything was so good.  The sausage was cold and a bit greasy so we didn't get that the second time.  The brisket is likely the best I have ever had.  The pork was delicious and smoky.  The jalapenos had hard cheese in the middle but were fine.  The baked beans were amazing and that isn't usually something I would choose.  Even the hush puppies that came with the meal were well done and yummy.  I didn't love the sweet tea but it was mild and well made.  The second night we stuck with the same combo platter but tried the burnt ends (as an add on $5 plate), chicken and ribs in addition to the brisket and pork.  The chicken was so good.  I'm actually not a big chicken eater and I wouldn't have even realized it was chicken.  The ribs were also a must get.  So yummy and the texture was spot on.  Tried the mac and cheese and creamed corn, both were just okay.  Had a blackberry cocktail that was good but not worth even the discounted price that night.  Oh, the water was terrible so found I had to order a Diet Coke to have something to wash the food down with.  Second night we sat outside and the patio isn't that nice and the service wasn't as good but it was still an enjoyable night.  One of our friends got the smoked 1/2 chicken and was happy with it.  If we ever make it back to Charlotte you can bet we will be eating here!

O9ZFKegK71vDbJeTc7x3Iw.text: Midwood came highly suggested by our bartender at Birdsong, so we ventured here after a couple of beer flights!   I ordered the Dixie Chicken Salad, and holy moly was it a HUGE amount of food. It's crammed with greens, toppings, an avocado, pulled chicken that was a little dry, and delicious chipotle ranch dressing. The BF ordered burnt ends, which comes with complimentary pickled onions (white, not red, so they weren't my fave!) and hush puppies, as well as your choice of side! He choose bacon-wrapped jalapenos per our server's suggestion, and even though they were tasty, we were only served three small pieces and it left us wanting more. Banana pudding was decent, but I'm spoiled by my favorite in Chicago.   Overall, a total hot spot for Carolina BBQ. I'm not completely sold, but it was better than greasy food after a couple of flights.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small banana pudding
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends with a side of bacon-wrapped jalapeños
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dixie chicken salad

uZ_NKa3ncFTVS-4XWY8OFg.text: Midwood has an incredible amount of hype to live up to. Most people that aren't from charlotte are usually heading here for their first bbq fix. I have come here on several occasions and am thoroughly pleased more often than not. Was let down by the brisket on one visit and they could do some work on their mac and cheese. Other than that the place is great. Decent service. Burnt ends are always my go to so I strongly recommend them. Bacon wrapped jalapenos are great as well as pimento cheese fries with pulled pork. Beer selection is full of local craft. And whiskey selection is good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fleeky hair. Great bbq.

x7jhPxa4-9I57cawCkJ_Vg.text: Y'all.  I can make my own salad here with up to seven (7) toppings. S-E-V-E-N.  This is the spot that J and I can 100% agree on whenever we "don't know what we want/don't care/too lazy to cook/life is insane sometimes..."   I have to say I haven't really ventured far from my SEVEN-topping salad extravaganza. Poor J has to listen to me every time. He's always like, are you done yet?  Midwood is so solid. I absolutely love their smoked chicken on top and have also enjoyed the pork. Service is usually pretty good here, too, which I feel is always hit or miss at a BBQ place.  On the weekends, be prepared to wait. They offer a couple (literally, like 2) brunch options on the weekend, which sometimes I wish was expanded, but I have to remember its a BBQ spot first and foremost, not a breakfast place.  We have also ordered takeout from here for a small group and it was a hit. Word of advice: over-order on the wings...they will be the first to go!  Okay it's only 7:45 a.m. as I write this and I know I just wrote about how I wish they did breakfast, but now I am really just craving BBQ.

zs9lgfjrE6GuV08OnAUw9Q.text: Love love love this place. Their ribs, smoked wings, and El Fuego tacos are my fav. Cocktails are pretty good too!

is0T4EbtEALtnljdXvG4qQ.text: Solid as ever; solid as the others.   Excellent BBQ with delicious sides (highly recommend the beans), topped off with consistently great service...you can't lose at any of the Midwood locations. I love that the experience is consistent across all 3, but the original location in Plaza Midwood holds a special place in my heart, so I'm a little biased.   Beer and drink selection is also great at very reasonable prices. This location is of course still family friendly and very casual. Overall, close to the same atmosphere has been achieves across all 3 locations.   If you are new to the area or need a fix for some excellent Southern BBQ, don't pass up Midwood. You will find that it quickly becomes a go-to spot for you.

bjL_H1kTEuPsKVwj03AEsA.text: Sitting near the heart of Plaza Midwood, Midwood Smokehouse has definitely become the local neighborhood BBQ spot. I love the burnt ends in their Cheerwine sauce... amazing. The side options have never let us down. My girlfriend and I usually order a big salad and the burnt ends to share, it's plenty of food as the portions are generous. They have a bar inside and seating both inside and out (covered).

5lL_9pH3BfQD_b-RwnrLsA.text: Got the combo platter Plenty of food andI has some for later  Got brisket , sausage, chicken and pork ribs Brisket had a good smoke ring good fat ratio and was tender without being dry Sausage was well cooked and tasty Chicken was pulled (not my preference ) but good Pork ribs were the star of the show as they should be Perfectly cooked with good smoke Pulled clean from the bone There were four sauces Mustard which was good a little sweet with good vinegar Midwood sauce similar to Kansas City style but made in house Was good on brisket The best sauce was the  habanero Similar to the Midwood but with a nice kick from the peppers Still it let the flavor of the meat come through Make sure you try it when you come Over all great barbecue Btw I am a former Kansas City and Memphis in May nationally certified judge.

4EDfgr0h1ZhoOFHDzGIqmQ.text: DESIREE was a great server!!! Very knowledgeable, personable and pleasant!! I brought my two coworkers here. Both are from out of town because they wanted some good BBQ. Well let's just say they will definitely be back when they visit Charlotte again!! Everything was amazing!! And we were able to add our names to the wait list via the Yelp app.   Get the burnt ends!!!

sMNRtMY9ivPIlPP689uKyw.text: I'm a fan of Texas bbq, but when you're in North Carolina, you have to try a local favorite, especially when a local friend insists on you going there.   Midwood is different from a lot of the local Texas options.  For one thing, Midwood offers table service and serves their meat on a plate instead of butcher paper.    But the important thing is the food.  The brisket is excellent and would compete well in Texas.  The sauce is tasty and they offer a variety of sauces.  I also liked my fries and hush puppies.  If I had one gripe at all, it would be that the St. Louis style ribs would've benefited from a bit more time in the smoker.   On a final note, our service was excellent and truly embodied southern hospitality.    If you're going to eat bbq outside of Texas, Midwood is the place to eat it.  And I am now a convert to the cause of serving hush puppies with bbq.

cvWIaaIu4Thu37dAZiCEPA.text: Had the brisket and it was so much fat I couldn't eat it!!! Sent it back for the St Louis ribs. They were okay... just okay Disappointed because the reviews were great.  Service was very good and they were understanding of the brisket...

0R7WxfYaXneJRzxphV8tJg.text: Had a taste for some BBQ while visiting and was able walk in and get a table. The food was delicious. We ended up getting a platter to sample everything. W

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

sTz2xKZmxaCTtl3GWTS8uQ.text: I have eaten at Midwood many times and never wrote a review of it before. This past Friday night, I wanted to take my boyfriend to Midwood because it's his favorite place for BBQ. We had a modest wait for a table and were seated and served quickly by friendly staff. The food was excellent (save room for the banana pudding which is amazing) and the server was friendly and helpful. I really can't say anything bad about the food or the service.   The reason I decided to review it this time is because it is the LAST time I will be eating at this location. Friday night, there was no parking, at all, on the Midwood side of the street. We had to park in the lot across the street. This is where things got really dangerous.   We waited and crossed appropriately but a huge, white monstrosity of a truck decided to make a left turn and not yield to pedestrians! I was in the middle of the road and it came barreling toward me stopping INCHES from my body!!! I screamed and dropped my purse literally frozen in fear. I ran across the rest of the street as fast as I could and was barely able to enjoy my meal because of the scare crossing the street. The truck didn't even stop to see if I was okay.  If you plan to eat at this location, plan to Uber or Lyft and don't even think about crossing that damned road with or without a light. I gave this review four stars because the food was excellent but the nonexistent safe parking means I will not have the pleasure of eating here again... but I'm very thankful to be alive and unharmed. #pedestrianlivesmatter

Aty1jHSmo27zU46LGp8wwA.text: The BEST brisket for sure. I stopped by for dinner on a Sunday night with three of my friends, we opted to share two combo platters. Tried the Carolina Chopped Pork, Beef Brisket, St. Louis Style Pork RIbs, and the Pulled Chicken BBQ. My favorites were the Beef Brisket and Ribs for sure. The brisket was so tender and had great flavor and the ribs were fall off the bone delicious! For the sides we went with Collard Greens, Mac and Cheese, Baked Beans, and Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos - all of them were great! Loved the bacon wrapped jalapenos and the collard greens the most. They also have a nice selection of local draft beers. Service was great, a little on the slower side at first, but I think that's because we lagged and took a while to decide on our order. Overall we had a great experience and I would love to come back again if I'm ever in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo - ribs, pulled pork, beef brisket, BBQ chicken, collard greens, baked beans, mac and cheese, and bacon wrapped jalapeños

M9ZBx2P-NYXuMjD93toAhA.text: Since moving to Charlotte, I've eaten here on a regular basis. I always leave happy. If you have time to eat at one and only one restaurant in Charlotte, this is it.

5jTDVmysdZb2Q-K19o7AVA.text: My fiance and I were from out of town and this place had the best reviews, so we thought why not. We had the queso and beef brisket, it was amazing. My fiance had the Texas hash which is their Sunday special. The Texas hash had fried onions, pepper, fried eggs, Texas toast, brisket and avocado. The Texas hash was packed with flavor, the brisket itself was really flavorful in it. I had the half rack of ribs. The ribs were out of this world they offered two different sauces for the ribs, one was a  habanero bbq sauce and then a sweeter tomato bbq sauce it was hard to choose which one they were both really good. For sides we tried the coleslaw, Mac and cheese, and bbq baked beans. However, I would not recommend the Mac and cheese, very plain and didn't really have flavor the noodles were also tough. However, the baked beans were really good. Then we also tried the banana pudding, it was only 2.50. It was amazing, don't forget to try that.  I wish I remembered our waitresses name, but she was really friendly and went out of her way to explain everything to us considering it was our first time. Highly recommend this place. Will come back when we are back in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

KQSrdDXMwWiN0VkIgT3RLA.text: One of the BBQ restuarants in Charlotte ! I had the Smoked Brisket Platter with. Beans and Macaroni and Cheese, it was great. Plan on coming here again !

4Nn-wReMePKryLqkOgBKjQ.text: When you're in the mood for bbq, this place is IT! great service, our waitress was fantastic and the food was good. My favorite was the wide selection of the diff bbq sauces, ask for all of them. The pulled pork was a bit too salty but everything else was cooked really well (ribs, chicken, sausage, etc- i feel like we tried it all).

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs and 1/2 chicken
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 rack

WT8jTLXqxaIfCHr2gT-AKw.text: My wife and I recently visited Midwood Smokehouse. Being non-meat eaters we were not sure what we would find there. We found that they have many options! We started with the Pimento Fries which were very good. We ordered 2 entree's.  One was the Upstrem Salad with Salmon which was incredible. The other was the Hickory Smoked Salmon which I liked very much. It ordered with a side of Mac & Cheese which was pretty good. I like mine a bit more "wet" that what is prepared here though.  The portion size of both the Pimento Fries and Salmon Salad was huge! We could have just ordered these and left satisfied!  Wait staff is very friendly and accommodating. At one point the manager even checked in on us to make sure we did not need anything and that we were enjoying our dinner.   We only eat fish but I can see that this would be a meat eaters paradise!!

J9cKpzx-kul5LJYBdPWbEg.text: Great smoked brisket and pork!  Really great food.  Standard table service.  Nothing special in terms of atmosphere.  I have been here several times and will continue going here for the great food.  I highly recommend for casual, very delicious smoked food!

GTFktyUw00BG-BxDsTKKJw.text: Mediocre at best, as a KCBS judge, I left unimpressed.  Brisket well over cooked/dry and the beef rib did not have a good beef flavor, too fatty and not trimmed well.  The jalapeno poppers were awesome as was the server!

ScH_v5_cqj96xVE0I4L65w.text: I am no BBQ aficionado, but I absolutely loved this place. We went on a really busy Saturday afternoon when the place was absolutely packed by only had to wait about 5-10 mins for a table.  Midwood is pretty huge and they're efficient with service so I don't think you'd ever have to wait too long (unless you had a massive group).  Service was excellent - our server kindly explained everything to us. We ended up sharing the taster BBQ plate and everything was phenomenal but it was ALOT of food. We are big eaters, but it totally defeated us. Most of the meat was spot on- I think the pulled pork was just a bit dry. The burnt ends were really delicious and so was the brisket.   Price was very reasonable and the decor is so fun and eclectic. The whole place has an awesome buzz about it.  Definitely recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

bmlXNufVp1fYEIYybkde4g.text: Here we go...  Got a combo plate. Mixed brisket piece and it was sooooo good. The burnt ends were tasty and didn't feel dry as some others I've had felt. The chicken was nice and had the right amount of juiciness. The accompanying BBQ sauce had a good mix of tangy and a slight spice kick, but not burn your mouth levels. The ambience was nice and the wait wasn't bad, great service and quite accommodating.  The mac and cheese and greens were also stellar sides. This is a spot you cannot miss.  Got it? Good.

VeRZfhGk18bz76u-iF5Zww.text: If I could give an infinite amount of stars to a restaurant this would be it.  Hands down the best BBQ place I've ever eaten, and I try to find the BBQ in every town!  Start with the bacon wrapped jalapenos, or smoked wings in cheerwine sauce, then a pork plate with slaw and ff, then finish it with a pecan cobbler and ice cream. Pure heaven.

Twjy5LAiX4yrSYAwdT_fVg.text: There aren't many BBQ places in charlotte but this place does the job. Nice atmosphere and great customer service!! the wait time on food could be a little better

Q-53DbqYebDBTri2Rl3gOg.text: I'm in South Carolina and I wanted barbecue! So I looked around and came across this place. There's nothing fancy about this place, just straight up Western "looking" atmosphere with lots of wood everywhere and smug paintings on the wall. Thursdays are 1/2 off wine bottles so you know I got one of them! When I come to barbecue places or smokehouse restaurants I ALWAYS get the combo! So here I got the "Well Fed" portion of chopped pork, beef brisket, chopped chicken and hickory smoked sausage. I had macaroni & cheese and steamed vegetables as my sides. Everything was amazing. Fresh, tender, full of flavor, hot and just good. I will certainly come back here to feast!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 4-meat combo. Brisket, sausage, chopped chicken and chopped pork. Steamed vegetables and macaroni &amp; cheese as sides.

x_4nx9L1rb3tA37dQLm6QQ.text: I was not too impressed with our dinner. I thought the meat was a bit on the dry side. I think there are other BBQ places in Charlotte that are better and have way better sides. But that's just me. My husband loved it.

uAtghwhX7g9DnAYVSq9aSg.text: Service, decor, value, presentation, and taste are all 5 stars. My only regret is that I can't find bbq like this on the west coast.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

YzeHVcemTDGnGsmSKaJxbQ.text: Not gonna lie, was not that impressed with the BBQ. Maybe I'm picky about it growing up eating Lexington BBQ.  My boyfriend and I shared the well fed platter where we got pulled pork, smoked chicken, ribs and brisket. Our two sides were mac and cheese and collard greens. The BBQ was a little too smoky flavored for me and the chicken was very bland. I did like their sauces though. The mac and cheese and collard greens were both great. I will say if you're going with someone else, the platter is the way to go. That way you get to try a little of everything. We also started with the hogapeno dip and bbq queso. Neither were anything exceptional.   They were slammed on a Sunday night so we had to wait for a little bit. Rachel took great care of us, and kept checking back to see when more burnt ends would be done since they were out when we arrived. The manager on duty was very active on the floor and visited our table almost as much as our server. You could tell she was constantly helping the servers out and checking on tables.   They had some sandwiches and burgers that looked really good, and I would go that route next time. They also have a great beer list although I didn't partake on this particular visit.   I thought overall the price of everything was high. One small portion of meat and a side for upwards of $11? There are many places you can get a lot more for your money and its just as good if not better.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Well fed platter

HBj4EawjekNMl0ci6XWFag.text: Loved!! Everything was delish. Must get the queso with pulled pork. Loved the tacos. Donnie was such a nice waitor! Everyone is so attentive.

YOqzfqlkp2cyfF0F--gwiQ.text: Can't believe I've never reviewed this place because I've been here so many times in the two years I've lived in Charlotte.  Nothing too crazy here just great BBQ.  I want to say it's the best in Charlotte but I haven't been to that many BBQ spots in Charlotte. It's a lot better than Mac's no master what anyone tells you but I do wish they had a better selection of sauces.  The sauces they have are good but they are more about the meat and less about sauce here.  I've had the pulled pork, ribs, and burnt ends and all were fantastic. Can't wait to go back soon!

6NUHKMfLqoj2Pkw3jfHFag.text: Wonderful staff here..Always Pleasant Experience here,and at all 4 of the Charlotte locations..Elizabeth, the hostess is always smiling and cheerful..She even brings treats to my Service dog,Caine..

Ci_CyT2DI-HlKIkBN6WjGQ.text: This place does not feel special. The Bloody Mary was not that good it was missing flavor and it came out of a bottle. The burnt ends were inconsistent. The bacon wrapped jalapenos were good. The baba sauce on the burnt ends was was solid throughout I would buy just the sauce. I don't think I need to come back here though to many other places to try.

oqB8HQ4wwiUe-Wrkzy47TQ.text: My wife and I were craving some southern bbq/ brisket type food, so we picked this place. We had small sizes of "briskets" and "burnt ends". They were awesome! The briskets were really tender, almost melting away in my mouth. The burnt ends are really burnt ends of the briskets - chunks of meet that are crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Both items came with nice hush puppies. We had bacon-wrapped jalapenos and crinkle-cut fries for sides. The jalapenos were really good. But we didn't like the fries. They were overcooked. Their spicy habanero sauce is awesome!

3Bz0T9UtkLltgNAhDKOFaw.text: This was my first stop in Charlotte after being away for nearly 8 years. The food was extremely tasty, but even better than that, the service was first rate. Our waitress (whose name I wish I remembered) was extremely prompt & courteous with a great sense of humour. Our drinks never got below half empty because she was always just close enough nearby to provide excellent service, without hovering. I highly recommend the "burnt ends" which are not burnt at all, but perfectly cooked to be nice and crispy on the outside whole being tender & juicy on the inside. This will definitely become part of my regular rotation of great barbecue joints in Charlotte. The hush puppies were also fantastic; very well done with just the right amount of crunchy while bursting with flavour. They offer many different regional styles of barbecue, so you're almost guaranteed to find something you'll love. Excellent portion sizes, also. I tried my darnedest, but could not clean my plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Burnt ends&#34; are amazing. The Fat Tire barbecue sauce was perfectly balanced between heat and flavour.

yR-CvKS2nR4zRzFVvTbS3w.text: Brisket, brisket, brisket! And bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers!! Honestly, this place isn't really my first preference (I think twice about eating here even if I'm right across from this place) because I'm not a fan of barbecue and almost everything I eat here makes me feel guilty about introducing my body to so much grease and fat. But my boyfriend is crazy about this place and so I eat here more often than I otherwise would. In fact if it wasn't for him, I probably would have never been here. But when I do eat, I enjoy my meal.  Their brisket (as I chanted before) is really good. You can get it lean or fatty. Of course I pick lean. And my meal is never complete without the fried mac-n-cheese and bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers on the side. The hushpuppies are pretty good too. My boyfriend also loved the burnt ends (I haven't tried those, but I trust his opinion) and pulled pork. I'm not a big fan of their seating. I don't know what it is, but I'm always uncomfortable here. The metal chairs and tables aren't the most comfortable, and patio seating is a little tight.

sS8o7cp3ZQLP9lTPJgGSug.text: This place has some pretty good bbq. Thursday nights is the night to check this one out since they let you bring in 40 ounce mugs and get top offs for anywhere from 4$ to 8$ depending on the beer.   The service here is excellent and as I said the food is good but it tends to get a bit cramped inside. If you are sitting at a high top or the bar you are always getting jostled around but bring on the 40 ounce beers and all those minor concerns will fade away.

n_RdMrN0mIQFSj4Q3gy82g.text: Nice casual atmosphere. Meat & sauce were great- I especially loved the burnt ends. The sides don't live up. The bacon wrapped jalapenos were just okay, and the Mac & cheese wasn't worth it.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I couldn't ask for more from the service.

ttraoS4bctBXMONpWuZLOw.text: We walked in with a group of 10 -- on a Saturday night at 7:45, not the best strategy. But we were seated in only 20 minutes at two tables (6+4) -- probably as good as we could have hoped for. The staff was very accommodating and friendly from the moment we stepped in.  The beer selection was good, solid -- just fine for casual dinner. Our table had fried pickles for an appetizer and they were delicious -- crispy on the outside and cut on the diagonal to give lots of area for dipping.  The barbecue I had was incredible. Their brisket can stand up to anything I've had in a Texas restaurant. I had their signature sauce which was a smoky, sweet & tangy (more tang than sweet) mixture, on a combination of lean and fatty brisket. I was floored by how delicious it was. I also had the bacon-wrapped jalapenos as a side. Do be cautious with these -- they vary in terms of hotness (seeds, most likely). The first I had was mild and the second knocked me for a loop! But totally enjoyable. The collard greens were also solid -- not mind-blowing, but very good. The portions were very generous and there's no way to leave this place hungry after a platter.  A dining companion, in fact, ordered a platter and couldn't begin to finish his pulled pork. He offered me a taste. It was tossed in the spicy BBQ sauce already. I had a few mouthfuls, and they were exquisite. I wish I'd been able to taste with the vinegary NC sauce I love so much -- maybe next time!  The service was excellent and our waitress brought a smile to the table every time she came by to check on our progress and offer refills. I was so full of good cheer and barbecue that I was halfway planning already to come back the next night. Definitely worth a visit for a casual dinner with friends -- I would love to come back next time I'm in town.

ShI8SjESzfcEQmgBRNJYfQ.text: I came here once on a recommendation. Was told they had some of THE best bbq in town. I felt the mac and chz was lacking, the flavors were just not there. The bbq was bland...eh i am just not a fan. I will go to Macs any day before I go here.

5eTiXzncOu4BHPy7VOIXmQ.text: Though touted as a barbecue joint, Midwood Smokehouse in Plaza Midwood has a Chopped Salad that is the dream of this vegetarian; Avocado, tomatoes, corn, lettuce... oh my! I love the fact that I have an option of a yummy salad when my man is in the mood for some pulled pork and bacon wrapped jalapenos.   When a solid salad is on my mind, Midwood is the place I am calling (their pick up window is convenient and parking is never really an issue).   Bravo!

fdCHzNwIVyz9j3ODtKT1OA.text: This place is the best BBQ I've had yet! The waiter was friendly, attentive and informative. The food was awesome and the atmosphere was enjoyable.

eVaPa0_-2h9_-vjc1aYAJg.text: sometimes the service is THE WORST. but, I have dreams about the chopped salad with chicken. SO GOOD. take it from this Memphis girl, this is probably the only BBQ place in NC I will eat.

oHgtzGluh4CfnjSoYng0bQ.text: I went to get the brisket, which is beef instead of pork.  So hard to find non-pork BBQ in Charlotte.  I really enjoyed it, though all I got was the brisket.  I didn't use any BBQ sauce so I can't comment on that either, but the brisket was nice and tender, had a good flavor to it.

P_5WiFSW7-OL4GNCzVOhBw.text: Having tried Mac's, Sauceman, The Q, and Midwood - I'm ready to call this contest for Midwood.  Everything I've eaten there has been beyond belief.  The other places seem to have some issue - too fatty, lack of flavor, too much sauce.  Midwood strikes a perfect balance with the bbq. The sides are also amazing. The only knock is the beer selection - Mac's and The Q have them beat.

sCjHnKbFm4Z8-UUFii0axg.text: Tied w/ Sauceman's for best bbq in Charlotte.
