gxQfAMoaI_MdkyEZcoOLdQ.text: Whatever you do, get the pulled pork on SOMETHING.  ANYTHING.  You can buy the meat by the pound, so consider taking some home with you.  The pulled pork makes for one AMAZING omelet.  Trust me, my friends.  There's a lot to love at Midwood, and some of my favorites are the pulled pork sandwich, pull pork Cuban sandwich, brisket sloppy joes, queso with pulled pork, and the Midwood chop salad with pulled pork and avocado goddess dressing.  You get your choice of BBQ sauce, and my favorite is the Eastern NC.  The mac and cheese and hushpuppies are great as well.

EX4yfya7htTHUzV7fpvcAg.text: Midwood has a good thing going for itself: great food and drink in a comfortable yet casually upscale setting. I came with a group of four, and we happily dined on some crazy good pimento cheese fries and bacon wrapped jalapenos. Another major plus is $2 National Bohemian beers, which goes great with salty and smoky meat by the way. Delivering the knockout punch was my full rack of ribs, which was nothing short of phenomenal. Great stuff comes from the kitchen here and I'd love to come back!

LOQW2xqHrq6m-H89oFgpMA.text: Awesome food!  Great BBQ near uptown Charlotte on Central Ave.

utI8E_MEWr09gkZmEkx6wA.text: Best, tender smokey biscuit I've ever had. The bacon wrapped jalapenos were tasty, and the chopped pork was excellent.

iLZj3JSrpk4jpAFNmMvctA.text: I think I'm finally ready to call this the best BBQ in Charlotte. After having been here a few times I have tired enough different menu items and they were all incredible. The smoked wings are ungodly good. I am not the type that normally orders an appetizer but I got these on chance because we were waiting for a friend to show up for dinner. They were so good that I make sure to get an order and opt for a smaller dinner to fit them in. Not that skipping dinner is any better. I did not see anything special in the pulled pork, though it is pretty good and not too dry. But the smoked veggies as a side are delicious and worth skipping the fries. The rack of ribs is also out of this world and I might start ordering that instead of the pulled pork. It is very flavorful. I'm seriously salivating like a Pavlovian dog just writing this review and looking at my calendar to see when I can next get over there.

IWOHWXRg7yyXkOMWAF5FgQ.text: Really some of the best pork I've had. Very moist, flavorful, and juicy. The taste without the sauce was excellent. I honestly thought the BBQ sauce took away from the pork flavor.   Cole slaw was not good, and the Mac and cheese was very so-so, but based on the excellent quality pork sandwich I will give it five stars.

GeMz9ezfXyWdetcBaBwopA.text: This place smells good as soon as you pull into the parking lot. I have always wanted to try real north Carolina BBQ on my many trips passing thru NC . This being my first time staying in Charlotte my girlfriend searched and found Midwood. We had a combo that was delicious and fried pickles for appetizer (you don't see that in NY). The staff was friendly and the prices were very reasonable.

AE9kcBV3praAEPd-yUjN1Q.text: I had the Carolina pork with fries and bacon covered jalapenos. The pork was very good with the vinegar sauce. The jalapenos were very interesting, I recommend them if you like strange combinations.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

Vt1sVAAs7F-iEMoLH7suKQ.text: We ordered take out so I can not comment on the service. But the restaurant was packed when I went inside to pick up the food. The first thing I noticed was the smell, oh what a heavenly smell. The food was equally good. Very moist meat with perfect balance of spices. My favorite was the yellow mustard sauce, it was amazing. I swear it had cardamon in it, there was something Indian in that. I could drink that sauce, SO GOOD. Whenever I get that rare BBQ hankering I sometimes get, I will return and dine in.

igxHhQpG2TkFKUVvg4Kc0g.text: How have I never been here before??  We went to Midwood on a Wednesday night at 8 p.m. and were greeted and seated immediately.  We were in a bit of wind tunnel because the overhead fans were on full blast.  I then  realized that was a good thing; since they actually smoke the meat, the fans help circulate the declicious smell.  We wanted to try everything, so we split a Well-Fed Combo Platter and got the pulled pork, beef brisket, ribs and hickory smoked sausage.  (I can't imagine how many people the Pig Out size would feed!)  It came with three sauces: mustard, vinegar and the tomato-based Midwood sauce.  The pork and sausage were great, but fairly standard; the brisket and ribs were phenomenal. The ribs fell off the bone, and the brisket was tender enough to cut with a fork.  We also got mac & cheese (great) and bacon-wrapped jalapenos (just ok).  Our server was very attentive and fun, and we rolled out of there miserably, happily full.

PtQCaMBymApcahqFC3iBeA.text: Drove 30 minutes for ribs on Father's Day.  Arrived at 5:30, sat at 6:00.  Put order for apps in.  Then ordered dinner.  Five minutes later were told that there were no ribs.  Brisket was good, but I wouldn't drive for brisket.  Feel like they should've offered free dessert or apps. free.  Won't be back.

S7WyM3SGJ0Te-RDgKu48Nw.text: Wow. This place has great food and good service. Pulled pork was delicious! You have to try the pickled onions they had a nice sweetness to them.

CLLRusJukdw5vRF8CjwR8A.text: The beef brisket is the best I've had in Charlotte.  You can order fatty, lean or both.  I ordered a combination of the two but next time it's 'diet be damned' as I'm ordering all fatty. Oh my goodness - very tender and flavorful with a large enough portion that you'll be all but begging for a doggie bag.  Service was on point.  I'll be back!

8CzyRfRR7gcZngINGvPYaA.text: LOVE this place. Midwood Smokehouse is definitely the best BBQ restaurant in Charlotte. The pulled pork and the brisket are a must try. They have excellent cocktails as well. Try a Beehive!

RjUHk-V6HrOTdKtJ_xM57Q.text: Second time here and tried the app smoked wings and pimento fries with brisket really good! Service is always great, staff is friendly. Will def be back next time in area

JfTP_WXLX_AbBV87CCevww.text: Very good brisket here...nicely smoked, burnt just enough for an excellent juicy flavor! The pork bbq is just as good too, but the hush puppies could be better. Overall, Midwood is on point with their bbq...will definitely go back again!

Y6DnXU_wp38OO_qDveOE3w.text: One of the best bbq joints in Charlotte. I had the bbq sandwich...simply amazing. Fries and fried pickles were good too. Definitely will return.

-EozufJ3Kfi-10LUwC0hRg.text: Stopped here while traveling because we were in the mood for BBQ and we checked Yelp. Fantastic!!! Tried burnt ends and pulled pork and they were terrific. Tried several sides and they were great also. Recommend especially the collard greens, Mac & cheese, bacon wrapped jalapenos.

-VbVUnRHA4zo1T2zHoR4Lg.text: The delicious smells of BBQ when you walk in make your mouth water! The service was very friendly and attentive. The food was awesome!!

UU2tLpBWe2ywUkoJgeyYkA.text: We usually always go on weekends for lunch right when they open, thus we have no trouble being sat in a spacious, comfy, quiet booth.  The service is prompt, polite and never too "in your face" . The smoked wings or the jalapenos are a home run for an appetizer. Then again, everything on the menu is pretty much a home run depending on your taste. The food and drinks are consistently good. The atmosphere is welcoming, not overkill for a BBQ restaurant. All around an A+

kY-SNasx6GzfQm3nJeg_Ow.text: Love midwood smokehouse! The drink specials are great, family friendly yet bar atmosphere works. Try the queso dip with pulled pork.

gLydQrvr2Q35W0yNBS1fRw.text: Always my favorite......went last night.....the bartender w dark hair and dark black rimmed glasses ....I think. She was new bc another girl was telling how to do inventory.....was amazing, very attentive but down to business! Always amazing, maybe not perfect but that's real life people! My fav! Keep it up!

MRIeQt3ET7bnBwYsi6o0Iw.text: delicious but a bit pricy for bbq...im sure thats only because they have to keep up with the plaza midwood rent... great drinks great food great atmosphere! nom nom nom!!!

9ed9AyWe3dCQCp4aVfklvA.text: Have been there several times now and food is consistently good. Especially like the brisket - it is hard to find really good moist brisket.

Z8a2LW34vquPsFTdkkIACw.text: Went again this past weekend and I have to recommend their salad of all things. It was packed with delicious fresh veggies (avocado, corn shaved off the cob, tomatoes, cucumber, red bell pepper etc)  and served with amazing dressing and shredded sharp cheddar...just perfect! I also had the grilled cheese with pulled pork which was pretty much delicious too! All of this was graciously served to us without a hitch during late night hours (10:30 ) making us happy and thankful! Our server was super polite and kept the drinks coming (plus they have slushy ice for their drinks woohoo!)

m19280CYTVYcuCV19PjaUQ.text: I LOVE Midwood Smokehouse. Everything I have tried has been prepared wonderfully.The salads are fresh and all of their dressings are homemade. I love the Salmon Sammie, grilled cheese,(be sure to add the beef brisket) and of course the sweet potato fries..they are to die for!!!  You can split a half rack of ribs easily with another person, the portion is that big! We come at least once a week and have never left disappointed!!

-GIM-mGkQmu32nHSqTyVMA.text: There is simply nothing that is NOT amazing about Midwood Smokehouse. You want the best pulled pork in Charlotte? You go to Midwood. Best bacon wrapped jalapenos I've ever had. The pimento cheese fries are outstanding. Prices are excellent ($8-$12). Melissa Swain is an angel behind the bar. Today I had the Roadhouse Burger but the ultimate is the brisket grilled cheese.

fhAamCvpPkXUQKE3IU55AQ.text: Beef brisket is on point, opted for both (fatty & lean), very tender and has the smokey taste to it. 8oz plate portion with one side is more than enough including the hushpuppies to fill you up.  Sweet potato fries were the best I've had in Charlotte, on the crispy side with sea salt on top were great! The beer list is diverse and the prices are very fair

k7Fh9nBIEfd7I_GvjMkYBg.text: I wanted to give 3 1/2 stars.. my son advised i should have at least tasted the ribs... well, by the time we got there , they were all gone .. This place was just ok to me... I had the mayo based coleslaw, it was just ok, as were the beans .

p4tO4rWikE6p7akeeA97aA.text: This is one of the few places that we never squabble about going to eat. The staff is exceptional always!  We were seated outside and "forgotten" apparently (we don't think/feel that we were), the manager apologized profusely about the mix-up.  She took care of us personally!  We are always full after the entree and never have space for dessert, so we made a special just to do so without a meal once.  Drew is the man and we seek him out whenever we go!

yEqiKgweDdEfSzR6riYI8A.text: I took my Dad here today on his first visit to see me since I moved here! He wanted really good BBQ and I think this place definitely nailed it!   I got the chicken and ribs plate with fried and Cole slaw. It was perfect! The fries were as salty as I love them to be and the ribs and chicken were fall of the bone delicious!    We also started with the jalapenos wrapped in bacon, oh my gosh I would buy those every day if I could, highly recommend them!   The staff was also super friendly, while we did wait a little bit to be seated it wasn't much of a bother.

UuKYKZg712UzcMQ99ExBag.text: Best bbq we've had in North Carolina yet, just what we were hoping for in southern bbq! Everything had that perfect authentic wood-smoked flavor and the sauces weren't even necessary, but took it to the next level of flavor. The brisket was as good as the reviews amped up, moist and smoky more than meaty flavor. Pork and ribs incredible as well. Collards perfectly cooked and not bitter at all. All so worth it, I could go back everyday. Price reasonable for the quantity of food. Service great. Cool mural outside.  Can't recommend enough! All rubs and sauces gf too.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork, ribs, brisket and collards

U8vm6i6WULK4aSeB2hyLxg.text: This place is the bomb!! I love their food! I've gotten take out during the holidays, and I ate in yesterday. Service was excellent! Tom was very knowledgeable and patient, explaining sauces & flavors easily from food to drinks. He was very thoughtful and I can't wait to go back. Even though they were busy, the food came not and timely. The 1/2 roasted chicken, brisket, chopped salad, Mac & cheese, greens, and hushpuppies were fantastic! I just enjoyed it all. However, the banana pudding although tasty didnt seem fresh. The bananas were already gray/brown and slightly slimey...um, yall need to fix that ASAP lol- That's the only reason its not 5 stars. I will absolutely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small chopped salad w/brisket &amp; been goddess dressing
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious tender roasted chicken w/mustard bbq sauce on the side! Everything on this plate was fantastic!

6ita94Gvm0G_Q-woIjJyFQ.text: Everytime I visit the Charlotte area, I have to stop by Midwood for BBQ. Best North Carolina pulled pork that I've ever had. Had the pleasure of having Rachel as our waitress last night. There isn't a better waitress out there!! She was not only very helpful with recommending certain dishes but she also has the best attitude ever! She really made the dining experience so much fun!!

iAWsTwTOjc3dhveyL5kBUg.text: I yelped best barbecues in Charlotte and I think this came up as like number 7 (can't remember) and it was he best choice I made on a lazy Sunday afternoon. I got the dry ribs with the sauce on the side and the bacon wrapped jalapenos. The meat was so tender! The hush puppies were delicious! The wrapped jalapenos were amazing. The establishment looked quaint, but I wanted to sit in the park to enjoy the beautiful day. I will definitely be coming back

ukP2V-tZ5DeJwdtKUOnMbQ.text: So disappointed!  The burnt ends were dry and tough. The side of Mac and cheese was barely warm.

F7ROnijfphupMi5mDMGpow.text: Immediate seating outside and a short wait for indoors.  Burnt ends were great and small portion is perfect size. Suggest to add a sausage for a few bucks more.

zBrVJK7QKIKRByfiVBn3rg.text: Go there. Locals say it is the best and I would agree.  We had the bacon wrapped jalapenos and the combo platter.  Banana pudding for desert was tops.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sampler platter

u9TZf_Lj3OQRcMt7CtqHXg.text: Get your BBQ fix at my overall favorite BBQ joint in Charlotte. I've only been to the Plaza Midwood location but it has brought me back multiple times. The restaurant vibe is less of your old-timey country kitchen and more of a casual-hip roadhouse feel with a touch of junkyard.  The bacon wrapped jalapenos appetizers are usually a fan favorite of my group. I always like to order from the classic BBQ plates section, with the mixed fatty and lean beef brisket leading the way. The more fun and recommended selection is to go with a combo platter to share with a friend(s)! You get to mix it up and find your own favorite taste.  Drinks are plentiful with many cold beers and crafty cocktail selections. There are multiple dining spaces to accommodate for different occasions. Importantly, the wait staff have always been friendly and fun, eager to give you popular recommendations.

08k9TVw0vexsMZ4BA86eQQ.text: Really good barbeque,  nice outdoor seating, and a decent beer selection.  We ordered plenty a ton of food, large combo platter, burnt ends, fried pickles, 5 sides,  and two desserts.  All of it was fantastic.  The burnt ends were the highlight followed up by the ribs. The meats had so much flavor,  which we were told was due to a wood burning smoker that ran 24 hrs a day.  We were told this was one of the few True wood burning smokers in town, which, if True is enough reason to eat here.  As for sides, all great with the stand outs being the super creamy mac & cheese and the bacon wrapped jalapenos.  They had roughly 10 local beers on the menu plus all your standard options. Desserts were good, but not the highlight.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

oTJmymJ-6rEkbxAw4J3J6g.text: After my flight, I wanted some bbq because that is what the Carolina's is known for! Their beef brisket. So I came upon a few restaurants and I chose this one!   Located in a very cute area and with outdoor seating, midwood smokehouse was a cute little bbq place which serves a variety of BBQ items. We first ordered the fried pickles! Which comes with a dipping sauce of ranch dressing. The fried pickles had a distinct taste more salty than sour! But dipped in a side of ranch made it taste better!  I went for the beef brisket and a size (small) 6oz of meat, along with the Mac and cheese! While my bf chose the BBQ tips with two sides, grilled vegetables and the bacon wrapped jalapeno.   My beef brisket was juicy and good but the fan above our table just made my brisket cold immediately! So I had to eat quick! The Mac and cheese was good, came out bubbly and hot! I got to try some of my bf's BBQ beef tips and they were so dry! And hard to chew. It wasn't a good choice . The grilled vegetables quickly became cold and the only thing he liked on the plates were the bacon jalapeno!   Both our plates came with hush puppies too! And they were good, but I was so full from eating the brisket that I could only eat two of the hush puppies!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef brisket with Mac&amp;cheese side!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pickles

plCyzPQTvknGRWz9ssr5cg.text: This is on my list of Charlotte favorites.  Beef Brisket was awesome. Got the half and half (lean and fatty). While the fatty piece was truly fatty, it blended well with the lean to provide a very satisfying taste. Even though I love brisket and BBQ, the large 10oz serving was pretty hefty.  6oz serving of pork or brisket appeared to satisfy my entire party so keep in mind that the bigger platter comes with the extra side so that could also factor in your decision of 6oz versus 10oz or heck - possibly even share a 10oz platter with a friend.  Bacon wrapped jalapenos could easily make an appetizer menu at any bar or restaurant across the country. It truly was the hidden gem on my platter. It wasn't that spicy and bacon wrapped anything.... well, it's just plain cool and great!  Mac & cheese was enjoyable.  Staff was awesome with service & refills. She was quick to make recommendations and the manager came by to ask how we were doing and thanked us for stopping in.  Definitely felt the Southern hospitality at Midwood!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large beef brisket!

x9rFj-Mz5L8QerEo1R_ZCw.text: Tonight was my first time visiting this establishment. I was there with a group of friends. The seating was fast even though our first table was in a bad spot and the waiter was rude. I requested to be moved. From then to the end of the night, service was PERFECT. Our waiter was Erik. He was fast with delivering drinks as well as taking our orders. He was funny and had a smile on his face all night. I ordered the pulled pork with the mac and cheese. Other friends ordered the brisket, ribs, and half chicken. ALL was delicious! Dessert was awesome as well. It was a peaches and cream cobbler! Can you say yum!? I will definitely be going back! Thanks Erik for saving us from the first rude waiter!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peaches and Cream cobbler

sy9PBjuGyAFfXRbyR__Xhg.text: I have traveled the Carolinas in search of the best BBQ.  After stopping here, my search was over.  The smokiest flavor and no fat or gristle.  The sausage is incredible as are the small crinkle cut fries.  GREAT JOB MIDWOOD!!!!! I eagerly await you opening in Huntersville.  Its kind of bittersweet that you are replacing the former SMOKE Restaurant.  I knew that wouldnt last!

urQvwIVU31ukfWYAQFRcwA.text: Tried the smoked wings, pimento cheese fries, moist brisket, ribs, and burnt ends.   The smoked wings have some amazing flavor and goes really well with their bbq sauce. No complaints about the cheese fries.  Moist brisket was the meat I liked best. Ribs and burnt ends were decent but the brisket was the star of the meal. If you've ever had moist brisket from Rudy's in Texas, you'll have no issues devouring the brisket at Midwood.  Service here was great.

ryLZtJLWHNTF5Bx9dBgNNw.text: The burnt ends, brisket, hush puppies, and banana pudding are all really good. The pork, mac-n-cheese, and their sauces are just good.  Probably deserves 4.5 stars.  I will definitely come back.

3ysDi_Ws5ZgrfJGGJ6tjqg.text: DEFINITELY the place to go.  Was recommended by close friends, and it did not disappoint.  It has become my favorite place to go. The brisket was awesome.  Staff is very attentive, but the best servers have been Matt and Brian.   Always good service and food.   Small plate seems to always be enough for a good meal, but the large plate is plenty to take  away for a meal later.     Everything on the menu is GREAT.  ONLY draw back is.... Parking can be a challenge at times. Make sure to check it out.

PZWxb2ZNX_anFxNDE6kHhw.text: This used to be my favorite bbq place in Charlotte, but the last several times the pork has been very fatty. Sorry Midwood, Mac's and Queen City Q have you beat. P.S. 3-stars because the beef brisket is very tasty.

gWt5A3c93s_GqpHPhIMIuA.text: great time and wonderful food make this place a great regular spot. be prepared though, it can be quite busy

a9QC0Je3L0eBvPOe836X-Q.text: Wow! Great brisket and the mac and cheese is to die for! You got to check this place out! Service was fabulous and I will sooo be conming back for more brisket!

kaQWQ0fzuDcpwI8onX__SA.text: My parents were in town last night and I live on the east side so I wanted to keep it local and chose Midwood Smokehouse !  Boy am I glad I did...  We had a wonderful dinner !!  Everything was just delicious !!  I dont have time for a long review but I would recommend this place to anyone !  I want to go back for lunch today !  I love east side Charlotte....

vzktZPlDO6Q-fnX_mulRaQ.text: This is a mixed feeling 3 star review because I wanted to love this place so bad after hearing everything about it. I almost want to say a real 2/12 but I guess 3 will work.  First we got a warm welcome, interior is nice, cool looking bar, nice tables, overall good feel inside of the restaurant. Our server was cool, yet a bit awkward. He did his job well, but when asked questions about how some of the meat was prepped, he kinda seemed to be caught off guard.  One big thing I learned, which was a huge turnoff for me was that all pulled pork, no matter how you order it (platter, sandwich) is pulled and put right into their vinegar sauce.  Yes, they will give you other sauces with it, but the vinegar still bites right through, and that is a huge turnoff for me, and 3 out of 4 of the people at my table did not order pork because of that.  Otherwise, I got brisket (both lean and fatty) was excellent, sides were all good. My wife liked her mac & cheese. In laws loved their chicken sandwiches though thought they were a bit dry, alas with more sauce very good.  Would I come back? yes. Would I ask more questions about how the bbq is prepped and cooked? yes. It seemed our waiter was a bit confused. But our drinks were filled all the time, and food was delivered and check on is a reasonable amount of time. So he did his job well.

rdsUHuvwFEq4wmm58npThQ.text: Ate there on Mothers Day and NO WAIT for seating or food this time! YEA! I got the Cuban sandwich (I AM Cuban, from Miami) which was a fair sandwich for being done in NC, but NOT a True Cuban sandwich. Still, it WAS tasty and huge and the bread (which waiter told me is flown in daily from Tampa) was the best! I got the coleslaw as my side...decent slaw, not vinegar, not milky type. My son got the pork plate with mac n cheese and slaw sides. He is a strapping young man, hungry...and the portions filled him well. We got one of the bacon wrapped jalapeno appetizers and they are decent, too. Ours were cold when served, but tasty and I will go by and get them 'as a meal' from now on. Their margarita is tasty...enough alcohol and good tasting mix. Son got two different beers, one the Blue Moon, the other I didn't sample as I was driving. We'd sat on the patio in the evening before it got dark...nice! We'd go back again. I did notice that you can get a plate of sides, differing amounts, and I often eat strange like that (gastric bypass past). That way I'd have several meals of several healthy foods, but I'll be a regular bacon wrapped jalapenos peep IF they'll cook them to order so I get them HOT.

FKlkGpLTbOhctjn2F-9VsQ.text: I'm not a carnivore who likes to eat in mass quantities btw but this place isn't half bad. I ordered the sausage plate and picked from my man's beef brisket -- good stuff. We finished the plate with no problems. The small plate was perfect . . . scared to see what the large is. The collard greens were not bad either. The little tater tott things were tastey.

otKBxp4oqpJvTEwe8GvAng.text: Great barbeque, sides are ok, A little pricey

bZyK9XPaXgo6c4SNUojtPQ.text: Midwood Smokehouse was good! I went there with two friends a few Fridays ago. We ordered fried pickles and a wing special for appetizer. We also ordered bourbon slush (not quite sure of the name) drinks. OMG drinks were so delicious! I didn't try the wings, but the fried pickles were good.  For dinner I had the brisket (I ordered 'both' - fatty and lean). Brisket was SO good. My friends ordered the BBQ chicken and the pulled pork. The pork was a bit disappointing, not sure if it was the sauce we didn't like but it just tasted a little off. The chicken was good, but the real standout was the brisket - I'd definitely recommend that. We wanted to try to the banana pudding but we were so full after all of the food. So, we will have to return for some pudding and ribs!

tHpaAGfro-n_9k8Ywrlf5Q.text: Went to this place BECAUSE of all the yelp reviews, so had to come share our experience. First off our waiter, John V was amazing! Knowledgable, personable and on point! He recommended the bacon wrapped jalapenos for an appetizer, they were awesome! I don't do spicy and I truly enjoyed these. He then explained the different meats and how everything was prepared, so we ended up ordering the pig out ( I think that's what it was called - 4 meats, 2 sides ) we got the pork, chicken, ribs and brisket, along with the Mac and cheese and creamed corn John recommended. The sides were phenomenal!! The chicken was beyond fabulous, second I'd say pork, then ribs and finally the brisket - all was great, but not being a big meat eater I'm a bad judge on the harder ones. Also not a fan of NC BBQ "sauce" - but it was good here, very mellow. Sadly Sunday early afternoon became VERY busy so our pecan cobbler never came out, so after waiting so long we canceled the order. Love this place!

hMV9n4moD9zDCBS-5RjDPw.text: My husband and his work peeps always went to downtown Charlotte..well, now that I've shown them Midwood Smokehouse...they won't be going downtown for a while! Love the atmosphere, decor and ambiance of the place; the owner came by to check on us. Entire staff was so friendly! Every bite we had was great, thanks Yelpers! The waitress improvised a "little bit of everything" platter for the 3 of us, and I have to say I loved the mac n chz, coleslaw and all of the meats. The brisket was a bit more fatty than I am used to here in Texas, but the flavor was wonderful. I am not a sausage person, but those bacon wrapped jalapenos stuffed with "conglomerate meat", as I call it..were very good! Fried pickles hot and crispy; perfect partner for a drink! The men had beer, but I had a special "Tea" they made (its on the drink menu), and loved it.  We will Definitely be back to Midwood Smokehouse and enjoyed sitting outdoors.  This entire neighborhood is full of cool bars and places to eat.!

3lxgFHyUSvQWeoIf64iPhw.text: This is a fantastic restaurant with terrific staff, wonderful food, and a great atmosphere, all for the right price.  I took my family here (small kids included) and everyone came away stuffed to the rafters and eagerly wanting to not only come back, but recommend it to everyone else we know.  If you like barbecue, it's a must visit!

Edh229MjGRA3XYrZJhPphQ.text: I saw that a new BBQ place had opened up and had to go try it.  I ate lunch there on a Saturday just a little before noon.  The restaurant was nice, with an industrial feel to it, but very well done.  It had your standard decorations.  The place is kind of narrow, but the arrangement worked well for the space with a mixture of booths & high top tables.  The do have a deck outside with seats.  There were maybe one or two tables when I got there, so I could pretty much sit anywhere.  My server took my drink order and when she came back I asked if they had any sort of combo platter where I could try a little of each meat.  She said they might and went to check for me.  After a couple of minutes a different server came back and said they don't currently have a combo platter, but he showed me a new menu with it.  It was a choice of 4 meats & two sides.  I chose chicken, ribs, pork & brisket with baked beans and coleslaw for my sides.  It took a while for my food to come out.  When Peter, my server brought it out, the plate was enormous.  It had a  chicken, breast & wing, 5 ribs, a pile of chopped pork & a couple of slices of brisket.  There were also some hush puppies and pickled onions on the plate.  The sides where served in soup cups and there was also a plate with three different sauces.  Peter went over everything explaining the different types of sauces.  There was a vinegar based, mustard based, and a tomato based sauce.  The brisket was sliced thick with a bit of fat in it.  The pork was chopped fine and mixed with a little of the mustard based sauce.  The ribs were served dry and the chicken had some of the mustard based sauce on it.    The brisket was tender and juicy with a nice dark bark on it.  When I first tried the bark I thought it might have been a little over smoked, but with more of the meat it was had a very nice balance.  My only complaint on the brisket was that it was sliced with the grain instead of across it.  The brisket was cooked long enough that it was still tender, but cut correctly it would have been better.    The pork was awesome!  Very tender and moist with a nice flavor.  The mustard sauce was a nice compliment to the pork.  I tried some of the vinegar based sauce, but didn't care for it as much as the mustard based.  The ribs were a little undercooked, but still tender enough with a nice flavor.  The ribs would have been much better with about another hour or two of cooking.  The chicken was tender and moist with a good flavor.  Nothing too special about it, but it was still good.  The baked beans had a nice flavor and had pieces of meat mixed in with them.  They also had chunks of onion and pepper.  There was a seasoning, like oregano or coriander, but I couldn't put my finger on it.  It was a different and I couldn't quite decide if it worked on not, but it must have since I ate most of them.  The coleslaw was meh, but you don't go to BBQ places just for the coleslaw.  The service was awesome here, Peter noticed when he brought my food out that the brisket had some fat on it so he brought a plate with some lean brisket, a little more pork and a slice of sausage for me to try.   I've tried a lot of the BBQ places in Charlotte since I've been here and Midwood Smokehouse is at the top of the list if not the best.  The price was very good for the amount of food as well, $16 for the combo plate.  With the extra meat Peter brought I couldn't finish it all, which is saying something.  With great service and reasonable prices I will be back.

IPRY8PfRDI6MDkVZu2FV6A.text: Well, they were out of sweet potato fries and potato salad before the dinner rush even started (we were there at 4:45pm on a Monday night) and the ribs took darn near forever, BUT the brisket sure made up for it. Best brisket I've ever had! It was worth the other issues. I do wish they'd have done something to make up for the fact that they were out of several choices on their menu.

YMlZETqNiLxgxsU-pUhslQ.text: Grilled cheese with brisket was excellent! And I think they served the best sweet potato fries I've had in a while.  The entire meal is highly recommended and I'll definitely be coming back for more.  Great beer section too!!

HumP8KrY8BxjxkM4aKaEDg.text: for memorial day i realized i did not have any barbecues or anything to go to, so i figured i would go to this place with the boyfriend who hates most places that we eat at in charlotte. but he didnt hate this place. this is why:  1. bacon wrapped jalapenos. you can get them as an appetizer or as a side.  2. dollar beer, or two dollar beer. he likes beer. i dont drink alcohol, im also not mormon, but i mean, that sounds super cheap so thats a good thing. apparently other drinks are expensive but what the hell do i know about drink prices?   3. the super awesome food! which we both agree on. the special was a brisket sandwich and it was extremely good.   other reasons why you should eat here: good service, nice people, they have coke and not pepsi (this is crucial people), it is relatively cheap and there are large portions. there is an outdoor area and on a really hot day the inside was nice and cool. the mac and cheese was very delicious as well!   eat here. my boyfriend ate here and said he liked it and so in regular people terms that must mean its phenomenal.

fWDc5_OXJIQ4MimhTy8QSQ.text: I hate bbq everything. except mcd's bbq sauce on my fries. Midwood blew me away, I tried things I never thought I would and loved them. Our waitress was super friendly. Definitely check it out!

SzdF5TlUP9ExsBZfhgRbUQ.text: This place is GREAT!!!! The brisket melted in your mouth!!! The burnt ends was fabulous!!! So much flavor and the staff was so friendly! Would definitely recommend this place to friends!!! The portions were a good size too!

monOyLgt_unS1vzn9MpelQ.text: BBQ is an acquired taste and everyone has an opinion. Personally I don't care if it comes from the Carolinas, Memphis, Kansas City, Texas or wherever. It just has to taste good. Charlotte has had it's share of BBQ places over the years - some local joints and others where chains. None have really wowed me like Midwood Smokehouse. Out of the dozen or so times I have eaten there it has been consistently delicious. I go there specifically for the beef brisket. It is quite literally the best brisket I have ever had and the kind you think about long after you have finished your meal. I usually get the half and half (half lean, half fat). The flavor of the bark from whatever magical rub they are using should be deemed a national treasure and samples of it should be put in the Smithsonian to celebrate its greatness. The word is out and this place is quickly becoming the hot spot for BBQ in the Charlotte region. So much so that seating has been a problem. But not anymore. They just expanded and opened a new section of the restaurant to seat more people. In a way that makes me sad because I wanted this place all to myself.

V-FcWxTeIFpAYrT-f80ZVg.text: Great local restaurant with NC style and KC style barbecue. Awesome brisket, as well. Definitely would go back. Service was outstanding.

eRz9-BF_2XrZ8moLtVX-pQ.text: To date this is the best BBQ I've ever had.....All the way from Miami! Delicious brisket, scrumptious burnt ends and amazing pulled pork! The combination plate is well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

-rTQ9s6c4KF14sN51NHW9w.text: I like it...wife does not.  It is very popular and can get notoriously crowded, especially on the weekend evenings.  The noise will do you in, which is why my wife will not come again.  And you will have a long wait on those evenings.  I go, usually for lunch, with friends during the weekdays.  The BBQ Queso (cheese mixed with pork or beef brisket or plain)  yum, yum and their version of bacon wrapped jalapenos.  Delicious, but make sure that they really cook them to get the bacon crisp and the cheese melted inside the peppers.  Great appetizers, both of them.  It's a BBQ joint, but they do have salads.  And uniquely, you can build your own salads from their ingredients.   Pretty clever and I never would have noticed except when a friend's wife was a veggie person and she was very happy.  Made me wonder why they were OK doing a BBQ lunch.  The sandwiches are basically BBQ on bread and are pretty common.  The entrees are also the common beef brisket, pulled pork, etc.  One key thing whether you are having beef brisket on bread or on a plate:  you can specify lean, fatty or both.  Nice...however, the fatty are REALLY fatty, having a quarter to half inch strip of fat on your slices.  I know some people eat all the fat on meat; but I do not.  Maybe that is you, so you are safer to go lean or the a mix, especially if you would like a little fat.  There are meat combination plates, which are an excellent option, and lots of sides.  My dad was a mac and cheese aficionado, so he would always go for the mac n' cheese, even as his entree for lunch.  It is very rich and will fill your growling tummy.  Bar is great...just be prepared to wait as it is the busiest place catering to those waiting as well as those seated.  The bar staff is in a constant hustle.  Enjoyable place, when not crowded, so go.  You might see me eating by myself at the bar.

sP3ACPFQCh2X_iCcRuS-aQ.text: Came in for some late lunch on a Saturday at 2:00 and was sat immediately and offered something to drink by the server.   We got a half rack of St. Louis ribs with the dry rub and the Texas hash that was on special. Everything was good. The hush puppies were really little and you only get a few of them. The smoked veggies side was very oily and was nothing special. The ribs were cooked really well, falling off the bone.   The hash came with 2 slices of sourdough toast buttered and was topped with two fried eggs and a half of an avocado sliced. It had great flavor but the brisket was really fatty. The hash is a good greasy breakfast/brunch meal for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

2QM82N0DF52BJb3n1H9jCw.text: Charlotte you have a real gem of a restaurant here. I ordered BBQ chicken. All the sauces were absolutely wonderful. Sides were exceptional! I look forward to visiting here again! Banana pudding was expensive but very delicious (split it with my son). Thank you Midwood for doing BBQ the right way, full of flavors and keeping you wanting more.

7XPdwXzpTcV7yDXvCsEnYQ.text: Ohmygah!!  I came here with my dad when we were in Charlotte visiting my grandmother.  As we explored all of the growth happening in the city, we passed by this spot and the reviews and amazing smells brought us in.   The service = amazing! The food = amazing x 2!!  I had the smoked wings (shared), quesadilla, and smoked veggies (seriously, so good and more adventurous than a salad). I was eating post workout, don't judge me! Lol.   My dad had the pulled pork sandwich and also really enjoyed it.   Use the sweet sauce that they put on the table too, deeelish!   This place rivals every place I've been to in Atlanta!  This is on my list every time I come back to visit!!

cWGQxVhmAwu1yYfSuGgXQQ.text: Take this review with a grain of salt. I have not dabbled in enough authentic southern barbecue.   But I was blown away at the quality of the brisket, both fatty and lean. To my surprise, both (and not just the fatty cut) melted in my mouth. I also order a side of hushpuppies, macaroni and cheese, and bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers. Sides were good, but the definitive star of the show was the beef.   Undoubtedly one of the most unhealthy meals I've had in quite some time. But hey, if it's good enough for Obama, it's good enough for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

C4xSBHHbL8PP0g6Y41ZURg.text: I'm giving this place 5 based on food and service. Food is always consistent and the people who work there are very nice and accommodating. Atmosphere is okay but I don't understand the carpet. Be prepared to wait if you go during peak times but regardless get the Burnt Ends and have a blessed day.

J7wVvG_6loGXJqeRTVIwCA.text: Awesome BBQ. I love the side dishes. The mac & cheese has bacon bits. The collard green is spicy and the baked beans were awesome, too. I'll be back to try the other sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cuban Sandwich

T-PdPkkuEk7GVSnrpH29Lg.text: A Top BBQ in NC. Haven't been to all but this ranks highest. Wayne was great. Great atmosphere. Brisket rules. And the SC mustard sauce.

49HystTX8rf8zG8iP6Y2EA.text: Excited to try this place given all the reviews.  Got on the waitlist on Yelp.  My table was ready but I couldn't be seated without half my party there and my coworkers were late arriving.  The hostess was very accommodating and didn't give away my table.  Service was OK.  Our appetizers arrived before our drinks.  My drink was $3 off for the daily drink special and the contents reflected that... barely any alcohol, and pretty much a cup of crished ice water.  I ordered the burnt ends with Mac n cheese and collard greens.  The burnt ends were really good but the sides were just OK.  Some commented the collard greens needed to be drained as there was too much liquid.  The hush puppies had good flavor and were the perfect bite size.    A big disappointment at the table was that they ran out of ribs while we were ordering.  It was probably around 7:30 p.m. Apparently, they run out of ribs every night.  They smoke meat on a daily basis and sell what they have until they run out.  For those who ordered the combo plate that comes with ribs, they were asked what they wanted in place of the ribs.  My coworker picked burnt ends and then was up charged for it.  They were not told it would cost more and I think it's ridiculous since they were picking something else because what was part of the entree was not available by the restaurant.

cA0c-Pkz0h_f5mIJYD9Dow.text: Hearing how great this place was on yelp and the people who ate here, I was disappointed about this BBQ place. Me and my boyfriend are huge fans of BBQ and have tasted multiple places to get. The wait time wasn't long so that was pretty great. However, it took then a whole hour to take our food out. I was so disappointed because we had to eat so fast. In addition, the food wasn't my favorite. I honestly think the food was ok but not the best I have eaten. The waiter was sweet and ended up giving us a free dessert because of the wait that ended up being the best thing of the night. I wouldn't recommend coming here. Tried:  Pulled pork Cream corn Hush puppies Short ribs Fries Banana pudding

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork, hush puppies, creamed corn, short ribs, and fries

t-f-vQKd3okhS5LcFWCecw.text: So I thought I had good BBQ before but now I really really know I had good BBQ. A short wait for our party of six, we ordered the nachos with chicken for an appetizer. They had a little kick to them! Very tasty!   I took the bartender's advice and got the "burnt ends" which are amazing nuggets of carmelized brisket with BBQ sauce. I am not a huge beef fan but I could be if I had this meal choice available to me all the time. So incredibly tender and delicious. And oh my goodness those BBQ beans! A must have. I also got to try some of my dinner mates collard greens. A first for me. They kind of tasted like spinach with a thicker texture. Not bad! Oh and those hush puppies. I never really had a hush puppy that I thought tasted good. I didn't realize why people even ate those until now!!   The ginger lemon jack drink was so yummy! Great food and great service!  I'm so full and happy right now.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

mLHtwOBOYJW-wjMXBMZoTw.text: Great food and service! My friend and I were in the area and I wanted to show my friend some Carolina style bbq. We came in at around 11:30AM on a Friday and there were already plenty people there. There's two main inside dining area so the restaurant can accommodate quite a few people. We barely waited before we got seated.  We had already had breakfast not too long ago, and we weren't ready to stuff ourselves with more BBQ. We wanted to try some ribs and some burnt ends, but we couldn't combine ribs in the combo option!  Our waiter was very friendly and provided us his suggestions and opinions on the dishes. He had also offered us an option to combine some dishes so we get to try everything we wanted without over ordering. We ended up with the perfect amount of food without having to take any to-go or force ourselves to finish!   At the end of the meal, our waiter knew that we were traveling from afar and probably didn't have enough water (it was also a very hot day). He ended up getting us two cups of water to go so that we could stay hydrated. Great service and great food!

qeQU2fVTzj5NCr_UtQgRyw.text: This food is awesome. Nice location food is distinctively different. Was here 3 years ago. The place has gotten better. Flavors are amazing. We had the Salmon Salad. Chris our server is awesome also. Will come again. 8-16-19 4:30 pm Thanks

_wQBj1rY-jvs3Xpmn6pKyQ.text: Was in Charlotte for a few days so knew I had to try some Carolina barbecue. So glad I chose to come here! Spent about $30 for the well fed plate, and it was definitely worth. I could barely finish, and for me that's pretty unusual! The meats were smokey and juicy, especially the brisket and ribs. The level of flavor was truly incredible. Would definitely recommend checking this place out if you're in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 4 meat plate: double Carolina pulled pork, fatty brisket, ribs, fries, creamed corn and hushpuppies

L77C6_MR62PPHIZCzij0Vg.text: And this is why I am fat. For real. Pimento cheese fries topped with brisket? You have got to be kidding me.  Between the beer, fries, BBQ sampler and banana pudding (yes, dessert too) it didnt take long for me to start hating myself. The only redemption I had was that everything we ordered was shared- but still.  I really love pimento, its a little weird and I think you have to get used to it, but it was sooo good on the crinkle fries. The little char from the broil just made it better, and topping it with brisket put it way over the top to the gluttonous side. So obviously I liked it!  For our shared main we split the sampler, where we had a chance to try their smoked meats along with some sides. The smoked veggies were awesome- one of the more surprising flavors of what we ordered-and I would order double of those next time. I got the mac and cheese as our second side, but after those fries that was way too heavy and too much cheese. Out of the two, the fries win hands down.  Meat wise I preferred the pulled pork and the chicken, though everything was quite good! I've got a thing for banana pudding so if I see it I order it, and I am keeping a mental list of best ones around the country. This one comes in third place! Yum! (Magnolia's in NYC is still in first place, if you are curious).  Everything here was good, but not mindblowing. I was also a little underwhelmed by the service and the bar staff, they were not very attentive (no, it was not very busy). We also had to send two things back, one was incorrect and the other cold (the mac, which made it a bit gloppy and unappealing the first time around). Overall quite good, but not a "must go back asap", for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. banana pudding
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. sampler with delicious smoked veg
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. piggies

EsgXAfEVuI2g_Q0OUpdaBA.text: Great place. Love all the owners restaurants and the chef at the one on Plaza Midwood, Miles, is amazing.   Their mac and cheese with the brisket is a must.

ivB2SUYN_kjrr-Y7TiZTnA.text: FIVE STAR SERVICE, FOOD, BEERS AND COCKTAILS  Emphasis on the service. I have been a server and bartender and it is NOT an easy job. So, when I get outstanding service-I let it be known. My fiancee and I had the pleasure of dining at your Ballantyne location on Sunday. Our server was Briana D. She was on point.   Above average knowledge of the menu. She knew how to suggest, describe and up-sell with class and tons of personality. She accommodated our request to sample a few draft beers before making our selection. She turned us on to all of the specials available to us for that day and talked us into the cornbread with butter, honey and jalapenos!!!  Delicious. She knew the perfect way to order my brisket so that it would be lean, but still have the flavor I was looking for. She checked on us often and treated us like the only table in the place. The overall ambiance is casual and classy with a modern touch. We spoke to the manager for that evening, Dave, who was professional and proud of his team.  KEEP UP YOUR AMAZING PERFORMANCE!!!

0ZGNPfmnT54RZkmlIZ_U6g.text: I've been in Charlotte area 2.5 years. I was told that the food was excellent here. I've been holding onto a gift card for almost year waiting on a special occasion. Well today being father's day and my birthday, I thought I would use it.  I was very disappointed. I purchased to go large burnt end large fatty(which supposedly means 2 ounces more meat and an extra side) which I got mac n cheese and collard greens.  Also purchased small banana pudding. The brisket was tough and it look more like stew meats just meat chunks about 4 oz. The collards are not what I expected, flavor not good.  The portion sizes is small.  I can say the banana pudding was good.

YFVbIy_JXJ1AWtslxCgshA.text: This is one of the best barbecue places I've ever been. The burnt ends were to die for, and the ribs were delicious and perfectly cooked. Great relaxed atmosphere, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half rack with burnt ends and Mac and cheese

NCgR0Z7zSfMXroPJ_Js8vw.text: Ok. This is our first time to NC and we were brought to Mildwood by our family and were told we must eat here. Well, thank goodness because this place is fantastic. We waited about 30 minutes but found out you can do on waitlist on Yelp. This is a must as we here they are always very busy, and for good reason. We had the Pigout and it was more than enough for four people. The ribs were so good and meat fell off the bones. Please get the burnt ends at an add"l $5 as they are well worth it. The sausage infused with a bit of cheese were so yummy. The brisket was buttery and flavorful. I can't say enough about the pulled chicken as it was some of the best I ever had. Soft, moist and delicious. Have whatever sides and you can't lose - crinkle cut fries, collards, mac n cheese, hush puppies were so good. To finish it off and we definitely did bot need it - pecan pie and chocolate cake ala mode were an amazing way to close out the night. You must stop by here. Enjoy!

_RpoVMIlXCN3Zgtj6c8W5A.text: This was not the experience I was hoping for. The bbq I got was swimming in a pool of grease, the French fries were cold, and my order was wrong. Would not recommend.

IrSpPIqTLWzpxfoR7VSMYA.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. They have some of the best tacos I have ever had. The service is always excellent. One of the best BBQ places in Charlotte as well. I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone in Charlotte or visiting

KKmjIzQvPBGoSR53Koao8w.text: Amazing BBQ, especially the burnt ends. I just wish the floor didn't feel like it was coated in Turtle Wax and KY Jelly. I felt like a baby deer trying to walk around in there!

V1Wzov1FBLgsyuTYdK4QKg.text: Great bbq place! Everything we got was great- salmon, brisket, and brisket burnt ends. The brisket was especially good and I would recommend ordering extra hush puppies if you like them. Some come with the meal, but just a handful and they're small.

HKyf0stb3wNxPVfQVVY2_A.text: Man when it's Tuesday, you need to come (or call for take-out) for their smoked turkey dinner. Amazingly smoked and delicious garnishes of cranberry sauce as well as some traditional sides (mashed potatoes of course). The Central Ave (OG) location is my favorite although their smoked wings and Midwood Chopped Salad are always good, regardless of location. Funky vibe, great service and even better food!!

oyJPk4pEPCnJdW_f6UBCGw.text: I love BBQ and get really excited over the idea of some delicious meats served in a unique way, especially in a place like Charlotte, that's known for their BBQ.   After reading a few Yelp reviews I ended up at this place and I was not disappointed. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with great customer service and a lovely atmosphere.   We opted for the Well-Fed combo platter between two of us and it was more than enough food. We got the ribs, brisket, pulled pork, sausage and sides of mac and collared greens. The brisket may have been the best I've ever had - literally unreal taste, melt in your mouth goodness. The ribs weren't far behind, as they were also delicious, smoky, with a dry rub and tasty without being greasy at all. The sausage and pulled pork however, were nothing to write home about. The mac and collared were top notch, but not the best I've ever had - the greens could have used more spice and the mac could have used a second cheese melted on top.   We also ordered two orders of texas toast, which came by the two slices, in huge portions for a dollar. Even though it was a ton of bread, with an already large meal, I'm not ashamed to say I ate it all - it was delicious and the kind of bread that does not make you regret the calories. We ended the meal with some sweet tea and key lime pie - which was good and served in an adorable way.   If you're looking for great BBQ in Charlotte look no further. I'd go back in a heartbeat, but this time just get the brisket and ribs.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

hYLZ4oDv_s1t3B0eY3s6Og.text: The best BBQ we've had since moving down south! My other half and I ordered the pulled pork grilled cheese, brisket burnt ends, the chicken and rib combo plate, collards, baked beans, Mac n cheese, and hush puppies. A lot of food and ALL OF IT was delicious!! I only wish the burnt ends were a bit more charred but everything was just so good. I was full and kept eating! We sat on the covered patio. Our server was very attentive. Whenever we're in Charlotte, this will be a go to spot and will recommend to any and everyone!

4mY9rNdmQ5Y4prwmvrtiqA.text: Never disappoints! Love the brisket and wings! Very friendly environment and kid friendly. Will def visit again !

4f9O5LIhsnlqZvLfl61uhQ.text: Drew was our waiter! 5 stars for him too! The food was authentic BBQ, all from scratch! I even tried the Moonshine! Rated #1 for a reason. Ate here based on reviews. I have to tell you, I've lived all over the mid & southern states and this is delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

WbMkVKBdLk8zQO5HGfvFpg.text: So we were on a little vacation in Charlotte and decided to try Midwood Smokehouse. The waitress recommended the ribs and they did not disappoint!!  We liked them so.much we decided to come back before we left the area.  Unfortunately we got seated at around 6:00pm and they were already out of RIBS!! But honestly you cant go wrong and the wait staff is awesome!! Definitely  give it a try but try to go around 4:00pm so that you can get the ribs

zGSiUZa-wLl1QagWREXvtQ.text: Tried the Midwood chopped salad (small). Added chopped brisket on top. Was very happy with my choice. Also had the bacon wrapped smoked jalapenos for appetizer. All around a good dinner! One of my go to places in the area.

LSSHYdS7HrRP7vGHJNpyOw.text: First time ate here I had the chicken and did not like it. But the 2nd time I had the brisket and my opinion went up 3-4 points! Omg, it is the best! Lean, flavor packed, not too salty or spicy, all around perfect! The best stomach-full up meal is that with mac & cheese, which is almost as delicious. Good hush puppies too, they give you just enough so you don't get full on them. Their sauces are pretty spicy, but I personally did not need them for my food. The restaurant is big and gets crowded and there can be a wait. But they're never long. And the food is worth it!

hIxi34SHeOmy-CfuIgciXg.text: As an avid bbq enthusiast and with crowds hovering at the door, my expectations were pretty high based on reviews and the pallet of food they were offering... but seeing how "smokehouse" is in their name, I also thought their staple item, BBQ, would be something worth savoring.   What a disappointment - bbq was cold and way too salty (and that's before I added any sauces to cut the salt taste).  Castllebury in a can would probably be better than what I was served on my visit.   If it wasn't for the rave reviews from others on yelp, I would not have made an effort to go here.  Bottom line -  mediocre food and there are better BBQ places in the Charlotte area I would recommend over this.  On an uptick, my wife ordered a burger which she said was ok (nothing special/unique) and I wasn't charged for the bbq plate.  Server was good too bad that food was subpar in my opinion.

ot7VgjI2tNRly9ZzDaJ0YA.text: Fun place to enjoy killer brisket, pulled pork, and meltingly tender ribs. Unbelievably delicious skillet cornbread!

obagwSB1IukSwVypLh0KDA.text: One of the best bbq's I have had. We had ribs and they were fall-off-the-bone delicious. The brisket was also really good. The meat is tender, juicy, and the sauces are oh-so-good. The sides are also very good. I thoroughly enjoyed the greens.  To top it off, our server was friendly and great!

mmqV5Ugqxao2HKnoARlTpw.text: I am such a big fan of barbecue and Midwood Smokehouse has some of the best pulled pork around Charlotte. I had the Carolina Pulled Pork and it doesn't even need sauce it is that good. I went with my girlfriend and shared the Pimento Cheese Fries and they were delicious. As sides I had Mac n Cheese and Sweet Potato Fries and both were very good. The hushpuppies are great as well. I will definitely be back.

6-QgRarNQ8zjkocBox4VFw.text: Texas hash is  all the food is amazing! Check to see if there is a wait before you go, if there is add yourself to the waitlist via Yelp - super clutch. Decor is awesome, beer selection is on point - all around 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

TkcAMM-bHYe8Nr1P0WNetA.text: Great BBQ with very good sides and sauces. We had the combo platter for two. I was a fan of the smoked chicken wings. I Love the ribs and sausage. The combo comes with 4 meats and 2 sides. We had brisket, pulled pork, sausage and ribs. Sides mac and cheese and really good beans ! Platter also comes with pickled onions and hush puppies. I ordered a side of slaw.  My daughter ordered the burnt ends (brisket) with collard greens. All the food was pretty damn good. The meats had great smoke flavor. I would go with the chicken and ribs. The pulled pork and brisket were good but not the best I have had. All the sauces, sides and fixings were awesome. I recomend this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Platter for two and sides.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Couldn&#39;t wait for a pick. The smoke wings are FABULOUS.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outdoor seating

LkErAd-yCOe2XAa9KGAsKw.text: After car searching for abt 3hrs, my son and I were hungry and wanted something different. Leaving Independence Blvd. we ventured down Central Ave. surveiling the various restaurants situated along this immensely busy hipster enclave. "No, I don't want pizza," No, I don't want fish tacos," No I don't want a burger or ramen,!!!  My son spotted Midwood Smokehouse and took an immediate right. Oh my gosh, never knew I was missing this!!! Have seen Midwood profiled on various local morning shows and I'm a sparerib officianato!!!  I ordered the burnt ends w/Mac & cheese. Son ordered the BBQ plate w/creamed corn. We shared a large chopped salad(delicious) as appetizer. Oh, I also had crinkle cut fries, my fav, as 2nd side. I love into those hot, crispy fries 1st thing. OMG, even the ketchup was good!!! Needless to say, most of our food was bagged up to take home. The burnt ends, phenomenal!!! The BBQ chopped pork, delicious!!! U rarely find a restaurant where everything on ur plate is outstanding. Midwood Smokehouse has managed to accomplish this. Cheers!!!!

isWr84dgOl2t5JrPSjxSNA.text: Best bbq in Charlotte I enjoy it every time. Been here 4 times and they have never let me down!  Love this place, try the burnt tips you won't regret it!

C7q4PjvOXt3jfZApfP8AJw.text: Holy smokes this place is great (see what I did there). The service, food, bourbon and company could not have been better. Had the smoked wings won't ever be able to eat any other wings again!!!

gmHYOiutuKsnLVo4o6exSw.text: Second visit and it was every bit as good as the first.  Went with my wife and our neighbor and had another meal of excellent barbecue, cold drinks and on point service.  This time I opted for a combo platter which I believe was a new option on the menu.  Four meats and two sides served in either a "Well Fed" or "Pig Out" portion.  Trust me, the well fed version is PLENTY!  Got pulled pork, St. Louis style ribs and double beef brisket since they were out of the smoked sausage.  It was all wonderful.  Smokey, moist with nice bark on the pork and the brisket.  The ribs were fall off the bone and just delicious.  It really is a lot of food.  Ended up taking some of all of it home so, I can't imagine what the pig out portion is like.  My wife and friend split the large pulled chicken plate and again, way more than they could eat.  The chicken is moist and served mixed up with the Smokehouse's slightly sweet mustard sauce.  For sides we shared fries, coleslaw and creamed corn and they were all delish as well.  I had a couple $1.50 PBR drafts and the girls had margaritas which they dubbed, "best I've had in a long while".  It will be doubtful I will get my wife to any other barbecue place after this experience as she dubbed it, best barbecue she's had since we moved to Charlotte in 2002.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 4 little pigs.  And one biggun...

ngNFX9PXLTl5PTh2Lp8VbQ.text: Love, love, love this place!! Their Cuban sandwich is my favorite. The hostesses are rude and not too friendly but with the amount of traffic they get I let it slide. Make sure you come early because the waiting time for a table it's usually 20 min.

RwQSkdGcwzCMeQ5oQEzEQA.text: One of the best bbq places in Charlotte and will satisfy your meat cravings for a week. I could eat my weight in bacon wrapped jalapenos. There is usually a wait so come prepared. (added) or Use the NoWait app. It really helps know your place in line and set expectations if you get there early, super useful for this restaurant.

J70oKh6fMSydbgRQJR6mng.text: Great quality BBQ with a classic American vibe.  Whenever I have family visiting from the west coast I will always bring them here.  Bacon wrapped jalapenos, smoked veggies, baked beans, creamed corn and a big 4 meat combo plater is my go to selection and feeds four people easily.

CyTNguvfgQNZH0mT6hHhrw.text: Holy cheese filled bacon wrapped jalapeno DELICIOUSNESS!   I feel sorry for everyone whose tastebuds haven't danced to the sweet, creamy, smokey, spicy tongue love fest that I have witnessed in this side dish. Yes the hush puppies are crunchy, sweet and nicely spiced.. And yes the brisket is nicely smokes and juicy. But those bacon wrapped jalapenos... Sigh.  #bbq #foodie #baconisbetter #jalapenopopperking

nNjgFx_YgeHYTrwkAwxy7Q.text: The meats were absolutely amazing. Tender hickory smoked meat you can smell the fire as you pull up. Asked the waiter for recommendations and got great beer recommendations. Wasn't crazy about the queso but my husband loved it. We got the "well fed" combo platter and all the meats were absolutely fantastic. I'll be back if I'm ever in Charlotte again.

uDkpN2jTmeJG4xnnC9cbLg.text: Best ribs I've ever had. Friendliest waitress I've ever had. My group received free brisket queso because they accidentally made too much or the wrong thing for another customer and they handed it to us the second we sat down. There was some forgetfulness from the waitress, but she was so bloody thoughtful and nice that a simple reminder was enough to get the beer and sauce we ordered. One of the best meals I've had.

q4xLPR3iQ44r1ATa-0mHaA.text: Hands-down the best barbecue in Charlotte. Nothing more needs to be said about this place except for pure perfection. Awesome food, great prices, excellent beer selection. The staff is well-trained, extremely attentive, and friendly.

GLSP9Sm-lxSuMvG6wfaogw.text: Always take family and friends visiting from out of town here. Try the Carolina Pork, so good!

BO9M6W1_xj-MyijANsEcmw.text: I am visiting from D.C. and thought I would visit the place. The BBQ was excellent and the customer service was very good. Very nice selection of draught beers. Must try! Parking is the only drawback, but not really a problem.

UGcztvTbX0x6IdCHvaUmpQ.text: It's hard to write a meaningful review that hasn't covered every facet of this popular bbq haven. I've had their pulled pork, and most people agree that it's very good. It's hard to get the right balance of smokiness in bbq, too little and it tastes bland, too much and it's overpowering. It's mouthwatering when it's done right, and they certainly have the skills at Midwood. I expected the pulled pork to be great, but their tacos were a pleasant surprise. Why eat brisket, slaw, and mac n cheese separately when you can have a perfect fusion of flavor all in the same bite!  Their creamed corn is great too, they add just enough salt and pepper to keep it from being pedestrian. The bacon wrapped jalapenos are fine too, but I wish they served more of them.   I can only speak for myself, but every time I've ate at Midwood I went home happy with a full belly. Sometimes the wait for a table can be a little long on a busy night, and their service can be a little sluggish because of it. But they're always friendly, and the food is always great. And isn't that all that really matters?

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Tacos &amp; creamed corn
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. St. Louis pork ribs &amp; mac n cheese
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

EsNlllrplPmLd78e2ks9SA.text: Sitting outside. With our dog eating a "pig out" platter. Life can't get any better! Excellent BBQ! Bacon wrapped jalapenos are phenomenal! Sweet potato fries crisped to perfection. Brisket melting in mouth...

Ngzw8L4Sv_HabZrUB5O3UQ.text: More like 2.5 stars for me. I'm not a BBQ fan but came here to help celebrate a birthday. What's cool about this place is the outside area where you can play corn hole while you wait for your table. Establishment was full of hungry patrons so I was starting to think that maybe this BBQ was going to be different. Staff is friendly, bartender was really nice and I even saw a coworker. Location is perfect and I was ready to nibble on my Hubs' food (since I don't do BBQ I didn't order anything) Hubs ordered I think the brisket sandwich. O.M.Google. Salty. Greasy and what's with the blue cheese??? Fries were good though. Hubs had to scrape off the blue cheese as he hated it too. The bread also looked like Texas Toast. Just not a fan....so sorry. Upside were the beer specials and also the banana pudding. THAT was good. yum.

UeaA5kaaqC8sdCuPqZujmg.text: Here's the big question.  Midwood or Sauceman's?  Oh that could prompt an endless debate.  So here's my take:  Midwood is the more pretentious, hipster-esque BBQ joint.  This is where I'd bring a friend who I'd like to impress with a cool BBQ spot and share a few local beers.  Whereas Sauceman's feels more casual and relaxed.  Almost like eating at a pit stop.  This is where I'd bring a friend who just likes eating BBQ.   Midwood is BBQ on a creative slant.  Burgers and tacos ... that's beyond the simplified offerings from the pit.  Bacon-wrapped jalapeno is delicious but ... that's just fixin's dolled up.  But don't get me wrong.  I can gnosh on these bacon jalapeno's all day.  Whereas Sauceman's is BBQ plain and simple.  The red slaw is a perfect digestive to the heaping amount of pulled pork you'd be served.  The hush puppies balances out the BBQ tray by offering you something mealy savor.    In a pure side-to-side comparison of solely the pulled pork (ignoring every other meat and side), I'd give the edge to Sauceman's.  Even when absolutely stuffed, I just couldn't put down the fork.  I just kept eating and eating.  Again, the red slaw helps tremendously.  But Midwood is legitimately good on its own right.  Briskets were above average.  Ribs about average.  Sides were above average.  Come on .... 508 reviews can't be wrong.  It's the most popular place in all of Charlotte.  Of course you'll come and you'll love it too.  If you took everything in consideration, Midwood and Sauceman's ends up being a tie in my book.  BBQ Hop 2015 #2 [March 2015]

SgTYfQsQcRGcnM5aowySGw.text: Absolutely delicious.  Friendly service and amazing food.  We had beef brisket, Mac and cheese, collard greens, BBQ baked beans, and a spicy Mary for dinner as well as banana pudding for dessert.  Everything was outstanding!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding!  Absolutely delicious.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef brisket, collard greens, hush puppies - everything was amazing!

zOfUBCU3ziIqB9AyIE0dWQ.text: Dinner was delicious, service was prompt and friendly, and portions were enormous. Highly recommend.

J18B8JasNF5LpPJ5mW1epA.text: I have been going to Midwood for years.  I am very picky when it comes to BBQ and I love the pulled pork that Midwood has.   All of their sides are also amazing, you really can't go wrong with any of them.    I have been there when they have been slow and when they have been super busy.  Overall their service is consistently good and their servers are friendly.   We love Midwood so much, this was the location of choice for our wedding rehearsal dinner.  All of our out of town guest LOVED the food and still rave about it to this day.

IgTe-hK4YrnksqSudhlhHg.text: From out of state visiting for the weekend and was craving some good ole' BBQ. Stumbled upon this place and what a great find!  The food was DELISH and I loved the atmosphere.  Sat and ate at bar.  Bartender was super nice and very attentive.  Will most definitely go back next time I travel to Charlotte.

jzkBnbXf_nA51GIedXDvyQ.text: Great BBQ. The gf and I sat at the bar in our usual fashion and ordered a few drinks before eating. The bartender (sorry, can't remember the name) was very friendly and gave us some recommendations for parts of the city to check out while we here.   BBQ was solid as were the hush puppies. None of that smother your meat in sugary BBQ sauce nonsense; all tender, juicy meat, and you add your sauce. You could not go wrong coming here, good atmosphere, good food, good company. Overall a memorable experience but wouldn't quite hit my top favorite BBQ places.

hrTBK5hcmCBXOdw6ocqNxg.text: We went to Midwood Smokehouse on a Monday which was excellent because they have North Carolina draft beers for 1/2 price!  We drank great beer for a super low price.  I had the chicken sandwich with mustard sauce which was great, and a side of mac & cheese, also great!  I tried a bite of my friends pork sandwich with the vinegar sauce and loved it.  I also asked for a side of the Midwood sauce to try and dip the crinkle cut french fries in and was very impressed!  The coleslaw was chopped up very fine and very flavorful.  Our waiter was very nice and helpful.  The prices are very reasonable.  A couple of downsides, unfortunately they didn't have any ribs yet available for us to try.  All the more reason to go back on a Monday and enjoy those $2.50 beers!  Also the hostess seemed very flustered and told us our table would take at least 15-20 minutes when in fact we waited for less than 5.  Luckily we didn't believe her first assessment since there was no one else waiting or we might have left....  Would be disappointing to lose customers because of this!

O4J6oaOpWmKNhvPAKQY_DQ.text: Absolutely delicious! Some of the best BBQ I've had in Charlotte. You have to try the loaded fries with pork appetizer. Also great beer specials!

i7KVsv3Cihms-Qml4b-Yzg.text: Ton of food. ..All delicious!  I went with the tacos. I liked the tacos but could have easily been satisfied with just the side dishes.  Mac and cheese & creamed corn were awesome. Large place. Kid friendly. Outdoor seating available.

9E8aQ0w-MqZhddHTDoD6tw.text: Went to the new location last week which was their first week open. For only being open a few days, the food was INCREDIBLE and the service was wonderful! The prices are very reasonable and the portions are very generous. Diverse menu with plenty of options to choose from. Huge selection of craft beers!    I ordered the pulled pork, which came with hush puppies (delicious) and a side item, I chose the delicious macaroni and cheese (seriously some of the best I've ever had). The people I went with ordered the salmon sammie with a side of greens, and the brisket with a side of sweet potato fries. For dessert we ordered the banana pudding which was the best I've ever had!! Everyone was more than happy with the quality of the food, the portion size, price, and great service. Definitely make a point to go here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork, macaroni and cheese, hush puppies! All delicious!

wRPbHaoBWU06hgmwT5n4kA.text: Eight of us went to the Midwood Smokehouse today for lunch.  It was a a great experience.  Two of us shared a four meat (pulled pork, ribs, brisket, and sausage).  We had sides of Mac and cheese, and bacon wrapped jalopenos.  The meat selections were excellent, very tasty!  Everyone enjoyed their lunch.  Service was excellent.

Z-3-iu6U4b9z_GSx84kaHw.text: Midwood gets better every time we try it.  Lately we've been ordering to go. Which I realized has become quite popular. People seem to order their smoked meat by the pound. Recently I've been ordering the wings and sweet potato fries. The wings are smoked and I choose to have them dipped in their sauce. This is my favorite kind of wing!!! I love them grilled or smoked versus fried or baked. My husband gets the chopped salad once with chicken and another with salmon. He said it was amazing.

3JgUHu0hQKNjP6TT2M2M_A.text: Lowcountry as sweet tea I know my own taste I shove mustard-based BBQ Into my face  Ambling into this split level  Church of smoked pork I ordered a plate of pulled ..and a fork  The sauce, so tangy I said, "Wait a sec... This vinegar base Defies my red neck."  And the puppies So crispy, the insides so sweet Extra sauce on the side Complimenting the meat  No Bush's Best, no sir! No salty slime douse The baked beans they bake here, They bake them in house  If I had a thtomach of much wider girth I'd have thtuck around longer And had thome desserth.    Instead I played corn hole On the patio out front And finished my beer 'Cause I do what I want  One day I'll return For vinegar suits Those weeks that I drift From my mustard base roots.

EkyCvVilbqCY__KtD0gNHg.text: Our first time out for a dinner meeting. Won't be the last. Outstanding, friendly service and delicious BBQ. When I asked for a Pilsner or some kind of light beer option, the waitress was beer-savvy and gave great recommendations, too. Looking forward to returning and trying more of the wide variety of food options.

lK0acObVVLnZfNY2G1uE3g.text: When I pulled up outside, the scent wafting through the air convinced me that nothing that smells THAT good can possibly be that boy.  And I wasn't wrong!  Overall, this I'd rate this a strong 4.5.  This place is uber-fantastic!  The first night, I ordered the beef brisket and my partner ordered the pulled pork.  Each came with a different barbecue sauce.  The brisket was so tender that I barely needed the butter knife that accompanied my fork.  Both the pork and beef had a great smoky flavor that was good even without the sauce (although it was better with just a little bit of sauce on it).  I had the macaroni and cheese, which was DIVINE!  It also had a hint of smoky cheddar flavor.  I also had the privilege of eating the brown sugar bacon.  OMG, it blew my mind!  My partner remarked that it was like "eating a pecan pie from a cooked pork belly."  It was a perfect combination of sweet and salty bacon-y goodness.  For dessert, we tried the pecan cobbler, which was so, so good - like eating a warm pecan pie.  My second trip I went at lunch and had the barbecue chicken and the bacon-wrapped jalapeno bites.  They were very good and not terribly spicy, but a little more cheese stuffed inside would have been perfect.  The chicken came with a mustard sauce, which I didn't try (not a mustard fan), but I was able to get a different sauce with it on the side.  Chicken was tender and flavorful, and less smoky-tasting than their other barbecued meats.  For dessert we had the cream cheese brownie, which was large and tasty, but very light on the cream cheese.    I have to agree with others that the picked onions and hush puppies were just ok (although I'm admittedly not a fan of raw onions).  Tables are a little close together in there, but they do have some outdoor seating available.  Service was good both times, even when they started to get pretty busy.  Prices are pretty reasonable - about $10 to $15 average per dinner.  Portion sizes are quite large; I had plenty to eat, but still had a lot of leftovers.
