They offer some less-unhealthy options, such as a couple of different salads, steam veggies, and smoked veggies.  You can also get three side items for $7, in case you want to go that route.  This is my new go-to barbecue place.  I want to try nearly everything on their menu.  If you're coming here, come hungry!

VljY21AkqKVoUzh9HLfDig.text: The brisket was very good! For my appetizer I had jalapenos wrapped in bacon and they were also very tasty. Great service and overall a really good experience. If you like beer try the copper!

hmm56RUsm-NLCdG033idpg.text: I was in town visiting my brother.  They really wanted to take us for Carolina BBQ, so Midwood was the place.  Great atmosphere.  Before we even opened up our menus, our waitress told usbtheyvwere out of ribs.  For me, no big deal, I don't like them.  But a BBQ place with no ribs,  at 7pm on a weekend evening?  I ordered the brisket dinner.  It came with hush puppies and I got mac and cheese and the bacon wrapped jalapenos.   The food was amazing.  My brother who was disappointed there were no ribs, got tacos.  One of each type, brisket, pork and chicken I think, and he loved them all. Also ordered was the BBQ Burnt Ends and the Pulled Pork sandwich both of which were enjoyed.  Food was served quickly, but we never felt rushed.  We will be back next time I'm in town.  4 stars just because of the ribs.

-axXiQ6wE568f50L9AFXtg.text: While I'm no BBQ aficionado...I loved this place.  Started with bacon wrapped jalapeno/cheese poppers what we smoked and delicious.  We sort of split tow plates: the Burnt Ends and the Pulled Pork.  With that had four sides: Fries (meh), coleslaw (just OK), baked beans (yum), and creamed corn (rich version).  I enjoyed the pork more than the ends - pork was moist, perfectly pulled and sauced (with more available on the side) and nicely smoked.  The burnt ends were hit and miss - some nice and moist, others pretty dry.  Nice beer list of local and non-local craft brews, great music and vibe with adequate service.  I'd definitely go back if ever back in town.  We were debating between this and Mac's Speed Shop (describe to us later by locals as having a "Hooter" feel...they affirmed we went to the right spot!)

DDi8h_SH0CIz1WmIpG0w1w.text: One of my husband's all time favorite places to eat. Im a vegetarian who occasionally eats fish, so I get the "get hooked" salad or I make my own. The salmon is smoked perfectly and I love the smoked veggies. The service is always prompt and friendly, and you have to end the m eew all with the banana pudding.

mcVQ1TbsnGqKWe-o5uV3ZQ.text: Best ribs ever, not counting Goode Company in Texas of course. Ribs are good but not that Goode. But I'm in Charlotte, so, I'll stop being so fussy. And Midwood has Banana pudding to die for. Go early, it gets very crowded. Sit at the bar for quicker service.

Q13PpntanokgG1MueS6PXQ.text: I have mixed feelings about this place. It has a cool vibe and the smoky smell as you walk in is exactly what you want in a barbecue place. Hubby is a True carnivore and was thrilled with the 4 meat combo plate, but...the service was not great and the sides left something to be desired. We started with the smoked wings as an appetizer. They were tasty but REALLY small. Hubby's 4 meat combo had ribs, pulled pork, sausage and brisket. His sides were fries and bacon wrapped jalapenos and he added an order of burnt ends. He loved all of the meats and the portion sizes are good. He's a big guy and almost went for the "pig out" portion, but opted for the "well fed" instead because of the appetizer and additional burnt ends, and wasn't able to finish all of it. He didn't even get to the sides, but he couldn't have cared less...it's all about the meat. I ordered the half chicken (all white meat) and for my sides, mac and cheese and collard greens. My chicken was good, but even though I asked, and the server repeated it to me, I did not get all white meat. I am a sides kinda girl, so I was disappointed in my mac and cheese and greens. I make them better at home. We also asked for an order of Texas toast when we ordered, which did not come out with the food. When we asked about it, they brought it, but it was unusual as it was sourdough bread and it wasn't buttered well. On top of not getting my chicken right and not getting the toast that we ordered with our food, my drink was empty when the server came to the table and she didn't notice. I had to ask for a refill. I will say she was very friendly and knowledgeable about the restaurant and the menu, but not very attentive to the details.

CFTo6r37Q0Z4ksUHX5Bs6A.text: I'm a native Carolinian and this is, hands down, the best BBQ I've had in my life. The brisket is tender and delish and the chopped pork is amazing. I love the Flat Tire Sauce and well as the vinegar based one. Our service was friendly and fast, even though they were slammed for Father's Day. Definitely a must try if you love your Cue!

JO6k8-54YjjaFIy25LFHIg.text: Honestly, probably the best BBQ I've ever had and that's saying something. Having been to the top places in Texas, Missouri, and elsewhere this place is ever bit as good and then some. Pimento cheese fries and the Combo Sampler platter are definitely must-try's.

e4fm-NwB3RRvb9FmhKsw9g.text: The BBQ ( and all of their other food) is so good here!  I got St. Louis Style Pork Ribs with Hushpuppies, Mac & Cheese & Baked Beans. The ribs were full of flavor, and so moist, that they practically fell off the bone. The sauce I got was the Midwood Signature and they've got it goin' on. The hushpuppies were so good. They were perfectly fried and were little bites of yumminess. The mac & cheese and baked beans were good as well. We also got some Banana Pudding for dessert and it was really good. It was fresh, creamy, and full of banana-y flavor.  The service was good. Our waitress was very helpful and checked on us pretty often, even though we were sitting outside.  This place gets packed as the night goes on, and parking is bad since the lot is small. So yeah, if you don't want to wait long, or deal with parking, make sure to come here earlier.

O4O7_7OCUsczm2BDEyuW5w.text: I mean, this is really REALLY good BBQ. I don't know what else to say about that.  I had a lunch special here once with a cheerwine-based sauce on wings. WHO DOES THAT? ugh. So good.

UaX4Rm32xLiVjSLk2rW-UQ.text: If had the pleasure to dine at their locations in Ballantine and plaza midwood. Both have set the bar extraordinarily high in terms of BBQ. The brisket is made to perfection. Their brisket sandwich is a must. Also try their smoked ribs. This will always be my go to spot.

XO_QL9yOlvFLOG87T2HDqQ.text: I'd give this place four stars+ but they seem to have portion issues. Food is consistent and delicious.  PROS: Best brisket in the city bar none. Midwood chopped salad is to die for and the dressings are pretty amazing. Honestly, with the exception of the smoked chicken, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. CONS: I have been shortchanged on portions so many times, it's become laughable. I went to buy(and paid for) 2 pounds of pork bbq to take to a friend in New Mexico but when I got home to portion it out in zip lock bags, it was 19 ounces. Had the same thing happen twice when I got a lage brisket plate to go. Supposed to be 10 ounces but both times it was 6 ounces. Called to complain and the manager was supposed to send me something in the mail but never took care of it or followed up. Bottom line, an awesome place to eat in but beware of take out. You pay for more than you are supposed to get.

Vwld1GHvfxVWFg_Pk-k1YA.text: Great food, great service and great selection of Bourbon. The service was quick warm and very helpful as this is my first time here. The recommendation of the Beef Brisket with Mac N Cheese was amazing. Every bite I was in heaven. Business is taken me west but I'll be back on Thursday to enjoy one last me before flying home to Oregon. This place is awesome!

GWplRyZYcynxOQj_v7gLMg.text: This place was busy!!! Even at 5pm on a Tuesday!   Came with a small group, was taken care of fairly quickly. We had a great waiter, can't recall his name :( but he was helpful. He really described each dish along with drink choices. He was awesome.   My group settled on the brisket, BBQ pork sandwich, and the chicken. We also had the bacon wrapped jalapenos. Along with sides of fries and hush puppies.   The meat was tender! The brisket was to die for. It was seriously so good. Especially when paired with their BBQ sauce. The pork was also nice and tender and packed full of great flavors. Loved the jalapenos, they weren't too spicy due to the bacon. Even the fries were cooked perfect. The boyfriend loves the hushpuppies (I'm not a fan of them in generally but he said they were great).   Nothing was left. Seriously. Every crumb was eaten.   Throughly enjoyed will be back.

CzIlHd15K_tBMiCVreUorA.text: Visited based on prior reviews.   There is no doubt the other 1000 people were correct.  Pork, ribs, chix and all sides were great.   Will visit again when here in the future

1A7PYzAc2BlBJ1IFff_YMA.text: Simply amazing! Great smoke on all the meats. Service was outstanding and will be back.

pz_SqKTTGzWJ1_8bPscchQ.text: My favorite bbq spot in town.   If they are offering the burnt ends you have to get them.

sfBPUhgkx3PXrwHCXchM0w.text: I will start off by saying I really wanted to like this place.... My husband and I met up with some friends last night for a bday party at this location. First we were told it was going to be a 25 minute wait which turned into almost an hour. When we sat down we Ordered the queso and brisket dip. After about 30 mins the dip was brought out and it was cold. We waited 30 mins for cold queso? And it Tasted like can cheese.... I told the server about the cold dip and he was very nonchalant and did not offer much of an apology. The food came out one hour after we sat down and the only thing that was hot were the sides. The bbq which they specialize in was not even luke warm. I sent the plate back after informing the manager and she brought back the same plate that she went and microwaved for 30 seconds. There were 8 of us and we were very disappointed with the food... We will never come back to this restaurant... My husband's burger was pretty good but that was the only plus

R9h8LFVBJ6kgMZ-0evbQ9Q.text: This place is so good, I'm writing the review at the table. In a word: Legit. The table had burnt ends, jal poppers, Mac and cheese (zomg!), the St. Louis ribs special of the night. It was all amazing.   With food this good, the service hardly matters, but it's worth saying the staff is so friendly you won't want to leave. Our server was so nice, we wanted to buy him a present. (New baby on the way.)  We'll be back often.

hICNDNSb5kR0DS0w0yyd8w.text: We were driving down Central Ave last night, looking for someplace to eat.  We figured we'd go to one of the places we've already been, when we spotted the Midwood Smokehouse.   It looked nice on the outside and there seemed to be people milling about, so we figured it must be good.    There was a 20-minute wait, so we sidled up to the bar for a drink.  During our stint at the bar, some stools opened up, so we sat down and were invited to dine there as well by the bartender.  Rather than wait longer and, since the restaurant was pretty much a bar atmosphere overall, we decided to go ahead and stay put.  I didn't really want an appetizer, but the bacon-wrapped jalapenos sounded delish!  That's when I noticed that they're available as a side item.  Woo hoo -- SOLD!    I ordered the small-sized version of the Carolina Pork plate (with vinegar-y BBQ sauce) and the jalapenos as my side.  Out came this big pile of shredded pork.  The sauce was served in a small ramekin on the side, which really isn't enough.  Be sure to request 2 or 3!   On the side were my jalapenos wrapped in bacon.  SO yummy!  And, actually, not very spicy.  The hush puppies that also came with the plate were delicious, too.    I really liked Midwood Smokehouse (possibly even more than -- dare I say it?)  Mac's Speed Shop.  They have great food, great prices (on food and drink), and a great atmosphere -- both indoors and out!  The bartender (sorry--I'm not good with names!) was super friendly and efficient, too.

OqgjBXMULeNxf18m17IsAg.text: There are a lot of great places to get BBQ in Charlotte and this is one of my favorites! Whenever I have guests in town, or anyone asks me for a recommendation I always suggest it.   I love the Plaza Midwood location! It is a great atmosphere. Last time I went, I went with 2 girl friends and we split the BBQ platter. There was so much food. It was great!! Definitely a must visit in Charlotte

136MB0mY5NmvME2WE0etyg.text: Pretty decent barbeque!  I had a great pear cider with my meal.  My husband and kids started with the bacon wrapped jalepano peppers and they were gone pretty quickly so I am guessing they were pretty good.  We got a combo platter to split at our table so we could try a little of everything.  The brisket was awesome and the pork was pretty decent too.  The pulled chicken tasted a little dry and I didn't really love the ribs...but am not generally a fan of Saint Louis style ribs.  The sides we got (fries and creamed corn) were good too.  We shared a peach cobbler to end the meal with which was okay.  Service was great.  They have outdoor seating as well...if only I could get my hisband to enjoy sitting outside as well...that would be perfect.

x5a5B9MP7PY8m4Dv9a6w4Q.text: We came here for July 4th and couldn't have picked a better place for good American barbecue! Hands down the best ribs I've ever had in my life. Great Mac and cheese too! Ask for a tour of the smoker. The manager took us back to show us how everything works, and it was pretty awesome. We will definitely be back.

oRUB_rdw7SNIdNXAdON-DQ.text: First time I've been here on Friday the 13th of all days. Well the bad luck ended at the door. Child it smelled good as soon as I walked through. It's my birthday so our waitress was overjoyed she got to serve us. I ordered a platter of ribs, brisket, pulled pork and hickory smoked sausage. My cousins ordered whatever they ate I forgot as my belly was blocking my view. I ate and ate. They have cheerwine sauce which when eaten with any meat is like a shot of sodie in yer mouf. 'Twas a great experience y'all need to come here order a plate and eat.

CPtkt71gp4i4ykd0_vuS8A.text: great BBQ shack, good beer.. and CHEERWINE!!!! so good, highly recommend

xuIauSVqOxjUbaf5D6OdGg.text: Yes I love bacon, yes I love pork, and yes I love this place!  I ate until my stomach, mouth and soul could eat no more.  The ribs don't even need sauce they are perfectly smoked and seasoned. The meat clings, just barely to the bone, and waits for just a hint of your teeth to come cascading into your mouth.  It's heaven from a firey pit.    Parking is a bit dicey at times, but worth the wait.

7WJmFGXGe5j6SInc4oAKCg.text: OK- we have been going here for years now.   I think the quality might be slipping. Or maybe it is just inconsistent. Sometimes we LOVE THIS PLACE and other times it is "meh".  I highly recommend the salad with BBQ and avocado dressing.  My husband recommends the ribs.

oIy8tBZSL2-zBc6f61GKxA.text: I've been hearing a lot about this joint and managed to make it out for lunch on a Sunday afternoon.  I arrived just a little after noon and was able to park in the lot directly in front of the restaurant.  While there were a bunch of open tables outside, there was only two tables open inside.  I was able to snag an inside table (it's much easier reading a newspaper at a table as opposed to the bar) and began perusing the menu.  Jennifer came out to take my drink order and when she returned, I peppered her with questions about the menu.  Among other things, I discovered that there is more meat on the small plate, than there is on the sandwich.  I decided to go with the small plate with mac and cheese and the creamed corn as the sides.   Food was out in less than ten minutes.  The pork was wonderfully smokey and came with a small side of sauce (eastern-style).  On appearance, the hushpuppies looked more like tater tots.  Not that there's anything wrong with that, but.....it gave the impression that they were pre-fab.  They were almost too perfect.  And I have to admit that I wasn't a big fan of the mac and cheese.  It was not creamy enough for my liking.  With all that said, the creamed corn was outta sight!  There was a strong black pepper taste which I loved.  Service was fantastic.  When Jennifer found out that I didn't like the mac and cheese, she offered something else.  She was apologetic and returned within a minute with a side of the red slaw (which was terrific, by the way).  She was quick to refill my beverage and was very helpful answering my questions.  As has been mentioned earler, the cost is a little on the high side, but it was a lot of food, and I think it's worth it.  I will definitely be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. small pork plate, with pups, mac and cheese and creamed corn (up top)

hmodmriqo_TOWfqLN3p2Ug.text: Great food definite must come back next time in town. Tried the pulled pork with Mac and cheese and smoked sausage.  The BBQ queso with beef brisket was great as well

Lf8TkSSifQ8RQ7EMqcvaJw.text: hmmmm....  Sweetie & I were super excited to check out this restaurant for lunch recently.  We both love barbeque.  I got the small smoked turkey plate with mac & cheese & sweetie got the chicken with south carolina style mustard sauce.  He got the creamed corn.  The sides were really good & we enjoyed them.  Maybe we picked the wrong things (?!), but for a place that smokes their own meats I'm sad to say we were disappointed.  The smoked turkey looked beautiful, but it was dry & mostly tasteless.  Not very smoky at all!  I doused it with barbecue sauce, but it didn't help much.  Sweetie's chicken was o.k., but that mustard sauce was weird... not a True SC sauce at all!  It tasted like it had cumin in it & we both agreed that if you put it over rice with some naan bread on the side, you'd be eating Indian.  It has a fun atmosphere.  Drew was our server & he was super friendly and helpful with the menu & explained the restaurant and set up since it was our first time there and always kept our drinks filled.  There is an upstairs area with a great view of uptown, but for some odd legal reason they can't serve up there.  People will just get a to-go order & go upstairs & seat themselves.  We might try it again & check out the brisket or pork. Maybe.

wMsxWndnWWL2okLYHbKZaA.text: Whenever I eat BBQ, I always compare the place to Lexington BBQ (the restaurant). While Midwood Smokehouse does not top Lexington BBQ, it is (by far) the best in Charlotte. The problem with Charlotte BBQ is that most places are some weird hodgepodge of different BBQ styles that ends in some strange mess that does not even resemble real BBQ. Midwood Smokehouse certainly does a good job at executing BBQ with its own twist and fair prices to boot. I highly recommend.  EDIT: I highly recommend either coming early or getting takeout. Parking is VERY scarce and long lines form quickly.

36kbNAhVEYp0rPEO2oYOXQ.text: As a server myself, I'm particularly critical of service at restaurants but Midwood Smokehouse did not disappoint! Our server, Sheena was friendly, attentive, and efficient. Everyone loved the food as well...we'll definitely be back!

RmtV5cC426NdED0a6OvtOw.text: When I want really good ribs close by, these are my go to. Fall off the bone tender and seasoned perfectly.

hAaEQC9Gy3L9ire1Nbqp5g.text: Excellent service. Fast food delivery. Everything tasted great. We shared the sampler plate with all the meats. My cocktail was superb. Creamed corn and mac and cheese were amazing. Palmetto cheese fries were just so so.

vGbVLHP0lllpBEFXy4m2Zw.text: Great BBQ, mac n cheese. Big portions and great service. Parking was kind of annoying though

Mc3uBHSPYLJKXwBE7wJ63Q.text: The brisket was on point, I even used the word fantastic!! My wife was like wha??? Very hard to please me with brisket. Great atmosphere and great service.

pJqxIhhjYE5n5dE422uBSQ.text: This place is a great neighborhood gem! There is an upstairs, outdoor patio where you can sip on drinks while you wait for your table...the view is amaze-balls! They have something for everyone on their menu, from burnt-end brisket to chicken bbq salads. So yummy and they have lots of local draughts and drink specials.

t-OIcmPIP2u3SedBECrmZA.text: Good service. Food was tasty but nothing extraordinary. Wait staff was friendly and timely. Not a bad place to eat in Ballantyne.

em2fdTSWtC-ts2Dg9_9oRQ.text: Great smoke house dishes such as ribs, brisket tips, and chicken. Sides such as bacon wrapped jalepenos and hush puppies are filled with flavor. Desserts are large and delicious such as pecan cobbler with ice cream. Noisy family style, no pretense, just great food.

vujqeYb_b0843GQJxuKecA.text: I was in town for work earlier this week and went here with a friend who lives in town. I really enjoyed it. The burnt ends were tender on the inside and a little crunchy on the outside, covered in a BBQ sauce with a kick. I ordered the small portion and it was more than enough. The hush puppies were light and airy. The mac and cheese was the only thing that didn't really stand out. The pecan cobbler was a home run. Do not attempt to eat it on your own. I did, and I failed miserably. It is sweet, warm with a maple syrupy type sauce that leaves you yearning for fall to get here already! The vanilla ice cream on top is an absolute must!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pecan cobbler with vanilla ice cream
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends with mac and cheese

3kIOqvJs077wpEzciwsAXw.text: Quite possibly the best BBQ in Charlotte. It's done right and everything is always tasty. If you get there late, they may be out of the more popular menu items...so try to get there as early as possible.  If they ever have the fried mac & cheese with pimento cheese....GET IT! Don't even consider NOT getting it!

L1rF5enCP4cEGartDi2VRA.text: I sat at the bar, and I received great service from the male bartender. He was courteous and professional. I also noticed that he checked to go orders for accuracy, prior to handing the food over to the customers. That is a commitment to excellent service.  Prices: Expensive. Figure on $25 per person without beer or cocktails. Yeah, I know that this is Charlotte, but I don't want to pay their rent.   Pulled Pork Barbecue Quality? Good, but slightly over-rated. Maybe the best in CLT though. I liked their burnt ends the best. B+  Decor: This is a cool restaurant, well laid out and inviting. I like the vibe and decor of this place.   Negatives: Parking in their minuscule parking lot is almost nonexistent. I guess that one could park across the road in the shopping center parking lot and dart across the busy traffic, but I'm too old to play "dodge ball with vehicles."  PS: A confused waitress brought out my bacon wrapped jalapeno appetizer - well AFTER I received my entree, and she tried to give it to other customers....not good. Many of the seeds were left in the jalapenos, so they were hella spicy, almost too spicy to eat. I left one on the plate.   I classify Midwood Smokehouse's fare as "city" barbecue or barbecue for those who don't know any better. Hey Midwood, don't despair, B+ from me on BBQ is pretty darned good. See my BBQ list for traditional BBQ restaurants in NC at 1/3 the price.

m9EnkbLUVYDZxDJcQAwNrg.text: Some of the best BBQ in the area.  I lived across the street and ate a whooole lot of BBQ during that time. I would recommend everything on the menu, particularly the bacon-wrapped jalapenos, baked beans and pork.

2AKJjJiBBDhBf-aEo22nkw.text: Good BBQ, but portions are small for prices and the parking is an absolute nightmare. Its a "meh".

aRn0h5x7oA8HQhLZUKfEBg.text: Stopped in here for a quick lunch and wasn't too impressed unfortunately. Ordered the brisket sandwich. I was disappointed in a few ways. The first was that it was chopped brisket. Would have definitely preferred it to have been sliced. Second was the blue cheese really overwhelmed the beef. The Mac n cheese wasn't bad, some bites were a little salty for some reason, but it didn't seem dried out and old or mushy like a lot of BBQ places do. It wasn't terrible, and service was good. I'd go back to try an actual BBQ plater when I have more time.

UXaxReoen4SLBFlYyk75zA.text: BAAMMM, The second you walk in the hickory smoke hits you right in the face.. No worries get cold beer and a bacon wrap jalapeno to help you settle you in.  Service : 4 stars Food: 4 Stars Restroom : 4 stars Price vs quantity : 5 stars  If you leave this place hungry, you should put a apple in your mouth and jump in the smoker pig..

ixDAdyZa-QYdJMVlW6PGKw.text: Only waited 10 minutes for table but food took a minute to come out. They were pretty busy. BUT I must say the food was great. I forgot the name of what we ordered. We had a platter were you can pick 4 meats, 2 side and mush puppies. We had Beef Brisket, Pulled Chicken, Pulled Pork and Ribs. All the meat was moist, fulfilling and delicious!! Try the collard green and mac n cheese. Man oh man the collard greens was so freaking GOOD! Mac n cheese were ok. My husband enjoyed the ribs, he ordered some to go lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac N Cheese bowl looks low because my husband couldn&#39;t help himself, lol. The pork, chicken and brisket are under the ribs.. Feeds 2 people

sHZsuwKuBF4ZQ9bZPy0A9g.text: Listen to your taste buds and.....                          Get the Brisket!!!  Best brisket in Charlotte. Bacon wrapped jalapenos pretty tasty as well and not too spicy.

SY27GCp8JJMeEqHreaT3OQ.text: Bigger fan of the Midwood - Central Ave - not a big fan of the Ballantyne location - loved the brisket - mac and cheese - just okay - love the dessert - great service

MsirjigdQtSBCen7wvm-dQ.text: I'm not even going to try to piggy back on everything everyone has said... This place is da bomb. Come on Monday's for drink specials.   The best dish they have is their Sat/Sun Smoked Beef Rib. I'm going to say it's the best in Charlotte. Darn tasty.   (Drop Mic)

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best dish hands down. Beef rib special on weekends! (Sorry it&#39;s upside down)

8iShYPI8u86tFWN4FWAgGw.text: 5 stars for the Brisket 5 stars for the ICE chips. Small and SOFFTTTTTT  5 stars for their hours. 11pm makes for some decent times to eat brisket.  2 stars for those bacon wrapped jalapenos. I would not recommend.  4 stars for the greens. YES!!!! I'd recommend. Flavored right but wish they added Mustard or Turnips to them. And offer more.  3.9 stars for the hush puppies with every meal. Good crisp but I'm not certain it's always fresh.   5 stars for our burger. The kid highly recommends.  0 stars for the price upgrades on Double ribs, Bone-in Chicken, et al on the $26 Well Fed Platter.  2 stars for not having more BBQ sauces to try. I guess Famous Dave's spoils me.  Mac & Cheese = ok. NO hand cut fries.  Texas Toast is extra.  Daily specials worth returning for! They sell out fast.   Oh! 1st visit was Thursday, 9/28/17 & they were sold out of ribs @ 9pm, EST.  I wasn't bothered but made me return. I left with Brisket to go and got the mixture of lean and fatty + jalapenos and I can say... I understand why everyone talks about the brisket here.   :* :*   Next time, I'll shoot for chicken (bone-in) and smoked wings and some more brisket.  Oh! Their sausage isn't bad. It's not beef but not bad.   P.P.S. That cheese dip with brisket - bleh. That cheese dip isn't even Sam's Club in the metal can. It's just tasteless and I would never recommend.   Why the 5 stars? P.P.P.S = Great service + BEST ICE away from Tijuana Flat + BRISKKKKEEETTTT. And the greens~  Muah. :* Parking is available.  Outdoor seating and it fills up quickly after church but decent space regardless of the hour.  I'm shocked there's not more locations.

LR-58eX-quFNfnk3Wbn0nw.text: Our visit was very pleasant. The waitress was very attentive. The food was to die for. Specially, the brisket and the sausage.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

DMkeZpiMGqYzXOiu6eCCJQ.text: Great place for family dinner--we got the Pig Out platter with a few additions, and it was some of the best BBQ I've ever had. Staff was super friendly and nice too

zTeX0qYhxtBaMsiLmbtLhA.text: This has (embarrassingly?) been my staple since moving to the Plaza Midwood neighborhood a couple months ago.  Love so many things on the menu from the collards & baked beans to the sweet tea & beer menu to the burnt ends, chicken, & ribs.  Great staff.  Lots of seating options- patio, bar, high & short tables.

fXWT28XEhL_vSC7XjbuRAg.text: Their smoked wings are just out of this world! And those smoked veggies!!! OMG!!! love love love it! I've been to this place so many times and honestly I have not had one bad thing each time, everything on the menu is top notch. I honestly think they're the best bbq around in Charlotte. Most definitely my fave that's for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

M-an1W1zwal-Gb8VOXXoZw.text: I'm not a HUGE BBQ fan but this place was great!! With moving to the south from Chicago, I knew that I needed to find some good BBQ places and this is definitely one of them!

NyvJUfsf_Wyd_L-a8vt13A.text: Great gluten free options (thanks other reviewers), including a separate gluten free menu. Delicious ribs. Mediocre bacon jalapeno side. Great beer and cocktail selection and overall a really pleasant experience. We came around 1:30pm and didn't have to wait at all.  We hoped to walk back to Charlotte from the restaurant but there was a lot of construction in early fall 2017. So we wound up cabbing, which was worth it since everyone needed a nap after all the amazing food!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside, side street, and nearby parking. Not quite walkable from downtown due to construction
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gluten free version of lunch. Delicious ribs and pickled onion

3kbmdQ_1vdE4E7tWD_RLmA.text: Our kids love the kids BBQ sandwich and playing with an etch a Sketch while we wait.  We eat here weekly as they are peanut-free and the food is amazing.

KVCwnLh_GPAGCPSdcUx1ww.text: A bit of an anomaly that a neighborhood NC bbq joint is known for their Texas-style brisket. But this stuff is legit. Got the large platter with a mix of fatty and lean brisket. Sides were also amazing - beans and bacon-wrapped jalapenos. And apparently 20oz beers are pint prices on Wednesdays, too. The bbq gods smiled on me today and this place did not disappoint- great service as w. I'm just bummed that I probably had the best meal in town on my first night here.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

bM_N_Vf9GfFQm_iRvzMVYQ.text: First time to Charlotte and this was the first restaurant I tried. Sooo good! I'm not a huge BBQ fan, but the food was perfect, brisket was so tender, Mac and cheese was delicious, chili was savory and juicy, hands down best BBQ I've ever had. Wait staff was super friendly and kind!

TP3yDDfVd-3T8nuAoxtIpQ.text: ALWAYS a great grab to eat. LOVE their ribs.  Skylar was our server & shall I say our experience was AMAZING.

WjTzoqyb9Bx8Q1q51nheXA.text: I've eaten here a few times and am always super pleased with the food. Really awesome draft selection. Great service. I definitely recommend this restaurant.

oAQ0sLhSCGvrg67jWV-hnw.text: Midwood Smokehouse has by far the best BBQ in Charlotte. My favorite is the small Carolina Pork Plate with a side of creamed corn. I will say that the cream corn recipe has changed recently and I don't like it as much as the old one. The old one had a really good pepper flavor and the new recipe is a little bland.   I went for a friend's birthday recently - we had a large group and some mild issues getting seated. The hostess seemed a little agitated when she took us outside to sit in the enclosed patio and we asked to be moved inside (I used to be a hostess and would have asked the party if they were okay with going outside before taking them out there and then turning around... but anyway).  Our server was really upbeat and attentive to our needs. He was great! I look forward to going back to Midwood.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

61HqXxXu1RanW3phFw2qww.text: Delicious! Brisket was amazing. Tea was excellent and had crushed ice! Definitely would go again.

HtUWIkx5bisFZjnkxEzfSw.text: The food it good. But the wait is almost always too long, the food takes forever, the waitresses/waiters arent the nicest. If you do go here, I suggest ordering online and pickinh up. But you should probably order like 1 hour before you plan on eating because it sometimes does take an hour or longer. If you have patiebce though. The atmosphere is pretty cool generally. And if you have the time it'll be a decent night

EWyRnlvryQE1euoGDPM_Pw.text: Our favorite BBQ spot in town! We always leave here feeling sick from overeating if that says anything. The classic pulled pork sandwich with a side of creamed corn is just perfect. I love the vinegar sauce. Great casual and fun atmosphere in the heart of Plaza Midwood. Our waiter always remembers us!

vWi8B3bW3Czmzsix2bla2A.text: Restaurant was super busy, but they got our party of six in as soon as we walked in. Food came out very fast and was very good. Our server was excellent. Highly recommend!

0rQt02vevgkMG7Q3imuycQ.text: Midwood Smokehouse is a restaurant I came to know from my foodie Boyfriend. My first experience to Midwood, I was a little skeptical especially because it specializes in NC BBQ, which as a NYer, I'm not really thrilled on BBQ. However, after going numerous times, this place is a hidden gem. The atmosphere is busy yet the staff is very attentive. The drinks are amazing and relatively cheap which is always good in my book. Let's get into the food!!! RIBS are BOMB! Burnt Ends? BOMB.com, the Smoked 1/2 Chicken (Midwood Style) AMAZING. BBQ Queso (Beef Brisket) TASTY. Amongst the sides such as Mac & Cheese, Collard Greens (a little vinegary), Creamed Corn, Sweet Potato Fries and many more are compliments to the party in your mouth. If you are looking for a place to get away in Plaza Midwood, I would definitely suggest this place! You can sit upstairs, outside or even indoors. Order a beer, get some burnt ends, and enjoy your BBQ with any flavored sauce you want. You'll enjoy!

ahQ_oe_ws86ui98BBFRw1A.text: If you are a barbecue fan as I am, you will love this place. The choices of entrees is quite spectacular and the quality is excellent. If you try it once, you will be back Many Times.

2JFLgXM3lM3lXN7ACy0q5g.text: Amazing as always! My fiance and I came in for a date night. We split an order of hush puppies. I got the chopped salad topped with chicken and my fiance got the burger with Mac and cheese. Everything was perfect as usual. If you've never been to Midwood Smokehouse you need to come ASAP! Great food, good drink selection, and a fun atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

qfUbYVEFT5SU-zS5EbwQJw.text: Before I became Vegetarian this was probably my favorite place for good barbecue in Charlotte. customer service is always great the food is always phenomenal and there's hardly ever a wait, the dining area is very open and spacious probably a good place for a casual date or family outing. bathrooms are always clean and waiters are always friendly I highly recommend this place and we'll go here again in the future for their sides. The Mac and cheese is baked and one of the best I've ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hickory Smoked Wings

3Ncf5hAzh_PviLGrgN5h-Q.text: I didn't think this was the best bbq I've ever had. I had high expectations as I heard great things. I got a meat sampler and the pulled pork fell short. I would recommend you trying the brisket that was the best out of the meats that I had tried. I also enjoyed their make your own salad, but they charge you for extra dressing.

GmAqhY2MewZI3e7mC_yPTw.text: This place is amazing. I am not a huge fan of NC BBQ but this place blew me out of the water. I did not choose the Carolina base sauce but chose the spicy one on the side of the ribs. First off the ribs are tender and great with a dry rub. Perfect amount of smoke, sweet and spicy. But add the sauce to it and it takes your taste buds to another level. So many exciting things going on on the pallet. The brisket was so tender you almost have to just pick it up with your fingers. So delicious.   Thanks to all the yelpers who recommended this place. Great find.

7hLTKa_BHimr9TUvtF8tHQ.text: This barbecue is absolutely delicious, slappen if you will. The first order of ribs we got was so tender and juicy that we opted for a second order after we demolished the pig out combo platter. If you get the brisket, ask for the burnt ends because those also blew us out of the park. The veggies were nothing to write home about but the baked beans had jalapeno and so many other tastes in there and definitely worth a try

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Brisket Burnt Ends Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs Coleslaw Smoked Veggies BBQ Baked Beans Chopped Pork

w4QGrSD8qu9XiEJENK0Ikw.text: I knew before I walked into this place that we were going to have an excellent meal. It smelled delicious from down the road. I knew we were going to have an excellent meal again, when I saw the pictures of Barack Obama when we entered. That man knows where to find a good meal. His recommendations are yet to lead me wrong. The staff was friendly and helpful, the food was wonderful and the atmosphere was great. A group of five of us was seated and served without issue. It was a little loud in the restaurant, but that is to be expected on a busy Sunday afternoon. The burnt ends were GLORIOUS! They provide four options for sauces, each one was more delicious than the last. I even got some packed up to take home! Both versions of their cole slaw were excellent. Overall I would definitely go back and would definitely recommend this restaurant to others!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two of the 4 sauces (served warm)
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork sandwich with creamed corn and vinegar based slaw
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The bbq nachos

BVT4prxlgdSB4R0vyO5Syw.text: We were in a barbecue kinda mood, so here we are. I wanted some pulled pork (not on the menu). Usually you can request pulled pork and get it at a BBQ spot. Not here. I asked the waitress and she tells me that the chopped barbecue is "basically like pulled because it's big pieces". I order it against my better judgement. Surprise! It's not like pulled pork! It's chopped into tiny little pork dust and dry (as I find most chopped pork to be). Not a fan. The macaroni and cheese was very salty. The collards were good. The ice in the drinks was the soft nugget style. We also tried the smoked wings and those were good. Doubt we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

e5RQNNd4510wHG7G4hHXXw.text: My boyfriend and I decided to give this place a try based on the positive Yelp reviews. We were visiting from the North and looked forward to some good southern BBQ and were not disappointed. I ordered the chicken and ribs combo and was pleasantly surprised at how much food you got for the price. The ribs were some of the best I've had and the sauce was equally as delicious! My boyfriend enjoyed his Cuban sandwich and of course the hush puppies. Our server was excellent, never letting our drinks go empty and constantly checking to make sure we didn't need anything.   If we are ever back in the area someday, this would be a must stop again!

WpWN4fNwUQtPC8-i2GgukQ.text: The best BBQ in Charlotte, this is hands-down the must-go for any Charlotte visitor and the go-to when I want rich and heavy dinner. You can't go wrong with everything in the menu. I especially love the tacos, ribs, and chicken wings. I'm very sad they no longer have the quesadillas on the menu, but if they ever come back GET THEM. All the sauces are great, ask for the mustard sauce and the habanero sauce, the vinegar and midwood bbq are lovely as well, try them all.

RYUB5Il-62qfPQ9fkDKjEw.text: Yolanda was AWESOME! She was very attentive and managed her section well. We got the pimento fries with brisket on side. The portion was big.  We split the 4 proteins but added the extra rib for $7. We did the smaller plate whatever it's called. We  got pulled pork, fatty brisket and the 2 racks. Creamed corn and Mac and cheese as sides. I asked for side of honey butter for the hush puppies.    I def recommend. The only thing I would suggest is another bartender for a Friday night

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

oBWhO8HV4z6t2VegwIx4UQ.text: This is bar none, my favorite barbecue spot in Charlotte. As a country boy who is used to whole hog barbecued, homemade sauce and crispy skin, it ain't that type of barbecue. However, their brisket taste like it was anointed by God. My wife prefers hers less fatty and I prefer mine fatty. You can get it either way or mixed. The brisket from Midwood is a revelation. Their Mac and cheese is delicious. It is baked and cheesy. The baked beans are great. The sweet and smoky flavor of the beans are a great side. Maybe my favorite baked beans. I also love their bacon wrapped jalapenos. My wife loves their chopped salad. She prefers it with the brisket, but you can have it with other proteins. My wife has had it with the Salmon as well.  We also love their pimento cheese fries with brisket added (of course). Their jalapeno, cheese sausage is a great addition. You can buy them by the link.  The ribs are also tasty and smoked right. I have also had their burger which is another good option. Staff has always been nice. There is ample seating inside, on the covered patio, at the bar and on the roof. If you have not tried it, please treat yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chopped salad with salmon
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sausage, brisket, hush puppies, and baked beans

6rnOa9mnvjIXKtQCxPphLw.text: Loved this place! Prices are reasonable, portion sizes are satisfying, and service is fantastic. The server was knowledgeable about the menu as well as the draft list and able to provide great recommendations. We got a combo platter to share- pork ribs, brisket, and pulled chicken. The meats were very well smoked and seasoned perfectly. The sauces and sides were delicious, as well. The meats had little fat and just the right amount of crispiness. Every bite was warm and satisfying, perfect for a chilly, rainy day (or any day at all really!). For dessert we got the banana pudding and it was to die for. This is coming from someone who hates bananas. Each spoonful was creamy with the perfect texture and sweetness. Highly recommend for anyone wanting a good meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pudding

oLywIa3C8psKVl7gqXikkA.text: This place is the shiiiiz!  I wish they took reservations, but I can see why they don't.  This place is busy! One cool thing is, on Yelp, you can save your spot in line. So perhaps about 15 minutes before you arrive just log in and punch in.   My fiance and I ordered the fried pickles and then shared a Well-Fed Combo platter. This is a great deal if you want to try a little bit of everything but don't want to spend the $$!  The combo platters are huge. Even 2 people splitting, there is more than enough food. Everything was exceptional. My favorite part was the brisket. Least favorite, the sausage. The server was friendly and knew a lot about the area.  Will definitely be back!

RpQBeFFNBxcgf0neTUjK6w.text: Phenomenal BBQ! Burnt ends , pulled pork and brisket were perfect. The cole slaw was off the charts. Our waiter Chris was great! Gave us the info on what to order and he was spot on. Great helpings, great flavor and four types of BBQ sauces.  Highly recommend and will return on my next flight to CLT

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

O7D0o2BKtgboONnAfPXQwA.text: I'm a little bias having lived in Texas for a year.. I feel like I have had my share of excellent and renowned  bbq. I came to midwood via yelp recommendation for some good bbq in the area. It was easy enough to get a table for 2 at lunch time on a Sunday. The menu is pretty big.. it's a restaurant as well as a bbq joint.. so you can get salads and sandwiches too. My friend and I split the combo platter- chopped chicken, chopped pork, brisket, and pork ribs, Mac n cheese, and beans. I enjoyed about half the plate- the brisket, ribs, and Mac m cheese were good-- not better than Texas.. but still tasty enough.   The chicken and chopped pork were so forgettable. In fact it was hard to tell the difference between the 2 chopped meats. This is definitely a rib joint! They have a limited number of beef ribs too.. but at $29/each I am skeptical! They weren't even that much in Texas.   Plenty of seating.. indoors and outdoors. Very casual place. Service was good and there appeared to be daily drink specials.

YpoTqx4E0tg-aSteJx1Nqg.text: Not impressed. For all the great reviews, Midwood Smokehouse turned out to be a disappointment. The weekend special beef ribs were largely overpowered by the over-seasoning and the mac and cheese was way too salty. If you're gonna develop hypertension, at least indulge your BBQ cravings elsewhere.  Born in Atlanta and raised most of my life in North Carolina, I've had lot of BBQ in my day and Carolina style BBQ is absolutely one of the best you can get. Some of my favorites have been in a few local shops in Raleigh and Asheville. Comparatively, the beef rib I had at Midwood was probably the least impressive in flavor. The seasoning was just too much which juxtaposed terribly with the meat since it seemed to have no penetration at all. Moreover, the mac and cheese was so salty I could barely finish it. For a $30+ meal (and a "weekend special"), it was NOT worth it.  Service was fine, no complaints there.

vKuPTE2GlX-5O8C308XV5g.text: Our favorite place to eat.   Had out of town company.  So we could order the Pig Out size platter   Delicious.  The 3 of us could not finish it all.  Lunch for 2 today !   Do yourself a favor and get the Bacon Wrapped jalapenos !

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. $5 Bourbon Flights on Friday
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bourbon

qDv18HCT4DuBPPVIIJpeVA.text: Service was quick and friendly.  The food came out fast!   A friend, who was not hungry, ordered fries with pulled pork that was in the appetizer menu and love it! She had lunch and still took half of the dish home. It was huge!!!  I was expecting a bit more for my ribs. They were well seasoned but not fall of the bone as I would have liked them to be.   The pork burned ends on the other hand..... I could eat a family size portion of it and would ask for more!!!! The fatty bits were perfectly balanced with the meaty soft bits. The sauce it was tossed in was sweet, salty and tangy. Amazing!!!   For sides - sweet potatoes fries, can't go wrong with anything fried and baked beans.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

mhnew8dunmCiMaQllcLPug.text: Hate the parking!!! But the food is good I enjoyed the burnt ends and the bacon wrapped jalapenos. If u come here just know there is always a wait so if your super hungry go somewhere else

l1K3M6qJ1vuhOc0J03dyBQ.text: Best bbq i have ever had! Mac and cheese, ribs, brisket, pulled chicken, chopped pork, and bbq beans are awesome!

vBQ5JvIEQ_fCcOvo53E8VQ.text: Good North Carolina-style BBQ sauces!  Thumbs up from this Midwesterner!  Everything on the sampler was great, but the beef brisket was by far the best of the bunch.  They have mastered searing a thin layer of charcoal-crisp-goodness that brings the dish into another category.

-y6KeBjXkXCI0RfYGH_Neg.text: I got the Well Fed with double Carolina pork, ribs and brisket. All of it was super tender and delicious. Reasonably priced and awesome customer service. Shout out to our waiter Todd. Def come back here if back in NC.

_6xBsMwzjEWaIvZKS3cXQg.text: I've been trying to find a go-to BBQ place in Charlotte for a while, but no more.  Everything here is fantastic, but I loved the pulled chicken with their mustard BBQ sauce.  I could take a bath in that stuff.  So good.  Go get yourself some.

NgdwYqsx5h37V6hX624XNg.text: Yep. Real BBQ, solid beer selection and professional service. Best BBQ I have had in the Southeast. Their brisket is as good as any I've had in Texas and Oklahoma.

E79sdUNRU9Oet4mHAKLKIQ.text: Awesome BBQ, The really know how to smoke a brisket!!!  One of my favorite places to eat!!!!

F08xiKQWp8RniCkZMnZk4w.text: I fell in love with the place after my ex's parents took me there because they absolutely loved the peach cobbler there. I had the ribs and they were perfect, falling off the bone and excellent BBQ sauce. My ex had the chicken sandwich and I fell in love with their mustard BBQ sauce. The only thing I didn't really like was the Mac & Cheese, I didn't like the spiral noodles it seemed like they were not fully cooked, and it lacked flavor. But all in all I will definitely go back again.

c4-CwV_j4P1Yx44Wsen0xw.text: Best brisket in Charlotte - no sauce require....  but the Midwood sauce is great. And I love that the baked beans are more like chili than anything else.

OlH7ofP1j58uhmkLZJrZaQ.text: A great neighborhood option for barbecue. They offer a little bit of everything for everyone--no matter where you fall on the great NC sauce debate (red or vinegar) or SC mustard-style. The pulled pork and the pork ribs are my favorites here. There are good beer options. Standout sides are hushpuppies and mac and cheese. The slaw is only OK, but to me, slaw is essential for barbecue. This is why I wish the small plates came with two sides. The sweet pickled onions are a nice touch. There is a reason it sometimes gets crowded.

pc3_hleF6udI0pjOl48K8w.text: This place is great.  Delicious food.  Affordable.  I like the smoked chicken (a half chicken!) with two sides for $10.  Lots of fun.  Highly recommend.

v5g_pi_Vjiry-dnosnnDqw.text: Excellent ribs, B-B-Q pork, Mac-n-cheese and hush puppies.  Picked up all those things for some visiting "Northeners" and everyone went home very happy.  I even got to enjoy some leftovers the next day and things.  Great location, food and service.  Will go back after I burn off all those carbs.

SSXbABTmCfB7X-9hF3ASiA.text: We decided to check this place, after the reviews .  Hubby and I shared the combination  pick 4 items and 2 sides.  St Louis ribs, pulled pork, brisket and smoked sausage with mac and cheese and bacon  jalapenos.  The ribs was delish ! I could not believe how much meat was on them.  Everything was very tasty.  Our server was very good in helping us decide.  Nice place !.

xYC3VmwnfvUCJNrT7v5Rtg.text: Delicious. My bff and I used to eat here as often as we could. Nomzz.

xKq_QPNFZtVKSEYGG2rHew.text: Caution: know when your body is full. This place is delicious. The brisket made me feel like I was back in Austin. Also had some pulled pork with the mustard and vinegar sauces and it was to die for. The pimento cheese fries as an app are so delicious, but before you know it you have eaten waaayyy more than you intended to. I enjoyed my lunch visit here so much. So much, in fact, that i went home and celebrated with a three hour nap. Solid, cozy place.

VzygshPITqPq6x6lSRbuEA.text: This place is the tits. Ive only grabbed to-go a few times so far but every time its been stellar. BBQ is awesome, mac n' cheese awesome, hush puppies awesome, bacon wrapped jalapenos almost awesome. Everyone in Charlotte is obsessed with Mac's (for some reason,i dont understand at all). but seriously, for food,  Midwood Smokehouse wins it hands down.

504W6RAVIVtRrqe5gKRbLg.text: So good..you really can't go wrong with the brisket or the pulled pork.  Also, bacon wrapped Jalapenos..awesome. Nice beer selection too, which you can't be mad at.

lw6EUsuBq3lBL3HyI9-UJg.text: The best barbecue in Charlotte. You can't go wrong with the pulled pork, sweet potato fries and bacon-wrapped jalapenos.

C5bFX3JAlNbfxE3IoSt_8g.text: Their brisket is hands down the juiciest and most flavorful I have ever had!!  Their appetizers are on point (hello cheese fries) and I always leave there satisfied!!  Good beer specials usually as well - this is a great Charlotte spot.

c8U5EeG69_8Dp0iVhQaeRQ.text: Wow, guess we caught the new Midwood location at a bad time. I've seen and read many favorable reviews, sadly, our experience was such that I told the manager on duty their products were average, at best. We arrived at 9:30, probably not the best time, but if the lights are on and the doors are open, the food should be as good as Noon or 7:00 PM. It was not, not even close. When we opened the car door the smell of wood smoke was a wonderful welcome, that was the highlight. We went in and waited and when no staff came to seat us I went to the bar to ask if they were still serving. She said yes and seated us. It was obvious folks were working to close, it appeared the kitchen had closed down early too. We got four portions of meat -- chicken, pork, brisket and ribs. Without exception they were all overcooked. The ribs were not hot (barely warm) but they were tough and dry. If I had been blindfolded, except for the texture of the meats, I could not tell the difference in taste between the pork and chicken. The chicken was overly moist, as though it had been in a holding tray being warmed and water condensation had dripped on the meat making it too soft. The brisket had a nice smoke ring but like the pork seemed to have been cooked much earlier and dried out. As a result it was tough like the ribs. I have eaten and judged BBQ throughout the southeast, as I told the manager, this would not have made my top ten. In fact if I was judging, under the rules I would have had to write individual notes on each sample as the score would have been so low. Hopefully it was a bad day, the review have been good but on this night it was average, at best. I will go back, it has to be better...

-KTGMCZOhwUBMtqRVSrTWg.text: Ballantyne location: Best BBQ we had in years! Excellent service when ordering takeout. The menu has something for everyone. We ordered Carolina BBQ, ribs, Cuban and burger. Not one negative thing to say.

IAgKQSadN3pFwTSOZDebyQ.text: This is one of my favorite bbq places in Charlotte. You must get the beef brisket - it is so tender. And I have not had a bad side there yet - really loved the creamed corn and the baked beans!!!

J4iMt7-A8NskYJ30JWUaEA.text: The food is amazing.  The staff at the bar today acted as if it was a burden to serve anyone.  It made me feel bad about being here.  I had a to go order and I ordered two glasses of wine, two meal and cheese dip.  I started eating my cheese dip at the bar while I waited to finish my wine.  Some of the chips were stale.  I advised the bartender, she said they are made fresh to order and walked off.  WHAT?  That maybe the case but some of the ones in my box are stale.  Just RUDE! I felt like me or my business was not wanted.  That is a bad feeling.

zHKkKuXhVBVmLr-gdMmwbg.text: My favorite meal in Charlotte. Definitely try the combo platter with bacon wrapped jalapenos. The bar has really fantastic choices and $1.50 PBR.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. City view from the roof

wJygCHD9Gu65HiVSmCkHJQ.text: It has been quite some time since I've found a place for BBQ - of course I haven't really been craving it in a while either.  I had driven by this place countless times (usually on my way to the other great restaurants in the area) but I am glad I finally made a stop in to experience it.  I was super early to meet my friend, so I just hung out at the bar and took advantage of their drink specials.  The bartender(s) were super nice and quick and the bar did fill up rather quickly around dinner time.  Take out orders are also handled/processed at the bar so they got super super busy.  It was nice to see that the bar can multi-task without losing any composure.  When my friend did finally arrive, we ended up sitting at a bar instead of getting a table so I didn't have to close out or anything, but it seems like a lot of people have a drink at the bar and then go have their meal in the dinning room when their party arrives.  We ended up getting a smattering of BBQ... the "Pig Out" plate that included:  Pulled Pork, BBQ Chicken, Ribs, and their brisket (Oh! and two sides) - went with the mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos.  The brisket was melt-in-your-mouth and the bbq was super tasty and everything I had dreamed it should be.  This is my new go-to BBQ place based on my first visit.  Judging my the constant stream of patrons coming through the doors... looks like I may have joined everyone else as well (just a bit late).

TP7ZSmSgu_CLyA6vM0TiVg.text: BBQ Pork Sandwich  Half Rack Ribs Sweet potato fries Hush puppies  ....order it. You literally can't go wrong with flavor like those. Each element was amazing and exciting to come back to. The BBQ sauce alone is amazing but so is literally everything else. You know the meat is prepared correctly when you can eat it on its own without a sauce but why not indulge if the sauce is there!? Call ahead seating is a dream, the reviews are real-we will definitely be going back.

AIyDhKVWz46IjWfo9AxpFQ.text: Came here on a Sunday. My fiance said they had the best bloody marys! I got beef brisket. I love how you can choose fatty or lean. I got fatty and it was so tender and juicy. Macaroni was also good. I would definitely come here again. Staff was friendly too.

K2wiV9zARu_PyntBlOOjnw.text: Another great barbecue joint in Charlotte.  We started off with the fried pickles and bacon wrapped jalepeno's.  The jalepeno's were excellent, full of smokey flavor and cooked just right.  The fried pickles were ok, nothing special though.  I personally like when the pickles are cut thick and these are pretty thin and greasy.  I shared the combo plate and it was good that I did as the portions are crazy big.  I tried the pulled pork, brisket, ribs, and chopped chicken.  All were really good, my favorite was probably the pulled pork.  The brisket isn't quite as good as Sauceman's but it definitely holds its own.  As for the sides, we had macaroni, collards, and hush puppies.  All were great as well.  If you're looking for a great barbecue spot, look no further.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends with bacon wrapped jalapeños and collards.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half a pig right there.

KnrnV2kYUfItAVrHdJ2S4Q.text: The food is good, but the service was so inconsistent.  We had a party of eight and the service started out fine.  Our waitress checked up on us periodically, but as soon as most of the food was delivered, she disappeared.  One person in our party did not get his food and it was 20 minutes before we could flag someone down (and that was not even our waitress; it was still another 10 minutes before we saw her).  You have a party of 8 and mandatory tipping is illegal now so you should be checking up on the table every few minutes, especially after the food is delivered.  The manager comped my friend's meal which was nice, but it was a bad experience overall.  The bacon-wrapped jalapenos and the brisket were just okay.  I am not in much of a hurry to return especially considering the hassle of getting in and out of the place.  They also need some blinds or tinted plastic on the patio.

VvlAAcn9tRXx9GHbKZPb9w.text: This is a nice place to try and don't skip dessert the pecan cobbler is great not too too sweet just right!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The smoked salmon was great the sides were ok! The huspups were good

B_yXhNz45SFk3fJN0KdRvg.text: For lunch the food was great...not a discounted lunch menu though.  Got the "well-fed" portion consisting of chicken, sausage, ribs and fatty brisket (vs lean...in TX we called this moist vs dry). Also creamed corn (meh, a little underdone but the cream was good) and cole slaw (phenomenal). Hush puppies are like savory onion donuts. 22 bucks for all that is not a bad deal. It fed both of us until we were bursting.   Atmosphere is new American bar and grill. Lots of televisions. Saw a few business lunches going on.  Would easily recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

CMFLusBKuxMokWrSLt5jQA.text: Nothing like a little jaywalking and a mad dash across Central ave to stoke the appetite. While the parking is limited the food is great. The pulled pork platter is what I hope for when looking for BBQ. A mound of pork, creamy mac and cheese, hush puppies, along with sweet potato fries, and I'm in heaven. I'm hard pressed to think of a better BBQ place in Charlotte and look forward to trying their new location in Matthews.

2aULz7wjsM-Yh7BA7OdOhw.text: Love this place! Kick ass BBQ the way it's supposed to be!   Fried pickles awesome way to start. Thin sliced and not the chip version. Kudos! Main dinner. The all star is the brisket and ribs! Make sure to order the mixed version of brisket a little fat and some lean to balance the flavor. YUM! Ribs are fall off the bone good! I also had the pulled chicken and pulled pork both tasty and tender! Also along with the pick 4 are the sides you get to pick 2. Skip on the hush puppies as a side because you get some with this combo. I choose mac and cheese and the bacon jalapenos. Mac was thick and tasty and jalapenos....awesome. Bacon wrapped around a hot pepper! Genius! So dam good!  Also they give you three choices of sauce to join your meal. Try them all! There all good.  Killer food guys, killer. Friendly staff cool bbq joint, can't say enough good things about the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hush puppies, Mac n cheese, brisket, ribs, pulled pork and pulled chicken.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love those bacon jalapeños!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deep fried pickles

BuBrE9ueyJsNmOqK3vi9Qg.text: I absolutely LOVE Midwood Smokehouse! I stumbled across this place when I couldn't decide what to eat, and I was not disappointed. It is rare to find juicy well seasoned brisket this side of Texas, but they knocked I think out of the park. The sausage...delicious. the smoked chicken...delicious. The smokey Jalepeno poppers...FREEKIN DELICIOUS   *I SERIOUSLY LIMIT MYSELF TO 3 MEALS THERE PER YEAR*

cenoJvGw-Igmx9NzVPujHA.text: I first went to Midwood when it first open and all I can remember is the mac and cheese. I'm a huge mac and cheese lover so it doesn't necessarily say anything about the entree that I ordered but I was never really motivated to go back.  Well this past weekend we were in the area so we stopped by. My boyfriend pointed out the brisket sandwich and I knew that is what I had to get. Tender brisket on Texas toast with red onions and the best part  . . . blue cheese. It not only lived up to expectations it exceeded it. The flavor was great. And yes, I did get the mac and cheese again and it was as great as I remembered it.  Another must try is the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapenos.  They are great.  Wish they had been a little spicier but that can be hard to gage when it comes to jalapenos.  I am already ready to head back to have that sandwich again.

RVO21Ek4Wv7Dekb-9hXRXQ.text: Three words alone makes this place worth a 4-star review:  Bacon wrapped Jalapenos.   These are the best appetizer and side ever known to man.  Just the right amount of heat and then what isn't good with bacon?  Aside from that, I came here for the ribs which came recommended and they did not disappoint.  They were tender and sauced.  You could get them dry as well but I prefer mine wet.  Everything else on the sampler platter was ok.  The pork was decent but not one of my favorites around town and the chicken was a little dry.  The mac n cheese is one of the better ones around town.  They have local beer specials on Mondays and other specials the rest of the week.  Service wise, they are decent although nothing really stands out with the service.

18HaOiggC16id2SRnn3Rcw.text: I swear the best food ever!! Had dinner with my whole family for my daughters first birthday and it was just the best. The pulled pork is mouth watering!

HOx0BLmuvKEHd1iF-Qf9QQ.text: Succulent Southern goodness!!  I came here with some friends on Saturday. After scouring Yelp, driving around town, and ruling out some places that have been featured on various TV shows (but had terrible ratings), we agreed on this place.   We decided to sample a little of everything: The fried pickles were pretty good, if you're into that sort of thing. (I heard that they're a Southern thing, so I decided to give them a try.) The pimento cheese fries were cheesy and yummy and otherwise delicious! The hushpuppies... well, I could eat those by the pound. Fried just right, not at all greasy. Just a little bit sweet and perfect one-bite sized. Careful though; you can eat a whole order without realizing it (and then you would have no room for BBQ, and nobody wants that!)  I got the brisket "burnt ends" for my entree. To be 'ends', they were surprisingly tender with just the right amount of sweet, smoky sauce. The mac and cheese was the real deal, with the slightly charred cheese on top... just like mama used to make (none of that Easy Mac crap that some of these places try to give you)! The creamed corn was not too sweet, a little peppery... not what I expected, but not bad. My friends got a half slab of ribs and smoked salmon respectively and the only complaint at the table was that there was more food on the table than belly to put it all in.  Stuffed though we were, we HAD to make room for dessert. Our server (Drew?) talked us into some of their homemade banana pudding. After interrogating him thoroughly about the legitimacy of the pudding (Is it banana "flavored" instant pudding? Are there real Nilla wafers in it? Are there any actual bananas in the pudding?), we were informed that it is made fresh by a baker that the restaurant 'stole' from a local bakery nearby.  (And in case you're wondering...No, it's not instant pudding. Yes, there are lots of Nilla wafers inside [and no, they are not soggy! That's a pet peeve of mine], as well as fresh, not browned, bananas).  The pudding was a bit too sweet for my taste (to be fair, I'm VERY picky 'bout my pudding!), but my friends gobbled it right on up.  The cocktails were ok. My friend got a drink with smoked ice (yes, smoked ice) in it that she thoroughly enjoyed. I got something with Jim Beam Devil's Cut, but to be fair, the drinks were in waaaay over their head competing with all the succulent flavors coming from the numerous plates surrounding them. All in all, we had a blast! The service was as good as the food and if I'm ever in Charlotte again, I'll be back!

IPZA7T5bAs53oG1xnkDz6A.text: I had my first Midwood lunch experience today. Service was a bit slow and the place was jam-packed. The food was just as good as it is at dinner, my only real complaint is that there were too few servers and there isn't a lunch menu.   I'll definitely be back, but Midwood is strictly a dinner place for me from now on.

F7I2Vg4xbD0wj2zeaiSoEw.text: It's good but some reservations  on the Plus side: Awesome Greens and BBQ Beans, in fact all their sides seemed good; again maybe best beans I have ever eaten. Nice place - almost trendy inside, very unlike a normal BBQ joint Obviously fresh baked potato buns  on the Minus side: BBQ pork was average at best A bit expensive but I guess that pays for the nice accommodations the bun flavor was quite strong actually stronger than the BBQ pork flavor  Overall - good but wouldn't be my first choice.

LmpeWsbsl3zjNYW9A5hQLQ.text: It is a favorite of ours.... we used them to cater 2 weddings in 2 days... can't say enough great things about them!!!!

OGtwFtSSsqgej8MiEdCzdw.text: Great BBQ! The atmosphere is not my favorite but the food is always good. Their side salad for $5 is fantastic with the avocado goddess dressing! I eat here more than I care to admit and order it at least once a month to go. Great place to eat or order out and eat at home.

vUkO9R5yz1suElZQ2lTw7g.text: Great bbq and the sides are incredible!  There's something for everyone and a fun place to go.

61je76Q6gHDm4kIivc3dbA.text: The salads, brisket, sides, and cue are outstanding! Two out of three rib orders very dry. Recommend other menu items instead of the ribs.

3H5sk_NLfFIZH9rVgB30eQ.text: with a hangover and no desire to make that ridiculous trek from NoDa all the way over to southend for BBQ, my buddy Ty geniusly brought up Midwood Smokehouse.  i cannot remember what the place was before this, but that was the last time i was there.  we bellied up to the bar and the quite capable barkeep, Chad, proceeded to help us.  he had just gotten done writing the special on the mirror behind the bar, and it was just what we needed.  8 oz. of brisket over mashed potatoes with a side.  i had originally said that i was down for the creamed corn, but then changed my mind after seeing bacon wrapped jalepenos with cheese inside.  oh my.  the brisket was succulent with fantastic flavor.  the mashed potatoes weren't too bad, but nothing crazy.  might have been a tinge of garlic to them.  the bacon wrapped jalepenos were awesome.  everything my mouth wanted and stomach needed  after a night of drinking.  about halfway done with my meal, one of the other servers said he forgot my creamed corn and brought me a cup of it.  good consistency with a tinge of cheese to it, which was a good spin i thought.  my only possible complaint about the place would be that their ceilings are high and they put the televisions as much out of the way and as high as possible.  sitting at the bar, this means you are craning your neck to watch the games.  being a stone's throw from the beaver and having ample outdoor seating, there will be a return trip with fairer weather coming.

DYv1FdWWHg9h2XzIPetATQ.text: Excellent mac and cheese! Great sauces. But to be honest, Mac's speed shop has better pulled pork.

PKqUY7Oi2r417EMIQ30DWA.text: Best BBQ in Charlotte.  Didn't think I would like anywhere better than Mac's but this place.  Must have the bacon wrapped jalapenos as a side!

oRTVCSofQQwacaleX0nx-w.text: I love good BBQ so I'm definitely loving Midwood Smokehouse. I've been trying to find a good brisket lately and I think the search is finally over. They actually let you choose what type of brisket you like (fatty or lean) and their BBQ sauce is spot on. My brisket was really tender and was cooked to perfection. It wasn't rubbery at all... The bacon wrapped jalepeno's are an awesome idea (of course wrap anything in bacon and I'll love it!). Their baked beans were delicious too... If you're craving some BBQ this is some of the best in the Charlotte area.

OMh6oCM1uCHoF2EbaTq_Ng.text: Great BBQ and Service.  The mustard and vinegar BBQ sauce was great.  The waiters were very friendly and talkative.  Had a great time.

ZAv-AfVhK017XvYlNdYavA.text: Yum, glad I looked on Yelp.  Milwood Smokehouse was fantastic.  Ate the sampler and it was worth every bite.  Left no morsel behind.  Always looking for great BBQ and everything was spot on tonight.  Yes Mac and cheese and yes on the bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers.  Also great friendly service.  How many local beers?  Great selection just bring me one.   Will be returning.

mn4kJOsrhABfOXcWtbjIbw.text: Better than most...  But not among the best BBQ in the city.  Good to above average service.  Visited for lunch.

ff6vGUIrh7DU91bVM73SXw.text: Bacon        Wrapped.............. Jalapenos!  WOW  Besides loving the location of this place and the decor, the food is downright impressive!  I will never go to Mac's again.  Great drink specials and great prices on entrees.  This is as good as it gets in Charlotte.  The pulled pork was savory and moist-didn't even need sauce, and this is coming from the condiment queen!  I usually never order chicken because they are usually dried out, but I could really taste the smokey flavor come out-almost as much as the pulled pork.  This was my first visit and I will absolutely be returning!  My only complaint is that the mac and cheese could be more cheesy...just sayin...  still good though!

ug3HSm-2ueueVVPZOWEpfQ.text: Yummy bbq with yummy sides. Straight forward and simple. They have been so successful they expanded not long after opening, doubling the size of their space. Wait staff is good about checking the table and I've never had any real issues with my food, it never takes long! My whole family enjoys midwood!

AlURwnxy2gwvsPrkL6SfGQ.text: Hostess was extremely rude because we had originally requested for a party of 8 and only 6 showed up. We had no idea till the last minute and she was acting put out and ridiculous over something called life. Get a grip and hire people who treat your guests well. We are the people who make sure you keep getting a paycheck. Food was decent but will not be back due to her rudeness.

uDoVSiJ1f2jt_lKBhznbyw.text: So far the best we have found in Charlotte.  Pulled pork is cooked and seasoned just right!  Don't miss the fried pickles and save room for the pecan cobbler.  Warm pecan cobbler is amazing and worth every calorie!!  Atmosphere is fun, great outdoor seating for when the weather is warm.

oGad5fe94Q7Y1X60fxVKnw.text: The food is amazing. The one time something came out improper (lean instead of fatty brisket) they took care of it within minutes. Great beer and drink selection for a food focused restaurant.

FEO82EsKjQdQUti7Eq7Epg.text: I'm a sucker for good BBQ. Of course I am - I'm a Southerner by birth and the grace of God! So I am always excited by the prospect of some good 'cue.   I'm sad to say, I gotta give it 3*s 'cos it's a crazy mixed bag. Some things are incredible (this is some of the best pulled pork and mustard sauce I've had in the Queen City, and no mistake about that; the bacon-wrapped jalapenos are delicious; and the collards are downright tasty), but other things kinda... Suck, frankly (as noted by others, the service, for one - why did I have to ask MULTIPLE TIMES to have my water replenished, for example? I don't know - they weren't that crowded). And some of the menu items kinda just didn't get it done for me - the ribs, for example, were well-prepared, but I couldn't taste the ribs for the flavour of the wood in which they were smoked; the mac 'n cheese is merely middlin', and Mac's brisket is far superior. And since when does a server not offer dessert, anyhow?   So, it gets a solid three: what it gets right, it gets CRAZY right. What it gets wrong, though, really puts a damper on things.

5umwnwQmneFj5Q2JYVhvRg.text: Great Carolina BBQ place! First time having Carolina style BBQ and this place was awesome.  Pulled pork - awesome.  Brisket - awesome. St. Louis ribs - awesome.  Hush puppies - F'in awesome! Actually the first time I had them and were so good I ordered an additional side order for dessert.  Definitely look for this place if you are in Charlotte.

pjE6oia4k0FWzxJNTD0L4g.text: Of course, the Cuban sandwich and the cheese stuffed, bacon wrapped, jalapenos are a must.

2dxunKhGPr-EoRGheEi_jw.text: I feel sorry for anyone who thinks this is the best BBQ in Charlotte. We had a bad experience here a couple years ago, but family kept going back so we wanted to give it another chance. HORRIBLE MISTAKE. The BBQ queso was not good at all. Looked and tasted like microwaveable dip from a jar. The tortilla chips were somehow stale, oily and unsalted all at the same time. I got the grilled cheese with pork which subsequently turned into a BBQ sandwich with half a piece of cheese. If you're going to call it a grilled cheese - it should be ooey gooey - just saying. Also did not taste or see the grilled onions and creamy tomato sauce it was supposed to come with. My boyfriend got the brisket plate. It was dry, tough, and completely overcooked. That's the first time I've ever seen him leave brisket on a plate. Service was bottom five I've ever had. We live right around the corner, but would much rather drive to Mac's than come here ever again. Mac's has bigger portions, better food and wayyyy better service for the same price.

kKqBUND4Fh5ch2PGLHDlKw.text: We will never go to this racist place again. My husband along with my son waited for over 10  minutes for someone to serve us, no one ever stopped by to even greet us. They weren't even busy, I watched a few tables get sat after us and the servers didn't waste any time going to greet them and taking their drink order. One server walked by us twice and looked at us without saying a word and she wasn't busy bc she was standing around talking to other servers who were waiting for tables. I'm sure if we weren't black they would have greeted us with a smile, but we decided to get up and leave and spend our money elsewhere. I just moved to Charlotte and clearly I don't know the rules about the white and black sides of town and clearly this is for the white people!

z1jmrFDaBlxBgzAdqDEdMQ.text: Yep...that's it, this place makes it all the way up to my #1 spot for Q.  Finally had the pleasure of giving it a try the other night and dined on some absolutely delicious beef brisket.  Brisket is a pretty tricky thing because it can dry easily and become very chewy, etc.  This on the other hand was falling apart it was so juicy and tender.  Prior to stuffing my face with the brisket I enjoyed some jalapeno peppers wrapped in bacon...good lord!  The temperature will sneak up on you so be careful but the taste is oh so good.  Great beer selections and a cozy neighborhood restaurant feel really seal the deal for me.  I'll be back.....OFTEN :)

eWFohgGpXL6Sfwx3U17ubg.text: Came here for dinner while visiting a friend- great place to grab some barbecue take-out. We chose to avoid a sit-down because it was crowded and loud. The Carolina pulled pork is great- light vinegary sauce packed on the side so you could put it on later. Hush puppies were good too.
