The Mac and cheese was thick and creamy and the noodles were cooked just right- not mushy like some places. Husband had the tacos and loved them! Our friends are regulars here and we know why!

R5IaUH-eaA2YfgmimTIYQQ.text: Fantastic brisket and burnt ends. Love the bacon wrapped jalapenos poppers.  Baked beans very good and nice selection of draft beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinner

b7hWpJ6ReP7T2hC1qudH3A.text: I have a hard time picking between this and Mac's Speed Shop for best BBQ in the city. Midwood is really close to my condo so I usually go here.   Oddly enough their pulled pork is my least favorite thing here. But literally everything else I've had on the menu is out of this world. Bacon wrapped jalapenos... umm YES. Brisket is phenomenal, BBQ chicken isn't run of the mill chicken at all, extremely flavorful and different. Just thinking about the smell of this place makes me hungry.  Tip: if you get the BBQ chicken instead of the mustard based BBQ sauce ask to get a few different ones on the side so you can taste them all.

b4Z7doe9Klc0TJWqGcmdgA.text: I'm not really sure what the fuss is about this place... maybe I came on a bad day?  However I had heard this place was beyond amazing and when I left I really had no desire to ever go back. Well maybe I'll give it another try if only for the banana pudding which was REALLY good (almost like grandma made it but only almost lol).  The jalapeno poppers were not good. They had a weird texture, were soggy, and the bacon was not even close to being crispy. I was very disappointed!  The pulled pork was okay but I've had oh so much better in my life (anyone who has had Lexington BBQ can attest to that).  The macaroni and cheese reminded me of something you'd get in a cafeteria. Again I just wasn't impressed!!  Our waitress was nice but clueless. She just never seemed to have her act together, couldn't remember our orders (yes she wrote them down??) and asked us if we wanted to order desert before our dinner was even brought out. I'm sensing that some other reviewers may have had this same waitress lol.  All in all I have numerous friends who keep raving about this place so I'm going to try it one more time to see if maybe I just got them on a seriously off day. If it's still not good then I may need to question my friends taste levels haha  Oh one more thing, the beer selection was good in my opinion!!

A2nKWpcpBse0vcZOv6WaVw.text: Can't go wrong ordering the ribs. The brisket and burnt ends are excellent too. The pecan cobbler is one of my favorite desserts to get when I am in Charlotte. I always make a point to come to Midwood Smokehouse when I am in town. Can't wait until they open their location in Columbia, SC!

M_jqWOU2L0eQJbBuhjJ92A.text: Went here on a busy Saturday night on the recommendation of a friend. The beef brisket (lean) was the best I've eaten anywhere - and I've eaten plenty in my day.   The ribs were a bit dry. The highly touted creamed corn didn't do it for me. I didn't like creamed corn before and I don't like it now, so no deduction for that.   Another friend of mine had the smoked sausage and raved about it. The big surprise for me was the appetizer of smoked chicken wings! Meaty and delightful - not fried or swimming in sauce.  Extra credit points for the men's room decor!

fRgnyqZdFvbQKOIgnD0b8A.text: Has got to be the best brisket I've ever had, bar none!  Smoked wigs are also delicious too!

6pbIHl9KMkvNYnQ4D_oYQw.text: Visited this past weekend.  The food was really good.  We started off with the smoked wings,  pretty good nice flavor, but not as good as Sticky Fingers smoked wings.  We had burnt ends plate and the the combo platter with brisket, ribs, turkey and pulled pork  Burnt ends-  Good but nothing special  Brisket-  Juicy and flavorful (portions on the combo werent that big)  Turkey-  surprisingly the best thing on the plate,  good flavor and was very moist  Ribs-  A little too fall off the bone for me, but were still very tasty  Pulled Pork-  Not bad  very juicy the flavor wasnt to my liking though  Sides we had Mac and Cheese -  Nothing special here but still good  BBQ Baked Beans-  were  the best beans I have had EVER!  So good I had to order some to go ( kinda disappointed though because for $5.00 the container I got was on the small side and not even full)  So far this is the best BBQ I have had in Charlotte

UhShzCChag1RCJqHc8p5XQ.text: Midwood Smokehouse features the best smoked brisket this side of Lockhart, TX.   Definitely my go-to BBQ restaurant in the Charlotte area.   If you haven't been, don't delay.   Go and enjoy!

9JDD31GCak44xKlyqLzVLw.text: This place is amazing! I've lived in NC my whole life and while this isn't your mom and pop BBQ joints I am so fond of from my childhood, Midwood is a perfect blend of authenticity and creativity. The "secret" is that the folks here really care. They sincerely want you to have a great time, serve you some amazing food, and have you leave with a smile.   On my most recent trip, my girlfriend took me to Midwood for my birthday. Although there was a line, they quickly seated us and we were greeted by our waiter Jimmy who was attentive and friendly. I always get the BBQ sampler with double dry ribs, smoked sausage, and fatty brisket. I had been hesitant to try the bacon wrapped jalapenos because I saw some complaints on Yelp. But on Jimmy's recommendation, we got an order and they were to die for! Really, really delicious.   Their meats are perfectly smoked, full of flavor, consistently moist, and always memorable. If you're looking for a great, fun, foodie place - look no further than Midwood Smokehouse!  P.S. Their hushpuppies are the best I've ever had!

4FR-EQdP4BGGweK0lmP3cA.text: I am a pescatarian and also have a weird wheat allergy so basically I'm an extremely difficult person to eat with. My husband eats all the things and especially adores ribs and any BBQ. I was initially very hesitant to eat here as the only thing I can get is the salmon with a side of veggies and that can get boring. I was wrong. We eat here all the time, I'd probably eat their salmon every night if I could. It's alarmingly good. I mean possibly the best salmon I've ever had good. And according to my husband every other thing on the menu is also amazing.  The service is consistently great. Once we had an obviously new and overwhelmed server on a busy night, she kept forgetting things and we felt bad for her, and instead of getting angry the manager and other servers just pitched in and were extra friendly. It's always great to see supportive coworkers and customers who are so thrilled with their food that they don't get all rude and complain-y about some occasional mishaps. 10/10 would recommend.

V4TTP_m14cfct1gMRSn8VQ.text: Disappointed. I have tried this place twice....hoping the second time would be better, but it wasn't.  Both times, servers were less than friendly, were upset if you just felt like drinking iced tea with your lunch, and whatever you do, don't ask for extra bbq sauce - it might not be part of her job description that day.   Ordered tacos - brisket tacos might as well have bee called beef jerky tacos because the meat was dry and there was a sliver of avocado so the bite I took stuck to the roof of my mouth. The Chicken taco was GREAT! The jalepeno in the middle was still very crunchy, but the taco overall was good!  Nachos - not good. The server said it was homemade queso - which apparently translates to melted shredded cheese.  The Chili was good. Good flavor and texture. I like the other restaurants within this group, but this one really let me down.   For good BBQ go to Mac's on South Blvd.

vmtlBZPAiVKk7rNWxt9vow.text: I love this place. The foods great! Especially the smoked wings and the pulled chicken-

dVCj9cQnHo5-stMaUcNuAQ.text: Best BBQ place in Charlotte hands down. The portions are huge and the service is usually pretty quick. I wish they had a sweet BBQ sauce but I can go to Sonny's to get my fix for that. Never had anything I didn't enjoy here!

0kVZS9GlfLILlkQo5HDKxA.text: My husband and myself stumbled upon Midwood Smokehouse when we were on our way to our favorite barbque restaurant, He was reluctant to forgo getting to eat at his favorite place but he gave in to me and man alive was we both glad he did. I had the brisket with the Best mac and cheese and he had barbque. Everything was so delicious right down to the tea. We definitely will be returning and bringing our friends. This was one time that him taking the scenic route paid off.  Beth & Kevin Chapman

xL6AoYKFJuFBmSND6ekXLg.text: Let's start with the good:  The bacon wrapped jalapenos were very delicious.  I think that they are cooked in a bit of brown sugar and some spices so they have a great sweet and spicy flavor.  Now the bad:  The BBQ, which is the most important part of  a BBQ place, was very mediocre.  I got the sampler plate with ribs, brisket, and pulled pork and I would describe all 3 as dry and a bit tough.  Basically, this is Chili's or Wendy's or some other fast-food-type place level BBQ trying to masquerade as real BBQ.  Even a mediocre hole in the wall type place will have better BBQ than this place.  I don't go to Charlotte that frequently and I was upset that I trusted the reviews on yelp and went to this place.  I wasted an opportunity to try a better BBQ joint.

-V1J4jA8qPiD1urMCseBBg.text: Visiting NC just for a night. Was lucky this place was highly recommended. The food was great as well a s the service. We had ribs and burnt tips. Everything was delicious. Server and staff were attentive and very friendly. Although I don't condone this... My sister got caught trying to make off with a souvenir beer glass (not cool) nonetheless one of the staff. Handed her a clean one. I've been around the world a thousand times. I love good bbq when stateside and this place surely impressed me enough to give a shout out on yelp.

qZWx_WdZFix9LXDpVFqHtA.text: Great service and pretty good BBQ.

7k-kSX77oidy-bNTnYUaqA.text: Moist brisket. Pulled pork. Both top notch. Homemade sauces. Hush puppies- 5 on the plate not too many not to few and Delish. Bacon wrapped jalapenos were a guilt inducing treat and the collards were as good as my dearly departed Mema's

Asmw_8One92eYdCm-wRnTA.text: Went for lunch last week and ordered the salad with pulled pork. It was good, and the portions were generous. The salad itself wasn't very exciting, but the bbq was good. I was so so on the bbq sauce, but tend to like it pretty sweet. Ordered a diet coke and it came in a plastic bottle, wasn't as good of course vs fountain as I had anticipated.

NvZrdiTkMcWRHwhEc4x16w.text: Get the brisket or pulled pork it's truly amazing!!! Great bbq but a bit pricey. Service is very friendly. Food can take while so don't go if your in a rush.

j_-tTWlqiIp8umeIR7SANg.text: THE best barbecue I've ever had! Meats were tender and full of flavor. Wish they had one out in Los Angeles!

mYe7ek_Vf7dzDe8Pmm9IQw.text: Living in Charlotte for over 10 years I don't think I have tasted a better BBQ than this place the meat is so juicy and delicious it's hard to stop eating when full, there is usually a wait anyway from 10-30mins sense this place is very popular which isn't bad, service and servers are usually nice  you get your food pretty quickly only downfall for this place is parking there is only few spots to park in ( you can't park across the street I got a boot last time and had to pay 125$ fine to some shady looking guys so don't park there just a tip) other than that I truly advise you to try this place if you haven't yet

jeUS0noVh_I1pJTJwoIk_Q.text: Midwood is my go to place in Charlotte for bbq. I've been to some of the other locations and this one was no different. I'm from Georgia where we do bbq slightly different than the Carolinas so I was happy to find a place that had great bbq here. We went on a busy Saturday night, but our wait was only around 10 minutes. This visit, I went with the brisket queso which was amazing. The brisket was tender and flavorful as always and the price is very reasonable. One big reason I also enjoy Midwood is their Mac n Cheese. Most places these days just give you noodles with some nasty cheese sauce on them, but Midwood actually provides baked mac n cheese the right way. There is also a large parking lot across the street which is nice so parking is a breeze. Midwood is always a good option.

yfkPnoe_rUD1GZmrZIKULg.text: I found my dining experience to be average here. We ordered a four meat combo platter with Mac and cheese and collard greens as sides.  First and foremost the food here does not come out up to temperature, just like warm. The Mac and cheese was good but not warm. The collard greens were pretty bland to have been cooked in pork, not very smoke or seasoned. The jalapeno cheddar sausage was good.  The rest of the sampler was average if not a little dry.  There are better choices in Charlotte. Service was on point and decor was really cool. Overall just average. Dinner for two with one beer and a tip was 55.00 not worth what the price.

iUpPZFA1niDE3u80AdyqfA.text: This restaurant is absolutely a must when you are in Charlotte. We had the combo of ribs, pulled chicken, pulled pork and jalapeno sausage with hush puppies. You also get 2 side which we chose the baked beans and collards. The portion called "Well Feed" is plenty for 2 people. We even wound up taking some home. Good local beers on tap, nice selection and great taste. Our waiter, Donny, was fabulous! He was there the minute our drinks were low. When we had questions he had answers without hesitation. The restroom needed a little TLC but other than that it's a definite 5 star!

zlNrEW-qV9ghCySoG31K-w.text: I am a lover of beef brisket. I think this may well be the best in Charlotte. If you know of a better restaurant for brisket, please tell me so I can give it an equal opportunity. Next time I'm at the Midwood Smokehouse, I'm going to try their brisket Burnt Ends. My son's favorite.

Z8pnwC7ClY7_V5wFGDAFTQ.text: Stopped in Charlotte for a night on the way back from Georgia. My wife recommended this place based on it's Yelp rating and the fact she knew I was jonesing for BBQ while in the south. We ended-up splitting a BBQ platter that included ribs, Cheerwine (soda) burnt ends, pulled pork and brisket; sides included mac-n-cheese, collard greens, hush puppies and coleslaw. I also ordered banana pudding to-go because I can't pass it up when eating BBQ. While I only had one, the beer selection was great and very local, which was exactly what I was looking for.   They also have tacos. I didn't order them, but it seems strange and worth mentioning.  The ribs were amazing. They were a little saltier than I've ever had and I still can't discern wither that helps or hurts them. Everything else was really good, but not great. The coleslaw and hush puppies were almost tasteless. There was a lot of mediocrity here, but I'm giving 4 stars based on the ribs, banana pudding and beer selection.

MOrghIAktsqzw0TSiWTNMQ.text: Great food! Brisket was excellent. Friendly staff and cool vibe. I definitely recommend.

lDa37V06sdWoflSwpfYBeg.text: Just WOW!!!!  Lots of flavors. Great Que, Brew, and Bourbon. Service was excellent too. We'll be back.

qfDry_PwL8bb5ezbuvIwrA.text: One of the best places for bbq in Charlotte! Love their platters as you get a lot for your money.

hULxJhuDWRuVtacr-Dpr4g.text: Love the Midwood Chopped salad! Tasty and it works for vegans who have meat-loving friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

6_TC3ofp94GEnVhm6pW2HA.text: In CLT for business, civilian consultant to the US Army 81st RD/Dept Public Works, expansion to facility located close to various restaurants located off Central Avenue. These being Midwood-Five Guys-Yana Sushi-YAFO-Roasting CO. We chose Midwood as their other location is outside a Ft Jackson SC gate and many choose to dine...I parked in an open parking lot defined as "Central Square", no lot attendants thus assumed all the noted restaurants in this stream had appropriate parking based on their capacity to serve CUSTOMERS for their revenue.  NO they don't, my $9 burger (which was good) cost me a total of $134 as my car was "booted" by CLT Wheel Blockers & Towing..in less than the time it took for me to park, walk into Midwood my car was "booted"...Total SCAM, shame on all that your business cannot provide parking for a customer-base...I shall make sure this is known as best I can to prevent unsuspecting customers they are about to be ROBBED !!!!

RNXslHx-VbpovSprEkWqwQ.text: So I ate the burnt pork ends here one time and it was one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. With the exception of a couple unmentionable things. But then I had them again next time and they were covered with sauce, which was not how they came the first time. The sauce killed all the Smokey goodness and made the dish very bland and undesirable. I came one more time and ordered them again, this time specifying no sauce, but they came with sauce anyway. Sucked donkey balls once again. If they stopped putting the sauce on the burnt pork ends it will for sure knock your genitals out the back of your pants. Otherwise....boooooooorinnng. The food here otherwise is pretty good. You can't go wrong with the pulled pork. Service is good.

d0g5R5MWeSe_7PN1FnX0og.text: BBQ time!  The great: sauces were very tasty, especially that vinegar sauce on the pork! Mac and cheese was bomb. A baked mac topped with cheddar combined with a cheese sauce to resist dryout: the way it's supposed to be. (If you're thinking "obviously," I agree but somehow a lot of places still serve casserole mac sans cheese sauce and it just doesn't work.)   The good: pork was slightly too dry, relying completely on the vinegar sauce. I would have liked it to be more moist on its own, but with plenty of sauce, it still worked. The bacon wrapped jalapenos had wonderful flavor but the bacon was somewhat undercooked. These mugs should be crispy outside, not chewy.  The okay: the chicken! way too dry! No amount of mustard sauce could moisten it up. Here's a tip from a real actual one-time barbecuer at a restaurant that, (no dis, it's just the truth) made better BBQ than y'all: If you're hot-holding your meats with the lid off, you need to periodically add stock to keep the moisture up. If not, toss it on your flat top and give it a squirt of stock (or water if you're out of stock), cook it for literally 20 seconds. The boiling stock (or water) will heat it in no time and it will be nice and moist!  I did this with my leftovers and it allowed the smokiness of the chicken to take center stage. DO IT!!  The bad: nothing!  Good job guys! A well-deserved 4 out of 5!

iQ547nC7YSlo3Pd7jzq5yg.text: BEST BBQ IN CHARLOTTE. After you experience the pleasure that is Midwoods smokehouse, you will not like bbq from anywhere else. I am only writing this post for the original location. Fatty brisket, bacon wrapped jalepenos, mac n cheese, and pork ribs are world class. Melt in your mouth meats and hefty portions. YOU CANNOT GO WRONG WORH ANYTHING HERE. TRUST ME AND GO.

Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. House margarita and Tito&#39;s kicking mule. Love the kick.

DppaZKsMnP5OLjMvKkfl2Q.text: One of my favorite things to do when I return home is have NC style bar b q. This is the best I have had. I had the Carolina pulled pork plate. The smoked meat was great by itself. With the added mustard & jalapeno (they make all 4 of their sauces) sauce it was over the top.  The combination of the side of slaw & pickled onions created a delicious party for the taste buds.  Server, Keely, was the bomb with great recommendations & attention.  I look forward to returning next time I am in town.

PSAyk_ShMtiMT9HXc8mTCA.text: Always impressed with the food, rarely disappointed, wish all Charlotte restaurants could be this consistently good.

rKV2H6UzNVFaLQet0H_TWA.text: While traveling threw North Carolina I was in the Charlotte area this place has some of the best authentic NC bbq around the decor inside is laid back and pays homage to the pig the staff was friendly we were traveling with a large group of over 10 people and we were seated in less then 10 minutes the menu is straight forward they stick to the basics but they do it right their beef brisket is fatty and juice it's so tender it falls apart in your mouth it has the perfect bark on the outside while tasting juicy and moist they have a pig out platter which gives you the option to pick and try 4 proteins along with 2 sides the pulled pork is juicy and their ribs are fall of the bone with just enough smoke in them they have a large selection of beers and drinks which makes this location perfect for coming to enjoy some authentic NC bbq their max and cheese is amazing cheesy deliciousness their nachos are so big yo will have left o era unless you share

3q2EHbtdRjQJeO-G6KDDHw.text: Had the 4 option meat platter - very generous portions of food.  Pulled pork, ribs, sausage, and brisket.  I wasn't a fan of the pulled pork, but it's a preference thing.  It was too dry and the vinegar taste was too strong for me.  The ribs and sausage were really good.  Brisket was good.  The BBQ sauce (house bbq) was super good.   Sides I wasn't impressed with - Mac n cheese was just okay - noodles were undercooked and the cheese just wasn't great, and def needed salt (and pepper) if you like pepper.  The bacon wrapped jalapeno was just a bacon wrapped jalapeno - not good, not bad, but it was encouraged as a unique offering so I ordered it.   Most people come to BBQ spots for the meat, so overall good spot and good portions for the money.   Super friendly staff.

zNIavfIHyfxaWa_HL83Idg.text: Been here 5 or 6 times since I moved to Charlotte last year. As a lover of 'cue who has traveled all over the south in search of the choice stuff, I've actually been kinda disappointed with the clt bbq scene overall.  But midwood smokehouse holds its own.  I mean, it's no 12-Bones (outta Asheville), but you'll leave happy enough.  The ribs are quite good, as is the pulled pork and brisket (I like a mix of lean and fatty).  Sausage was only alright, and I'd steer clear of the KC burnt ends, normally one of my favorites, but which were too tough and bland for my liking (lacking that sharp bark-y zing). Sides are solid: mac and cheese, beans, Carolina slaw, and bacon-wrapped cheesy jalapenos for the m'fin WIN!  Also has pretty good beer list, especially if you like NC and Southeastern craft brews.

UYyTtrC-s77YsTfv2sPlHw.text: The ribs were good, the sauce without a doubt add a nice kick to the juicy ribs. The service was certainly good, however there is room for improvement. The atmosphere was good and customers seemed happy with the food. There is plenty of parking in the area and location is relatively accessible. I'll be back!

oXXgRrQaIrzKvSsdo5FuAA.text: Midwood Smokehouse offers a wide range of barbecued (would this translate to "cooked-out" in the South?) goodness. Don't be fooled by the neon pigs on the sign, they faithfully prepare chopped chicken, turkey, and the best darn beef brisket ever to have graced my gullet in addition to the classic pulled pork, ribs, and sausage. These are all topped perfectly with amazing sweet, vinegar, and mustard -based bbq sauces. The vibrant flavors of the vinegar and mustard sauces have converted me away from the sweet sauces of my childhood.  While the menu is filled with a surprising array of sandwiches, salads, and sides, I've just stuck to their combo massive platters that comes with choice of 4 meats, 2 sides, hush puppies, and pickled onions. Enough to gastronomically stuff 2-3 people for $19? Now that is some gastro-nomics right there!  But wait, there is more! Did I mention the respectable local draft beers from the likes of OMB, Big Boss, and Four Friends? Plus 1/2 price on Mondays--an OMC Copper for $2.50?! I tip my bbq-stained hat at you sir!  Taken together, when visiting friends and family want to experience some local flavor, this place is on the short list.

YAl0t6CC1bBjqaf_AjYnNw.text: Great BBQ -smokehouse. Lots of choices and combos. Moderately priced.  Great service too. Several locations around Charlotte.

r_BfxX3EJQU124Yfo0Iafg.text: I really wanted to rate this place higher, but I just couldn't do it. The food was good, not great. The server was better than good, I had expected slow service after reading other reviews, but our waitress was on the ball with water refills and taking our order.   We started with an order of hush puppies, which my Wife and Daughter enjoyed. My meal came with them, so I waited for those. Alex ordered a brisket sandwich, which was served stacked on a bun. She selected mac & cheese as her side. She loved the mac & cheese, and said that the brisket was OK, but not as good as I make. I think she was sucking up for something from her Daddy. Alina ordered the BBQ Chicken sandwich. She really enjoyed her choice, and had the yummy mac & cheese as well. I splurged, and order a large burnt ends plate, with sides of cole slaw and bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers. Let's start with the sides. The cole slaw was chopped, and a tasty mixture of white and purple cabbage. It was a little dry for my taste, but it was still good. I loved the pepper poppers. They were the highlight of the meal. The bacon was cooked just right, not crispy and not undercooked to be chewy. The peppers had just the right amount of heat, and the cheese blended nicely with the 2 flavors. I loved them (in case you missed that the first time). Lastly, the burnt ends. I have prepared burnt ends a couple of times, and I think mine turned out better. My issue with these are that they seemed more like chinks of meat, rather than the actual ends of the brisket. They were tasty, but mostly from the sauce they were tossed in. I liked the smoky flavor in each bite, but the meat itself was nothing special.   So 3 stars? Mostly because of the price. Our bill was $42, with only 1 soft drink on the tab. For what we got, it was an expensive lunch, with no to go boxes.

ufmzBXeWEPypzK42Se0TFw.text: My son and I flew in from the West Coast for a weekend workout and we wanted some great BBQ--we found the perfect place in this gem!  The food was AWESOME and Rachel and Matt took great care of us. They walked us through the menu, made some great suggestions and pointed out some don't miss items, including the bacon wrapped jalapenos and fried pickles.

PMJV7FWYqAKF0OXcy5RSdw.text: The bbq itself is ok.  The 5 stars are for the Banana Pudding.  Pure heaven - I'd go out of my way to stop just to have the Banana Pudding.  The right mix of bananas, vanilla wafers & sweet!

cxhJGPrcOTtx5oypWHbSPg.text: A few months ago I posted a review complaining about the ridiculously high salt content of the meat.  (I enjoy high levels of salt, so you should know that when I complain about something being to salty, it's reached a level of ridiculousness).  Anyway, I'm pleased to say that they seem to have toned down the saltiness somewhat.  I'm giving them an extra star.  I highly recommend the smoked half-chicken, the brisket, and the ribs.  The hush puppies are the best I've ever had, though I'm not a fan of the hush-puppy genre.  For sides I recommend baked beans and slaw (or bbq slaw).  I also enjoy the pickled onions that come with every meal.  The bacon-wrapped jalapenos are pretty boring, sadly.   They are just globs of fat without much flavor.  Staff is super friendly and owner is very nice.

IXiHJFrncadRpkA5DaS3cw.text: Never had even a mediocre item here.  Everything is amazing, I order far too much because it is even better heated up the next day.  Fall off the bone ribs, great brisket, tons of excellent sides. Lovely.   The expansion makes it a lot easier to get in though doesn't have as much charm as the original section. Could use a few more taps but I am nit-picking.  I eat here just about every other week and take every out of town visitor here and they love it.

aMgUnBzfiG-03RtuTR_zQQ.text: Wow what a neat place! Being a BBQ junkie, the first thing you notice before you even walk in is the wonderful aroma of BBQ. We came over the lunch hour so there was a small wait to eat inside but they could've seated us outside right away.   Per other Yelp reviews, I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with the Mac'n'cheese. They were insanely good. The Mac was super cheesy!! And that's how I like it. We also ordered an appetizer of the hush puppies. They were perfect.   My mom is a big fan of pecan pie and HAD to try the pecan cobbler, with vanilla ice cream of course. She said she'd give Midwood a 10 based on the cobbler alone.   A+ to the wait staff as well. Very friendly and always checking in. It's a shame we're not from around here to visit more often!!

TRScDbbiFweBNncthp1WnQ.text: This place is wonderful. Tasty BBQ, great service, good for large groups, good beer selection.

maG2W-R2NYnzsQIshSaGHQ.text: First time in North Carolina from California. Looked up what food I should eat local cuisine. Had the pork sandwich with barbecue beans and coleslaw. It was well worth it. I thought that I was stealing as the food was so good and the price was so little.

KS_U8Ev2M3J1bYP85D4etQ.text: The meat was pretty good but the portions were small for how expensive it is and the sauces were only OK. I want to like this place but I simply haven't cared for any of their meats or sauces compared to other restaurants within an hour's drive. I can see myself coming back, but if I want real BBQ I'll have to make a drive I suppose

EKhi_dbssbr7sBx9Lj7nUQ.text: Visiting Charlotte for the National Parks and Rec Convention. Our hotel the Westin, suggested Midwood Smokehouse. Great recommendation, friendly service, great atmosphere and excellent food. Loved the creamed corn, BBQ beans and banana pudding and sweet potato fries. And of course great, BBQ meats.

1cNHuLCWHI6Jd0SATKma_A.text: The brisket at Midwood Smokehouse is the best in Charlotte hands down.  I never had the Q because everytime I come back, I get the brisket!

2eMdkW7VH0y7u_T3LZ_mPQ.text: First time having BBQ since I left Texas a few months ago and everything was delicious. The bacon wrapped jalapenos were a great start. Nice heat and flavor. My boyfriend and I shared the "Pig Out" combo. Ribs were delicious with the sauce on the side for an occasional dunk. Brisket was tender and flavorful. The smoked sausage with pickled onions and the mustard they brought with it was a nice combo. I even enjoyed their Carolina Pork. The sauce had a nice balance to it that I didn't experience when I lived in the state 10 years ago. Collard greens and Mac&Cheese were both winners. Don't pass up the chocolate chip bread pudding a la mode. Even the tea was nice, not over brewed and bitter like some places. Although we specifically went for the rooftop seating on a perfect night and it wasn't open and the downstairs patio was full our table inside was pleasant and the service was attentive. We'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The &#34;Pig Out&#34; combo with ribs, brisket, smoked sausage, and Carolina pork, Mac&amp;Cheese and collard greens. All delicious!

4B9QTnMJ5IkxuJUeK35CpA.text: My new favorite Charlotte BBQ spot... Amazing specials! Try the Brisket fo sho!

Yoz2Bis_xIzaWYJxSo_aIg.text: Beef Brisket - Recommended by a national-traveling-smokehouse/barbeque-self-proclaimed connoisseur and I will have to agree - best brisket I've had since West Texas! Mac & Cheese pretty close to Mama's too!

d7iqxiwyOv4qmmrKjJ-dCg.text: So me and my friend are BBQ lovers and we wanted to try out this place.    First off, finding the place was a little tricky and the parking can be a hassle as well. We went on a Friday night and it was not too crowded. We sat at the bar area because we did not want to wait for a table and the aroma was making me hungry!  We ordered the fried pickles and the smoked wings for an appetizer. The fried pickles were good. Not the best in Charlotte, but good. The smoked wings however were great and had some flavor to them. We got a combo platter to share because we wanted to try everything. We got the smoked turkey, pork ribs, pulled pork, and the brisket with 2 sides. The sides we got were the mac n cheese and fries. OMG!!! Everything on that plate was fantastic and we had no complaints at all.   I can't speak for her, but I know I will be coming back here again. Especially for those yummy flavorful ribs!!!

syBNZmcfJ9m3RWM7-gbz3A.text: I've heard all the raves... so I decided to check out Midwood Smokehouse for myself. And I'm now a convert! This place is, hands down, my favorite restaurant in Charlotte!  The bacon wrapped jalapenos are as awesome as others have said - FRESH jalapenos, stuffed with jack cheese, wrapped in bacon and smoked until absolutely, mouth wateringly delicious! I could eat my own body weight in them!  I had the pulled pork barbeque, which was also excellent. It was perfectly smoky, and texture-wise it was still "meaty" (a lot of places in Charlotte has "mushy" BBQ, which is a crime against humanity). The portion of barbeque was fine, although I wish I'd ordered the large plate... it was just SO GOOD!  And the rumors that Midwood Smokehouse has the best mac and cheese in town? True! It's decadent and delicious, without being pretentious (no "truffle oil" here!) It tastes like the mac and cheese you remember grandma making... only better! I even got dessert: pecan cobbler. It's like pecan pie, only served warm, with vanilla cream on top. It was HEAVENLY, and warmed the cockles of this Southern boy's heart! It was almost too big for one person, but was so yummy that I just couldn't stop!  My only complaints about this place are that it's just too crowded (not that that's Midwood Smokehouse's fault!) and that service seemed a bit slow. I mean, the table service is fine, it just seemed to take a while to get stuff from the kitchen to the table. But hell, the food's so good that it's worth the wait! And the beer selection (and specials!) are really good, too.  I cannot recommend this place enough!

-KUnH8Pf_L7K6VdamHmKwQ.text: I went today 5-31-18 and I had the 1930 Cheesesteak sandwich and fries. The service was great, not a long wait for my food. The food was great but I was disappointed in the size of the Cheesesteak.  I had saw a pic of it on Facebook and that what made me go here today. Make sure you ask for the bbq sauce that's what took the sandwich over the top. I even had the banana pudding and that was delicious also. The only bad thing about this visit was the size of the sandwich and the water. I ordered water and it tasted like it came out of a rusty pipe. (The water was tap water)

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pudding
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesesteak and fries with extra mayo on the side.

NuGrUUe-h3wv1qjawaMXxw.text: When you want BBQ, Midwood Smokehouse is the place to go! Any time we have out of town visitors that want southern BBQ, we don't hesitate to take them here. The service, the ambience, the food, it's everything you want in a BBQ joint.   Personally, all the meats are delicious, but what I care about are the sides. In my humble opinion, they have the best collard greens in all of Charlotte. Don't forget to ask for their homemade pepper vinegar, because that just takes it over the top delicious. Midwood was actually the place that turned me into a collard eater, and I thank them for it. My husband swears by their Mac and cheese and will always get it as his side. It's the kind of Mac and cheese that you dig your fork in and the gooey strings of cheese follow the noodles all the way out of the bowl.   We had friends visiting that also do competition BBQ back in the northeast and they were able to see the whole smoker operation in the back, which I thought was a nice touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cuban Sandwich with a side of Collard Greens

loeCA20UzJW0GRUMcYbJXw.text: Alright all first of all get the Corn Bread Skillet; but get there after 3pm because it's the only way to get it.  All I can say is that if you like corn bread you will love this corn bread.....if you don't like corn bread it nothing like any corn bread I have eaten it's do much better.  It's like the corn was grown in heaven and used for this bread.  Well the Beef Brisket was as good as other Yelpers said.  I got the combo (Fatty/Lean) but I would recommend to get the fatty.  Don't get me wrong the lean was tender and great tasting.  Get the Vinegar Base BBQ and the pickled onion was great.  A MUST PLACE TO EAT WHEN IN CHARLOTTE

Y4YRq63IduNXYm1my0VmsQ.text: They have some of the best wings ever here. I also like how friendly everyone was to my Dad brother and me. We took my dad here for his birthday he enjoyed it a lot and will be back. The prices were ok.

EEhmFUJs8dvIFqBFKxqcZg.text: Good food.  If they aren't out!  Normally run short of ribs.  Tonight (5/17/2019) they are out of brisket and burnt ends-by 9 PM!  Each time they have been out they have stTed it was because they smoke the same amount for that day of the week as the previous week.  I think they are skimping to close to the edge!  Any statistician could examine their sales and fix this.  We don't run in to this problem at the Birkdale location.  From now on we will only be going to the Birkdale location.  When you are short of your two best sellers then half your menu is gone.

1lK05kiZGaaKuGavU3LJlg.text: This is one of the first places I dined when I first moved to Charlotte and I have yet to be disappointed by the food and the customer service. Pictured is the midwood chopped salad with chicken bbq and chipotle ranch dressing. They don't skimp on the chicken and the food always tastes fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

Le_w0RKEMkE9NYw5mpdDvQ.text: Oh my gosh! The brisket here is life changing! Didn't know whether to chose lean or fatty on the brisket and the awesome waitress advised "fatty." Dang, best tip ever! I can't stop thinking about the briskets!

EGNBaj3DZZz0vjgZOqqsfw.text: Expected more from this place, given the really high ratings. Service was good, but not great. When asking about cocktails, we got a lecture about which drinks a man could order, and which ones a woman could order. What? We got a platter to share with a variety of BBQ meat and tried a bit of everything. Everything was reasonably tasty, but nothing stood out. Head up to Lexington for MUCH better pulled/chopped pork, or find superior brisket/ribs in the Triangle or out in TN/Midwest. If this is the best Charlotte has to offer for BBQ, I'm left seriously unimpressed.

Tby8wzYhowYT6clFzXSR0A.text: The brisket was great. Ordered the fatty pieces. It was juicy and had great flavor.   Burnt ends on the other hand were subpar. Some of the pieces were quite dry (like turkey) and tough to eat.   I'd say it's a little better than the ny area bbq. But not as good as the Texas bbq I recently had...  not by far

JMzIKApeedyPsqSA464LRg.text: I am shocked this place has 4.5 stars, and forgive me if I just ate the wrong thing, but I am being generous with 3 starts.  I went to this spot expecting excellent southern barbecue, but was thoroughly disappointed. The reviews put the thought in my mind, but at the end of the day, it was just barbecue, nothing worth writing home about. It might be that my standards for barbecue are now sky high, but at least give me meat that isn't dry.   I try brisket anywhere south of the Mason Dixon line now, and hope for the best, and that might be a mistake in specific cities, like Nashville, where ribs or another type of meat is prevalent and the 'best'. I wonder if that were the case for Midwood Smokehouse and Charlotte.   Well, the sides, the meat was all average. I was not impressed, and found the flavors to be lacking. The hushpuppies were fine, the mac and cheese was fine, etc.   Anyway, maybe another place on my next Charlotte trip to satiate me barbecue hunger!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Man, bring me back to Austin after eating this barbecue

2efrjUUHJUinjfshg88zBg.text: The best food and the best service. The staff was super friendly. A MUST if you ever visit Charlotte. Ordered the nachos, with beef. The beef brisket and the bbq chicken. Sides were fries, roasted veggies, creamed corn and coleslaw....each and every item was fresh, and packed with flavor. The sauces with the meat were flavorful. Tried sweet iced tea for the first time, am addicted to the stuff now. I wanted to try the peach cobbler but they were out of it (emphasizing on the freshness of the food). Instead I ordered the banana pudding(if I'm not wrong, it was a banana dessert though.) Loved it.  I left this place, utterly satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ol6tkYzqewAOTEdRfmofCQ.text: I ordered the half chicken white and it was just alright. One of my Brest and wings were cooked until it was handing on for the last drop of moisture. It was so dry I had to chase it with a drink after every bite. The Mac n cheese was dry as well. I tried the baked beans because they were entirely too salty, even for me and I like salt. They were replaced with greens and they were good. I ordered the cornbread IG comes with honey butter that was my favorite part of the meal. I wasn't impressed but not disappointed too bad just the dry chicken and Mac sucked.

VLedoI57_2oubnQu0CCuWg.text: Great food as advertised!  Service was great as well.  Parking on the other hand... would highly recommend.

XR4WOoyks12EkJmMPm5T_g.text: This is one of the best BBQ spots in Charlotte that I've found so far! The wings are out of this world, they don't even need sauce. We tried almost everything--the wings, half chicken, ribs, and burnt ends. The burnt ends were my favorite, I definitely recommend. Everything was cooked perfectly.  The hushpuppies are a great addition to every plate, and for sides we loved the creamed corn and mac and cheese.   Huge drink selection from the bar--and sitting at the bar to eat is a great option when it's super busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Wings

qDcv1zp_tU_7jZXj7NpMMA.text: I can't believe that there is a Dick's Last Resort style BBQ joint in Charlotte! All kidding aside, the food was delicious: the brisket was perfectly moist (the lean was not cooked long enough because there was no fatty separation at all), the greens were tender, the bacon wrapped stuffed peppers were to die for. Unfortunately, the service ruined everything. I ordered the brisket and one of the slices was all fat (see picture). I showed the server and asked if I could get another slice, but she decided to have a debate with me about the fatty slice. I asked for a manager, but she refused, so I asked another server. The manager (pretty loudly) defended the server by explaining how great  of a server she is, which was noble of her to do, but I don't respect servers (or establishments that defend such servers) who want to get into augments with their guests/customers. Fortunately there was a server switch, who did an amazing job. We finally got our appetizer that we never received until we were half way done with the meal. The manager comped our whole meal, which we didn't ask for, which gave the place the 3rd star (the 1st star is a given, the second is due to the great service we received from the second server and decent meal). Many of the servers didn't seem happy to be there which gives the place a negative vibe. The two hosts standing at the door never said bye or thank you nor attempted to open the door while I was carrying my baby through the door. I would give this place 2.5 stars if I could. Please work on your FOH staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

u9N4_RNhUeqZt7O_Va3Kcg.text: This is hands down the best BBQ place I've EVER been. Their pulled pork plate, with some creamed corn, collard greens and mac n cheese is addictive. Add their ranch to the Mac - yum!  I prefer the more vinegar- based sauce on the pork, but they have an array to choose from.   Sometimes we get the jalapenos wrapped in bacon and the chopped salad.   You have to go here if you haven't.

lfueCjfs9smralEdhTo1qA.text: This restaurant was great! The queso with cheese and pork was incredible as an appetizer to start off with. The sweet tea was very sweet and very good!! My husband had the smoked wings and he loved them. I had the bbq chicken and Mac and cheese, it was good as well. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because once we got our food the waiter never came back and checked on us or gave us refills until we were done with our food. Overall, we had a great experience and will definitely be back when we visit again.

j-OoKbh0HnqiZkFAiXJi7A.text: Visiting from Texas - it was ok, but not great. Superb staff, but the chicken/pork too dry and the "lean" brisket too fatty.  Smoked wings and burnt ends were great, though!

zcceQgt4okFEa7GHFzMELg.text: I can't believe I haven't already reviewed Midwood Smokehouse! Simply put, it stays in constant rotation for a dinner option for us. My fiance sticks with the brisket and loves the baked beans and mac and cheese as sides. I will typically get a brisket sandwich or a chopped salad with brisket and green goddess dressing. Occasionally we get the platter with different types of meat and share that and we always have left overs. Anytime anyone comes to visit from out of town, we take them there and they always ask to come back on return visits.   Overall, amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chopped Salad w/ brisket

W7X0zw39vQ4Q2bMH6BtLXw.text: I went there Sunday at lunch. We were seated quickly and at a table type I had requested.  The server took our order and was ready, but also gave us time to decide what we wanted.  Food was better than I had expected.  I had a chicken plate. We were given time to eat, even on a busy Sunday.  Server was quick to turn around our bill.

Q8EWMTMXhRd8b-JrHtcx6Q.text: The food was amazing. Being from Florida and traveling for a living I eat BBQ. A lot. This was by far a top 3 in the country. Burnt ends are the bomb. Brisket needs a fork only to slice.  Drew was a great server.  Will be back.

uZ6IlcZdTXAZwm3AaPRjCg.text: After two visits, Midwood Smokehouse BBQ and Bar has become my current favorite BBQ place in Charlotte.  I say current, as things can happen to take that status (and it's an important one) away.  One only needs to ask me about Mac's Speedshop where starting back in 2006 I would frequent at least once a month.  After too many instances of stale sandwich buns, so-so service, and so-so 'Cue...I haven't been back in probably 2 years.     A few weeks ago on a bright and warm Saturday, some of my friends came in from out-of -town to visit the CLT and they were looking for some tasty BBQ.  In the past this would have been a quick drive over to Mac's in the Southend.  However, this time I was searching my Yelp app for a new king of 'Cue.  This search took me to my first visit to the, Plaza Midwood located, Midwood Smokehouse BBQ/ Bar and my new number one.  Atmosphere - Crowded, lively, and happening, a darkly lit and noisy bar area, a bright and a little calmer dining room, and a packed with patrons patio space.  Service - Despite our server seeming crushed from the craziness that a nice day brings to a place with a patio, he kept it together and provided prompt service.  The server was quick and thoughtful in offering suggestions, though I knew what I wanted to have...the Carolina Pork BBQ Plate.  Food - Great!  As mentioned above I ordered the Carolina Pork BBQ Plate.  I opted for the small portion, which comes with hushpuppies, pickled onions, and one side (I ordered sweet potato fries).  Despite being busy, the food arrived quickly and hot.  I tasted some of the pulled pork immediately before dressing it with the table placed sauces...it was excellent!  While Midwood Smokehouse does lightly dress the pulled pork in their Eastern NC vinegar sauce prior to serving, all I could taste was smoky goodness.  The pork was lean, flavorful, and juicy.  The sweet potato fries were good and the hushpuppies on this visit were awesome, with a light crunch and a soft, cake donut like center.  Everything was perfect!    Being a bar too, Midwood Smokehouse has a nice selection of beers, including the local offerings from OMB, Triple C Brewing, and NODA.       Overall - While you may have read this review and expected to see a 5 Star rating...I gave 4 Stars.  Why 4 Stars??  Well, as stated in the beginning of my review it was the result of two visits that made Midwood Smokehouse my king of 'Cue.  The absence of a star comes down to consistency.  I was so enamored on my first visit, as described above, my second visit occurred a mere four days later.  It was a Wednesday; the shine had come off on my new trophy winner.  While the pulled pork on this visit was just as good the portion seemed a little smaller and the hushpuppies I received to me seemed dry and old tasting.  Despite a little downturn on my second visit, I think the solid nature of their pulled pork makes Midwood Smokehouse some of the best BBQ Charlotte has to offer.  With that I will be back again with friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina Pork BBQ Plate (small) w/ hushpuppies, pickled onions, and sweet potato fries

dWoE49nk6H-_XwijqgDB6g.text: I went to this place by accident, and wow, so happy for that detour! We had cheesesteak sandwiches (subbed mine for chicken) and both were melt-in-the-mouth amazing! Ya gotta go

_iRZ0Wi463xTqG_kwio14A.text: Large family party went there the evening after Thanksgiving. Food ******   Briscuit as good as I have ever had.  Burnt ends excellent. Ambience ***** Menu  ****** Service *   Numerours items not delivered properly, some items wrong, bill all screwed up.  Two very nice young people, but NO profesionalism and clearly a listening problem.  Otherwise the place and the food are as good as anyplace in Charlotte.  You really need to supervise better and check with guests to insure that standards are as required. We had out of town guests who could not believe that everything be so near perfect then the standards seemed to be set by MacDonalds!

UmPvqDO4dht-5YoWWeZWOQ.text: This was my first time in NC. Midwood Smokehouse didn't disappoint for a quick meal after arriving in Charlotte. Compared to NY, the portions are huge.   I had the Beef Brisket that I topped with the Eastern NC Vinegar Sauce. It was perfection. My boyfriend had the   1/2 Chicken and 1/3 Rack Ribs. Everything was packed with flavor and the service was so fast. We were literally in and out in an hour.   I really suggest this place for a great evening meal if you are visiting Charlotte.

ACP4e1DtZi1UoejgtknO2w.text: Great barbaque, local beers, what else could you ask for.  I met up with a buddy at this place who lives in Charlotte.  Let's jump right to the action kids:  Cool decor, laid back and we sat in the bar area.  It was pretty packed so the food must be good, right?  I started with a Tito's kicking mule.  Great take on an old favorite.  I followed with an Unknown IPA.  Great local beer that starts with a good hoppy bite and a mellow malt finish.  Dinner was bacon wrapped jalepenos, burned ends and cole slaw.  Great smokey flavor tender bits of meat.  Solid service, great food, it's a winner!

VbfwGzycTi6KSBwxpwaE4g.text: In Charlotte for one night and decided to hit up this restaurant...  The service and atmosphere is awesome!  I'll be adding this place to one of my go to places whenever I'm in town.   The smokey chicken wings are some of the best around,  especially when combined with the in-house harbenero sauce!!!  The banana pudding was like eating whipped butter!

fT7MiScAglM4fo68pfL3gA.text: Some of the best Carolina-style BBQ I've had since moving to NC, and the collard greens were fantastic! Parking is a little scarce and Midwood is pretty popular, so be prepared for a bit of a wait, but it's well worth it. Service was fast and courteous, even with the crowd (thanks, Mallory!)  Dinner with appetizer and a soft drink came out to about $24, before tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina-style pulled pork platter, with collard greens, hush puppies, and sweet potato fries. Delicious!

PkN_kWLxQe8U3fFGK-IiEA.text: Midwood Smokehouse was pretty good, but I think it was definitely over hyped for me. We are here for a quick trip and decided to try it based on great reviews, but we're a little disappointed. We had the brisket and chopped pork, both of which tasted good, but it was all a little in the dry side and not very hot. The mac 'n cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos were delicious though, and I could have eaten a full meal of those alone. All in all it's very good barbecue, but I have definitely had better before.

UtKVwFgdA0DCRhxvZCHk7g.text: The pimento fries are very filling and a good starter. The combo sampler is a nice way to try most everything. The brisket was awesome. I like it fattier but we got the mixed to share. The fatty ends just completely melted. They have not overly-sweet sweet tea. I liked both their bbq sauces. The tomato based on was nice with a little bite at the end. Not so spicy that the kids couldn't eat it either so probably just the right amount.

qyJQtkVcJF0qBfrJFjM9NQ.text: Outdoor patio, great service and fantastic bbq!!! Loved this place and their food. We ordered the pimento cheese fries with brisket on top to start. It was incredible, so much flavor. For our meal, we shared 4 proteins and 2 sides; ribs, shredded pork, brisket and we upgraded to burnt ends (great decision, highly recommend). Our sides were bacon wrapped jalapenos and smoked veggies which I would order again. Excited there is a location in columbia which is closer to us. We will be back!

6jG2JsJJagcWwp4Hl4TSBg.text: My wife and I gave this place a try way back when it first opened and we thought it was terrible and haven't been back since.  Last night we were in Plaza Midwood with family who wanted BBQ so we decided to give it another shot. WOW, you've come a long way Midwood Smoke House!!  There were 4 of us and everyone was very pleased with their dinners which included shredded chicken, salad with pulled pork, smoked wings and the burnt ends plate.   The shredded chicken was good but this was the least impressive meal of the bunch. It lacked smoke flavor and almost had a 'watered down' taste. The burnt ends dinner was excellent. The meat has a good smoke flavor, it was moist and tender to the point you could cut it with a fork. I did however think that for an $18.50 dinner the meat portion was a little on the small side. The smoked wings were very good, cooked perfect.  The salad with pulled pork was large and although I didn't try it I was told it was excellent as well.   The sides, I was able to try the mac and cheese, greens and BBQ beans. Mac and cheese is on point. It is moist and has a great flavor unlike at some places were it dries out and has a bland taste. The collard greens were really good, not to salty as they can be from time to time and had a nice amount of meat mixed in. The BBQ beans were a hit as well.   If you're like us and tried this place a while ago and weren't happy it is definitely worth a second try, they seem to have come into their own and it's pretty dam good now.

znxiB1EcJWI1c4-x8kM7Xg.text: I now understand why this place is so highly rated. By far, the BEST brisket I have ever had..melt in your mouth goodness. Was not a big fan of the burnt tips, but everything else, including the collard greens and Mac and cheese were delicious. Don't forget to also order the banana pudding, so yummy.

ODYcZv4yx7wafvrU_87ENg.text: Midwood Smokehouse is one of my favorite places to eat barbecue and I personally think it's one of the best in the Charlotte area. Not only are the meats and sauces very flavorful, but the portions are very good, the prices reasonable and the service staff has always been attentive. Of course, there are many other things to eat besides barbecue, but let's face it, that's what everyone comes here for. The other dishes are great as well, sandwiches, salads etc but the barbecue is awesome and that's what's going to bring you back.

yeuxt2du6TAkotfqUuHWhw.text: Midwood Smokehouse FTW!!   My fiance and I went out to dinner with a couple friends and when plans fell through at another establishment because of a storm (closed kitchen), Midwood Smokehouse pulled through! First off, I would like to compliment our waiter Cameron for his excellent customer service! He was very personable and provided us with great recommendations for both food and drinks. I got the pulled pork platter with macaroni and cheese and cole slaw and it was amazing! The burnt ends would be another fantastic choice (a little bit fatty, but good!) It was kind of loud when we were there, I think they turned the music up loud to offset the alarm that was going off because of the storm, but that was out of their control! I've dined at this particular location several times along with the Ballantyne location, but this will be my go to for BBQ! Awesome experience overall! Ask for Cam!!

EkRf7EOhPR1yeVGXbxSG_w.text: Visited last Monday evening with a large group. Ordered the St. Louis ribs. Was informed 15 minutes after my order was taken that they had run out of ribs. Tried ordering the burnt tips only to be told they had ran out of them as well. Never would have happened in Texas!

NthhaP_1UFw3a0Z-7LE7hg.text: This place is hit and miss. I know people who have eaten at the Johnston Rd location and vowed they would never go back it was so bad. One can like a restaurant for various reasons. Atmosphere & location come in second to the food I would think.   Haven't been here in 5-6 months but was looking forward to the BBQ chicken and those golden mini crinkle fries they cook to perfection.   Well, things have changed in those 5-6 months. The sauce for the chicken now comes on side, and those mini crinkle fries were not so golden. In fact, they were 1 step from disgusting. Way undercooked. The chicken was good but it was way better when the sauce was seared into the meat. I don't normally eat the hush puppies but they turned out to be the best thing on the plate.   On a brighter note, the service was excellent. Drew (man bun) has been there a while and is top notch. But I'm not sure when I will return. There are so many new restaurants opening in Charlotte and I continue to be on the prowl looking for the ones that make me go WOW! Midwood has been knocked way down on my list after today.

HnYHhH0SVU6pcW1ByOEO-Q.text: Really friendly, professional service. Check in with Yelp. Food excellent! Bathrooms have posters of hunks from days past. So fun & funny!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Women&#39;s restroom wall.

c8zSObdsgElfZQom3XUeZQ.text: I am just writing about this restaurant from the perspective of someone from Western New York, where we don't have too many barbecue places, let alone good ones like this.  I tried the Cheddar chicken bacon sandwich, and it was just pure deliciousness, despite the fact that I'm a stickler for crispy, lean bacon, which this particular sandwich did not provide. The same can be said for the jalapeno bacon cheddar bites, but I just worked around it.  The pulled pork tasted very good, the idea of chopping barbecue in North Carolina is an interesting concept.  The whole place looked like something you would find in maybe D.C or downtown Atlanta or someplace. It was a pleasant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork sandwich
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon Cheddar grilled chicken sandwich

dCGhTTebvJhxfaYw7XsN4A.text: Though it's a BBQ joint this place has one of the best salads around! Must try the Midwood Chopped salad and selection of local beers is awesome.

Fc67Bse8aTx9SrBJ2YJsgQ.text: Amazing que!!! Great environment. Great staff. Great food. Had the sampler with pork ribs sausage and brisket. Wonderful. Even got a tour of the smoker! Cool set up and history of the restaurant. Really impressive how much thought is put in to cooking the meat. Pecan cobbler was good too. If I didn't live in Florida this would be my go to bbq joint for sure. Hope to be back again one day.

6XfFhMs3hrymvlWHXwdeWg.text: Great BBQ food, great service, great prices. Everything that everyone ordered in our party of nine was eaten clean plate. Would highly recommend and I would come back.

MSRCBFBD5eGUmCMGUFM1NA.text: Dan enjoyed his pulled pork BBQ player with the mac and cheese and hush puppies. He asked me to give this a 4-star.   I just had a grilled cheese with broccoli. Two of my favorite things. It was okay. I'm not into smoked meats but veg options were available. The old fashioned was okay.   We are at the bar and service was good. That's about it (it was election day so we were preoccupied)  Parking. Let's just get this out of the way. It can't be good anywhere in this area.

qGcQYWu3xrEMLX-Thnw0gA.text: The Barbecue Chicken & Ribs are excellent. The staff are very polite and nice to their customers.

EEQbbvyOsDd7Cy3yO6l3Bw.text: Being a native New Englander with not a ton of exposure to authentic southern style barbecue, this place is a hands down 5 star. I love everything about it from it's simple, traditional menu to the hip ambience. My only regret is not getting the burnt ends, as I thought these were superior to the brisket and pulled pork that I ordered. The hush puppies were amazing.

-XKdbYsWn98NMOhrFsxhbA.text: I don't think that Charlotte is really a BBQ destination city. However, if we had more places like this, then we actually could be!

nR6BMWqJ6tn42Ei8ZK9ydQ.text: This was the second time I visited this location. We had a very positive experience our first visit. This visit was very disappointing.  First, our food was incredible we had chicken nachos, stockyard and el fuego tacos, brisket and creamed corn. All of our food was incredible, delicious,hot and satisfying. Our table wait time was approx 25 mins, also satisfactory.   The problem was the 22 mins we waited for our drinks after being seated. Over 30-45minutes seated before our app appeared. The manager recognized the problem and comped our nachos(very nice). What gets worse is we waited another 30-45 for our dinner. We arrived before 8pm and didn't leave until after 10pm. Drinks should be served around 5 mins, apps should be around 20 mins and entrees around 40 mins. Not cool

pm1FvLLUKEAQkdY4vg8hOg.text: Excellent pulled pork tacos, brisket and ribs. Collards and mac n cheese were great as well. Service was excellent. We were in town from TN doing some shopping and stopped here because of the excellent reviews. We were not disappointed.

MWYlFGcbdLGn2s6JVWNJyQ.text: This place is amazing, we are going to plan another vacation here just to eat here a few more times. Best BBQ I've ever eaten!

G2jLPDq5cxuAp3bvKO6I1g.text: Midwood is still the go to place for bringing your out-of-town guests to show them the great Queen City barbecue. And so I met my Minneapolis buddy here! Great service from our waitress, who kept the conversation going and kept the beers filled.  We split a plate of the pimento cheese fries. Plenty here for three, but we put a good dent in it. Lots of great cheese, good grilling that toasted the fries and melted the cheese all the way down.  For barbecue, my friend had the four meat sampler and enjoyed it. He said that the sausage was particularly tasty. I had the pulled pork, with mac & cheese. It did not need any extra sauce. The pork was chopped fine, which made it a little mushy. Next time, I'll go for the sliced brisket perhaps.  Overall, still great to visit and still great to bring your visitors.

y8T0aKI67p3XRADlOW-fww.text: Pretty good! Needed to come here for good southern BBQ since I was in the area and I was very pleased.  Started with the smoked wings with sauce on the side (best thing they had here). Wings we're so flavorful and delicious it was unreal! For my plate I had the pig out portion of the meat combo and got mixed brisket with burnt ends and double ribs. They were all very good but not the best BBQ I've ever had and the portion seemed kinda small even though I ordered the larger one.  Brisket and burnt ends stole the show for the entrees.  My mom got the burger with brisket and it was fantastic, definitely recommend looking for a massive and delicious burger.  Desert was great, I didn't know pecan Cobbler was a thing but O man was it delicious! Apple pie was on special for the day and it melted my heart it was so good! Best BBQ I've had in the Carolina's and the service was very friendly.  Unfortunately they have a tiny bathroom and unneeded to go the entire time but it was in use from the moment I walked in to when we left so that kinda dampened the experience but I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for a great BBQ experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Apple Pie a la mode
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pecan Cobbler
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Chicken wings dry - best thing here!!!

4NoTSQfyr9pxi4udquPn0g.text: Travelled all the way from DC and worth every minute of the road trip....fantastic ribs and service top notch....definitely more road trips to Midwood are on the cards

a_Uo4xO1M9g-dROgQjTC5w.text: Awesome food and awesome service! Got the combo plate with ribs, chicken, brisket, and sausage with Mac and cheese and baked beans, along with the complimentary hush puppies. Everything was amazing and great prices.

AGA1gaAsaIE6-RUiJSh3ZQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the BBQ here - so smoky and delicious! My dad and I agreed that it was great. My grandfather was a fan of the baked beans and I liked the flavor of the smoked vegetables. The fries and hushpuppies were pretty standard and the unsweet tea was a bit weak. The server was kind and patient and struck a good balance between not checking on us every minute and not ignoring us completely. In short: very pleasant experience and yummy BBQ. If you want to avoid the crowd, Thursday at 5 pm was pretty quiet!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small plate: BBQ, hushpuppies, pickled onions, smoked veggies

bqf_Tehb-4eE_xbg-VImbg.text: Delicious delicious delicious!! Cool diverse spot we decided to checkout since the reviews were so good. We ordered the 4 meat sharable platter which had brisket, pulled pork, ribs and brisket pieces? I forget what they were called but they were the ends of the brisket with extra yumminess. The sides! OMG. The mac n cheese, the baked beans and the hush puppies were out of this world! Whenever I visit NC again, I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

EESrNNXTpB5UdvXQ0Ldn6w.text: Every one of my friends loves Midwood Smokehouse. Full disclosure, their type of BBQ/BBQ sauce is not my favorite (vinegar based) Their mac and cheese is one of my favorites in Charlotte. I take everyone I know here, and most of then either order the brisket or the burnt ends. Personally, I think the chicken is one of the best values on the menu.

SbKQy1qd3Lgc6hS0mGTPqw.text: The food and service was great. Tyler was a great server, very attentive and sociable. His service definitely had an impact on our return a few nights later while staying in Charlotte. We had the burnt tips, roadhouse burger, Cuban and the pulled pork queso.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot mess burger and sweet potato fries

i5ifQNmNyQhI4gUm3gbFqQ.text: Solid food - great service. I was here 7 or so years ago and found myself in Charlotte again so I decided to stop by. The food was delicious - I did ribs and brisket with sweet potato fries and jalapenos. The jalapenos were a little soggy so that was disappointing and the brisket was a bit on the dry side for my liking. The ribs did not fail and I devoured them happily. I did dessert last time and was not extremely impressed but maybe that has improved - however I did not revisit that tonight so I cannot comment. My server, Christopher, was awesome and super helpful. Great balance of social and helpful without being overwhelming. If you are craving BBQ this is a great option

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charlotte for business - need some BBQ.

AXtwoJ-Qr0QDyEnP86bycQ.text: Delicious BBQ! Would definitely go back and recommend to others.  I had the pulled pork, baked beans, and mac and cheese. Hush puppies are also served with the entrees. Also, it was very affordable - ~$12 per person.   The restaurant was very crowded during lunch on a weekend, so I would recommend calling in advance.

9QPvTgEeDo_VPJLVa7hzeQ.text: Well worth the hour wait on a Friday evening: they've got burnt ends! We first tried burst ends in South Carolina and have been searching for them ever since. We put our names in at Midwood Smokehouse and loved that they texted us when our table was ready an hour later [we walked down the street to the Thirty Beaver, the sketchiest dive bar EVER, while we waited!] We'd heard great things about Midwood but were ecstatic upon examining the menu that they serve burnt ends!   We ordered a large burnt ends plate to split with BBQ baked beans, bacon wrapped jalapenos and hushpuppies for sides. I'd skip the baked beans next time, but everything else was stellar. Honestly, I wasn't super hungry, so it was easy to split the large plate, but if we hadn't been tasting as many things in Charlotte as we could, we would definitely have had to order two plates. Also, I was surprised that the large $18.00 plate wasn't bigger then it was. Again, we weren't at full hunger, but if we were, I would've been disappointed. Midwood is a little pricier then most BBQ joints, but it is dang tasty. I might recommend grabbing an appetizer at a local restaurant while you wait instead of going balls-to-the-wall here.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends large plate.

fzKo2A9chrur6yqHK4lEsQ.text: Went to Midwood Smokehouse with the family on Friday afternoon. The place was busy before 5:00; good sign. Full disclosure, I'm vegetarian, so the meat reviews are second hand from my meatetarian husband.  He had a three-meat combo plater of ribs, brisket, and turkey. He said it was the best brisket he'd had in his life...and that's a long time. LOL. I had a three sides combo of mac and cheese, coleslaw, and smoked veggies. All very yummy. We started with hush puppies and the surprisingly tasty, but artery clogging, pimiento cheese fries. Our server was helpful and friendly, too. We'll definitely go back to Midwood Smokehouse!

eNYG8Q6Bx1EdyKW6lD06iA.text: Cute, friendly atmosphere with AWESOME food. I had the Carolina BBQ chicken sand which with the stuffed jalapenos wrapped in bacon. Can't go wrong! I will go back and utilize the patio and corn hole games next time!

1WPyzexTL14kgRsrtSQe6Q.text: two words: brisket tacos. I ordered the two taco plate with one pork one brisket... the brisket was ah-maz-ing... I wanted to trade in my pork taco for another it was that good. I ended up saving the pork taco for the next day, it was really good left over and tasty in its own right but the brisket blew it out of the water. BF had the pork plate w/mac n cheese, he said the pork was too smoky for his liking (we eat Mac's a lot)... I didnt think he tasted overly smokey but to each their own. The food here is good, staff is super nice and they have a lot of options (no burgers thou!).

G-MHHDlQtFpIS0g3n50P3g.text: We finally tried this place last Friday and it was AMAZING!!  The brisket was so tender and yummy.  The hush puppies we delicious too.  The service was outstanding.  The pecan cobbler was so good.  We will def be back.. and the prices were reasonable.

4aEP1rg4LPd11jCHguZ3Kw.text: This is the BEST BBQ I've had since the BBQ I had in Lexington! The vinegar sauce is amazing! The pork platter, the brisket, everything is spot on. You can taste the smoke in the meat and its always so tender and juicy. The service is great too. Being a server, this place offers customer serviceman great food for a decent price. The decor is decent too. Old school. EAT HERE NOW! It's totally worth it!

Ax0cHUdcj8jrySVlW49_lQ.text: This place was awesome! After reading about it online four of us went and we tried the burnt ends, pulled pork, bacon wrapped jalapenos, sausage, brisket and ribs. Everything was really good, not one thing to complain about. We also got an apple cobbler and banana pudding which were delicious. We would definitely go back. Side note the service was fantastic. Super friendly and helpful with suggestions on what to order.

Ld7Nv0mHUZwfsJ08q262EQ.text: Very good! We'll be regulars and bring more friends. Wait staff- even the boys-  are friendly and Professional. Music was great tonight -80's. If one of those 5 tv's played something out of their box, like TCM, or comedy channel. Plaza midwood is overloaded with sports bars, they have no personal identity. Plaza middwood is a mixed community! That's the beauty of it. So the culture should follow. Makes it much more interesting. I could offer other suggestions to bring in plentiful sub-groups. I'd like to see it stay around for a while.

ngPtWgTSyV1z6f9c9LaqRQ.text: Great food, had the pulled pork and "the Texas special". My 6 year old daughter loved both, as did my wife and I. Service needs a little work.

vJyaBaBgqkyQKv7WKV3-BQ.text: First, let me say that I am a 20 year restaurant veteran and somewhat of a BBQ afficianado.  After my second visit to Midwood, I am sad to say that I will not return. Evidently success has ruined the effort given and the portion sizes seem to be shrinking.   My entree last night was $40...a large sampler platter with double ribs so that I could sample both preparation styles, with both cuts of brisket (props for offering lean or fatty) and the sausage (which I had enjoyed on my first visit.  Beans and corn for sides.    Neither style of ribs was edible...tried as I might.  The waitress was friendly and fairly prompt with beverage refills prior to food being delivered, but no check back for quality.  When the waitress finally asked, she didn't believe me that the ribs were terrible- didn't send a manager, and disappeared after processing checks for our party of 6.  Sorry- neither value nor good ribs to be found here....

6lC4-Sf-REVr7GNyhcrYSA.text: Love this place but so upset they took away the creamed corn.  We have reduced our frequency since this happened.  BRING BACK THE CORN!!!!

UL37hch5JXGJVw7pVz47sg.text: Thanks to Charlotte Mag naming this the "Best BBQ" in town, this was my first stop once I moved down to Charlotte, and I was not disappointed.   The atmosphere is a bit more modern than some of the other BBQ spots I checked out in eastern NC, but the food was just as good.  For starters, we ordered the cheese fries topped with bits of brisket burnt ends, and those are currently the best appetizer I've tried anywhere in the country. I ate so many I wasn't sure I was going to be able to tackle my main course.  I ordered a full rack of ribs with beans & fries for a side. Since I had already sampled the Eastern NC style vinegar sauce, I went with the SC mustard based sauce, and I absolutely LOVED it! My friends weren't huge fans, but this is my Yelp review, not theirs.   The rack was MASSIVE, and not too tender, which made it great for dunking in the mustard sauce. My buddy also ordered a rack, but with the house special BBQ sauce, which was also really good. The portion sizes were exactly what I expected, and the sweet tea was extra sweet.  For dessert, I took home a pecan cobble and absolutely fell in love. I haven't been able to stop eating pecan pies & cobblers since!

yLtIuvopTOTRmPAD7tJ4Gw.text: This place is pretty darn good. I find Charlotte reviews to be a little strange at times (saying places are good when IMO they aren't) but this one is on the mark. They have good service and great food - never dry. I feel their prices are reasonable (considering it's Charlotte) and you get a lot of food.  I did find they aren't consistent though, which can be disappointing when you are jonesing for their food.  Either way I'm a returning customer!

BYOxLovpwNdAFOVm-UrgOQ.text: Probably the best BBQ we've ever had, especially the queso dip.

jVfopQYUxVt83WMJWUxJqQ.text: Burnt ends are amazing. The Fat Tire BBQ sauce tastes great and the greens and BBQ slaw are great pairings.  Big secret... Best time to go is Sunday afternoon. Very laid-back, great service, not crowded, football on the TV, beer is cold and food is hot! Love this place!

m8SsjixplOVdm67R_X21wA.text: Really great BBQ...my only wish is that they would add a fish entree. Other than my little quirky wish they give you all you want in a BBQ joint.

4G2_tESe1VLan6QesfrVjg.text: Best bbq I have ever had. Been searching for something comparable ever since I've been here with no luck.

PdvjAUiiHtx4p3R-yz09pA.text: Food was amazing. Service was great and had a good amount of local draft beers on tap.

fceaAKW41v_kP8Af7x8FiA.text: Yep!  This place is awesome! !!  Best meat in town.  It's that brisket.   I dream about it!!

3LJ4glWf1FJC2stI8KXLsw.text: We were visiting Charlotte on a business trip and sought out a good BBQ joint. This was the unanimous recommendation. The menu lists a good variety of smoked meat items. I ordered the burnt ends with a side of bacon wrapped jalapenos and an Oktoberfest from Olde Mecklenburg Brewery (they have a good rotating selection of craft beers, too). My wife ordered the sloppy joe sandwich with sweet potato fries. Both entrees were delicious and brought out hot. The beer was cold. We would definitely come back if we were in town again.

I52THUGKRMzkI6E2mg_kJg.text: I love barbeque so, I really tried to like this place and I live around the corner. The veggies are very good but, the pulled pork just doesn't do it for me. I gave it 4 tryouts and was not impressed.

RqxWQAUu5FwodNZySaArJw.text: I had burnt ends. They were delicious.  Everyone loved their food.  They had a good selection of local craft beers, essential for bbq.  Our waiter was friendly and effective,  I would have liked a bit more attention.  We seemed to have to wait for refills.

fLqYWODz8Rzot8EeMRYilA.text: I cannot believe almost 6 months later and I am just now writing this review!  When I was on vacation in June and visiting my sister, she wanted me to try out a 'cue place she told me was pretty solid.  I am indeed a huge fan of Carolina style cue, so I was excited to see how this place would fare against Memphis.  Hidden away in hipsterville, this place is nestled on the bottom left of a I think 2 story strip mall.
