There was some construction behind the place, so with that being said, parking was real tight- but I managed to find a spot on the street (and didn't get towed!).  The weather was perfect to eat on the patio, but we decided to eat inside.  Inside, it looked like there were 2 rooms, separated by the bar.  We sat in the bar area- which was cool, because our server was hot as hell- hell yea!  When we got the menus, I was torn about what to get, but I was hungry as hell too- so I got enough food for 3 people- the whole rack of ribs an order of some bacon wrapped jalapenos, and some other stuff.  My sis got a plate of pork with some sweet potato fries.  It looked like they had a pretty solid beer and mixed menu- but the Kentucky slush won me over.  I think I only got 1 (didn't want to get shwasted by 2, even though it was vacay).  It was pretty tasty, but I found it funny they served it in a Shiner (a TX beer) mason jar.  Hell yea!  When the food came out, my eyes opened up wide.  It looked as good as the place smelled.  I tell you what- I will say it again, this is the kind of shit I live for- and those were good enough to be in the top 5 racks of ribs to ever touch these lips.  And It left me full as hell.  I have no idea how I did it, but I dommed the whole plate!  Believe it or not, I didn't get sick either!  However, I did take a nap after the meal :)  A lot of eye candy, solid food and drinks are always a plus in my book.  The place seemed clean as well and they had tvs to keep you entertained if you didn't feel like conversing with your sister.  If parking wasn't such a pain, I would push the 4.5 up to 5 stars!  Cheers!

2imaO7pUsrTBoHGPS50Jmw.text: This place had great food and a plentiful supply of local craft beer- how can you go wrong?!  I had a special turkey sandwich.  Service was nice and friendly!

fzYJlvPBL5M9RihQt73wJw.text: I'm not a beef fan but I tore up some brisket for the first time and would do it again happily

4JuZB6ax9CHp8bAE31Kv9w.text: Best BBQ I've ever had! Got the beef brisket and it was perfectly fatty and tender. My sister got the burnt pork tips and they were good too, not as good as the brisket though! The cocktails were super yummy, I had something that tastes like lemonade and my friend had something that tastes like sweet tea (forget the names, sorry!) but both were tasty and didn't taste like alcohol. Would defs recommend coming here if you're visiting Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket, hush puppies and cream corn

UEuj1Re1kfIlh28SwfYBeg.text: Quality BBQ at a low price! Good variety of different types of bbq (burnt ends, brisket, pulled pork, etc.) but my favorite is definitely the burnt ends. Perfect bit of crunch and great flavor, plus it's hard to find burnt ends in Charlotte. It comes with a spicy bbq sauce that fits perfectly with the meat. They have recommended bbq sauces or a large variety that you can try with your meat as well.  The sides are definitely unique, as they have much more than the normal bbq sides, including the delicious bacon wrapped jalapenos! These were definitely a favorite (you can get it as an appetizer as well.)  They have a good beer list showcasing some of the best of Charlotte beers, but also some classics as well. I went on a Saturday night and there was a pretty big wait, but luckily there's a lot in the area so you can explore (they will text you when your table is ready.)  Overall, would highly recommend to get your bbq fix!

5JPANkGQuQ0xV8dZOAiFGA.text: SO so so so good. So good. Vinegar based bbq sauce is to die for, the one with a hint of sweetness is also pretty amazing. Delicious pulled pork, perfectly cooked sweet potato fries and a bowl of cold slaw I would have literally dove into if I could have.  Exactly the meal we were looking for  you won't be disappointed!

eXjxT81iaTh6hu7nkz6-kA.text: I will forever love this place for what they did for me and my family.  I had probably about 40-50 people with me celebrating and Midwood got on the job and found sitting for us in 30min probably less, the manager was  serving us.  That happened last year 4/8/2016 and my family still till this day, no lie, not even joking like 4-5 people mentioned it again today,   awesome sauce, get the burnt ends!  Thanks,  C.

BoaRQWLR3VzDWu9Fq876WA.text: The food here is great. The staff is very below average. Not super friendly and way too pushy on their up selling. If the staff was better it would be five stars

0p-1T1qKYKCuhjjFmf5xCA.text: Absolutely delicious!!!!  We sat at the bar while we waited for our table. The bartenders were attentive and knowledgeable about the specifics of each beer.   Our server was also knowledgeable. He was able to tell us about favorites, provide information about the company and explain the different sauces and flavors of the meat.   We had tacos with roasted vegetables and the build your own salad.  The prices were unbelievably low. Our meal total was under $30.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build your own salad (large). Pick two tacos with a side of roasted vegetables

-0PwH2hD5MIcPwW3MyJ-Ew.text: First off - the sweet bbq sauce is something else. After that, the Burnt ends and Mac and cheese were amazing. bacon stuffed jalapenos and hush puppies are next on the list, not amazing but very good. Especially with the sauces :)

7oypEcgXXxa7SClxI48lFw.text: Best barbecue in America and hands down my favorite restaurant in Charlotte! If I was on death row, I would want Midwood's pulled pork and mac n' cheese as my final meal. It's THAT good! I love their vinegar barbecue sauce and the mac n cheese is made with cavatappi noodles and is like no other macaroni I have ever tasted! When Obama and Hillary Clinton came to town to campaign, this is where they ate. It's simply THE BEST.

YoR7m-SuBF4vg3BqEq35Ag.text: The service was very friendly but the food was just at par. I won't rush back to this place but it was a good bbq fix with all the different styles of sauce at the ready. The beer list is overwhelming but the staff is really knowledgeable about the full list. My boyfriend and I split the sharing size of the pick 4 meats and 2 sides (bacon wrapped jalapenos were delicious) and we're both big eaters and we had leftovers, the portion size was huge. Ribs were great, chopped pork was also pretty good but the brisket and sausage could use a bit of work. Worth another try when we're really craving BBQ.

8Au4IKl6wF4GZncm4OSCzw.text: Great customer service! Waitress described the menu so well and told her honest opinion about the food. Would definitely recommend

AireP9rKHdYSYGQhg-qC4Q.text: Awesome barbecue! Loved the brisket. We had a lunch special with pork rinds and nacho cheese that was delicious. Excellent service.

7ZkZNwBWiXublhuHjYZZqw.text: The food is great. It's consistent comfort food and that's hard to find these days.  If this review was only for food it would get 5 stars. But, there's a service component to this and it was awful.  From getting to the hostess, to being taken to an occupied table and back to wait again, to the server boxing our food up before we were finished. It was a disaster. Rude, rushed, and unprofessional.  I understand the need to turn tables, but if you're scooping full plates off of the table to move people along, you're missing the point of service.   I'll call for takeout next time.

enIy6MOEv92vSG__fMDTBA.text: Excellent barbecue! I love the ribs and the brisket! If your undecided it's best to get the variety " pig out " choice on the menu. It gives you four choices of meats and two sides. It a fantastic introduction! Make sure you order dessert too!

XJ4AC8Ym5OWH86r9eozItg.text: I've never had a chance before but after my gf got me take away I was surprised! Great Hamburger !!! I need to check this place ASAP

m3zFuafg0uiiIYxXc3pD8Q.text: Great baked beans, ribs and Texas toast. If you are a dessert person, eat it first because you won't have room at the end of your meal.

G96gsmWPs7a_kXkYCDwUOg.text: My boyfriend and I came on a Wednesday and their special for the day was the burnt ends with cheerwine sauce. I explained to my waitress that it was my boyfriend's first time trying Carolina bbq and I wanted him to taste the vinegar based sauce. She said "No problem!" and brought out the Carolina bbq sauce along with the cheerwine sauce. The burnt ends were delicious, the baked beans were probably the best I've ever had at a restaurant, and the hush puppies were...okay :).  They have a nice selection of beer from North Carolina breweries.  Warm service, good food. Will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends with Cheerwine sauce

hkY_TkMTdUxh-BCqLtB90Q.text: A good barbeque spot in Charlotte located just outside the downtown. I had one of their salads with brisket which was pretty good. I also had tastes of the ribs and pork which were also pretty good. The place wont blow you away but overall worth checking out if your looking for good barbeque at a good price.

CIlgjLS-h_Up1AKzUqRojg.text: This place is a must for barbecue novices and enthusiasts! My husband and I ate here on Friday night for the first time but not the last! I am a very picky eater & enjoyed everything I ate. The Brisket was very good! They even ask if you want fat, lean, or both, which, I now know,means they know what they are doing! Richard & his staff made us feel welcomed and appreciated as customers! Be sure to save room for dessert-the Pecan Cobbler is amazing!

B9IH8TKjHfn_5XMvfBMHEg.text: Amazing service, amazing food! I love the mac and cheese, and they have some amazing cocktails.  I'm from Kentucky, and I know my bourbon, and I was impressed by their selection.

yeEeP6FDtbV8UQPMvl-i4A.text: The burnt ends and ribs are always delicious.  The sampler platter is more than enough for sharing and has something for everyone.

eIT9Nerzz_CgGiKMcnev6Q.text: Delicious food.  Server very nice.  Bacon wrapped jalapeno a definite must of you like spicy.  Burnt ends ends tasty.

-VrOt9nSxZWymPa0wlbgyQ.text: I really enjoy their mac & cheese, I could eat it all day. I had the fatty brisket and it is very fatty and a bit salty. I think next time I will shift to the less fatty choice. Otherwise, I enjoyed the place. I've been there about three or four times now and I will return again.

Ykqu4O5LSEaHnDcy0VzS0g.text: Food is ok...not great. The service is inconsistent at best. Management is nowhere in sight. There are better options in Charlotte.

C5xn37pICOwIcIsZJPJm2A.text: Went here for an early dinner today with my wife and kids and really had a nice time and a great meal!!  When we got there, parking was a little tricky..... There was none available in their lot but I was able to park on the street right outside the place.  We were quickly greeted at the door and seated right away.  Our waiter was Matt and he was simply great!!  My wife had the chicken with veggies, we got a pork sandwich for the little one and I got 1/2 rack of ribs with the hush puppies, which were delicious!!  The ribs were top notch with great BBQ sauce!!  The only drawback for me was the men's room.... It had a very strong stench of urine and just wasn't very clean.  But I feel like bathrooms should be both the staff and patron's responsibility to keep clean..... That's just my opinion.  The price was very fair I thought.  The food was very good!!  I would go back!!

Lj2hFN3JaTTBbAixs-Q0sA.text: Got off the plane late and wandering around looking for dinner. Just happened on this. Wow! Amazing food. My son got burnt bits and I got the brisket - amazing food. Amazing service, friendly and helpful. Good collection of beer. And open late too.

_Mj3OSrhkFkTvY7OispALg.text: My wife and I were visiting Charlotte for the Elevation Church Live recording at Time Warner Arena and needed some late night grub after that event. This place hit.the.spot.! The service was fast and very friendly, atmosphere was what you'd expect at a non-chain BBQ spot. Parking was easy. And most importantly the food was amazing. Great Mac and cheese, beef brisket was out of this world and the pork burnt ends were packed full of great smokey flavor. Definitely check this place out!

eAzpZj_U-y82dojDmEJmBA.text: I've never been a huge bbq fan but this place is amazing. I had the pork bbq sandwich and it literally melts in your mouth. The pimento cheese fries are a must for an appetizer. The bbq baked beans are so flavorful as well as the sweet potato fries. We had great service and the prices are not outrageous. Go there! You won't regret it.

yuU8jRsCduqTx7o8ih6QyA.text: One of the best rack of ribs in my life. High quality pulled pork, sides, and service.   If you are visiting Charlotte and staying downtown, a visit is worth an uber or a short cab ride

xpQIhA0IecjTXjxhmuTN2w.text: I recently relocated from Texas, and have been searching for some decent brisket. I was so thrilled that MS not only knew what wet brisket was, but produced some of the best I've had in a loooong time!  I am so excited that I now have an authentic bbq place to eat in Charlotte!  The service was fast and friendly, atmosphere great, and I also loved the side item of smoked veggies.  Delicious!  We are going back today!

lmxuohHqDu3RsL02LTkQCA.text: We ordered a huge order from Midwood for a party.   It was all delicious.  The barbecue was tender, juicy, and tasty.  The side dishes were all outstanding.  The coleslaws were all outstanding.  Really is the best barbecue in Charlotte in my opinion.  I ate so much barbecue that it will be quite a while before I'll crave some.

5G8xGmju22lEuIPLtq63tw.text: Not sure what's up with all the terrific reviews.  I have been twice and both times by meat was dry and we had less than "great" service.  I might try one more time, but after that, I'm heading back to Mac's for always great sandwiches and the best smoked chicken wings in town!

gKfPqjfTDPmj9n4Zahg1Ig.text: I'm not a barbecue fan, so I'll start off by giving that disclaimer. That said, I usually don't mind when friends want to go to a barbecue place because they always have really great sides. Not the case here. I wanted to like it so badly; I have been two or three times in an attempt to appease the friends I'm with ... and I'm just not happy with it. I wish they would focus a little more on their sides ... then I would be all about it!

DXGpJOfCahQOktZYiwp1kg.text: Ok, I love this place! The staff is very engaging and friendly. The food is great. It's a different take on BBQ. Some things are so down-home good food that I don't know that it is country. Other things are a fusion of new and old.   The amount of beer they have is staggering! The bartender will do an excellent job of guiding you through the maze of wonderful ales and beers they have.  All in all this is a top notch restaurant.

CClkJdJC4S82o4jlgmGI2A.text: Hands down my favorite BBQ place in Charlotte!  The brisket is the best I have ever had. Super juicy and just the right amount of fat! (Although you can ask for it lean if you don't like the fat.) My favorite side is the grilled vegetables but I think most people would go for the macaroni and cheese or bacon wrapped jalepenos. I also love the sloppy joe and grown up grilled cheese which have all the flavors of childhood with enough flavor for my adult tastebuds!  They always have great beer selections and unlike most every other restaurant in Charlotte they don't start blaring the music at seven at night.  Easily one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte.

C6AbZIySPVarsrjgx5umxQ.text: WOW, WOW and WOW.  This is serious BBQ and one of my favorite places in the last couple of years.  First, to roll in at 930p and still find the food appearing and tasting as fresh as when it likely opened was a welcome surprise.  I got a platter with chopped pork, chopped chicken, ribs and brisket.  The serving was the smaller platter but it was all I could manage.  The meat was perfectly smoked with intense smoke, but not too much.  Moist, delicious and even better when dipped in the three sauces brought with the platter.  Pickled onions and hushpuppies along with the bbq slaw and bacon wrapped jalepenos rounded out my dinner.  Pretty reasonable price for a great meal in a nice, upscale environment.

8yZm8SsGhWovwI9eA-Hx4A.text: In town for one night and wanted BBQ.  Found Midwood and gave it a try.  It was nice to get out of the rain.  Atmosphere is very nice, clean and relaxing.  Waiter was friendly and beer and food selection were good.  Decided on the small sampler plate to try a few bbq items.  Brisket, turkey, pulled pork were all very good.  Vinegar and bbq sauce was average to good.  The sausage link was not to my taste but overall food, drink and staff were really good.

ntnPMkRTA555bosSA0F1IQ.text: Best BBQ in Charlotte I've had so far. Now, this isn't Texas BBQ, but you have to remember where you are. For consistently good, convenient BBQ in Charlotte, this is where you go.   The Brisket and the BBQ Ribs are my go to staples here. You won't go wrong with either. As far as sides here go, my favorites are the macaroni and cheese along with the baked beans. Pure goodness.   Pro Tip: Try to avoid weekend crowds if you can. Go during the week when they have time to prepare the food the right way. I've come on weekends and sometimes they struggle maintaining their weekday quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. St. Louis Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs BBQ Baked Beans mac n cheese. All very good. You order this dish and you won&#39;t go wrong.

lJOvrLfFSRFHcANo7TCWng.text: Visited here during a trip and the food is unreal. Had a perfect brisket, dinosaur sized beef rib, mac and cheese, baked beans and hush puppies that are perfectly crispy and blessed with butter. Finished it off with banana pudding that I can't stop thinking about. (And I hate bananas)   Great price, great portions, great sauces and our server Dwayne was one of the best servers I've had in any restaurant. Definitely give this place a try!

glqsXUZXOqNrQ7OKs3tnhA.text: Continues to be the best chopped BBQ pork in Charlotte. They have an unreal bourbon selection and their queso appetizer is phenomenal!  My dad would kill me if I didn't book reservations here every time he visits.

uAo-PuOx7HzvPf4dW487hg.text: I need more stars. Like for real!  My mom and I were driving from Nashville to Virginia and decided we needed *one* more southern BBQ meal. It added about and hour and 20 mins to our journey, we didn't get to Virginia until about 4 am, but this was worth it!  First, we came in pretty close to closing time and no one batted an eyelash about it! All the southern hospitality, even sitting at the bar, the whole time!  Most importantly- the food was BEYOND my expectations! I got the fatty brisket, against my typical judgment call because in my past experiences brisket ends up just being dry as hell. But this was not that! It was juicy, it fell apart and it was incredible! The greens I got were seasoned perfectly, and the Mac and cheese was the kind of homemade experience you'd want.   My mom got ribs and she was just as satisfied! I tried one of them and she was right to feel that way- the same fall off the bone tenderness, smoky yet flavorful and all around satisfying!  I want to go back here. Like now. I had intended to save my leftovers for my boyfriend to try when I got back to NY but alas, it was just too good to share!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ quest with chopped pork. So yummy!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fatty brisket, Mac + cheese and greens. The stuff dreams are made of!

mSmamkJQUEqkDcikGo-gLg.text: Everyone loves this spot and my boyfriend is a huge fan of their brisket. Unfortunately, I don't like bbq like that. I know some American. However, I do enjoy the sides and I would definitely go back for it all. Their spicy habanero bbq sauce made my meal more enjoyable. We got the combo platter and additional sides. If you're a bbq lover this is definitely the place for you if you're more I to Texas style bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

7T8rTXHzTZd4I0lkLSFhrQ.text: Midwood Smokehouse is a Charlotte staple. It's my favorite BBQ in Charlotte. This is the original location and they've since expanded with several other locations.   We came this time around 7 on a Wednesday night. They told us there would be a 25 minute wait, but ended up being able to seat us a few minutes later.   I've had a variety of different things here and have never been disappointed. This time, we decided to get the pimiento cheese fries with pulled pork and the Midwood Grilled Cheese with brisket. Both of them were delicious as always. We got mac and cheese as  our side which is amazing (also good with baked beans). We added on a side of hush puppies which were really good. If you have room for dessert, the banana pudding is amazing.   This is definitely a must try Charlotte restaurant that I highly recommend trying if you haven't yet!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends with mac and cheese and baked beans
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Texas style brisket sandwich with bacon wrapped jalepeños

i-MNLzUruBQW5ySS63xnmw.text: Well this was a lot better than my last BBQ review. I had the Burt ends with baked bean and Mac and cheese. The Burt ends where tender with great flavor. The beans were very tasty. The Mac and cheese was not the best. It was a little cold. I ate everything else but the Mac and cheese. Oh and i had the bacon wrapped jalapenos. Those could have been a little warmer The staff was very friendly. Defiantly recommend stopping in.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends

OAnNN5kdIAXYjZ9qFubooQ.text: This was highly recommend by a few locals, so we checked it out for lunch. There were 4 of us and we split the Pig Put platter, added 2 sides of burnt ends, side of collard greens and Mac and cheese. The sausage was only so so, but brisket, spare ribs and pulled pig were great. The burnt ends stole the show!   They also have a decent selection of craft beers on draft.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

iDv_wlxoax_kV8PjJZYdKw.text: Best BBQ in the area! I know it's a chain, but honestly I haven't found better BBQ in the area. With the amount of celebrities that stop by, it's got to be good! I typically get the burnt ends with bacon wrapped jalapenos and mac and cheese.

7N8sPe_Rl8UiSo3Fg98rmw.text: I really appreciated the style of service we received from the guy in the dreads.  Very friendly guy and was accommodating the entire time.  I had a pound of pork and a whisky.  I think it was $13 for the pound $5 for the whisky.  I was happy with what I had and would go back again.  The brisket cheese fries looked really good and I might get that next time.  Casual dining room with lots of TVs.  Perfect environment for having some food and watching a game.  Extensive beer and bar selection.  Thanks for a nice meal.

HKKNRfn9hj-Sl2pEg0XKrQ.text: Wow!!!  Simply amazing!!  Food was spectacular!!!  Service from Chris was the best!!  You have to visit and you won't be disappointed!!  Only issue was their specialty corn bread is only available on Friday/Saturday/Sunday!!  Other than that - perfect!!

IkswSc8N0Km_OOWmr0H9uA.text: My husband and I are on a cross-country trip and weren't planning on stopping in Charlotte, but he said we have to make it work just for Midwood Smokehouse burnt ends. And it did not disappoint! Also, the most delicious pecan pie I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Demolished ribs and burnt ends.

bOmSLymAU7rxNwyAforegg.text: Yummy! Stopped in here on a Saturday night about 6:30 on. About a 25 minute wait to be seated. Not much space at the bar. Reasonable. We were seated outside at a sort of zip up patio with heaters. Once I zipped up the awning I was fine.  Brittney was our waitress and she was awesome with draft beer recommendations, meat recommendations, and desserts.  My wife and I ordered the pig out to share. Our meats were the ribs, brisket, burnt end (substituted for an extra fee), and pork. Sides were mac and cheese and creamed corn along with Texas Toast.  Let me tell you the meats were delicious. While I wouldn't characterize the ribs as fall off the bone they were extremely moist and well seasoned. The briscuit was equally good as were the burnt ends. The meats had a good bark and smoke flavor to them.  Brittney was so kind to explain the sauces to us. My favorite by far was the habanero sauce. The pork took a back seat to the above three. If I were to do it again then I would skip the pork to see if I could double up on the other meats.  We finished with a dessert. Heck, we went both the pecan pie and banana cream. I read other Yelp reviews about the banana cream being good. It sure was. The pecan pie was warm and came with a scoop of ice cream. Ultimately, the banana cream won out as my favorite! Next time I will order just a large banana cream and skip the pecan pie.  Overall, it was a really enjoyable meal with an awesome waitress in Brittney! I will definitely return next time in Charlotte.

-BNN30CE-7ar2dKMbs5LPA.text: I came here after seeing the impressive Yelp rating this restaurant held in this area and was not disappointed. It was so delicious that I can't imagine coming back to town and not stopping here to enjoy a meal. The meal started off with queso dip and tortilla chips which was served piping hot and you can choose to top it off with some meat for an additional two dollars. I ordered a combo platter which was called "pig out" that allowed you to pick four different cuts of bbq served with two sides, pickled onions, and hushpuppies. The four cuts of meat I chose to go with were bbq ribs, carolina chopped pork, shredded chicken, and brisket. The brisket was charred on the outside and extremely tender and moist on the inside. It was absolutely delicious. In addition to the brisket, the ribs were by far the best ribs I have ever had, and I have had a ton of ribs in my day. Mixed with a dry rub and finger licking good sauce, the ribs were fell off the bone and had a ton of meat.   I did not care so much for the chicken as much as the other cuts but I am a little bias since I am not a big fan of poultry in general. The waitress also was nice enough to bring out three different types of bbq sauce so I was able to experience the goodness full circle from vinegar, mild bbq, and a sweeter habanero bbq sauce.   To round out my gut busting meal I ordered a small banana pudding that was life changing. I used to work down the street from Magnolias but I have to say, this banana pudding blew theirs out of the water. Save room for this banana pudding, it is speckled with fresh sliced bananas, laced with creamy light pudding, and topped with crunchy vanilla wafers.   All in all, I would say to skip appetizers, get a combo platter if its your first time here, and get the banana pudding. Banana pudding is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso dip
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Feasting

VHVXA8ltzN9Eo7zaByb40g.text: This is my favorite bbq places in Charlotte! I've come here countless times and am never disappointed. This is the place where I take my parents and out of town we friends to for some good bbq.   Personally I love the burnt ends and will order a large to get two sides and some leftovers.   For sides, I always get the Mac & cheese and then split between either the sweet potatoes fries or normal fries. I have a peanut, nut, and shellfish allergy so I don't often get to eat fried food, but the head chef here has a peanut allergy so this place is great to come to and have no worries.   Finally, I always, without a doubt, get the banana pudding! It's absolutely delicious and a must have from this place.   One small downfall is since the Plaza Midwood location doesn't take reservations, you could have a long wait.

XYr3VylOhLUU1upKmmZdWA.text: I went in for lunch and the server described a "lunch special"... the only thing special about this beef rib and two sides lunch special was the price of FORTY DOLLARS!! The server conveniently left that out and even before knowing the price I contemplated sending it back but I didn't because I don't want to be one to complain. Then I mention that price is outrageous and the server said "haha ya" takes my money and walks away!!  Then, I had a friend try to convince me to give midwood a second chance. So I did and the food was cold and not very good! I'm shocked this restaurant has a good rating because other friends of mine agree with me now. There is other way better BBQ places in Charlotte! Save your 40 dollars and buy something else!

a4jGAJmWg2OdPZ3T-Lmmbw.text: This is a great place to try in plaza-midwood. The parking isn't the best though.  I love their smoked wings so flavorful and tender. I would go just for the wings. They are some of the best I've had.  My main dish I last ordered was the burnt ends & Mac n cheese. The burnt ends are great just a little heavy on the salt for me so something I wouldn't order much.   I would definitely return atleast for the wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends...Mac n cheese and sweet potatoe fries

5EkOZY5m45cAx5xaQBRvWw.text: My first time in Charlotte..... this place is amazing. I ordered the Hot Mess and fell in love. Its not messy like I thought it would be but the flavors were there and amazing. My mom ordered a salad and was shocked but the portion size but the flavor was there! My friend and her mom shared ribs and love them also. This is one place were some southern girls can enjoy collard greens too! If you're in Charlotte stop by here! It's great!

-SVjRoUnoYVs2qD01NN6UQ.text: Southern food with Southern hospitality what more could I ask for. Our host Tyler was INCREDIBLE! I have never experienced that type of hospitality in a while. He was so awesome my table wanted him to eat with us! I order the beef brisket sandwich with Mac and cheese! This is the definition of southern food. They legit put there foot in the pots in the back. I don't remember anyone talking at the table when we all had our fold that's how great it was. I also tried the hush puppies which were good, a salmon salad which was great and of course sweet potato fries! I also had the banana pudding which is something that I am trying to get used to eating and I enjoyed it. Everything was Fantastic! Not only did we have the manager come but the general manager which is rare! They were both AMAZING! This is what a restaurant should aim to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

JQhirnwQFPUZfneqms5fng.text: The brisket and ribs will never let you down at Midwood smokehouse.  I only like the location on Plaza.  Their pull pork is just ok for me.  (Pull pork at Mac's is better).  The service is always great!!!  As you can see the meats and sides vanished so fast that I can't even capture the before pic...lol  After all President Obama knows his bbq...

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. We ate so fast didn&#39;t get a chance to snap the before pic...lol

fpsJJh1yPTTjdkNUNIr7zg.text: A trip to North Carolina is incomplete without a visit to Midwood Smokehouse! We ordered the combo platter to share, and it was super reasonably priced!! You get to choose 4 different types of meats with 2 sides. We ordered the St Louis ribs, burnt ends, pulled pork and beef brisket. For sides, we got the mac n cheese and the bacon wrapped jalapenos. I loved everything!! The St Louis ribs were my absolutely favorite! It was so tender, juicy, and perfectly flavored with a dash of sweetness and a lot of savory-ness. The burnt ends and beef brisket are also a must-try. If you want really good pulled pork, you should definitely check out Mac's Speedshop!! The pulled pork at Midwood was good but the one at Mac's is GOOOOOD.

NFS5fU6FdziQZKUaX3w-ZA.text: Food: Pulled pork, brisket, cheddar sausage, pork ribs, baked beans, smoked vegetables  Pros: Best ribs I've ever had, no contest. Incredible texture, excellent spice mix. Great sides, beans were great comfort food and the smoked vegetables tasted good. Pulled pork was good, but I wouldn't consider it exceptional.  Meh: Brisket cuts were too fatty, couldn't really taste the beef flavor. Sausage was alright, but nothing exceptional.   Cons: The sauces were not good. We were provided two sauces, presumably a spicy and a mild one. The mild sauce was alright, but too runny and the flavor was mediocre. The spicy sauce had little viscosity and wasn't really what you'd consider a sauce.  Overall: Get the ribs. The other meats you could likely pass on and not miss out too much. The sauces were pretty disappointing, but luckily the ribs are great without anything additional.

HSSSQohOJuOoMBRy-ewApA.text: Love their wings. Definitely try a bourbon flight with their pimento cheese fries. The staff is always friendly and well manored usually. Not our waitress but her assistant was very slow and forgetful this evening. Our waitress made up for him and we continued to have a good experience.

7I6jrebU21z9HzvLyu85lw.text: I had the brisket and burnt ends. I cannot believe this is considered bbq. The brisket was dry and the burnt ends weren't burnt ends. They were covered in sauce to hide the "meat from yesterday" taste. If you want bbq I would suggest other places.

dE3_YmBc6WlgoYVoyrO7XQ.text: Food was great, service just ok. Told the server it was our first time, he gave us recommendations, but brought the check before I could order another drink nor did he ask if we wanted dessert. He had a bigger party to tend to, which I get but we were in no hurry. Hopefully we'll have better service next time.

zdvz3yxUCvz8YU4YuVRb5Q.text: This Amy be the best BBQ I have ever had! Don't miss the Carolina style BBQ chicken. Everything is amazing and the staff is fun and attentive. A must visit if in Charlotte.

dpYMiRIm9H1xBN7zYTUh7Q.text: Its been years since I've had quality BBQ and on my whirlwind business trip through North Carolina, was able to stop at Midwood for lunch.  Best stop I made on my trip.    Found parking on the street outside and stepped inside to a casual restaurant with friendly service.    Started off with the bacon wrapped jalapenos.  Was on a phone call, chatting away and next thing I knew, they were gone.    And then the BBQ arrived...  Carolina Pork-Smoked, tender, flavorful and exactly what I've been missing.  I'd like to consider myself  a memphis bbq connoisseur; however, this pork was excellent in its own right.  And that vinegar sauce?  I'm not a fan of sweet sauces and their sauce's blend of vinegar and spices was a perfect pairing.  I didn't need anything else, but the goodness didn't stop there.  Creamed Corn-creamy & buttery perfection. Hush Puppies-WHAT?!  I haven't had Hush Puppies this good since 1987 in the bootheel of Missouri.  Excellent BBQ and sides and Highly Recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina Pork, cream corn &amp; hush puppies and that&#39;s a stuft tater back there

UHKF2ckGxXzlZYbsAMnuXA.text: Great food but weak service. Had the combo platter and everything was great. Had to pay extra for the burnt end but it was worth it. As good as the food was the service was just meh. Our server was slow and not very attentive.

FTzG-88BJlK5_MTdxX1NDw.text: Mediocre, at best.  The food was just "eh". Bacon-wrapped Jalapenos were clearly sitting under a heat lamp, brisket was so-so (if you choose this, get the 'fatty' one), burnt ends were more like sugar cubes.  I will say, the staff/bartenders were great, and the portions were generous.  This may be harsh, but I really disagree with the 4.5 Stars this place currently has; I won't be returning.

xSw-RpeSDx0Rble8sw481g.text: Great BBBQ, beans are the best ever and I love their collard greens. This is one of the top 3 BBQ places around Charlotte. Highly recommend.

bOQ02vajZvYl04OwOUaRTA.text: Very good food, cold beer, courteous staff that was willing to accommodate more than expected in our party. Well  manage establishment.

UHmvrbjzM1agqhOgKfNEpg.text: The food here is amazing! We had the Carolina Pulled Pork and it was so good. Usually it's the BBQ sauce that makes the pork taste so good at other restaurants but this tasted great without sauce. I would definitely recommend eating here. You won't be disappointed.

elnF3Vb-AkbW1Q0IZswSUw.text: It's an average place I honestly thing it's bland pork. Mac's speed shop is def better

db_Wq9C4punQCBLg7BNPkQ.text: Meh. Lots of good BBQ places in town. This one is cookie-cutter. You can do better. Skip it and check out more authentic places in town.

LS6lsd-W_TeoT2PavpfoOQ.text: I hate writing bad reviews, but I have to get this off my chest. I'm bothered that I paid $44.67 for a meal that was mediocre BBQ at best.   We got the BBQ queso to start, which was just alright. Nothing to get excited about and reasonably priced at $6. For my meal, I got the "large" burnt ends, which includes six tough brisket cubes, a cup of mac n' cheese, and a good handful of sweet potato fries for $18.50. My wife got the "large" pulled pork plate. The pork was dry, like really dry, even with sauce. As for her sides, she chose collards and creamed corn. Both were okay.   Our server seemed to keep forgetting about us. It was frustrating to finish our meal and sit there waiting 20 mins for our check. Then when she brought our check, my debit card wasn't there. After she walks away, I'm looking around for her to to tell her that it was missing and I see it sitting in the middle of two tables on the ground. Now, it must have fallen out of the sleeve and I'm not mad at her about that. But it just kind of the cherry on top of our crappy experience. If you're looking for good BBQ, you won't find it here.

JdZChxivY3x5EDtOHEBjXw.text: Midwood was good for the most part. I absolutely loved the mac and cheese, baked beans and brisket. If I go back, those are likely the items I would order. They were really good! I ordered a four meat choice sampler, but was told that they were out of ribs. One star docked for that. BBQ places cannot run out of ribs!!

MVTfPwQI5H1On73qmQIpjg.text: I LOVE this place!!! Everything I order here is incredible. Hard to find good food with good service in a restaurant but this place has the best of all worlds. Always a great atmosphere, always a smiling face, always clean and I will always go back

-RmeYHinOT1tl-H0bdKttQ.text: this is the best smokehouse i've ever been to in north carolina midwood's ribs are so easy to eat and slides right off the bone and their nachos are so delicious and they add a smokehouse twist and it's so good and their food is just overall amazing would totally recommend if you want really good ribs and would definitely go again already been there several times probably my fav smokehouse! and their vinegar base barbecue is so amazing u need to try it!!!

KAAqetklPofRX_Qen4b1nA.text: I love BBQ and if I can get quality BBQ, at an affordable price and that too quickly, then dang, I'm sold. Midwood Smokehouse checks all those boxes and more. Super friendly staff, great portion sizes, flavorful sauces and tender pork - winner. Loved this place and hope to be going back soon next time I'm in CLT. All I can leave you with is that the BBQ Pulled Pork sandwich is my go to and you really can't go wrong getting it your first time there.

5_A2FhONmZd5C3m5VZ_ENA.text: Small wait the later you go in the evening, but we'll worth the wait.  We got the bacon wrapped jalapeno peppers, pretty ok.  Not great.  They come 5 to an order with ranch dipping sauce.   We reached ordered ribs, I got the creamed creamed corn (can you say OMG!!!) The best I have ever had, my partner got sweet potato fries.   The plates came with ok hushpuppies, I have had way worse.   The ribs were fall of the bone tender, no knife or fork needed there.  They are  a dry rub, but the ribs are super moist.  You can get them sauced or sauce on the side.  A sweet habenaro (a little kick) sauce or a Smokey sweet sauce.  Both were really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

1nsrz7ui1E4j16Kus-vkfQ.text: AMAZING FOOD. Try he burnt ends and fried jalapenos, but don't you dare miss their juicy, perfectly prepared burgers.   I have dreams about them!

rxTesrDOECtj7KGGvQl0og.text: Wow I wasn't expecting the brisket to be that great as I just moved from texas but I was horrified when the pork was even worse. I always bragged NC knows pork BBQ and Texas honestly is not that good at it. Sigh. I will never understand yelp reviewers. This is objectively not good bbq.

p306Q-9T9EKo-5hnN-FVZQ.text: We went to Midwood Smokehouse tonight for dinner! It was great as usual. We arrived at about 6:15, which was perfect because we got to sit down right away. There was hardly anybody there. By the time we left (about 45 minutes later), there was definitely a wait.

3hR5Dq1jw10hx7o4V5KSow.text: Is really nice. The service is fast and consistent. We went there because the reviews in yelp. And really they are very close to te reality. Really is good place to have a great meal or drink.

GNy7fvbWsCdbvs8PM7Et0A.text: The wings. That's all I need to say. Came here with a large group, our waitress was awesome juggling all of our food and drink orders. We all ordered a variety of food and really the main thing that we ended up ordering more of was the wings! Perfectly cooked, little crisp, amazing seasoning. Definitely recommend!

TJKXfmDishj-cqYJn8U3iw.text: The reviews on yelp & confirmation from the hotel employees brought me here - and they didn't steer me wrong. This place is a gem!  So many items on the menu caught my eye, but I decided to get tacos to try 3 meat options & that were amazing. I ordered the brisket, pork & special taco of the day made from pulled ribs.  Service was great from the hostess to waitress (Mindy) & management staff. Mindy was so patient, attentive and gave great recommendations. I felt more like I visited my good friend's house than a restaurant.  Will definitely return on my next trip to Charlotte!

gFfbruLECnS7IByPcdOdsg.text: The meat-eaters had a jolly good time here, thanks to me and my Yelping prowess.  I had eaten a starkly contrasted raw vegan lasagna a half an hour prior in anticipation of this meat feast because as you can imagine, not the most vegetarian friendly place!  At least the sweet potato fries were good and service was on the better side.  So that pleased me well enough.    Given that Midwood Smokehouse is such a sought after lunch joint, do anticipate a bit of a wait.  I think we waited around twenty or thirty minutes - sufficient time to cram in a game of cornhole.  I killed it, that's what vegans kill . .. games?  Nice touch offering this distraction during the wait!  Anyway, the omnivores REALLY enjoyed their meaty selections - can't quite recall everything, but I think there were some leftovers, which a late flight arriver was more than happy about receiving.

PND20RjiGZrvWNj0TkM9PA.text: Decent bbq, either we came on an off-night or this place is a tad over-rated on here. "Texas Toast" is essentially just toast, beans are good, smoked meats were tasty enough. Will likely stick with Mac's Speed Shop for bbq when we visit Charlotte.

lQ_gLEtanD_Phee0Ob4KoQ.text: Fried mac & cheese, hush puppies, gigantic beef rib special and Carolina pork plate.  Yes that is a ton of food, but it was all so delicious.  I was especially enamored with the Eastern NC vinegar sauce.  If it wasn't for the liquid restriction on carry-on items, I would've tried to bring a bottle home.  Maybe I should've tried to portion it out to 3oz bottles.  The mustard sauce that came with the Chicken BBQ was also awesome.  I felt like it would be great to have with a soft pretzel too.  Sadly, those aren't on the menu.  Prices are extremely reasonable for the portion sizes.  I wish I had gone all out and tried the combo platter just to get more options in.  Next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef rib special

FEuXvVx7FsBcMqyU706Q_g.text: The food was amazing. This was my first time there. Even though my girlfriend doubted the creamed corn (she's from Cali) she absolutely loved it and ate the whole bowl by herself. How shellfish!!! But no, please go eat here, the best food that we have had in the past 2 weeks of being in NC!! Get the ribs, highly suggested!!

8WrLHC1uLZ3Y5HxTcX6zkg.text: I was in Carolina so I had to get some Carolina BBQ. Midwood Smokehouse had some high ratings and a bunch of reviews so I had to try them. When I came in the parking lot was full, a good sign of they must be good. They have a nice indoor and outdoor dining areas and a rooftop dining area with an awesome view. Overall it was OK. I went with two small plates of BBQ just to sample a variety of the menu. yelp.com/biz_photos/midw... The first plate I'll call it the South Carolina plate yelp.com/biz_photos/midw... it was a plate of smoked pulled chicken, South Carolina mustard sauce, bacon wrapped jalapenos, and hush puppies. The pulled chicken wasn't that bad for chicken pretty dry, the SC mustard sauce was tasty, and bacon wrapped jalapenos and hush puppies were MEH. The second plate I'll call it the North Carolina plate yelp.com/biz_photos/midw... it was a plate of smoked pulled pork, Eastern NC vinegar sauce, BBQ slaw, and hush puppies. The pulled pork was good but not amazing, the NC vinegar sauce OK, the BBQ slaw not my favorite. So which BBQ wins this matchup SC or NC BBQ? Hard to say I wasn't wowed by either but NC wins just because the pulled pork tasted better. I don't think it was a good representation of what SC and NC BBQ was. Not recommending any of those plates. Maybe try something else their ribs, wings, and fries look good. Since I can't try them I have to keep it neutral 3 rating, BARELY, for their food. They have a nice atmosphere, friendly service, and a full bar. The outdoor patio has ceiling fans perfect for when dining outside on warm days. They have random decorations; one that stood out was the Hawaii license plate that started with a 'K'. If it starts a 'K' it usually means Kauai but it seems like whenever see a Hawaii license plate hanging on the wall it starts with a 'K' now. There's a cool mural on the wall of the building behind of Midwood Smokehouse.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

43iNy2HnXrOQuemhzj4X_Q.text: First time here and it was pretty great. The service was awesome and quick, place was clean and comfortable.  I'm not a BBQ aficionado so I can't really comment on how great the BBQ was in comparison to other people, but I did really enjoy it.

9nVJWak1zTnZm6g6TOuvrA.text: Love their smoked wings and brisket. Parking can be tricky during peak hours.

JX8aHy6QohW1OOk1GrGbew.text: Wow!! We asked several locals if they recommended any decent bbq places and no one had anything to say, found this place on yelp and will make sure to be back. Ordered the pig out with ribs, brisket, pulled pork and sausage. The pulled pork and sausage were amazing and everything was spot on!! The pimento cheese fries are love at first bite....seriously....LOVE this spot!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Heaven....the pig out!

ku-xGq5RaIo4_p9v0lMLwQ.text: For openers, if you believe the best barbecue is usually found in a bad part of town in a place with bars on the windows and just enough grease on the table to write your intials, then this isn't it.  If, on the other hand, you think good barbecue can be found in a funky part of town, with tons of other places to eat in every direction, then Midwood BBQ may be for you.  Actually, I suggest calling it Midwood BBBBQ... this is another of those places that has grown to the point that it's a Big Bucks BBQ place complete with a real people bar and more televisions than needed, much less appreciated.  Parking is yet another issue and don't be surprised if there's a wait.  For someone who has spent a lifetime in search of the perfect barbecue, Midtown has several things going for it, but, in reality it's a big sports bar that has some decent barbecue.  Let's start with the service and the decor: folks are there to greet and seat you when you come through the door, a smiling face to who quickly takes your drink order, clean tables with the now-it's-almost required rolls of paper towel, a beer signs from brews gone by, photos from Charlotte's earlier days and at least one television per wall in the bar and in the main dining room. There's also some sidewalk tables.  We opted for a couple of their better known appetizers, fried pickles and bacon wrapped jalapenos, a half dozen bucks. And that's the first rub...   the bacon wrapped Jalapenos were at the highlight of the entire meal, followed by the Hush Puppies and then a tie between the souped up baked beans and the Mac n Cheese - and when the sides outshine the protein offerings there's a problem.  That's not the way it's supposed to be.  The situation is reversed at most barbecue joints: the meats get all the attention and the sides, all too often, come out of a can or the freezer. Not so at Midwood's Smokehouse... and for the real barbecue zealot there for low and slow cooked meats, too many TVs, beer choices and sides can be a distraction.  The ribs, as a for instance, literally fell off the bone. Why?  Were they parboiled, or baked, and then tossed on the grill?  Steamed (to tenderize) before they were served? If any of the aforementioned, that's not low and slow over a bed of smoldering wood.  That's cheating.     To give credit where due, the brisket was exceptional... just enough fat left to provide real good (and moist) flavor. And the pulled pork was almost as good and served in the same generous portion.  The chicken was on the dry side.  For the Brown Shoe Gourmet's taste, their homemade sauce (smoky and sweet) worked best. An alien at the table preferred the vinegar based which brings up another point: this is a North Carolina barbecue joint that shows more of a leaning to Texas 'cue than Carolina style... the brisket, the jalapenos being good examples.  For a guy who has spent a lifetime in pursuit of the perfect barbecue (read more than 70 other barbecue reviews), this certainly isn't it... but it's fairly good with some exceptional sides, friendly folks and exceptional service.  Worth the effort if you can find parking, worth the effort if there's a game you want to see, a specific beer you've a thirst for, and are up for some fair to middlin' 'cue.

8LYtVx49b5FOOSfVpDQZ8Q.text: Well, you know I have to try BBQ places wherever I go to see who has the best. First time in Charlotte and I must say this place is up there with the best BBQ places in the US.  I had the ribs and the brisket and they were delish. Very tasty and smoky and very tender.  The Mac n cheese was not bad and the greens were pretty good too.  Hush puppies were good. The service was excellent n the price was about what I expected.  Way to go.

mA_C6W6du2kx1BUzDepygw.text: Love this place. Best brisket in town! And their hushpuppies are excellent. My girlfriend likes it to. We eat here weekly. I highly recommend!

2Pilz4QC8sMW2hwDABDGzg.text: After a long morning at the office I needed a break but I'm really trying to eat more healthy, but that always seems to go out the window after a hard morning work. I was struggling because the mac and cheese apparently is awesome. I stuck with my new found healthy eating habits and grabbed a salad. After much deliberation I decided on the chopped salad with pulled pork. Great recommendation by my server! I added jalapenos because i like it spicy and my pickled onions on the side (which come with every meal, unless you get a salad). It was a quick lunch and well deserved but I had to get back to the office, but I will definitely be coming back here again.

lxSJx2k9WjTgvTRhmYNhAg.text: Midwood tops my list of BBQ spots in Charlotte. Macs, Queen City Q and City Smoke are great, but Midwood is my favorite.  Huge portions and a very diverse menu. Believe it or not, they have very healthy options and amazing salads. Granted, I prefer jalepeno poppers, burnt ends and mac & cheese.  Parking can be tight, but there's usually at least space on the street around the block.  Beer selection is fairly strong too.

wlx5xL6n29mbl-XYXL6G6A.text: 5 stars for the food. 1 star for the service. Multiple tables that arrived and ordered after us got their food 10 minutes before us. The server ignored us and kept going to other tables. The managers excuses were annoying too. She said because we ordered grilled items they take longer but how did it take my medium burger 10 minutes longer than the 3 well done burgers ordered by the ladies sitting next to us that came in 10 minutes after us.Then the manager offered us desserts and said she had already let the server know. He never asked us what desserts we wanted and I had to flag down the manager to take care of us.

lGoItq3ZDop6ipSvrT9njA.text: Don't tell my grandmother, but the banana pudding is phenomenal.  The best I have ever had.  The take out service is slow every time we order, but the food is great.  The chopped salad with meat  is almost too big to eat, but it is delicious and the dressing choices are unique.  The burnt ends are good, as are the ribs, but surprisingly my favorite meal is a burger, Mac and cheese, and banana pudding.

2l9VkCEmhVDjVRsuYnyErg.text: I absolutely love the bbq salads here! This dish is unlike any found at other restaurants. Thankfully you can buy half portions because it would be a real shame to waste any of a full portion. The original restaurant on Central Avenue is closest to me but I'm looking forward to trying the new location at Ballantyne. It can be very discouraging to see a huge crowd waiting to get in but I've never had to wait longer than 15-20 minutes. Once seated the wait staff is quick and efficient. Excellent prices for delicious and ample meals.

bbw7C7jn2JbL2pbA8nKQvQ.text: If it's good for the Prez and future Prez as well as Secret Service, 'nuff said.  I have enjoyed their entrees for the last couple of years.

J9ArfLHKJ-7g-82EIdpbdg.text: Your review helps others learComing from Kansas City, I KNOW what good BBQ is!  I was very impressed.  Nothing I tried was even mediocre in the slightest.  I highly recommend the ribs in Habanero BBQ sauce.  They don't even need extra sauce.  The brisket was amazing in its own right, particularly with the crust.  I completely enjoyed the beans, the corn and my God...  the sauces!!  The pork was decent and was exceptional with the variety of sauces to add on.  I would also say that the sausage is amazing.  Most of the reviews on here don't tout the sausage and I don't know why!  Dip it in their variety of mustards and you've got a real winner.  It was nice to have the hush puppies as an add on to dip with, etc.  Now, if this isn't enough to convince you, the people make it a spectacular experience indeed!  Both of my servers were absolute sweethearts and made me feel very welcome.  I would not have been surprised if I had been invited to go to a party afterwards.  Just incredibly warm people.  Richie Haddox the manager even stopped by several times to check on me and treated me to some great conversation as well as a little extra sauce.  ;-)  An awesome experience to be sure!  These people know good BBQ and exceptional customer service.  Its too easy to find average or even bad customer service these days.  Tragic commentary on where we've come to as a society.  Not at Midwood Smokehouse, however.  I'm definitely coming back the next time I'm in town, and to my buds back home... get ready!  I'm bringing home some killer sauce!n about great local businesses.  Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

QVzZrMPbejjlqHolPTdxpw.text: Best brisket in charlotte. The bbq beans have chow chow in them. Pickled onions are the best as well as the hush puppies. Smoked salmon is great,  if you are into smoked fish.  Great sugar creek beer to drink with. Brisket is not as fatty as the pork. Love this place.

0vA9MRqQSOxMrgwyEjpSig.text: The winner here was the pulled pork for me.  I liked the vinegar sauce very much.  The pork was juicy and a little smokey and perfect with their sauce.  The smoked veggies and greens were excellent as were the hush puppies that came with my meal.  The ribs were pretty good.  I ordered them dry, not wet.  I liked the rub.  The ribs were a little overcooked and tough on one end and just short of dry.  Their house red sauce was good and was almost a little much when combined with the ribs.  They're ok.  I didn't like the beans.  They're in tomato or something and a little pasty.  Not my taste.  I liked the place and the service was excellent.

fBsUdp_qsfk2C9EdEMJ6Wg.text: DELICIOUS! Stopped in here for our southern barbecue fix & we were not disappointed.  Everything we ate was fantastic & my husband claims this is the best barbecue he's ever eaten.  What a fantastic treat!

2huyhbIKepRW2oOsx4KuqQ.text: One of the best places in Charlotte to get BBQ.  Love the hush puppies.  Because it's so popular, there is usually a wait, and parking is a beast.  However, those are minor issues for the awesome food!

7Vh7qlrQfQenSko2M4wkpQ.text: I recommend the nachos with brisket and burnt ends! The hushpuppies, slaw & beans were in point as well. The service was friendly & helpful. Great beer selection too. Went 2x within 24hrs it was so good! I don't recommend their bloody marys or the pimento cheese fries, we has them plain & my daughter (who LOVES cheese) hated them too.

xW01I07CdZauYKzoKdNBrw.text: If visiting Charlotte, it's a for sure place to eat. Awesome food!! Great service!!! Definitely try the jalapeno appetizer (not to spicy). The ribs with the red sauce and the baked beans were amazing!! I can't wait to go back!!!

RlQL89MRn775DNdGcQ2Fmg.text: Best BBQ in Charlotte...maybe even in all of NC.  Fantastic food, great atmosphere.  I recommend the pulled or half chicken.  Try to get there early on weekends, as it gets crowded very very fast.  Came back in February 2017 and tried the craft cocktails.  Very Very Good!  I recommend the brambler drink.  Excellently made and a good amount of alcohol.

Vo9BZQSQAPTq9cd_p3TQ_g.text: Lunch, 6/2/14, seated immediately, friendly and knowledgeable hostess. I am an Eastern Style NC aficionado, having eaten it all my life. Others at the table did not have this bias. [g]  Of the items I tried, I'll make comment. Ice tea rather bitter and watery, $2.00. Tasting the sauces -- 5 of them -- was great. I don't know if this is offered to every new customer but it should be. The one with the Habernero was my favorite and really well balanced. The Eastern style sauce was good, actually very good, but just a tiny bit on the sweet side (as Bob Garner said). But seriously, ask for the sauce tasting if you don't get it; they arrive steaming hot.  Stars of the show: The fatty brisket. You must request it well marbled, and it beats anything I ever had in two driving trips across Texas. Next in line would be the ribs. Request them without sauce and use the sauce tray you earlier requested. They were moist, tender, and not too much char. Third star was the sausage. It's a rather sophisticated blend with a natural casing; they don't grind it there but they smoke it there.  The hush puppies are fine, though probably started out as a mix. On this day, the macaroni and cheese was just too dry and one dimensional; I would not order it again. The collards were great, without as much grease as my grandma used.  I do not recommend the fine chopped pork. The flavor is not quite there and the chop is too fine for my taste, but I've met old barbeque masters who prefer it that way. The vinegar/pepper sauce wakes it up for sure. I asked about banana pudding and was told that they use the old time method with Nilla Vanilla Wafers; that's something to try next time.

LaQ-SLoQzNupsxLnl_KYQQ.text: Even though it was a Friday night when my friend and I went yesterday, we only had to wait about 10 minutes.  They have parking too, which is a huge plus for me!  I had the sausage, macaroni and cheese, and sweet potato fries.  It was a large portion for the price.  The sausage wasn't listed as a combo plate, just as a meat for the 4 meat combo, but I was able to order it anyway.  She had the macaroni and cheese, with added brisket, and ate every bite.  The bacon wrapped jalapenos had seeds removed, which I liked, since spicy food is not my favorite.

YLKfT9DLTCXV4kE6Y4Lpfg.text: So glad I finally made it out to midwood smokehouse. Food is incredible; I took our server's recommendation of the brisket and could not have been more impressed! The sides held up to the brisket too. I went with the mac&cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos. I can't wait for my next visit.  Service was great; friendly and attentive.   Parking can be difficult, but there is a decent number of spots down the street.

hxTzYxE0NbHJb1Mam49z7g.text: Finally had a chance to check this place out after hearing so much about it. And it always looks busy, so it must be good right? Right!  The place is very casual, but service with a smile and good BBQ!!! Better than Mac's Speed Shop, I thought. But, I'm not a BBQ snob... I just know good food :)  We tried the brisket tacos, sausage, chicken... sausage was YUM and a large is more than enough for 2 to share.  Sweet tea is VERY sweet, even with 1/2 and 1/2.  Overall, price, location and service was great.   Wear your baggy pants ;)

EjO033P-u3XtqxYu7B5BZw.text: Great barbecue!!! Bacon wrapped jalapeno's are awesome! Great brisket! Lots of good beer too!

mcIYsEHuNzOOo-HaNcuKZw.text: Midwood Smokehouse claims to be Eastern NC Style Barbeque. I know not. I had their Barbeque Sandwich, this evening and was not impressed. Though it was my first visit, I was expecting, at least a mediocre sandwich, at best. What I first discovered, was a bread sandwich, with a small amount of pork barbeque, atop a 4" bun. The barbeque tasted less than mediocre.  True Eastern NC Barbeque is from the WHOLE HOG, not from butts and/or shoulders. I don't mind paying $8 for a great sandwich; but one that was so disappointing as this one was, I wouldn't pay $4 for it. Also, the crinkle-cut fries were cold. You'd think that for $8, they'd cut fresh taters and fry them. I suggest doing your homework about NC Style Barbeque. Seasoned Apple-Cider Vinegar is used and it's Chopped.

eiX_5r86UDOoNDbKmWTrwQ.text: They serve pretty tasty Southern BBQ. Our party had ribs, brisket, pulled pork, and various items from the children's menu.   There was not a complaint amongst us. The service was excellent and timely.

Uz3P-9JS43RaswztGNUCLw.text: 2 Words:  No Brisket :(  They literally ran out if brisket when we ordered it.  A) That means it's awesome.  B) I need to get here earlier next time.  Starters we had fried Mac n cheese with salsa and smoked sausage.  It was the happy hour special.  We also had the bacon wrapped jalapenos (amazing).  For my entree I had a half rack of ribs and more Mac n cheese.  (See photos) p.s.  Great beer selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Mac n cheese with salsa and smoked sausage.  Bacon wrapped jalapeños.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half rack of ribs and Mac n cheese.

8hGJCvPB25NSZmXRvh2Y1g.text: Great experience! I had the Carolina pork, bacon wrapped jalapenos, and smoked veggies. I didn't care for the veggies because they were a little bland, so I got the collard greens instead and they were amazing. We also had the BBQ queso which I added brisket, jalapenos, and barbecue sauce to and it was awesome. The food was delicious and our server Jessica took great care of us. I told her I like sauces and she brought me every single sauce the place has to offer and packed them all to go. I'll definitely be back!

z6nsIPyt_oT5UZHvF85Ptw.text: I was at first pleased with this place until I got sick from the food. I had the Briskit, which is supposed to be their best item. I am not one to get sick easily from food and when I do it is from very bad food. I know this place is popular and a lot of people seem to love it but to each his own. On top of the food being bad, I felt the service was horrible. It took 10 minutes for our server to acknowledge us and take a drink order. I mentioned that the soda was flat. My server looked at me with an annoyed facial expression like I was wrong. She asked if I wanted anything else and I said no and asked if it could just be changed. Apparently it was too much work to change the soda.  I noticed a girl was getting sick at her table so now I'm wondering if she got sick from the food too. I did call the restaurant tonight and the lady I spoke to was nice but didn't seem to acknowledge the seriousness of the food causing a customer to get sick. She said I may have gotten a bug from somewhere else. The sickness I am feeling is definitely from their food. I don't think anything will be done about this and that really bothers me because this is a serious issue.  I unfortunately will not be returning there and again, I won't be surprised if nothing is done about this

uFYKxYA_gYFp8fzY9zwq3w.text: So I have heard the buzz and had friends already go, so I had to try it too.  This place is great - I love the smokey smell and the bar area was cool. I had the large Carolina BBQ plate and you could taste the smokey flavor - Yum! I also had the mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos - YUM!   This is my new favorite place, and on my way out, did I notice an upstairs deck for those nice summer nights? I think so!

fb-BILq45bVz2jMSEeACfA.text: Who has two thumbs and ate waaaaaaaaay too much barbeque?  This girl.  But that is because it was super delicious. You want ribs? They got 'em beef and pork, half and full racks. Pulled pork? Check. Half chicken? Check. Sausages? Check. Brisket? Technically not check tonight but its opening weekend, cut them some slack. And all of it comes with one (or more if you ask) of their 3 delicious sauces: the tomato-y Midwood house sauce, the vinegar based NC sauce or the mustard based SC sauce.  We split the BBQ Queso dip, which was out of this world. The smoked flavor of the meat went great with the ooey, gooey cheese. I got the small pulled pork plate which comes with NC sauce, one side, hushpuppies and pickled onions. The meat was great. I had to literally smoosh my napkin in my food to stop from picking once i was full. The collard greens I got as my side were cooked within an inch of their life, but thats not uncommon and I guess better than them being tough. They did have meat in them, but our server said they have a veggie friendly section of the menu in the works. The pickled onions were great to cut through the smoky meat flavor. As for the pups, I heartily recommend dipping them in some of the SC sauce.  They have a solid beer menu, on draft, in bottles and in cans.  All the better if you enjoy them outside at one of their picnic table or on the rooftop patio they are redoing.  Midwood Smokehouse is certainly a welcome addition to the Plaza Midwood restaurant scene (especially now that Rib Palace closed), not perfect but lip smacking none the less.

5baJEPNdHXnqquU8Gib6NQ.text: Best BBQ spot in Charlotte! The pork is unbelievably moist and flavorful and the sauces compliment it well. I've been to most of the spots around Charlotte and although there are other good ones, this is definitely my favorite and the one I take friends and family to when they're in town.

OmmrhVYrhBOCJBiX_DA85Q.text: Looking for a new place to eat last Thursday, my team at work and I stumbled upon this new place on Central Avenue. First piece of advice: get there before Noon if you want to find a seat. This place is small and fills up quickly! Parking was a little tricky as well!  Second piece of advice: If there's a wait for a table, grab a bar stool and let Karen take care of you! If she makes cocktails half as good as she makes recommendations and serves food, then she's the best bartender in town! She was funny, accommodating and quick to help us make our choices from the very expansive menu of yummy southern barbeque menu items.  Enough about the atmosphere...let's talk food! We started with the queso. I think it's the first queso I've ever ordered with barbeque. You had your choice of beef or pork. We went with the beef. A great way to start the meal!   One of my friends got the Chicken Salad sandwich with sweet potato fries. The sandwich was so large, she took half home for a great dinner. My other friend got the beef brisket. She fancies herself a brisket expert and she gave this two greasy thumbs up! Her side of choice was the mac-n-cheese which she said tasted like a cheese dream!  Everything looked so good, I had to just close my eyes and point. I got the pork sandwich with a side of creamed corn. The corn was gone quickly because it was sweet and tasty with a bite of peppery that would slip up on you at the end of each bite. As I didn't want to make a total fool of myself by drinking the creamy goodness, my friend offered me one of her hushpuppies which I baptized in the creamed corn cup in the name of the Beef, and the Pork and the Chicken!   We got dessert to go and snuck into my office at 3 p.m. to delight in the Pecan Cobbler and Banana Pudding. The cobbler was yummy, a little like Derby Pie if you're familiar with that. I'm not that big of a fan of Banana Pudding, but this was probably the best I've ever eaten. A large dose of vanilla made this less on the banana side and more just yummy pudding, but I didn't complain and the three of us had enough dessert to taste test on two different occasions.   The only complaint I have about Midwood Smokehouse? That it's way too small and too far away from my house in South Charlotte! I hope they expand soon and in my direction!

WUAxHQ2jm1WZcp-Tw3L5Ew.text: Yummy. Sweet sauce is excellent. Ribs meaty and succulent. Mac & cheese is great as well. Go now!

CM1vW2eC43HYmfVX2Kl5KA.text: Stopped here based on yelp recommendations - it did not disappoint. We had the four meat sampler. Everything we tasted was excellent. The brisket and chicken stood out. The chopped pork was solid. The pork ribs were good, but I would not hesitate to choose something else next time.   Arguably the part of the meal was the pecan cobbler. Amazing.   Solid bbq joint, would not hesitate to drop by again when in town. Highly recommended.

ydAORhWyJsA-NJ_V_L9iZg.text: I would say over all our lunch experience was just was okay.  Midwood Smokehouse smells great, but you leave smelling like smoked meat all day.  Service was outstanding--and that is a big plus for us.   The food was pretty good/okay, certainly not what I expected.  I had the  BBQ sandwich, it was nothing special.  you can certainly find better BBQ in Charlotte -- no matter your "style" preference.   As a side, I had the bacon wrapped jalapenos,  definitely the highlight of my Midwood Smokehouse experience.  My husband had the fried bologna sandwich with the smoked veggies.  The smoked veggies had no taste of veggies and only tasted of smoke.  He was not a fan of his sandwich, because the cheese overtook the bologna.    The Midwood Smokehouse has fixed alot of the problems the former tenant had in regards to usage of space. The bar is no longer awkward and the set up is very spacious.   I would go back, but will wait a while for them to come into their own.  Maybe with a little time this place can be another great eatery in Plaza-Midwood.

DClcXanMxCNWTZqDU5VtQg.text: best bbq in charlotte..... bacon wrapped jalepenos were just alright though. bacon seemed a little on the chewy side, possibly just a preference. hushpuppies awesome. baked beans awesome. also, they have great ice.   service was wonderful, friendly, energetic

XwQW7ZpjAI62vV260NgoDQ.text: One of the best BBQ sandwiches I've had in town. Their drinks are meh but appetizers are green light as well. Service was fast and our server was very friendly

RRBlG9mnmLCTlYqzqCFOLA.text: Oh yummy! I went here with a friend recently, and not only was the service SPECTACULAR, but the food was incredible. I really enjoyed the bacon wrapped jalapenos and the brisket sandwich! Hooray! The meat was tender, juicy, and super flavorful. There are many items on the menu that I want to try...but alas...my calorie counter won't let me try everything at once. So, I guess I'll just have to go back ;)

LLD0XZWp9TOm4h3YkcDTVg.text: I was super excited about this place finally opening. I saw it in the works on my drive home every single day. We tried it out only a few days after it had opened. It wasn't packed by it was definitely a good kind of busy for a Monday night. I was really really excited about the cheese stuffed jalapenos wrapped with bacon (which were EXCELLENT) but what topped the cake for our meal were the pimento cheese fries with bbq brisket on top. SOOOOO gooooood. I've been craving some ever since I left! Between the two of us we got sloppy joes, a simple bbq sandwich and creamed corn. Everything was so tasty. The only reason I give it four stars was because it was a little pricy for the BBQ plates but our sandwiches and apps were decently priced. And I can't wait till they open up their balcony on top!  The service was excellent as well. Our server really knew what she was talking about and she was very quick and helpful.

PfZceSxQhTMHCScj7Kp90A.text: When we want bbque we go to the mid wood smokehouse.  Great ribs, brisket and sausage.  They smoke their own meat have great beer on tap.  Great meal and the desserts are excellent to with their pecan pie.  They opened another smokehouse in Ballantyne, but it is not as good as the Midwood original location.

_lgrmxlUQrVFmy6aUhEZtA.text: Great place for meat person like me!!! Highly recommend Bacon wrapped jalapenos and smoke wing for appetizer and combo for two!! Be there early if it's weekend night I went there saturday night and waited for half an hour.

OaAlEeMMlIb67J8GAbAmqw.text: I visited Midwood to help settle a bet between friends on what is better... Macs or Midwood. I will start this review by saying that I tend to prefer NC vinegar-based BBQ. However, arguably my favorite part of BBQ is the delicious sides, yum! This is were Midwood let me down. While the beans were very good, the mac and cheese was dry and congealed (not very appetizing at all). We also tried the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapeno peppers. These were good, but nothing too special. We tried the Carolina Pork and the Burnt Ends. I was not a fan of the sauce on the Burnt Ends. The pork was good, we tried all the sauces and they were decent, but they were a little stingy on them. I love sauce and am use to having a squirt bottle full of sauce. Overall it was ok, but I definitely prefer Macs or 521.

T163qpZFhG69FVWw6bVihQ.text: As a resident on Plaza-Midwood, this place must be in the top 3 of my favorites.  It gets crowded very quickly, especially on the weekends.  I am a huge BBQ fan and I have made the switch from my previous preference tomato based sauces to now a vinegar based sauce.  I do, however, from time to time get the habanero BBQ sauce which is awesome and has a nice kick!  The brisket is starting to become a favorite of mine but you definitely cannot go wrong with their pulled pork.  I am a sucker for the queso app with a little meat mixed in.  PBR is very cheap and I am all about it at this place.  Parking is scarce but you can definitely find a place across the street and across from the new apartments.  I usually get a sneaky take out when my wife works late but that is all screwed up since she will see this.  Midwood Smokehouse is a must go to spot if you are in the area and want some good BBQ.  Awesome!

oMPp5k5l-b5IcBmqxIpG-Q.text: This place is SO good. Mac's no longer is on my list.  For BBQ and an atmosphere, come here.    First, the prices are better than Mac's, WAY better.  And you get just as much food.  Plus, the food was actually better in my opinion.    Being raised on the NC Coast, GOOD eastern bbq is hard to find if at all in CLT,  but they have it and it's great.  The service was great and the food is really good. We went on a busy Saturday night and our plates came out quickly. Mac & Cheese, Brisket and the Banana Pudding were the top-hitters for me that night.

cYz0Qwe-ElKohPWyjeqnag.text: This joint is located in Plaza Midwood and I think is very good! I've gotten the brisket, pulled pork, and mac and cheese which were all excellent.

64PUkG1Q8ls4W4eQa1qNsw.text: When we lived in Atlanta I was ob-SESSED with Fox Bros BBQ.  Those guys set the bar immeasurably high.  Now unfortunately at this point in my life I can no longer eat beef or pork without suffering for the following 24 hours.  That being said, I still love going to BBQ restaurants for everything else on the menu.  Midwood Smokehouse has me covered with their turkey plate, salmon sammie, grilled cheese, any of the side dishes...all so good!!  And to go with it they usually (always?) have a decent beer on special for $3/pint.  Midwood is quickly becoming my go-to BBQ in Charlotte.

lkMosAK3-BYXV9LSUpPGGQ.text: The belly was so happy after this grub! I love the Carolina style BBQ with the vinegar flavors.  I tried the sampler and split it with my husband.  We tried the beef brisket, the sausage, the pulled pork, and the chicken.  My favorite was the pulled pork.  The chicken had a mayo looking dressing which I was not feeling so I recommend doubling on the pulled pork because you get 4 meat options on the sampler.  the sampler also includes 2 side orders.  We selected the collard greens and the BBQ beans both excellent!  Seriously love me some Carolina BBQ!!!  Be prepared to wait in line here...it's worth it.

z3b32aP-K56G_KBxhgwnMA.text: I love places like this. Mac's has always been my go to for bbq and because it's a cool atmosphere, but Midwood may have just taken the #1 spot. I will definitely be coming back here!

q0rD4NNiiVwCJzwaRUpObA.text: Our first NC BBQ place in Charlotte on family vacation to the area & it was absolutely worth the drive & price.  Good is super yummy & way more than enough to eat - so come hungry!!!  Mac n cheese and hush puppies are delicious.  Meat is sooooooo tasty & love the sauces.  Should we come back (or move) - this will def be a must visit again type of place.
