photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Full rack &amp; 2 sides...couldn&#39;t finish half of it being super hungry.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork - super yum
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Well fed combo of 4 proteins and 2 sides.  Mac n cheese is to die for.  Hush puppies are super yummy.  And meat is amazing!!!

4gsM7QoYe4Fyz52sW3LS3g.text: Great service and good salad options w/ and w/out meat (try the smoked salmon- it's delicious!). Definitely a long wait on the weekends so join the wait list online before you arrive.

X4qefundAlFPEK2p3YzEoA.text: Carolina ribs in North Carolina? Woohoo! That was my thought when Grant L brought me to Midwood Smokehouse.   Instead of Carolina, I ended up getting their special Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs with Midwood signature sauce on the side. I'm sure someone can tell me the difference with Carolina ribs. My favorite ribs are Memphis style dry rub but this wasn't it. Still, it was pretty close and the Saint Louis half rack was pretty darn good.  The hushpuppies were delicious and the collard greens surprisingly tasty and not overcooked or overly salty like 75% of Southern restaurants.   Our order took awhile to get to our table but our waitress was friendly. NoDa local brew while waiting was a big plus. Watching the World Series Champion San Francisco Giants beating the Kansas City Royals on TV was an even bigger plus!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs

l1jgIQ-uXeLp5ceFVEFwng.text: Wait staff is on point. Food is delicious  Obama ate here and he had my vote so that's two thumbs up for this place  meat is good but the Mac and cheese so damn good!

XWgCXPb9xYIJiASBCqcMLA.text: We'd wanted to try North Carolina style BBQ for a long time since we moved to the area. I knew this place from my co-worker and finally made it on Saturday lunch. It was packed, but we were seated right away since just two of us. First time here I could say that I was impressed with their food and services.  When you walk in, it is very cool and clean atmosphere. Good for family and friends. Staffs were super friendly and attentive. They kept checking on us.   Their menu is on point. You can also find that they have a lot of selection of beer. My fiance ordered the combo platter: the Pig out! You can choose 4 out of 5 kind of meat you want and 2 sides. It came out with a huge portion and good for 2-4 people! They have 2 different BBQ sauces; tomato based and vinegar based. Since we are from Texas, we never liked vinegar based. But at this place, we said yes!!I ordered salmon sammie. It was good but not the best. We loved their bacon wrapped jalapeno! The best we've ever had. Not too much cream cheese it's what we like. For the sides, we loved sweet potato fries and hush puppies. They were just delicious.   There are plenty of parking spots in the back of the restaurant. We'd love to come back again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Sammie
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The combo @$24. Perfect size for 2 people!!

6Tm4R8CRZz3sYl3ZxuaM3g.text: Amazing fatty brisket and baked beans. Skip the burnt ends. Service was phenomenal.  If I could go back, I would:  Uber, drink a cocktail, get to go containers of fatty brisket, and some t-shirts.

y2vbvtZlVtmwUxMUDLYIkQ.text: Really good food here!  Well worth the wait on a weekend.  I enjoy the outdoor area where it's a little quieter.  The service has always been attentive.

YY49VND9zdcNAhh7lpE0DA.text: I came here for dinner with family and we ordered the Queso with Pork, it was very delicious we ordered the small and it was plenty for the 6 of us. I ordered the well fed and had the ribs, chopped pork, pulled chicken and sausage. Everything was delicious! The Midwood original BBQ sauce was the best. The Mac and cheese was creamy, cheesy and sinful, the hush puppies were crunchy, savory and golden brown. My sister got the nachos and they had ample Amounts of smoked chicken, lots of Queso and plenty of fixins. We had the banana pudding for dessert and it was pleasantly sweet, creamy, perfect banana flavor and just enough for everyone. 4 stars only took one star off for the Cole slaw, it was not as sweet or Tangy as I would have liked.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bread Pudding
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled chicken
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Well fed

dI0Q8j6M3_bH3V5Qfy0xCw.text: Excellent bbq place even for someone who knows a bbq place in s Lake Tahoe. Good job y'all.

nFh-5sX-QCJ5SEhDK7F74Q.text: Great BBQ feast with tremendous sauce and great service.

fK82afUD2zBxRAJcu9Y-ug.text: The best Midwood in Charlotte ! Always good food and great service even when you have a wait !!! Had a bad experience at the Ballantyne location but didn't stop me from going to my fav central location !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

UXEYLsFh63SM12Jb8md3Jg.text: Coming to Charlotte on business and being a huge fan of BBQ, I read a number of good reviews of Midwood so wanted to check it out myself.  While Charlotte and the vinegar based sauce is not my favorite, I still enjoyed my lunch at Midwood.  I had the pork platter which was really good.  The meat is tender and the portion is very large.  The hush puppies are absolutely excellent and one of the favorite parts of the meal.  I also had the mac and cheese which I would rate as average but still enjoyable.  On top of that, as a midwesterner I also enjoyed a nice large sweet tea!  Really nice atmosphere and room to sit at the bar if you are eating alone such as myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork platter with excellent hush puppies and mac &amp; cheese.

2s1uIVLAeuotgLKB91zVPg.text: Never fails with the Midwood chopped salad! Open late so always our go-to for takeout!! The large makes two meals for me so I always get extra green goddess dressing! So delicious!

ZjQOclsOkFYGn92uTIJ5MA.text: I had higher hopes for Midwood after searching far and wide on Yelp for bbq in Charlotte while driving down to Atlanta. The menu is large and boasts several dishes and sides. My friends ordered ribs, pulled pork sandwich, hush puppies and I ordered the pimento fries with pulled pork on to[. Skip the pimento fries because they're basically crinkle fries with toppings. Head dive into any bbq on the menu and wash it down with a whiskey flight or a beer from the beer list. Serving sizes are no joke here so order responsibly.

KkzqSy8shE0xzvUhRs1NiQ.text: Enjoyed it very much! One of my favorite bbqs in town!  I had been meaning to eat at this place sooner, but every time I would drive by, there was a ton of people outside waiting to get in or no place to park. Then I saw on TV that Obama and Hilary Clinton had stopped in so I knew then I had to check it out! So we headed there at about 5pm on a Saturday.   I had the dry rub ribs with sweet potato fries and a side of sliced brisket. He had the pulled pork with a side of burned ends. We specifically asked for side of just meat because we didn't want to make another full plate that came with more side items like fries, etc. So this is the easiest way if you want to sample the different types of meats they offer. Also, it wasn't expensive to add this on (something like $5 each).   I thought the price was excellent for what you got. The dry rub ribs were some of the meatiest and tastiest I ever had in Charlotte. I am giving this place 4 stars and not 5 because of the crowds, limited parking, and mediocre decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dry rub ribs with sweet potato fries and a side of brisket. He had the pulled pork with side of burnt ends

FEiwdroNR8aMpJLIMjXeww.text: Fantastic BBQ.  Legit NC style.  I know.  I'm a big man who eats BBQ all over this great land.  The service is fast and friendly.  Molly is the best of them all!!  Come show these people some love!

XQ3glNxWwU2205aN25qTdA.text: This place is still good and the service never disappoints but the food is overly salted, in my opinion to entice you to drink more beer and booze. When you have a quality product and there's plenty of sauce and sauces on the table, why would you need to add so much salt? I'm too young for my kidneys to shrivel up and stop working. Bring me more water, please.

L8AMdgQHiEfVbyte-8wFZQ.text: I had a good salad and my husband had the brisket along with creamed corn. I liked the hush puppies! I also ordered the banana pudding. The picture of The SMALL salad shows that it's really not that small!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Liked my SMALL salad-very filling

CTOT1Ive8aevps3LnXm-Zg.text: My husband and I ate dinner at Midwood Smokehouse at 1401 Central.  We had just arrived in the south and wanted a regional meal.  This was IT.  My husband had the BBQ ribs and smiled the whole time he was eating them.  He said they were the best ribs he's ever had (and he orders them a lot).  I had to try the brisket burnt ends and they were wonderful.  I cook brisket at home, but can never get it to be this tender.  We know hushpuppies have calories, but they are also irresistible.  Our waiter was so friendly and the host came over to talk to us, too.  We felt like we were guests in their home and their enthusiasm for the restaurant shows why it is such a wonderful experience to eat there.

MDtL4jA4l4pN_97OGgNX9A.text: We went here last night after seeing the reviews and not having success in finding a good local bbq restaurant - we have tried quite a few!  We arrived and it was packed.  We were told 30 minutes, but it ended up being 5 minutes to wait, we will take that! It doesn't look like there are many tables, I can see this place being very busy in the summer.  Because it is small, it gets loud easily.  When you walk in you immediately notice the smell - and start drooling! Good thing it was only a 5 minute wait.  Kevin and I had the platter, picked 4 meats: shredded chicken, pork, turkey, and ribs.  Sides were mac and cheese and stuffed jalapenos wrapped in bacon.  Turkey: just okay.  Would not go for this again though.  Shredded chicken: Good flavor, but did not stick out in my memory like the remaining meats.  Ribs: the meat fell off so easily and had an awesome smokey flavor! A++ ribs!  Pork: the smokey flavor and whatever seasoning they have on the pork is outstanding!!  I'm drooling just thinking about it again.  A+++++, the best pork ever!  They give you sauces to go with the pork.  They are just okay - they have mustard based, tomato based, and vinegar based sauces, the first two being my favorite.  I didn't really use them, not because they were okay, but because the pork was just so good, I didn't want to mess with the flavor!  Sides, both excellent.  Mac and cheese was a good homestyle kind and cheesy!  The jalapenos were something I've never had, so bad for you, but yet so good!  Service was outstanding.  We were greeted and welcomed by our server quickly.  He never let our drinks get low and was very helpful - said if we didn't like something he would find us something to like! Wanted us to have a great experience, and we did.  Love this place and will be back soon for more pork!

Bsw0z7ymnWBj--8ZiJg_gg.text: This place had a lot of hype coming in and was able to live up to it. I was really craving BBQ or tacos so I decided to combine the two. While these were good I should have stuck with just the BBQ. I had the brisket tacos and the meat was excellent. By the end I was just eating the meat. Beer selection, which is a must for anywhere I eat, was great. I would recommend this place.

gAfIr1wrW97Tb28ufrru_A.text: Love their bbq, whether pulled pork, chicken, or brisket they are outstanding at bbq meat! I also like the el fuego & chicken tacos when I am feeling not as hungry. The sweet potato fries are delicious. And I eat the roast veggies when I'm being healthy usually. They have a good take on the Moscow mule cocktail and their margaritas that have old bay on the glass with salt. Sort of a salty sweet smoky pairing for margaritas.

QKAucHmcpRlWrm_1XlxCsg.text: Amazing wings!  One of the best wings I've had.  Service is great!  Food was all good including the salad.  The ribs were very good and moist.

nOACV5NIo5lDep_bRViLTQ.text: Yes indeed, this joint was on point!! From the young, fun and courteous hostess, to the bar keep, this establishment knows how to take care of it's patrons.  I must admit that their smoked bacon wrapped jalapenos were tasty, but lacking any type of heat. Our waitress (Sheena/Sherra) said that too many customers complained that they were too hot, so they now remove all the seeds...booo!  Moving on, our meal was "SLAP YOUR MOMMA" delicious. Their grilled veggies were perfect, the chopped salad with green goddess dressing was heavenly and the rack of ribs was tasty as all get out! They offer up 3 types of sauce, house, mustard and a fiery jalapeno, I   tried each and all had their own goodness, but the jalapeno was my favorite.  Finished out this great meal with an amazingly delicious pecan cobbler ala mode that sent my taste buds into the stratosphere!

eYQl8yWaHWhUWihkZWWm4g.text: My family and I stopped in for lunch on our last day in Charlotte, all based on the reviews here on yelp. They did not disappoint.  The meat doesn't need any sauce, but the different types all tasted so delicious we used them anyway. My daughter is vegetarian, and she even enjoyed her hearty grilled cheese with broccoli in it. AND dessert was phenomenal. We had the Pecan Cobbler with ice cream. It was large enough for 4 of us to share. I literally closed my eyes and hugged myself when I took a bite!  Service is great. Food is amazing. Music is nice. Atmosphere is fun.  This place is a must!

EQ3NGlobda3W75TePEExiQ.text: Stopped here as we were driving thru town and it was fantastic!  Drew, our server, was extremely knowledgeable and friendly.  They have an extensive bar menu - and showcase local as well.  They are a True smokehouse and the food was delicious!

bWvbfXZaFM4EvilyH34qdA.text: This is my first review and I was so impressed I had to.. I travel for a living and that travel takes me to all of the BBQ regions in our country. My company home office is in Kansas City, I have been all over Texas, travel to Memphis a good bit, and Lexington is right up the road... so I have been to the best all these areas have to offer. Milwood is different than all of those in a really good way! Prob borrow a little from those regions, and the result is their own thing going on.   I will just say you can tell someone has smoked a LOT of meats to get it this right. Most other BBQ places has something over-powering going on.. Either the smoke, the rub, the bbq sauce, but here it is such a good mix. That's why I say someone has smoked a lot of meats because no one gets that lucky lol. The ribs and chicken I tried were both smoked perfectly. The BBQ slaw was the best I have ever had! I do my own sauce at home and I will say one of the hardest things to do is to get the sweet vs sour just right, but they do here! I just appreciate something done right and they do smoking right hereI will be back!   Curt

9KwxXFKhjaOTGm-3JS4faw.text: Hands down best food and best service in Charlotte! Every time I eat at this place my facial hair grows a little more every time, my voice gets deeper, and I suddenly get the urge to fight bears and eat brass. This place just makes a man out of you.

KuBH3gzm3ra2QHcuTPDJ3A.text: Smoked salmon is super tasty!  I sided it with the veggies which were equally as good.  And the hush puppies?!?! YUMMY!!  The service was really good.  They get very busy around mealtime so plan on a little wait.  Well worth the wait!  Good selection of local beers too.

g7CLck08dJtGXm1Lg7fYXA.text: Ordered a St. Louis 1/2 rack with creamed corn.  The ribs were wet with a mild red sauce, hush pups were included.  The creamed corn was peppery goodness and the ribs were cut from a slim pig (not thickly covered in meat, they serve you more though to compensate), the hush pups were,... Wait for it... Meh.   The wait staff was busy and forgot butter for the pups, silverware for the creamed corn and largely ignored me. It could improve.  The sweet tea was excellent. I am a big boy and overall the meal was well portioned.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. They added 4 more hush pups to fill the plate out

fi0kYm5w_ragefetKbkwCw.text: Food was pretty tasty. From previous reviews and recent rank from "BOB" Barbecue in Charlotte, it didn't disappoint.  I ordered the Burnt Ends with Mac N Cheese, hubby got a Pulled Pork sandwich and fries, kids got Grilled Cheese and Apples. I also got a container of Sweet Potatoes fries (I can't turn those away.). Everything was above par for a BBQ joint. Burnt Ends had a lot of sauce on them which made it a little underwhelming.  However,  the Mac n Cheese and Sweet Potatoes Fries made up for it. Grilled Cheese and regular fries were average. Hubby's Pulled Pork sandwich looked amazing. I didn't try it but it looked really tasty.   Only bummer was there's no drink specials on Saturdays. But a bottle of Johnny Appleseed was only $4! We would definitely go back at least for additional drink specials during the week. Plus I need to try the Pulled Pork Sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt Ends and Mac n Cheese. Delicious!

xCg3ZaQgHER0qvyegwL4EQ.text: This adventure of Excited about Eating takes us to the Midwood area of Charlotte to Midwood Smokehouse. This restaurant is tucked into the edge of a building, but it's bigger than it looks.  A Friday lunch was a 10 minute wait, but it probably took that long to snag a parking spot. Although the restaurant was jammed, service was attentive and prompt.  For starters we ordered the Fried Pickles, unique, in that they were sliced length-wise. They were coated in a spicy batter, crispy like I prefer, but I would've enjoyed them more with half the salt.  Since we expected to eat a hefty dinner that night, we shared the BBQ combo which included four meats: pork ribs, sausage, brisket (lean, fatty, combo), and chopped pork. We chose mac and cheese and creamed corn for the two sides.  The combo plate came with three dipping sauces: Midwood Signature (sweet, with just a hint of tang) for the ribs and brisket, Eastern NC Vinegar for the chopped pork, and South Carolina (spicy) Mustard for the sausage. The ribs had a wonderful smoky flavor and fall-off-the-bone meaty goodness, the star of the meats. Dora here, the ribs were finger-licking great, but Ernie's home-smoked ribs are still better. :)  The sausage ranked second, mild with just the right amount of kick. I especially liked the dark bark in both the chopped pork and brisket. Ditto for Dora. And the corn had a firm consistency, not soft or mushy. The spiral pasta had a deep cheesy flavor, but it could've been a tad warmer for my liking.  I would rate this establishment 5 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving outstanding food.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Comb
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Pickles
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside

pfYA_3Gfv7Lq5bvpBu4ZoQ.text: I am a NY native so I am not into BBQ as much as people in the South are, however I love this place.  One of the reasons being you don't have to get something that is covered in BBQ sauce, because even the salads are good.  If you are going to go here, definitely get the burnt tips..  and the prices are great too.  I came here with two other people and I believe our bill was only $35, even though we left stuffed.  The only downside is that this place gets packed so be prepared for a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket Grilled cheese

5oxM97URBkogKvw_HCpAdA.text: This is such a good place.  They smoke their meats on premise and do a great job.  Never had a bad meal.   Pulled Pork, Brisket and the Wings are all good choices.  The Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos are a great start.   Creamed Corn,  Collards and MacNCheese are all great sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small Pulled Pork plate with MacNCheese

U_LOA1h9iavpArciE4kV3A.text: Best BBQ I've had outside of Austin Texas!  I was in Charlotte for business and was eager to experience their BBQ scene.  I was told that I had to try either Midwood or Mac's first.  I chose Midwood which was a good call.  Decor is Texas shabby-chic.  The place was packed from when I entered to when I left about 2 hours later.  Expect a wait unless you choose to sit at the bar, which I did.  But lets move on to the food.  Food is insane.  When I'm in a restaurant that clearly knows their stuff I'll just turn the keys over to my server/bartender and tell them to bring me the drink and meal of their choice.  This was a good call.  Melissa, the bartender took great care of me.  Everything from picking the best IPA in town to letting me sample their burnt ends.  Uniquely great service at an already great restaurant makes this the best BBQ place in CLT.  Brisket was incredible.  It doesn't come served with a slice of white bread like many BBQ buffs might be used to, but I can forgive that slight difference.  Sides were also amazing:  Bacon Wrapped Jalapeno's and Hush Puppies.  Geez... why am I not there right now?  I'm wasting my life...  Small disclaimer, milage may vary with different locations and different meals.  I went to the Ballantyne Midwood a few weeks later for lunch and ordered a pork sandwich and didn't find the meal that impressive.  I chalk this us largely to most BBQ is really about the pure meat, plain and simple and most attempts to dress them up never have the desired effect.  Go there, right now.

e05xPzaEKRje5vhbWy3VhQ.text: This is one of our go-to restaurants. In fact, we eat out A LOT, and we come here more than anywhere else. All the BBQ is good. Maybe it's great. We love this place. Tall Tom is the kindest, best waiter in the world. If you're fortunate enough to get him you'll be spoiled. In fact, you should request Tom when you go. Then you'll enjoy some of the best BBQ in Charlotte (or maybe anywhere?) plus you'll have the best server around. May as well make the whole evening great, right??  Believe it or not, in spite of the fact that the BBQ is great, and we love BBQ, maybe our favorite thing on the menu is the Midwood chopped salad. We usually get it with grilled salmon and balsamic dressing, but seriously, it's so good without the protein that I almost always get it that way now. Go and enjoy!  And don't forget to ask for Tom!  (He's super tall---just so you know you've got the right guy) ;))

DzKkJy6w-HkwIJmLT-hWBQ.text: Couldn't visit the South without have some good southern BBQ!  BF and I visited here because of a recommendation from work.  We came here on a Tuesday night and were seated right away.  This place has a bar area and a restaurant area, and we were seated in the restaurant.  Looks like there is an upstairs and patio too which I guess they open on weekends.  The place was about 3/4 full the whole time we were there.   BF and I shared the "Pig Out" combo platter ($31) where you can choose 4 meats.  We chose ribs, brisket, chicken, and chopped pork.  It comes with their infamous hushpuppies, and we chose mac n cheese, bacon wrapped jalapenos, and Texas toast as our sides.  It also came with 4 different BBQ sauces: South Carolina Mustard, Vinegar, Midwood Signature & Spicy Habanero.  I liked the spicy a lot actually, but it's not even spicy; it has just the right amount of kick.  Signature is the runner up, followed by the vinegar, and finally the mustard, which i didn't care for much.  The food itself was delicious although the chicken was kind of dry.  The sauces went with the meats well, and the Texas Toast was the cherry on top.  I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone whose looking for good Southern BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pig Out feast!

t63J3JCwXKp_whr9IHewpA.text: Midwood is delicious and very casual as bbq should be. The food is always hot and plentiful with plenty of options and variations both flavor and selections alike.  Great kid friendly options with a good price. All in all its my favorite neighborhood bbq joint!

p3lFEDgBuuYzb8qaNJ7pUg.text: When a line for BBQ is out the door, you know its good. The brisket was the perfect blend of lean and fatty meat and smoked to perfection. It was served with a side of hush puppies, and I chose the BBQ cole slaw as my side of choice. I didn't quite get the BBQ flavor from the slaw, but it so pretty tasty none the less. It was a busy night, but our server did a great job of keeping our beverages topped off and bellies full.

DnDYxiNlRcq2iXJCEaAfMw.text: Walked from the stadium for this place. So worth it!!!! Everything is so delicious. Found it on here. We are avid Yelpers when we go out of town anywhere. We are never disappointed. Service  was also great!

8ywsj7DRqUatkWtRQeCRJQ.text: Ate here with a group of 8. Everything was very good, from the appetizers to the drinks and, of course, the bbq. They had some inventive creations as well, including the cheerwine rib tips. A little sweet for my liking, but nice to see a creative rib place. Nice selection of cocktails as well. Good ambiance and also has a large bar area for watching games

mrkL9Mc1ltjeJgZj6Yrgsw.text: Great BBQ and close to my Army Reserve unit. Food is alittle pricey and they have smaller portion sizes but the winning flavor is present.

Nvqa0H83ZVfXFzm54I8jjw.text: Amazing BBQ!! We split a combination platter and got to try their pulled chicken, pulled pork, brisket, and the best ribs I've ever had with sides of creamed corn and delicious Mac and cheese and hush puppies. We tried all four of their BBQ sauces and they were all fantastic, and we topped off our meal with delicious banana pudding. We also had a great waitress while we were there for lunch. This is hands down our favorite barbecue restaurant in Charlotte and we will definitely be going back!

LplsD-HosZCgiMv3gIy3OA.text: Consistently good food and service  Burnt ends are great.

jAxsJ38I-zkPzKaK6QRchA.text: Love midwood smokehouse. We eat there at least once a week, and it is always consistently delicious. The smoked wings are some of the best, and the service is always good.

xYJbIVlEqCFJy31Qnu0qbA.text: Had the brisket for lunch.  I was told it smoked for 16 hours and I believe it! The meat had great flavor and melted in my mouth, no need to saturate it with sauce.  Inside or patio seating available, nice atmosphere and good service.

ObLjYfhOy4X_CHN0YMDImQ.text: It was delicious we tried the combo platter and got it up sized and it was enough to feed two people plus left over for carryout.

TcpKEERfi_f2qDeyuMFXPg.text: We are longtime fans of Midwood Smokehouse. Consistently good food and great cocktails. But I have to give a special compliment to the current waitstaff. Last night we had a great server- funny, efficient, and had some great ordering suggestions (plus, she knew the beer list so well!)- but the server at the table next to us should win some kind of medal. An older, disabled lady was dining alone and had a large number of take out boxes. Her server offered to help by taking the lady's boxes out to her car for her and met her at the door with the car keys. I was really moved. Nice job, Midwood Smokehouse!

XbD0Ley541UNa6ZDNy0yaA.text: Love Midwood! All of the food is great, the environment rocks and the staff is excellent.

a_uXJXtz9z7A-bRA5nuWgQ.text: I had a craving for bbq and due to the strong yelp reviews I decided to give this place a try. I had the El Fuego tacos, hush puppies, mac and cheese, and the house slaw and it was a solid meal. The tacos are very original. I enjoyed to see a different take on a modern classic. The sides and pups were really good. I'll definitely be back to give the rest of the menu a try.

JGKz7qsFh4H5xTbGBuDDdA.text: Just had the Q at the Midwood. Outstanding. As it was my first time I went with the combo platter to sample various meats. Ribs, pork, brisket, and sausage were my choices. All were terrific. Sauces were good but nothing special. The pickled onions were unusual but the perfect change up between the meats. Mac and cheese was exceptional.  I'm stuffed.   I went early, 5:00 PM on a Saturday after reading how packed it gets. Glad I did.  By the time I left a hour and change later it was jammed.   Sat at the bar and had terrific service from Chad the bartender. Thanks Chad.   Bottom line:  I'll be back.  As often as I can.

0PRpAZ74xUy_F-HBykWs3w.text: Atmosphere:    Great outdoor seating!  Price:   Very fare.  Food:   Excellent!  Full of flavor. Pork was yummy! - not fatty at all. Chicken was moist and tender.  Great sauces.  Hushpuppies were perfect size - and not greasy!  BEST baked beans I have EVER had! - extra flavor with the additional spices and peppers.  Portions:    Generous.  Location:   Convenient, yet parking can be tricky.  Service:     Friendly, fast and courteous.

JKHEyrvpSb42PD2Zjo6DQw.text: This place is just AMAZING. The atmosphere is loud and seating is limited. However the food is just great. If you're from NC or SC or even GA you can find some southern cuisine here to put a smile on your face. It's a little pricey in my opinion for this type of food but the portions are large and the flavors impressive.

1_luC9IbnM0fuBA6VZvIfw.text: I heard a lot about this place and Mac's as the place to go for BBQ and I have to say I was pretty impressed. The ribs especially were amazing. My friend and I got the sampler platter with ribs, pulled pork, pulled chicken and brisket. I think we also got sides of Mac and cheese, collard greens and hush puppies. The collard greens were gross but it's also the first time I've tried collard greens so maybe I just don't like them period. Hush puppies were good and Mac and cheese was okay, a little under flavored. But let's talk BBQ! The ribs were by far the best. Next time I come it will definitely be for those. They were well seasoned and very tender. Other BBQ was pretty good. I'd probably say the pulled pork was next best then brisket then chicken. If you've never been before sampler is a nice way to go but if you just want some good food get the ribs!

GDJ16fGqj-LrvJSL-Quafg.text: Very good food. Very slow service. You would think they were cooking the bbq to order

npwW6WMdX-q3jPTCiiWoMw.text: My daughter and I visited this location on a Saturday in September. We had an amazing server, I forgot his name, I believe it was Drew. My daughter and I enjoyed the BBQ Queso with shredded beef brisket, Burnt Ends and a half rack of Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs. Yummy. This was my first time visiting the location, I decided to eat outside but the flies wanted to enjoy my meal too so I had to take it to go but I heated my food up later on and it was yummy :)!

-V7OS5_JJuh0kXldFfYPzw.text: Best smokehouse I have ever been to. The spicy BBQ sauce is so good on their smoked pulled pork sandwich and the Mac n cheese is amazing. Will definitely be back here!

UaGKoZb-8iwFMTuDpqt9Vw.text: My 4th visit for the usually wonderful pulled pork plate. My first dining inside experience. The music choices are good but volume is too loud. I was there for lunch on Thursday and it sounded like Friday Happy Hour.  And the fan speed blows almost any paper off the tables.  My pulled pork was too mushy for me. I know they can do better.   The staff does a very good job.   I will go back based on my earlier visits.

eIwPUhoBAkJWFnrbxUpRgg.text: The best bbq in Charlotte! The platters and stock yard tacos are my favorite! It gets pretty crowded so come early. The service is  pretty good, every time I've been there I've seen the manager walk around and ask people how the service was.

0hWmb2-kw20xvMhYx5A1Lg.text: I've been reading yelp reviews saying this was the best BBQ in Charlotte. I can say they didn't disappoint. We went during a relatively off time I thought, but it was still packed out. We had to wait about 15 minutes to get a table (not bad). I got the pulled port plate which was probably the best I've ever had. Sometimes you get this and it has a lot of fat in it. Not this one. Very lean, very tasty. My wife got the brisket, which was excellent also. We also grabbed the bacon wrapped jalepeno's as a appetizer. These things are amazing. We had fried pickles also, which were good, but those Jalapeno's went first. I would say, at this point, the new standard for BBQ has been set.

VrkB55330yxwmZiSUx_hdg.text: I met a friend here on a Friday night.  Table for two around 8pm.  No wait at all!  We sat inside in one of the big booths.  We were a bit undecided regarding what to order, so ended up getting the sampler.  We chose beef brisket, pulled pork, ribs, and the smoked turkey.  Sides were Carolina slaw and bacon wrapped jalepenos.  Everything was delish!  The jalepenos were AMAZING!!!  My favorite meat was probably the ribs, but the turkey was also great.  They also served the meat platter with 3 different sauce sides.  The classic BBQ was great.  Though my experience was great partly because of the excellent company, I have to say that the food was great, as well as the service.  We took awhile to actually order because we were chatty and our server was patient as can be.  I will be back!

2CewSvBfFxMhHAKi_1rK4w.text: My hunt for the best barbecue in Charlotte has come to an end. I came to Midwood Smokehouse with my wife and the in-laws last weekend, and we were all wowed. We ordered   Right away, I was pleased by the drink and beer selection. There are a lot of local brews available, and there are more than just the usual suspects. As far as the food menu went, it was really, really hard to make a choice. Everything sounds and looks terrific. I went with the burnt ends with hush puppies and mac and cheese, which were all fantastic. My table also had a sampler platter, which included pulled pork, some sides, and some wings. My mother-in-law got a salad; I didn't try it, but she loved it.   I really don't think you can go wrong here. Now that I've tried the BBQ staples, I'm excited to try some of their more inventive options on the menu. There's a lot on the menu to explore, and I'm looking forward to the journey.

Z0fecgLvmu2_VCQiFhP4Pw.text: I've probably been to most of the BBQ places around charlotte that are worth going to.  I would say this place is probably my favorite.  Came here with my family to get an assortment of BBQ choices.   I recommend getting the large platter to share if you want a variety of meat.  I am a brisket kind of guy, so I say this brisket comes up to par with some of the best in Charlotte.  Although its no Texas brisket, i would say this comes just right under Texas' brisket.  Nonetheless, this place is worth trying out.    The larger patter comes with 2 sides and your choice of 4 meats.  I would suggest just trying all they have to offer.  The BBQ pulled pork and sausage is great.  The brisket is amazingly tender and soft.    If you're looking for an appetizer as you wait, i would get the wings.  These wings are pretty decently made with a unique flavor of BBQ.  It isn't your typical type of bbq wings, but its something you must try.  All together i probably spent $60 to feed a party of 6.  We came out stuffed.

0oftWiate6dDNJIOZPeKQw.text: Best Texas style beef brisket and ribs East of Texas besides Judge Roy Bean's in Brentwood,  Tennessee.  Great variety of beers , good bloody Mary's and Atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. St Louis Style Ribs. Yummy
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped jalapeño....Awesome !

WzJpX1pStAATSw6ChLiBmg.text: The food was very good and the service was great. The only negative I can think of was that my beer was a little bit warm. Great atmosphere, and I'll be back again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half rack of ribs with hush puppies and cole slaw

NbJ1_dQA1QLldVUxrOKIFg.text: The hostess was horrible. She didn't pay attention to us and seemed like we were disturbing her by requesting a table. She took our phone number down wrong so we never received our text when our table was ready. Other than the initial poor experience, the food was good. We had a little bit of everything. The ribs and chicken were better than the pulled pork, in my opinion. The pork had a plastic after taste. The neighborhood and atmosphere was nice. I'd probably go back, hut the service was a huge turn off for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

NjpMhEjy_hzpyoRT5GeyjA.text: Great food! Try the beef brisket; it was awesome - great taste; they offer fatty, lean or both. The baked beans and hush puppies were also great; place was packed inside and outside. They also had a good selection of local beers

5ya4ELarYDVuVgg9p7ySvA.text: Really delicious BBQ.  I would highly recommend the burnt ends and the mac and cheese.  I also got the fries as a side but would not recommend those.  Try some of their other sides instead.  Still a solid BBQ place and I would happily go back again!

EQL7EwSGyGy4KSp89HpNjw.text: If you want barbeque, make your way to Midwood Smokehouse. Oh goodness, their draft selection is good, and their custom mixed drinks are great. You must try the Back Porch Tea -- it was superb! A True Southern mixed drink that combined sweet tea (that isn't overly sweet) and Jack Daniels Tennessee whiskey (and muddled lemon).  We (2 of us) ordered the cheese fries topped with brisket and the combo platter of 4 meats and 2 sides (collard greens and bacon wrapped stuffed jalapenos) and that was plenty of food, enough for leftovers that we made into breakfast the next morning.   Absolutely delicious. Oh I can't wait to make my way back here....

WaCWGJh9h8iFn75AU9iVqw.text: We are big fans of Midwood Smokehouse, but a while back they phased out our favorite menu item, the creamed corn.  We were in the restaurant a few months back and expressed our disappointment to the manager, Kristin.  She was extremely nice, and took our feedback.  She also took our number and promised to let us know if the creamed corn was to be released again, even if only for a limited time.  Fast forward to today, months later, and imagine our surprise when we received a text message from Kristin letting us know that Midwood Smokehouse has added creamed corn back to the menu!!!  Regardless of the menu item being back, we were SHOCKED that this manager went out of her way to follow up with us and make sure we were happy, even months later.  You DO NOT see this kind of service anywhere and I can't believe she even remembered this encounter.  We immediately changed our plans for the evening and went in to Midwood for dinner.  Our food and service was great as usual, but the creamed corn was AMAZING.  It is back on the menu with a jalapeno twist and it was out of this world.  We will continue to go visit Midwood Smokehouse and I can't shout loud enough how cool it was to get that text message today... not only because I love the creamed corn, but because I appreciated her taking the time to do that so much.  Kristin deserves a RAISE!!  :)  Thanks so much!

jbqjoFgytTgbnZcBPeyHMg.text: I was in the area for work and had stopped by to try the bbq. Had the combo platter with corn, bacon jalepenos and hush puppies. Very nice atmosphere with outdoor seating and a very friendly staff. I'll be the first to admit that I'm not a big fan of the vinegar based Carolina style bbq. With that said, I thought the bbq here was really good. The brisket and porks ribs were the best. The ribs had a touch of sweetness and all the meats had a decent smoke flavor. The pulled pork was too tangy for me and seemed a bit mushy. Overall worth a stop if you're in town.

FTr8QgPKjEsdVzu3UhtASQ.text: WINNER!  Situated in the Plaza/Midwood neighborhood with a diverse staff and clientele. My husband got the smaller, 4-item combo platter (BBQ chicken, Carolina pork BBQ, brisket & ribs) with creamed corn & BBQ slaw. I got the Carolina BBQ with bacon-wrapped jalapeno poppers. For dessert, we got the banana pudding (oh my yummy) & chocolate-chip bread pudding. The desserts were slow coming out & when the manager realized it, he comped both of them. The place was busy, people constantly arriving & leaving, but nobody waited more than a few minutes (we were sitting near the front door) and ample (& friendly) wait staff helped everything flow smoothly. They get 5 stars for sure. We'll be back for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sorry, forgot to take pics until we were almost done!

dzTfMMGYclPdTZOVVW-S6A.text: Hands down, the best bar-b-que I've eaten in Charlotte. I'm originally from Texas, so I love some good BBQ. However, I'd been relatively disappointed in the BBQ I've had in Charlotte until I came to Midwood. We ordered the pulled pork, chicken, brisket, and burnt ends, collard greens, bacon wrapped jalapenos, and creamed corn. Everything was delicious! I'm a connoisseur of good brisket, and this did not disappoint. I'm excited to go back and try the ribs! Carry on Midwood; I'll be back soon!

s-H8SouckkEVZZY41NlfLw.text: We a had good experience at this popular Charlotte restaurant. After finding a parking space (a challenge in this area), we were seated quickly with a reservation--key on busy nights. Our waitress and servers were attentive and efficient. They were terrific with the two small children in our group. The space is incredibly loud. You may want to sit outside if you want a quieter experience.  One member of party received a drink not to her liking and the staff made not only one but two attempts to get it right. They succeed in satisfying her requirements. The two appetizers we shared, jalapenos wrapped in bacon and barbecue chicken wings, were amazing. The combo platter of ribs, pulled pork, and beef was good, but not outstanding. Though the ribs were tasty. We thoroughly enjoyed the crispy sweet potato fries and crunchy hush puppies. I'd return when I visiting the area again.

8O1GLy0BSj17ev19XK94vw.text: Very nice restaurant. The burnt ends were very flavorful. The baked beans were the best I have ever eaten. The coleslaw was excellent.  My son also loved the beans and the Mac & Cheese.  They had a great selection of microbrewery beers.  The waitstaff was great.  I would definitely eat here again.

PdGnqSoqRe0ojs3iTiZ45g.text: Coming from Central Texas, I miss Texas style BBQ and this comes close!  Sides are delicious, brisket is very good, nice smoky flavor, you can get either fatty or lean.  Sausage was good as well.  Not bad for NC take on Texas barbecue!

id4G52WhHLaXAv-WwFRmQQ.text: This restaurant is a local famous. They serve good BBQ food and beer.   You should order a large plate if hungry because the regular size is more for sampling (about half the size of the large plate)

YEOWj0v8KbzLQxyABMI4dA.text: So much food!!!! OMG.. we went for my sister's b-day and I don't think any of us could move after. Great service, fun staff.. tons of food and yumm-o desserts!

cTu4_jVH0WFzlxT7t9VunA.text: Make this a must stop on the way or while in Charlotte! So so so damn good! From the apps to the combo platter to the out of this world deserts! Stop here do not pass Go! Go directly to Midwood!!!

FZGCNNNC_mLVMHyMl3Zvvw.text: This is by far my favorite BBQ joint in Charlotte. I usually get the sampler (around $20)  that comes with your choice of 4 meats and 2 sides and split that with my wife. Easily enough food for two people ... depending on your appetite you may even come home with leftovers. The bacon-wrapped jalapeno poppers are an absolute must. Easily the highlight of my meal --- also their brisket is on pointttt. A great atmosphere and fun place to come with a small group of friends for dinner.

WIj2w_6ra6bCXfAPOJPu6Q.text: Had high expectations and it sort of met it. It is a hipster place and food quality suffers because of that. Service was quick and friendly. I'd go back again if it wasn't so crowded.

5_t2KnKPtZQF_00i9Uhf5Q.text: Heard so much about this place, but first time visiting. Absolutely loved it! good flavor, nice ambience, and DELICIOUS!! Was packed when I went (not surprised..) and it was late so had to eat small..but looking forward to going again to grub big!

Pbv0ACGofeSN8l0740BXfw.text: Looked up somewhere to eat while visiting Charlotte and this place came up several times in my search. Very lively and fun atmosphere with indoor and outdoor seating. The food was AMAZING!!! We has the Pig Out Combo platter with the ribs, brisket, pulled chicken and sausage. No regrets on any of out decisions! The baked beans were also surprisingly delightful. The service was additionally fantastic! Our server, Melissa, was very helpful and definitely on top of her game, and everyone else who helped us was very sincere and friendly. I wish this place was closer to home because I would come back all the time, but I will definitely be recommending it to everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pig Out combo platter

XnnFQ_X9evbR1txWfldkhg.text: Some of the best barbecue I've ever had. The North Carolina vinegar sauce was perfect, and the smoke on the pork was so flavorful! The sweet potato fries and Mac and cheese and creamed corn were tops, but the hush puppies and cole slaw weren't great.  Good prices, nice atmosphere, cheap beer. Overpriced cocktails and my personal disappointment in my slaw kept me from rating this 5 stars, but I would definitely go back. Great place.

Qy64PFQt2EFovbhkQS5w2A.text: One of the best BBQ we've experienced so far in the Charlotte area.  We lived in the Sanford NC area before moving to FT. Mill SC and had eaten at the Pik & Pig in Carthage NC and their pulled pork and Brisket is phenomenal.   This place is very good and I would definitely recommend it.

NWNDu4qhjwHrUWcWp0fSrA.text: Best BBQ I've had in Charlotte so far. Great service and staff. Got the BBQ platter to share.

tVl0jQqBmJ0wOBjX4vrQ9g.text: This place is ridiculously good.  Best que I've ever had & especially the brisket.  I think they make their own sauces on site--just an assumption.  Even the side items were awesome.

1KTvSXYLtREKTI0iqECZVA.text: OMG the brisket is so good. Midwood has somehow figured out how to smoke. The food we had was very good and the brisket was a highlight for sure. The mac n cheese was also incredible. Local craft beers on tap and all in all a great place for some meat and sides that were very well done.

R6Dus0vKtfgFTOrRRgQOrg.text: Love this place.  I have been here plenty of times for take out, as well as with big friend groups and even two work lunches. This place is really good.   I am not a bbq expert like reviewers claiming they are super pro, I just like it frequently and I am really picky about how it tastes. Midwood serves just the right sauces with everything.  Sauce is basically my favorite part of the meal and these guys nail it. I love getting the hush puppies with the regular bbq sauce, or the thin vinegar nc style sauce with the pork.   And I don't see a lot of people mentioning this, but ... the bbq chicken with the SC style mustard sauce, is probably my #1 favorite. It's so tasty.  Also important: The staff have invariably been courteous and friendly to me, even when I show up 15 minutes before closing to please get a to go sandwitch. They never make me feel like it's the end of the night or anything, I get the same bright cheer I would at 7 pm.   And 1/2 price nc drafts on mondays is pretty much the best. basically this place is great.

0FARjL0eLnO6qR-8FXNn9w.text: Absolutely loved this place. The bacon wrapped jalepenos were amazing! The pulled pork was excellent and the banana pudding was the perfect ending to a great meal. Service was quick and friendly.

9wwlk3ySc0t0NWYZPwAyyg.text: The brisket is the best I've had anywhere. I've been to several well known BBQ spots, but this brisket has them all beat. You also have to try the Jack Daniels cocktails and the bacon wrapped jalapenos!

0L2pnOxN4NLPYABF5gEqaQ.text: Midwood Smokehouse is situated right in the heart of the Plaza-Midwood area surrounded by tons of great places to eat and yet it rises above the rest.  No easy feat.  For one, I had heard stories about this place prior to visiting, about how the food was so good that it was always crowded and you might have to wait to be seated.  Well the first time I went came here with a friend we did in fact end up having to wait about 15 minutes to be seated but I have to say those 15 minutes were very well worth it.  First off, the staff is amazing.  Always friendly and conversational, knowledgable of the menu, and happy to be there.    The shining star meal of the Midwood Smokehouse for me is the Burnt Ends BBQ plate.  These are little cubes of meat made with their in house Fat Tire sauce.  I was really blown away at how great these things tasted the first time I had them.  I ordered a small plate and regretted not getting a large.  Seriously they're that good.  On the side I also decided to try their bacon wrapped jalapeno side as a jalapeno wrapped in bacon was an odd combination that I had never heard of.  These were really good too.  I'll recommend grabbing a side of them with whatever meal you decide to get.  Overall I must say the food at Midwood Smokehouse is top-notch.  Midwood Smokehouse has a sizable menu of draft beers so we decided to have a few.  A good portion of their selection consists of local drafts from right here in NC so I went for the Mother Earth IPA out of my hometown and it was as good as expected.  I can't recommend Midwood Smokehouse enough. It's well worth the wait to get in and I see what all the fuss was about over this place.  Since first trying them in 2013 I've been back several times and it's always a great eating experience.  BBQ is big in the part of NC that I'm from and I have to say Midwood Smokehouse ranks among some of the best in the state.

HG6ClZYrQDRVvqKhF92chA.text: So glad we decided to do carry out! This was my first and only taste of North Carolina que and it was a solid choice. The place was completely packed, even for carry out! I'd recommend ordering online bc it's faster. Only thing is the combo platter wasn't an option so I waited until I got there to order mine and I had to wait a bit. Macaroni was to die for and I loved the spicy bbq. Combo platter was enough to feed 2-3 people so recommend sharing that one :)

OIcPINXg0NA04LGfUhaICw.text: Go to for BBQ. I am from Charlotte and strangely not the biggest fan of BBQ but this is some of my favorite. Their brisket is the perfect balance of fatty and meaty and with great staples like mac and cheese and collards you will not leave hungry.   Also tried their kickin' mule (moscow mule with jalapeno) and it was great!

bhCFLrouFLB5UkSZ_dycaw.text: Brisket here is amazeballs. Love their pickled onions and the bacon wrapped jalapenos. They used to have this brisket chili that was the best chili I've ever had and they took that off the menu. WHY?!  It really made me sad. I'm still sad about it actually.

9sAgf9mo1Sm1wc_sEFkhQw.text: The food is exceptional, but do not come here for healthy food! My favorite things to order are pork burnt ends, ribs and the hot mess burger. It's honestly hard to limit my favorite items to 3 things off the menu! I wish I could remember the name of our server the last time we went, she was one of the best servers we've had (I will add her name if I figure it out)! Being in walking distance of Midwood Smokehouse is extremely dangerous!

khSXx7EZksavq5jqp-SfMA.text: Parking is tricky and be prepared to wait.  It's worth it. Service is superb and the food won't disappoint. If you aren't a big eater there will be enough for a second round the next day.

aLuAVdBycDliml9hS74XNg.text: Can you say heaven wrapped in bacon? How about slap yourself warm pecan cobbler topped with ice cream? The pulled pork was no slouch either. The portions are large, so be willing to share. Despite being busy, the service was fast and efficient.   Even getting there right when they open, there are several of us waiting!

jN1k4lEf9tOk_SrmxRdXWQ.text: Well well well. Being impressed by a bbq joint is though to pull off in Carolina. But Midwood is impressive. I must say their Abiline brisket sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. Wow. Good beer selection and great sides. I have been twice so far and plan to make it a regular. Go try it out.

PBRXghLL-kOUpoaM0LA5Kg.text: Have been to midwood a few times now and have loved the food each time! The service is good and the staff is very friendly. Any place that serves great BBQ and keeps a cold beer in front of me is tops on my list!!

mNRSVft-LwHkSxzQdhbxDA.text: I love this place. The pimento cheese fries are a definite must try as are the smoked wings. I always order the BBQ sandwich and macaroni and cheese. I have yet to even try anything else due to the sheer perfection of these two items. The hubby usually gets a trio of ribs, sausage and burnt ends, its a huge plate with plenty to take home. The baked beans are kind of spicy, but we'll worth the heat. This has quickly become my favorite BBQ place in Charlotte. If you love good BBQ, midwood is a don't miss.

lR1cERqraF5VkilLr3bDEQ.text: My first bbq in North Carolina and it didn't disappoint.  The brisket was a bit dry, which has been an unfortunate trend I've noticed, so I will stick to pulled pork and ribs from now on.  The pulled pork was fantastic and the sides (hush puppies and beans) were excellent.

MPWgM-LqqhSJPEvp720qQQ.text: The service & the food was Amazing!!! It was Tater Tuesday & Tito's Tuesday food & drink specials!!! We loved everything especially the staff!!!

7tLIW97zJvtvVP1ev0iqpw.text: (3.7/5) The brisket is a must. I don't care if you get it in a salad, between a grilled cheese, as a side, or on a plate like how I did. It's tender, delicious, and slow-cooked to perfection. I ordered the beef brisket plate (both lean and fatty) with hush puppies, pickled onions, and bacon-wrapped jalapenos as a side. Unfortunately, most of the accompaniments besides the pickled onions were mediocre, not amazing. Do not get the mac and cheese--my friend got it and I tasted it. It was grainy like dry finely grated cheese and not very saucy.   Service was great. He regularly checked up on us and had great energy. We didn't have a wait long for a large group dinner at 7pm on a weekday. Compared to Mac's Speed Shop, I definitely prefer Mac's for an overall dining experience (sides were better, servings were larger, wait was much longer too) but like I said, the brisket here definitely deserves a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drinks deals

LRbaqMY38R88Hr_F3ozIPg.text: An understated outpost of 'cue on Central Ave., Midwood lacks many of the typical sign posts I look for when in search of great barbecue (i.e. storefront art featuring chef's hat and apron clad pigs gleefully cooking bacon).  If you look closely enough, you'll notice that the pig on the sign is smiling.  Once inside however, you instantly know you're on to something.  The bustling dining room offers tightly packed tables with plenty of seating, but I opted for a seat at the bar which offers a little more elbow room.  The stout bar stools offer support should you imbibe too much brew, or be overcome by "the itis."  I can only speak for the pulled pork, which is served up Eastern style, and the mac 'n cheese--both are delicious.  You'll need access to a roll of paper towels for this one. I've mentally booked a return trip intended to sample the beef brisket.  So deep in pork country?! I know, it sounds crazy, but it says a lot about how much these people know what they're doing with that namesake smoker.

QjTAcMUT4E42Y2Tbk-phfA.text: I'm giving them a 5 star  for the one gentleman who had a very strange voice, caught me off guard from the hostess stand. Their customer service and hospitality skills were exceptional.  Food and atmosphere all were on que on cinco de mayo. First smokehouse experience and it was fantastic

gXORIHaBFqNao9gQdaVvhA.text: Arrived into town 6/25 and didn't know where to go for lunch. We decided on BBQ and headed to Midwood Smokehouse and were seated outside. We had burnt ends and pulled chicken with very crispy sweet potato fries. It was delicious!!! The mustard sauce that came with the chicken was tasty and different. BBQ sauce that was brought to the table was perfection. Coleslaw was a nice way to cool some of the spicy food down. Our ice teas with firefly vodka were spot on! Our waiter, dark brown beard and hair, was very informative about the menu and town. Service was great! Definitely returning to eat here next time in town.

wl2M677APfQ4r6QxXoofVw.text: Very good bbq! Nice hickory smoked sausage and ribs were.fantastic. We had the combo platter with 4 meats, the small one is plenty for two people.

Z49oZX9hGHjfCi55xhhLUQ.text: I used their catering to host a Birthday party and I was thoroughly impressed how good it was. It was a crowd pleaser and made my hosting job a breeze. They were really good on having it fresh and ready at the time you need. We choose to pick it up 30 minutes before party started. It worked out perfect. Their side items such as baked beans and mac and cheese are pretty typical so I made my own very easily. So if your looking to host a big BBQ they will hook you up with some good BBQ. Thanks Midwood BBQ

D9KrzXc5p2bJY-GqSpcdRA.text: Service makes or breaks a restaurant.  There was a healthy wait and we found a couple of spots at the bar. The bartender Pamela did what I consider best practices. She introduced herself along with everyone else behind the bar and said to please ask anyone if we'd like something. That's just good , smart service. We ordered drinks from the drink menu. I asked the bartender for a recommendation. Her favorite was a BeeSting. I thought I may have to wrestle my wife for it. I am happy to do that.  Really good! We ordered the sampler plate. (The smaller one) we both ate from it and have healthy portions to bring home. Highlights were the pork, brisket , ribs , mac & cheese & collard greens. Wait ... Thats everything. They had a vinegar soaking in peppers for the collard greens . Whoa! Almost forgot jalapenos with cheese wrapped in bacon.... Seriously!  Friendly service, great food. We will be back with friends.

7e5T5iHTPnnrl3-LvUgq1g.text: Food was ok. We started with fried pickles and the bacon wrapped peppers. Both were tasty. My table ordered everything from ribs to chicken to burnt ends. The meat was ok. It's not the most mouthwatering BBQ  I've ever had, but it was fine. I think everything could've use a dash more of seasoning. I'd eat here again, but will still be looking for excellent BBQ inside the city limits.

lbzNFJDumfD7Yd1jHII8pw.text: This place is a solid 4. I have eaten here many times when in Charlotte for business.  The sides are OK, the beans are my favorite.  Mac n cheese is mediocre and the smoked vegetables are not that great.  Best meat here is the ribs, which can come with either dry rub or wet sauce.  I usually get the dry rubbed ribs and dip them in BBQ sauce separately.  The burnt ends were average.  The pulled pork was OK, nothing special.    I did come here once on a Tuesday at ~7PM and they were out of ribs, but that has only happened once.  Beer selection is decent and prices are good.  Overall a good eat and you know what you are going to get. I'll be back.

xaatKGVi43i9GJkiIQb7Yw.text: Midwood Smokehouse did some catering for a Southern Christmas Party I hosted - and I have been meaning to post a review.  They were great to work with, offered great advice about how much food to get - rather than having me get way more than I needed.  The BBQ and smoked wings were the favorite items on my buffet!  The wing are fantastic, and the pork BBQ tender and delicious, made even better with their collection of sauces.  This place is legit.  Eating there is great, but consider them for some local, delicious catering for your next party as well!

Ur3Cntxo3K1EWyqSzpCQDw.text: Every seems to agree this is the place to go if you only have one nigh in Charlotte. 44 and 45ish seem to agree, and I can see why. Don't skip the bacon wrapped jalapenos.

Cgt4DeLRGAIlj_vND1kPEQ.text: I crave these smoked wings all the time. They are juicy and delicious! Fantastic people watching very fun atmosphere and good drink specials! My husband had the bbq pot roast once ( I normally do not like pot roast) and it was absolutely amazing so much flavor and just yum!

6cHNTaqQdO2wYwaR4onowg.text: Wow! Best BBQ I've ever had. Excellent smoked wings. Amazing sausage. Great pulled pork. And the brisket was good. They sold out of the ribs so I'll have to try those next time.

O-K60dGvgmtjXfRQAR4xTA.text: I am in love with Midwood Smokehouse! We just moved to Charlotte and after a day of moving furniture with my family and friends we were in some serious need of food. I did a quick yelp search and decided to head over and pick up food for all of the helpers!   Came in and placed a large to-go order consisting mostly of pulled pork sandwiches, which everyone enjoyed. The best part was all of the different sides! I think that we were able to try most of the options but the stars were the mac-n-cheese, the bacon wrapped jalapenos and the potato salad. It was even super delicious the following day when we reheated the leftovers!!  I do have to give a special thanks to the bartender who went through the bag to verify all of our food was included before we left. Had he not we would have been one sandwich short and that would not have been good! So, thanks for being so thorough!   Fast forward 2 weeks, the house is all unpacked and my husband and I are craving the BBQ again. This time we decided to actually eat in. The service was top notch and the food amazing. I stuck with the pulled pork and the husband went with the special which was a brisket taco with spicy slaw (SO GOOD!!!). We were both really happy with our choices and left full, with to go cups for our iced teas. I always think this is nice, especially after a big meal like BBQ!   I will def be returning and even as I'm writing this review, I'm wondering if I will be able to convince the hubs to go tonight!

hSk5cPOTJNIY_5KGhEarcg.text: Well I gave take out here another chance and all I can say is check your order thoroughly before you leave because they don't.  In addition, the smoked wings were  undercooked, rubbery and not fall off the bone tender as they usually are.

DEHqO1SxMTvUQiYMwM1hnQ.text: Poor service, extremely slow. Our waitress didn't show up until about 15 minutes in, then it took forever for her to bring the food (despite the fact the table of 4 next to us ordered from her about 10 seconds before we did, we didn't get ours (a table of 2) until a good 10 minutes after them). She even said she saw it, but then didn't bring it for another 5 minutes. Before we had gotten our entree she came by and asked if we'd like any desert. Totally clueless.  Now the food. It was just ok. They got the order wrong and messed up the sauces completely. We both had the pulled pork, but neither was very pulled, more like chunked. I shouldn't need a knife to eat pulled pork, but I certainly did. It was also extremely fatty. I had huge pieces of fat and gristle. It was also way oversalted, and this is from two people who like their salt. The fried pickles were just ok, we've had better. They were too soggy. The jalapeno bacon poppers were good, but not outrageous as I was led to believe. The texture was a bit off, and the bacon wasn't crispy. The potato salad was good, as were the hushpuppies. The smoked vegetables were a bit soggy as well, not crispy as you'd expect, but they were ok.  We won't be going back.

QylZFEIeWCKDvW8fw5khAg.text: 1st time here today. OUTSTANDING. The food and service was some of the absolute best since moving here a year ago.  Paul S. our friend for the night was nothing short of amazing. Attentive and so polite, I never felt hovered over or uncomfortable. He was genuinely happy to help.  We had pulled pork nachos, pulled chicken sandwich with slaw and hushpuppies, and a chicken bacon sandwich. I could have eaten it all with my eyes alone. So glad to have used my mouth instead!   Hushpuppies were hot and crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. We had freshly cooked tortilla chips with that DELICIOUS dip of nacho sauce and tender pulled pork. The slaw and mustard sauce that came with my sandwich were seriously good enough to eat on their own.   I will ABSOLUTELY come back with my friends and family when they visit. The service and choice of drink specials kept me intrigued enough to do so. Thanks so much to the hostess and Paul today!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled chicken and hushpuppies. Mac &amp; cheese already obliterated before I could snap the pic.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork nacho dip

cgbjMKlSSXOOh8JXf3ilng.text: Good portions of food even on the small plates. My fiance loved his brisket with the habanero BBQ sauce and the pork BBQ was so good with the classic NC style vinegar sauce. Bacon wrapped jalapenos were awesome! Service was real attentive and food came out fast, will definitely go back when I visit Charlotte again!

ZL9MEpaa-fz3MXFPlw0RKA.text: Food is really good! Very wide variety to choose from! Try the BBQ spaghetti!!! Delish!!!

WBBOqUHXk519vpmE_jhi6g.text: The bbq sauces are fantastic for sure! They'd make even great food taste better. And you absolutely *must* try the baked beans! (unless you're vegetarian)  There's been a line (20-30 min wait) the two times I've been here for dinner but I don't see what the hype is about. Both times, the food was as good as what comes out of my kitchen and I didn't have to cook it so I suppose that makes me happy. The service was ok; the waitress was friendly and got everything right but it was a long time between table visits even when bringing condiments; I think they must have been short-handed. Bacon wrapped jalapenos were quite tasty but some were waaaay hotter than others. It was like 3 were poblano and two were real jalapenos seeds included. (I like it hot!) The turkey (special of the day) was nothing to write home about but it was definitely something I'd put on a sandwich for lunch the next day.  All in all, if you're looking for a new place to eat, check it out. You won't be sorry you came.

cYbDQAdPdt0qUhzjvnDNxw.text: Endless possibilities of delicious filling BBQ options. Come with an appetite and Tums. Parking can be a challenge during busy times. I also used Midwood Smokehouse for catering my rehearsal dinner as well as a neighborhood picnic, and they did not disappoint. Great service and good food in a hip hood. The bar isn't bad either.

9QOlqbg297P81HAvsPeYzQ.text: It was pretty dope. Get the ribs. Get the burnt ends. Disclaimer: if you don't like fatty meat then don't get the burnt ends.

T5LNR8giX0iD4LEL_aa3ig.text: This food is absolutely phenomenal! I first visited this place a few years ago after reading an article in the NY Times ("36 Hours in Charlotte, NC -- nytimes.com/2014/08/31/t...) and have been back several times since. My favorite things to order are... - BBQ Queso (app) - Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos (app or side) - Classic Mac & Cheese (side) - Dry Rubbed Ribs (entree) - Well Fed Combo Platter (entree for 2) - Stockyard taco (entree) The restaurant itself can get a little crowded. Go early to avoid a long wait. Outdoor seating (on a covered and climate-controlled patio) is available and is what I prefer. Parking can be a little cumbersome. The original restaurant is in Plaza Midwood. They have since expanded to Ballantyne and have plans to expand in Park Rd. Shopping Center.

cAz6ecaxKADv_Lj-DYzuow.text: Great food, great service!!!  Gabby set us up perfectly. She even brought a water bowl for our sweet puppy Pi.  Just a happy Place to be. Thank you!!

XCj4etW4Ks1YtNIbZzBlAA.text: Thanks for accommodating my family for my husband birthday celebration. Everyone enjoyed the great food and the waitress just made our meal enjoyable. Hats off

WSYaY4Zr8tewcAfVgCG_fA.text: Still love Midwood...might be my favorite place for brisket in Charlotte! Last trip we got the 4 meat platter - tried their smoked turkey, ribs and brisket times 2 (lean all the way). For sides we had the mac & cheese and smoked veggies.   Everything was DELISH! And our service was great too. I really like this place and definitely recommend it to someone looking for the best bbq in Charlotte!

En9rP2uVWf8sbxhI9JGd5A.text: Pretty good barbecue though I'm from the eastern side of the state so nothing around here seems to compare for me... but for Charlotte it's a pretty strong showing and better than Macs but the atmosphere is t as good so still 4 stars like Macs...

qSB0AIAnAG_3XVD_duao5w.text: One of us had a taste for some BBQ, so on my monthly lunch trip with my lunch buddies, it was decided this was the place.   I'd really like to give this place 5 stars but something was lacking. Don't get me wrong; food, service, ambiance, and drinks were on point. Maybe it was the portion size or the ratio of meat to bread, or the skinny crinkled cut fries.  I had the Grilled Cheese with brisket with crinkled cut fries and Kentucky Slush Puppy.  Kentucky Slush Puppy was on point. Not too sweet, refreshing, and not a lot of alcohol. (Amaretto Sour is my favorite drink if that tells you anything)  The Grilled Cheese w/ Brisket was good. I guess my one problem is there was more bread than anything. Also I was expecting meat, cheese, and onions to be pouring out of my sandwich. I like a mess when it comes to BBQ... and leftovers. I mean this is the south... Bring on the large sandwich and overwhelmingly large portion of fries. Let me decide when enough is enough.   All in all... It was good. Perhaps, I made the mistake of comparing this place to BBQ's. ill give it another try.

gYp6kcg0mw7Wyet--VTKzQ.text: The food was amazing. The staff made every attempt to accommodate our large party (including our wheelchair using friend). A great atmosphere. Stunning BBQ that I'll never find the equal of back in NJ.

sbSR5YGceWvAQRSk50INpg.text: My husband and I don't eat Bar-b-q regularly.  We hold out until it is no longer possible. When we go for Bar-b-q it is only at Midwood Smokehouse. Great servers who know the food, the food is HOT as in temp., the prices are reasonable and everything we order is great.  Good job Midwood Smokehouse! keep up the great job.

CDyk7tfefEXRuP-_npGX8g.text: I have been to Midwood a few times now and have never been disappointed. Service is always nice, atmosphere is pleasant. But the ribs! Om nom nom. We always share the big combo that has a variety of meats and two sides. My favorite is the ribs, tasty without any sauce and falling off the bone. Macaroni and cheese is always perfect as well.  For dessert, the banana pudding is a good option.   Overall, always a good choice for barbeque.

lhqT-PsMEZD2_ZviEClzIA.text: Terrific lunch today with server Kim, backed up by a team that all works together to make sure you're really taken care of. Sizable portions and everything is tasty. Brisket and Carolina BBQ are tops and all sides tasty. Bonus - hushpuppies! and plentiful servings off beverages. Cool hostess/manager. We'll be back!

vNRY06s_F25dCZqloxtUaA.text: Delicious meal.  I went small plate combo with probably the best baked beans I ever had.  The bartender was super nice and fun to talk to.

BGc5bG6UTo18iSEtHhexIg.text: Gotta say, Midwood Smokehouse was pretty tasty--coming from a girl raised on Memphis style BBQ.  Everything was delicious.  I had the pulled pork plate, an utterly huge portion for a reasonable price (choice of meat, two sides, and hush puppies). The fries were lightly spicy and cut very thin, fried to a perfect crisp.  I enjoyed my one hush puppy.  It had a slight kick and was nice and crunchy with a rich cornmeal flavor.  The best part was definitely the Mac and cheese.  The noodles were soft and cooked perfectly and the cheese struck the perfect balance between gooey parts and semi-solid parts.  The BBQ itself almost paled in comparison to the sides, but it was quite good with a nice smoky flavor.  I will say that I preferred the more southern style sweet sauce than the vinegar based sauce, and I wish the pork had been a little more moist without having to add sauce.  The only disappointment at Midwood was the banana pudding, which I felt had too much whipped cream and not enough bananas, vanilla wafers, or, well, pudding.   The decor is super cute--we now sometimes play trivia at home with the name "Praise the Lard"--and the service was good.  Midwood is worth a visit for sure!

r58RbEIiB8BdqzbtzIY34Q.text: I am embarrassed to say that the only time my mister and I get barbecue is when we have visitors from out-of-town. Well, Midwood Smokehouse is our go-to choice for meeting any barbecue hankerings. Plus, you get some of the local flavor from the surrounding Plaza Midwood neighborhood. Kill two family visit birds with one stone!  In terms of food, I've sampled a little bit of everything from the menu at this point, but the Cuban sandwich is usually what ends up calling my name. It's a solid choice with some of the chopped smoked pork for that barbecue taste .The local beer selection is on point, and has just enough offerings without overwhelming. I also appreciate that they do have regular drink specials.

vQcxxt3enbAQK-wu1Q-eSA.text: Great smokey tasting pulled pork. Just landed in my top 5 in Charlotte for sure. The meat was flavorful and juicy versus one-note due to baking. The sides - creamed cord- decadent. The greens - though tasty- did not exceed my flavor development in a pot o' greens Our server, though slow, took his time to be cordial and kind so I didn't mind. Cool spot. Especially since our President et al stopped through. I'd come again and again... In a pair of cute flats though.  Gotta park across the street.

RPI07QgoLgcd42UGqbHp7Q.text: Yum, Yum, Yum!!!  LOVE the food and never had bad service. Downside is parking and they get super busy. I just try to hit it on down times to avoid the parking issues and the wait.

cKAw922DCmQ3F-7818kAsg.text: This place is located about 2.0 miles from the heart of downtown Charlotte. I'm not a huge BBQ fan but was in the mood for some on this day. We waited for about 35-40min on a Saturday night. This place is a very busy place and loud on the inside. Our server told us that their popular dishes are the Carolina pulled pork and beef brisket. He emphasized that the burnt ends entree is one of their best sellers. With that being said, I opted to try it. I started out with their chopped salad as my appetizer. Easily one of the best salads I'd ever had. Very simple but loaded with flavor. Get the green goddess dressing on it. The salad has chopped cucumber, black beans, corn etc in it and it's topped with fresh avocado. My entree was ok. The burnt ends were salty to me and the flavor of "charred" ends was overwhelming. I would get their regular beef brisket next time, as I am sure it is delicious. My sides were wonderful. I had their smoked vegetables and collard greens! Their hush puppies were really good! Despite my experience with the burnt ends, I think this establishment offers wonderful BBQ food, if you want some good ole southern BBQ! I would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends entree. Although a popular dish, I&#39;d get regular brisket next time.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chopped salad tossed with goddess green dressing! This salad was so delicious and only $5. This is the small portion
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

vr4Bubw57TJNnhDh1PFA3Q.text: Best. BBQ. In. Charlotte. Get the sampler platter and as many bacon wrapped, cheese stuffed smoked jalapenos as possible and enjoy!

Rx9FdyFu4vZTvKrhJtYcFQ.text: We had Midwood Smokehouose cater a work event for 25 visitors coming in from Japan and also the office staff. We wanted to give the visitors some real Southern American food. First of all, they all loved the food and thanked us incessantly.   We purchased the grilled chicken, roasted summer vegetables, potato salad, and banana pudding. Everythinng was excellent! The chicken was really moist and had a rich smoky flavor. The veggies were fresh and crunchy. The potato salad was creamy and tasted like they had just made it. The banana pudding may have been the best one I have ever tried. I am guessing they make it with condensed milk and cream cheese and fold in the whipped cream to give it that airy feeling.   We also ordered regular and sweet tea. They brought us sliced lemons which was a lovely touch. They also provided serving utensils and flatware.   I will definitely be visiting in person. I also want to comment on the wonderful presentation that the caterer gave us. It looked very nice for a professional event. Also, the ease of the ordering was appreciated as well as the reasonable prices. Thanks Midwood!

_klwAARLtXdcDamdiThbyw.text: Smelled great walking up to the door. All the staff were super nice. Ordered pork  ribs dry. Found the rub average at best, sauces were excellent. Ribs were a bit too fatty and meat fell off the bone and portion size was very large. I mean the meat actually falls off the bones while trying to cut them apart, i prefer a little "tussell" , you know chew the meat right off the bone. I probably ordered the wrong thing based on everyone else's reviews.

dzXoWpdawoWtnK6zsqOLQA.text: I'm from Texas...and this is outstanding BBQ. The sides were awesome, then meat was awesome, the sauce was awesome. Very good. I'm from out of town, but when I'm back through here again, I will be back at Midwood!

xWcm0-3mjRmPMcmXiWHBTQ.text: Kristen gave such amazing service that in itself is worth 5 stars. Best bbq in Charlotte

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

WpafGLEKv6gJ3MU9fDN9hw.text: Super yummy!!! I had the combo - ribs, brisket, pulled pork and sausage - ALL super flavorful and juicy meats. Sweet potato fries and smoked veggies are pretty on point too.  I love the outside seating & the street art on the back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

BYTHpJe9PJav4QtIUNgpOA.text: I can't compliment this place enough! Casual but classy atmosphere with friendly staff and amazing food, what more could someone ask for? Came in on a Saturday afternoon, pretty busy for 3 o'clock. Our waitress was out of this world.
