So often you get a waitperson who is either lacksidasical in their service or smothering in their concern, but not Rachel. She was friendly and conversational, funny and witty really enjoyed her making us feel at home. Being from NC, BBQ means one thing...Pork, but their burnt ends are to die for. If I could eat it everyday I would, seriously at good.   PUMPKIN LOVERS- get the Gordgeous beer from NoDa Brewing Co....probably one of the best pumpkin beers I've had in a long time!

OdnAon_Bf5J3esKPqMoZHw.text: 1. The pimento cheese fries. I order pimento cheese fries PRETTY much every time I see them on the menu. These were really good. Very generous amount for an appetizer, 2 of us could not finish them. The cheese was good but it was on the more tame/bland side of pimento. I would order again! 2. I got the hot mess burger. This is a burger made with ground brisket and chuck I believe, and the waitress suggested I order it rare/medium-rare. While I will eat a steak that way, I am not as trusting when it comes to ground beef. I ordered the burger medium and it came well done. Luckily the delicious bacon-y  cheese-y condiment and the jalapeno poppers on the burger made it so tasty and juicy that the meat being a bit dry didn't bother me. If you are all about the meat, I would check the doneness before the waitress leaves. I ate the entire thing, and the collards were delicious.  3. Hubs got the large brisket plate, and he ordered the brisket "fatty". I will say, my husband is a barbeque snob. He smokes his own meats and spends ridiculous amounts of time researching barbeque. The brisket was dry for him...especially since he ordered it fatty. He said the sauce and the flavor were good, but it seemed to be rushed due to trying to serve customers. He also remarked that the mac and cheese was some of the best he has ever had.   So..all in all, we had some meat issues BUT we would definitely go back and try again. All the sides and the app were fantastic. The burger was still delicious even though it was well done.

G3ArezvpM_Peq8RobQ9t-w.text: Best barbecue I've ever had. Absolutely awesome. We ordered burnt ends and brisket fries. Highly recommended. I also prefer the regular coleslaw over the bbq slaw....lastly, bbq sauces are great!!!!!!

AEse_ugk3uAK-GrLT4ELAw.text: Incredible meal The smoked wings might just be the best I ever had and I love all kinds of wings. Also bacon wrapped jalapenos were incredible We had a party of 8 and everyone loved it. The brisket was excellent. Great tap beers as well. Definitely coming g back when I am passing thru again

S6g7pkyDi6srrxB5bfYhnQ.text: Head the half rack with baked beans and hush puppies. Man, this place was awesome! The ribs were so tender and the beans had brisket throughout. I definitely plan to come back and highly recommend you gone them a try. Really good bbq and the staff wad super friendly as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half rack with baked beans and hush puppies. Super good!!

OYKgObkXBldXsyO8EzfZdg.text: Best barbecue, slaw, banana pudding, brisket in the Southeast! Why do you think President Obama ate there? He has good taste.

-V3oUbs9CoOKPuep-s_iUA.text: Had chopped pork with vinegar plate for dinner. Loved it! And I know my pork because I'm an Eastern NC girl. They got the vinegar sauce just right. I had the baked beans and collards as sides. Delicious! Can't wait to return to Charlotte to enjoy Midwood again.

36XqXakLHlTl4foFnSobrQ.text: The food - you just want you be rolled out of there. Meat meat and more meat. Comfort comfort and more comfort. Greens, Mac and cheese and tender meat. Workout and skip a meal before going. However they will run out of things like ribs... so go early. That can be frustrating but it is fresh and from local suppliers.  I was so full I cant recall having cocktails but BBQ is best with beer anyway!

DnON6RHkVUAuVWWSZICuWQ.text: I may not be the biggest fan of barbecue, but Midwood was really something else. We came on a Sunday afternoon and sat out on the porch, thoroughly enjoying the laid back atmosphere and beautiful weather.  Our order included a Bloody Mary ($3 off that day), a Combo platter with the chopped pork, beef brisket, St. Louis ribs, and smoked sausage and sides of mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos. We also added a side of burnt ends. My favourite meat would have to be the beef brisket - it was the perfect balance of lean and fatty meat. Pair that with Midwood's signature bbq sauce and you're solid. The ribs were also very tender. Although the burnt ends were packed with flavour, the meat was a bit tough for me since it was fully cooked through.  Aside from enjoying all the meats, I thought the sides were alright. I would have preferred a runnier consistency for the mac and cheese, and I am just not too fond of bacon in general.  I would highly recommend this place!

UqMpCy64HvbxkVUb99bNiw.text: Honestly I'm a bbq snob having lived in Texas. I'm rather unimpressed with this BBQ that everybody is always raving about. I've had the brisket, pulled pork, and bbq sandwich. The Mac n cheese is very underwhelming. Service has never been a problem.

pS9Xvb1p9yMj2v6oXcIdZw.text: Simple but outstanding. We are from California and nothing comes close. Lucille's is like a drive thru compare to this place. They also give you twice as Much for for the price of a bbq restaurant in California.

Spb82BDZ8wdZnm0P8BXnzw.text: Excellent food and service, should have went here first before I went to Queen City Q. Also a much better atmosphere that Queen City Q.

uamzEPhip02aNZmWTRsDZg.text: I was visiting Charlotte for a business trip and wanted to try some BBQ.  I am something of a BBQ aficionado, and Midwood had the best beans I ever tasted in my life.  Also, the ribs were awesomely delicious.  The day I was flying back, I checked out an hour early just so that I could have another meal there before I flew out.  Fantastic!

PtgadU1PU9msvXob_HA1eg.text: A couple of weeks ago, I heard rumor of a new BBQ joint opening up in Charlotte. As I read more and more about it, I started getting excited and determined that I just had to check this new place out soon. Well that new place is Midwood Smokehouse, and I took the opportunity today to check it out before having to head in to the office. Nestled in the Plaza-Midwood neighborhood of Charlotte, NC, Midwood Smokehouse is the newest restaurant opened by longtime Charlotte restauranteur Frank Scibelli. Scibelli is the brain child behind several popular Charlotte restaurants such as Big Daddy's Burger Bar and Paco's Tacos and Tequila. As noted in an interview with Charlotte Magazine, Scibelli's restaurant fully intends to produce serious, authentic wood-smoked BBQ. To accomplish this goal, he traveled around North Carolina to research the state's well-known pork barbecue joints, and he also collaborated with James Beard award winner Robb Walsh on the intricacies of Texas barbecue (read: brisket). My task for today was to see how close he came to meeting this goal. While the location of the restaurant may be in a trendy part of the city, the interior decor was inviting. A mirror behind the bar stated the daily specials as well as some rather interesting one-liners/ Since Midwood Smokehouse has been open for less than two weeks, the menu was a little limited. However, plenty of options were still available, ranging from Eastern Carolina style pork to brisket to sausage made on the premises. After perusing the menu, I ordered a half-rack of ribs (St. Louis style) with a side of BBQ baked beans. I requested that the ribs be sauced. In addition, I ordered an additional side of bacon-wrapped jalapenos stuffed with cheese (which I lovingly refer to as ABTs, or atomic buffalo turds). The server was very pleasant, taking her time to go through several of the menu options and offer her personal recommendations. After about 10 minutes, my order arrived. The first thing I notice is that the ribs were served with sauce on the side instead of being glazed on the ribs (as I expected). The food certainly looked appetizing, and I will get to my thoughts on the food shortly. As I was taking pictures of my food, the general manager came over to my table. I introduced myself to him as a BBQ blogger, and he immediately offered to bring me a sampling of their other menu items. How could I possibly refuse? As if I wasn't already starting to feel full enough, out comes a sampling of pork, brisket, prime rib, sausage, and other goodies. In addition, I also got to sample all of the sauces that Midwood Smokehouse offers as well as a small sample of collard greens. Now on to the verdict... The ribs had an excellent flavor. The meat was not too smoky, and I could actually taste the pork rather than an overabundance of rub to mask the flavor of the meat. However, there were two things I immediately noticed: - The back membrane had been left on the rack when it was cooked. - The rib meat pulled right off the bone without any resistance, which signified that they were a bit overcooked. The sausage was a very mild sausage. It had a bit of a crumbly texture. Since I'm not an expert on how authentic Texas-style sausage should taste, I won't give an opinion on that. The brisket was good, with a nice texture and taste. The pork was, in short, PERFECT! It had a perfect savory flavor, and the texture was on point (and not mushy like a lot of Eastern Carolina style pork can be). Honestly, the pork did not need any sauce, but I decided to try it with the vinegar-based sauce. The sauce added an extra dimension to the pork. Finally, the prime rib... why didn't someone introduce me to smoked prime rib before? Completely and totally droolworthy! This one is definitely on my repeat list. So would I recommend this BBQ joint? Absolutely, with no reservations whatsoever! This review is available with pictures at bigwaynerbbq.com/2011/05....

kSA4c4skLIfiVrnc6v5Log.text: Amazing BBQ. I'm from Chicago and I'm always looking for some good ribs and pulled pork. This place has it!! Great service and a good time :) I will definitely come here again for BBQ!

5I7ATAilQrwoTv9S6oX7Ng.text: Solid BBQ with multiple sauces - check.  Good service - check.  Fair market prices - check.  Generous portion size - check.  Fairly crowded (so you know it's good) on a weekday for lunch, but not too crowded for a long wait - check.  Parking adequate - check.  Eyes bigger than my stomach - check.  What's not to like?  Pimento cheese fries.  Bacon wrapped jalepenos.  Huge salads you can fix up with BBQ chicken/pork/etc.  I still love Mac's Speed Shop, as well, but Midwood Smokehouse provides an alternative closer to Dilworth (location of my employer).  I'm not sure a city can have too much high-end BBQ.  Not only is it in the rotation, I'm putting it near the top.

D9k2T4XRzbP2_keTPuO88w.text: The Good News: Authentic BBQ smell, tasty menu, prompt and friendly service.  The Bad News: Totally generic  atmosphere and the music is loud and the worst selection of 80s rock  I've ever heard. It felt more like a chain restaurant than a local joint.

VR3nOGHIMFjrvpKEAKk9bQ.text: To be frank I am in love with Midwood smokehouse.  My wife and I went on our first date here, it's the first restaurant I bring family/friends to when visiting, and it's the first words out of my mouth when somebody asks where to go for BBQ.    I always get the giant platter with a nice portion of everything on it.  I kid you not I can usually feed a couple of people with the leftovers.  The Brisket and the ribs are the stars of the show but everything else is fantastic as well.  The sides are great and I don't think I can ever get my fill of bacon wrapped jalapenos and hushpuppies. Thinking of the warm evenings I've spent eating in the outdoor section with a bourbon, giant plate of bbq, watching the sun go down is keeping me warm this winter! Are you still reading this?  Get your butt over to midwood!

oU_8fj1Dq927JIDMYL0Suw.text: Great food ! Probs my first choice for charlotte BBQ. Parking is a pain in the butt though and service is... average, I prefer their other location

LfMWJpNobDhaJS9NmS2blQ.text: We have been coming to Midwood about once a week for 2 years. I never grow tired of their chopped salad, fresh Romaine lettuce tossed with black beans, corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, carrots and cheese. I LOVE this salad. The smoked wings are large and tender and oh so good. The ribs are fall off the bone delicious. Service is always friendly and prompt. Cannot say enough good things about this place.

SRsA1fFywjf83JeSZlfZmg.text: I stopped in for lunch at Midwood Smokehouse and was delighted to grab a table outside. A beautiful day and a much-hyped BBQ shop had the makings of a great meal. I've been searching for a great BBQ shop. I went into the meal hoping I had found a great local BBQ shop.  I ordered a Small Pulled Pork Plate and was delighted when the meal came out in no more than 3 minutes. Love that.  The very friendly and attentive waitress claimed that the meal was 8oz of meat and the menu also claimed that the pork was PULLED. I must have done a poor job of hiding my confusion when the meal was delivered because the waitress asked if everything was ok. I pointed out the obvious fact that the pork was chopped and not pulled. Apparently, they pull the pork apart...and then chop it. In my book, that's called chopped. Chopped and Pulled are two different meals. I won't be convinced otherwise and I won't be fooled.   I suspect that there wasn't quite 8oz of meat, but forgot my digital scale.  Putting the texture discrepancy aside, the BBQ was seasoned very well. I'm a fan of a sweeter BBQ and tend to shy away from vinegar-based sauces. The BBQ was seasoned so well that the side of vinegar sauce was unnecessary. The side of baked beans had great texture and were seasoned to perfection(sweet), but was a small side. Mixing the BBQ and the beans together, I found my sweet flavorful BBQ.   I was unimpressed with the hush-puppies but my four-legged companion liked them. I'm sure she would give them two-paws up. She likes hush-puppies but I've never had one I really liked.   Overall, the food was pretty good but I have to admit I was disappointed at the prices. The portions were small for the amount of money. The small plate was in the range of $9 and only came with one side. I couldn't justify to my self spending $3 to get an extra side. After seeing the size of the sides, I made the right choice.   Midwood Smokehouse is a good concept and has the makings of a great BBQ joint, but they've really missed it on portion size.

gAyRrnMoqgOMI-dWnl-31A.text: Always delicious, always great service. Love the hushpuppies. Be sure to try the chopped salad and green goddess dressing. Yummm

Iy0rwNZ6k8U3YgPRZtRI4A.text: We had brisket, chicken and pulled pork, they were all equally delicious. Great sauces and sides. Cute, nice and clean place with friendly service.

3WdYS0Q6d611LUbaL7l1mg.text: Doesn't compare to Mac's Speed Shop.  My first visit went well, a lazy Sunday afternoon with a couple buddies when they weren't too busy.  The menu looks really good but the pulled pork I ordered didn't stand up to Mac's.  My buddy liked it better than Mac's, but I think he's biased since he lives 2 miles from Midwood Smokehouse (to be honest, I live 2 miles away from Mac's).  My second visit was a complete disaster.  Originally planned to go to Mac's this past Friday (Jun 24) with 5 out-of-town buddies plus 2 others, and got talked into changing to Midwood Smokehouse (same buddy as above).    While their menu states they may run out of bbq from time to time (never seen a restaurant advertise running out of food before, but whatever), they were out of pulled pork bbq on Friday night at 8:00, and also out of bacon wrapped jalepenos (gotta love the south, they wrap everything in bacon).  I ordered a rack of ribs to compare to Mac's and they tasted like they were cooked in the oven as they had zero smoke flavor.  The bbq sauce didn't help at all, too bland.  The waiter hooked us up with wings since they were out of pork bbq and the wings were supposedly smoked but had zero flavor.  No rub, no sauce, no nothin.  The mac & cheese however was very good (close to Mac's).  I tried my buddy's sausage and it was dry and tasted like cardboard.  Midwood Smokehouse has been open for only 2 months, hopefully they step up their game!

fcGGLQhB8SpqGC5hb7Z2Sg.text: I've been coming here since they opened and I'm not sure why I've never written a review. I was a die hard BBQ chicken sandwich fan. (With Mac 'n Cheese of course.) Then, on a whim I tried the Salmon Sammie. I've gone from a fan to an addict! At about 11:00 a.m. on Saturday I find myself craving my weekly fix! The salmon is always cooked perfectly w/ the right amount of seasoning and smoke and the tarter corn slaw puts it miles above any other salmon sandwich I've ever had. The combination of textures and flavors is fabulous! Plus, Melissa always greets us w/ a smile at the bar and even remembers what we drink!

XAbFwHBrGiHxFgxD4znPKg.text: I had the Carolina Pork BBQ plate. The taste was bland and the BBQ sauce was just ok. The hushpuppies sucked. The bacon-wrapped jalapenos weren't bad. I don't understand all the high reviews. I've had better BBQ in Miami and that's sad.  Service was good and attentive, though.

ii2k2q7X3yYFNx04Q3XH8Q.text: Much of Charlotte is divided into 2 BBQ camps - you're either a Mac's fan or a Midwood fan. While Mac's is definitely delicious, I am undoubtedly in the Midwood camp. Their BBQ gives Charlotte a reason to be famous for BBQ! Start with the pimento cheese fries topped with beef brisket and thank me later. I am a huge fan of the Midwood Chopped salad topped with chopped pork. It is an incredibly satisfying, flavorful, enormous salad full of veggies, avocado, and deliciously flavorful BBQ. Their BBQ chicken is delicious, but you can't go wrong with the pork or brisket. Both are flavored and cooked perfectly every time. Their smoked veggies side is absolutely delicious and a great pairing with any of their BBQ dishes (especially if you're looking to add at least a bit more nutritional value to your meal). And, if you're up for dessert, their banana pudding is among the best I've ever tasted. The small size is plenty big, and the large size is truly LARGE. Definitely enough to share - or not, if you don't feel like sharing! They also have plenty of beer, wine, and cocktails available.

8dg9pIQE5E2a8gj3m5rWOQ.text: I went here with my cousin and it was to die for. The wings were amazing, and my half chicken with cole slaw and Mac and cheese was literally melt in your mouth, bursting with flavor. I am drooling just thinking about it. I love how they give you the sauces  on the side and you can try each of them to find the one you like best. I am in love with the mustard one. Best BBQ sauce ever. You have to check this place out if you are in Charlotte.

LsbCdDhhTywfYn1ux8aY6Q.text: We were greeted by a very friendly hostess. Our waiter was great and gave us many recommendations since it was our first time there. I had the BBQ pork sandwich with the vinegar based slaw and a side of Mac and cheese. Everything was amazing!! I definitely recommend trying this place!

Ggr77fIg9YH1hLbpxPisLQ.text: Had the burnt ends with Mac n cheese, hush puppies and Texas toast. The small meal was more than enough for 2 meals. The BBQ sauce that's mixed with fat tire has a bit of spiciness to it but not overpowering. I also had the devils cut bourbon with pineapple and ginger soda, for a non bourbon drinker it was pretty good. I want to come back and try the sandwiches and other sides. The area is a bit small but the decor is pretty neat.

TykcFYdUWSVF0PrQaUYLgg.text: When I see a new restaurant open, I usually like to wait a few months to let them work out the kinks before I give it a try.  But pork bbq makes me all weak in the knees, so after driving by a few times I decided I had to give in to see if it was worth drooling all over my steering wheel all week long.  Holy crap.  It SO was.  I went on a Friday with a few friends.  I had the pulled pork sandwich with baked beans, and we got an order of hush puppies for the table.  I opted for the vinegar sauce.  The pork was tender and smoky, the vinegar sauce was just a little spicy, and the baked beans had bacon (!)  in them.   The hush puppies were just the right kind of fried - crispy but not greasy, and were perfectly balanced between sweet and savory.   For dessert I had banana pudding that made me lick the bowl and my hubby had some kind of cookie/peanut-butter cup concoction that was also fabulous.  Oh, and the service was warm and friendly and we never had to wait on drink refills.  We had such a good time that we went back.  The next night.  This is a little embarrassing for me, admitting that I gorged myself on bbq two nights in a row and didn't regret it for a second (until Sunday morning).  But I think it speaks to the deliciousness of the food.  Also, the next night someone ordered the brown-sugared bacon as their side, and I feel I should warn you not to eat it, ever, because if you do you won't want to stop.  If they diced that stuff up and mixed it into some vanilla ice cream I would leave my husband for it.  I'm not even kidding.  I would leave my husband and declare brown-sugared bacon ice cream my one True love.  (Do you hear me, Smokehouse?)  Midwood needed a place like this, and I'm so happy to welcome it to the neighborhood.  Anybody have any plans for dinner?  I have this sudden craving for bbq.

8slkO402EHskUWImCFtTsA.text: Our 12 hrs layover at Charlotte: Midwood was our second lunch. The meal consist of brisket, spareribs, sausage, pulled pork, hush puppies, baked beans and Mac n cheese!  All that food for only $22!!!!!  All the meat was deliciously smokey flavored.  My favorite was probably the spare ribs.  Hush puppies were not too greasy, just wish that there was jalepeno in it.  The baked bean was just perfect, great tangy smokey taste.  The Mac n cheese was sooo good, especially the top crispy crust.  Our waiter Andra was very friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

78a7QVFkTWjtAaiiZ-TzGg.text: Yum!  The best:  BBQ pork, chicken, beef brisket - they smoke it all!  THIS is the place we take friends and family who are visiting Charlotte for the first time.   Midwood lives up to the South's reputation for great barbecue.  In addition to sweet, sweet meats, they've got delicious sides (hush puppies & collards!), a great beer selection, and very reasonable prices.  Go!  Today!

koHNS6fKLbIoB-gEnOpluw.text: Order the brisket!  As a transplant from Texas, I can tell you that their Brisket, Sausage, and bacon-wrapped-jalapenos are just like home.  I had to ask for bread and pickles (which would have come standard in Texas) but other than that, I was very pleased with my dinner.  I ordered the brisket plate and added on some sausage.  My side was macaroni & cheese and it was ok.  Service was slow, but that was probably because of the server we had.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Pecan cobbler with whipped cream.&#34; Just like a pecan pie.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo plate: brisket, sausage, ribs &amp; pulled pork.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket plate with sausage added on.  Why are there hush puppies on this plate??? Weird.

wsHujqq8dZp4KQHcHYB8vA.text: My sister and hubby were visiting from out of town and were dying to try this place out.  We went on a Sunday evening and it was beyond packed.  We were a party of 9 and they told us it would be about 1 hour wait.  We decided to wait and about 15-20 mintues later my sister went up there and god knows what she said to them but we were seated right away.  To start of the smell of the BBQ was absolutely mouth watering.    Once we ordered and waited about 10 mintues then the waitress comes out to say they ran out of ribs.  HUH??? but ok, we decided to go with the saugage and brisket. Then we asked them for a complimentary appetizer to make up for running out of ribs.  Guess what?? They all of a sudden had ribs left, so we ended up getting what we originally ordered.  Now to the food part.  The ribs and brisket were very tender, tasty and of good quality.  Definitely better than alot of other restaurants.  The baked beans we didn't care for.  They are very reasonably priced, actually cheaper than I expected.  For the 9 of us the bill came to $110.00  For the food 4 stars, price 5 stars and  the service, hhmm 3.  I would definitely try them again.

Wz0jcKHj82L3pBTqZslDoQ.text: Damn that was good! Just left the restaurant. We were passing thru Charlotte on the way home to Ohio. BBQ was the last item to check off our vacation to-do list. What a way to finish our vacay!  Under the category of Best-I-Ever-Had: Brisket Ribs Mac n cheese Ice tea  Two word review: Yum and Yum!

GwX-H7qzpXSWXv0KkNDZIg.text: Minus 2 stars for the new menu. No more Redneck tacos? No more smoke sausage plate? 2 of the best things on the menu, gone.

dnlp58kZD9lDhbdtkxCKnw.text: My fiance and I were in the process of deciding whether we wanted to leave our beloved Portland, Oregon and move across the country to Charlotte when we first visited the Midwood Smokehouse.  Being from Portland, food is a big deal to both my fiance and I...a dealbreaker when considering moving.  My close friends in town suggested this place and we all went.  My fiance is a big BBQ guy and he loved what he had.  It was flavorful, moist and just enough food.  I loved all of the sides too.  We had great service at the bar and then sat outside under the covered patio.  We only had to wait a few minutes for a table, even on what seemed to be a busy night.  This made the (very long) list of restaurants that convinced us that we'd be able to survive in Charlotte.  We'll see you in July Queen City!

KyPNyXhWrhKgJhPtJSf3Rw.text: We are from Texas and came to this place to have dinner due to a long layout on airport. I am glad that we did because food was amazing. My husband and I decided to order the pig out with ribs, double brisket, and sausage everything was splendid.

_RafsRpp_-iJ-UIbJjqj_A.text: Very good spot for bbq and smoked wings. Good local beer and bourbon selection. Very casual setting but the service was above average.

f3X24-mTuOJNGEA8J2clRA.text: Excellent bbq in a really cute neighborhood!  The wait staff was really friendly and helpful.  Brisket and pork had tons of flavor and the portions were just right.  I was here on a business trip and so glad I made a stop at Midwood!  We went early because we had the kids with us and it was family friendly. Love the art work, really fun atmosphere .

Czvr4jX2cH2cX24OuDMV2w.text: BBQ in king in the south. Midwood Smokehouse does not disappoint. I love the cuban sandwich. I know i now not BBQ but it is a more than decent rendition of one of my favorites. Every dish I've had here has been good. I take my out of town guests here that are looking for good southern BBQ.

zjK9N5ghmfPdzjW4-PfHHQ.text: We are from Gastonia and actually love trying BBQ joint we haven't tried before.  I actually enlisted Yelp for us to pick our next one.  Midwood Smokehouse's reviews looked very interesting and promising so we went on a Monday for lunch since my husband was enjoying a long weekend.  The first thing that hits you is the smell of the meat smoking.  This is always a promising sign!  The waiter was very friendly and since I told him I was a newbie, he really tried to make our experience pleasurable.  We decided to just go for the entree but I know I want to try the jalapenos wrapped in bacon as an appetizer next time!  We ordered the well-fed Pig.  You get to choose four meats and two sides.  We chose Chopped BBQ (you get 4 oz. so I asked if I could get double BBQ and count as two choices) and he said, yes, Beef brisket (1/2 lean and 1/2 fatty), and ribs (you get 4).  I found out with the Well fed pig you get 4 oz. of meat each and with the Pig Out (you get 6 oz. of each choice).  Our sides we chose were mac & cheese and coleslaw.    First, to comment on the meat,  I am an Eastern-style chopped bbq kind of girl.  I just loved it.  The meat is pulled, not minced, like I love!  Very smoky, it comes without sauce, has nice pink ring.  You have a choice of 4 different sauces, SC mustard style, vinegar Eastern style which I used, of course, spicy bbq tomato based, and their original.  I thought it was really good and ranks up there with some of the best bbq, I have had in a long time.  The ribs were good, and although I haven't had a lot of brisket in my day, it was very good.  I will definitely be getting some more of that next time!   For the sides, the mac & cheese, I thought was delicious.  I know everyone's experience is different and so are their taste. However, I have to disagree with one of the other comments that I have read. The writer thought it tasted like a cafeteria mac & cheese.  I really have to disagree.  I found out Midwood makes it homemade everyday and it was great!  Can't wait to have that again, for sure.  Now, for the coleslaw, it is mayo-based which is how I like mine.  It is very finely chopped and for me, it just isn't my preference but it was tasty.  I would probably order a different side next time but hey, the mac & cheese is definitely a keeper.  I will have to say, for me & my hubby, we are definitely going back and probably on the weekend, so we can experience a crowd.  They have a long bar some and some good local beer on tap. Oh, on Monday's 1/2 priced local NC drafts.  I got the Highland Gaelic Ale, yummy!  It went great with the bbq.  We would definitely recommend for people to try this place and hope you have a great experience like we did!

ArqMxzVujFAmGTYE4mEIuw.text: While visiting family in the area for the Holidays , my cousin wanted me to try this place after both had seen it on the TV. We stopped in on a Saturday about 10:15pm  knowing they closed at 1100pm  I had the burnt ends with added sausage and started off with Bacon wrap jalapeno's.   Thought I'd loose my mind - AMAZING and the great service only added to the " Hell yes I'll be back" experience. BUT BUT BUT!!!!!  The very next night while my cousin was working, his wife and I made a return visit....................................It was like we went to a completely different place. This time, we did take out.  To start.............. Way to many things went wrong to list---  1) Cold. 2) Order wrong.  3) Portions seemed smaller VS night before.  4) BIG TIME ATTITUDE AND ARGUMENTATIVE DEFENSIVE POSITION FROM ROBERT.when i tried to explain. He made me feel as though I was trying to scam or just lying.  Robert even commented how angry I was - So I had to explain the difference between anger VS stern clear communication.  It was the interaction with Robert and a female staff that I initially interacted with-both was so " That isn't possible." regarding my feedback.   When speaking to any owner/manager about my experience I try not to bring it up, but I trained in the culinary arts in LA and Italy; I know a little something about what I'm talking about.  Robert's attitude was less than warm and "I'll  fix it by" ..Didn't seem like an option for him. His comment to me was  "What do you want me to do?"  He was kind enough to take off the charge for a sandwich that had cheese on it WHEN IT WAS NO CHEESE request, the person eating it or suppose to eat it hates cheese.  I still have yet to see if that was done on my card.  Bottom line........... I hope the experience that Saturday night is the norm and Roberts accusative manner isn't.   I didn't come there for Robert.... But Robert is the reason I may not come back.  Take this as positive feedback, for that is the intent.   The food we got Sunday night was horrible - what should of happen was a total refund.  ( For me -- it wasn't about the money)

d9PtSeAw7IEFAynYJJTqLQ.text: Best beef brisket in town! The sides are also VERY tasty - my fave are the smoked veggies!

Ek3g9rdU6xx-35VBurjs-g.text: The pulled pork is amazing. The East Carolina sauce is the best. The Hush Puppies are perfect. I didn't eat here, I actually had the leftovers after a plane ride and it was still so good!

wx5loGcMXpxfGU0k6iqaoA.text: As it is right down the street I frequent this place quite often. I have never sat down and ate so can't comment on the service but for $20 I get a pound of BBQ and a large side of Mac N Cheese. I have always been impressed and the food is consistently great. They offer 2 different BBQ sauces and typical Eastern NC Vinegar and a more sweet and tangy sauce. My favorite is the sweet and tangy. Mac N Cheese is also delicious as well. I am very particular about restaurant Mac but you won't be disappointed.   As I said earlier I have never sat down inside the restaurant and ate but they are always packed when I go to pick up and it's in the Plaza/Midwood area which is quite trendy. I would recommend this place to all BBQ connoisseurs and those looking for a fun night out.

bNCepbPnb5EuJiao5jDjRw.text: So me and KB the largest leprechaun were in Charlotte this week and we wanted to hit up an authentic barbecue joint to find out what this North Carolina barbecue was all about.  we decided on Midwood largely because to get four stars across 290 reviews with yelp is an accomplishment.  For me it's all about the food yeah the ambience is really nice and when I arrived I was pleased to find the corrugated sign out front with the flying pig I mean how bad can it be.  We started our meal with the stuffed jalapeno wrapped in bacon and as far as they were concerned definitely very spicy very moist very cheesy and the bacon was crispy so I'll put those at the top of the list is the best jalapeno I ever had.  Both KB The largest leprechaun and I ordered the combo plate.  I opted for the brisket smoked sausage chicken and St. Louis ribs.  I decided to order the ribs dry because if I wanted them wet i could always add sauce.   For my size I ordered the coleslaw and the mac & cheese.    I like to start with the good stuff so let's just say it was the best mac & cheese I've ever had. The brisket was moist and the ribs were above average.   The smoke sausage was sausage it's pretty much always going to be good.   I could tell KB liked cause he ate everything on his plate and it was Eyeing some of my plate as well.  My minor complaints where the pulled chicken I think they include too much of the white meat and/or if it happens to be yesterday's chicken.   I would just skip it.  And I'm not used to the way they serve cole slaw in the south it looked like it was put in a food processor just not my thing.    The beer selection is nice.  And the service was very good.  Only mix up with what type of dessert we wanted we ordered the bread pudding were served the banana pudding I think the waiter was hungry and really wanted the banana pudding. It was very good. The reason we don't get five stars because even though there was some serious highlights the jalapeno poppers and the mac & cheese the barbecue was very good but not the best ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sign out front with the flying pig. How can you go wrong?
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The four combo plate

bJb-xwBQBR_AP_o62aZb4g.text: 1. Bacon wrapped jalapenos 2. The little crunchy pieces of ice 3. Awesome local brews on tap  Do you really need to know more??

Bktm-8CO18iZyb7FiesOiQ.text: Great 'Cue + Ambiance + Killer Service = Feeling REAAAL Good. (Bloated, but real good bloated!)  After spending 3 years living in the Kansas City, eating some of the BEST BBQ in the country, it's pretty hard to stack up to a Gates or Jack Stack's (5 Stars IMO) but the service and ambiance really bump this place up to 5 stars for me.   My husband and I went here for lunch on a Saturday, when it was packed. Even so, we were seated quickly, and had our unsweetened iced teas on the table within 2 minutes.  Our server gave us some recommendations-- but I would have liked if she "sold" some of her favorites better.  (The chicken salad is good...the chili is our special of the day...I like the mustard sauce.)   What our server did do, was offer us options.  My husband wanted a pork and brisket sandwich, but since it wasn't on the menu, our server said he could get the brisket, and add a $3 side of pulled pork, and she'd give us a buttered bun.    Our server recommended the chicken salad so I got that on lettuce leaves, roasted corn, tomatoes, red onion, cheese and orange honey mustard on the side.  The chicken salad is good, no doubt, but didn't have the smoky flavor I was hoping for.  If this wasn't at a BBQ joint, it would be A+.   When our server learned we were 1st timers, she brought us samples of each of the house sauces.  A mustard based one (sweet and thick, really nice), a hot and spicy tomato-based, a regular tomato-base and a Carolina vinegar based.) Alongside were 4 hushpuppies for dipping.  We appreciated this and were able to decide which one we wanted with our meats.   The real star...  Frank, the owner came over to us, and we started chatting.  When he learned we were first timers at his restaurant, and that we were from KC, immediately offered to bring us two of his ribs to try.  He explained how he smokes his meats everyday, (unlike Mac's Speedshop, where the meat is smoked somewhere else and then brought in...I was not surprised) and only used hickory wood to smoke.    The ribs were tender and fell off the bone.  The outside is extra seasoned and some would say salty, but to me, it was perfect.  All that spice and salt permeated the outside and helped seal in the juices of the meat.  Tender, moist...didn't need sauce.   My macaroni and cheese side was good-- as were the sweet potato fries.   The BRISKET was unreal.  You can pick lean, fatty, or both, and I recommend getting the "both" option. Tender, juicy, nice browned bits from the outside. LOVE.   Note: They have crushed ice here-- bonus!  $2 small banana pudding super creamy-- wafer cookies IN the pudding and on top.  NOT YELLOW. Delish.   Overall, the casual, but rich, warm interior and mirrored bar area really made us feel welcome.  Nice patio area too. Lots of drink specials daily.   Looking forward to going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large turkey plate w/mac, grilled veg, hush, cran dressing, pickled onions &amp; toast (not pictured)!

bY6cHyZfzCLCz-xsz7H8dQ.text: It was everything we'd hoped for. Moist chicken, tender ribs, friendly staff, full bar and beer selection. Even the fries and coleslaw made us happy.

kFn9fj7U3XuERqAy3di4ZA.text: The reviews for this place sounded so good and I did not realize where it was until the other night.  Right across the street from the Family Dollar Store where Bistro Le Bon is.  Today for lunch - (I did not eat it all).  The small Combo platter was: Chopped Pork, St. Louis Style Ribs, Sausage, Beef Brisket, Hush Puppies, Pickled Onions and two sides - I chose the Jalapenos stuffed with Cheese, wrapped with bacon and BBQ Slaw.  In addition I ordered: Fried Pickles, Sweet Potato Fries, Brown Sugar Bacon (only two slices) and for Dessert the Peanut Butter Cup (a minimum of 700 calories a meal in itself)!  One at a time:  Two very excellent BBQ sauces, One sweeter Tomato Based 4.5 yelp stars.  The second a vinegar based sauce 4.85 stars.  The Meats: NICE Smokey Flavor!!! The Beef Brisket (I needed a knife and not a sharp one and only barely - this brisket was Tender)! Good flavor on its own!  With the vinegar very good 4 stars.  St. Louis Cut Ribs 4.25 yelp stars.  The Sausage was better than many and better than most I've had lately 3.25 stars.  The Chopped Pork  Fantastic 5 stars.  The Brown Sugar Bacon 3.75 stars.  Extras:  The Fried Pickles are a Winner!!!  Thin sliced perfect batter (light and Thin) perfectly cooked an Easy 5 yelp stars and I ate these with no dressing!  They needed nothing the flavor was perfect!  Sweet Potato Fries another winner 5 yelp stars with ease.  The BBQ slaw was good, no mayo, very simple, I added the vinegar BBQ sauce to it so it rates a 3.95 stars.  Stuffed Jalapenos wrapped in Bacon 3.85 stars.  The Hush Puppies and Pickled Onions were throw away items (throw them away!) and NOT factored in to my review rating and that is a good thing for the restaurant!  The Dessert was good (I ate the whole thing) though I would not order it again because I'm very picky - This Dessert will not make my "Dessert" list at 3.6 stars!  Yes I took photos!  Happy Dinning!  The Roof Top dinning area looks real cool so I'll be back for the Cuban Sandwich and see how it stacks up with Carlos Cafe.

Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

B_m3-PP-vzAvgPuIwJxXeQ.text: I am from the North, so I never really had good BBQ until moving down to NC. I tried a few BBQ places down here and they were all great, but somehow Midwood Smokehouse managed to separate itself.  Here is why: Fatty Brisket.....It sounds odd (or maybe it doesn't if you are from the South), but it was awesome.  It melted in your mouth. Everything else was good, but this was the All-Star.  Service was great, too.  Only downside is that the restaurant is a little bit cramped, so it fills up quickly.

zr9XWx20tIQKC5CPDvFG5Q.text: We were visiting Charlotte for the weekend and a friend from NC recommended that we tried their barbecue with vinegar sauce. We found Midwood Smokehouse on Yelp and decided to give it a try. And I'm glad we did! I got the Carolina BBQ with a side of hush puppies and collard greens. It was well-seasoned, perfectly cooked, and the hush puppies reminded me of corn bread, which I love. The portions are super generous and I'm sad that we had a plane to catch and I couldn't take leftovers :(

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

dLV1VlmivAr2iXvIqpYByA.text: This place has the best barbecue in Charlotte or anywhere else I have personally visited.

oZP9iN8FuVvauGd6Kjuc3A.text: We are barbecue lovers but only eat it occasionally out of respect for healthy choices. The reviews on this restaurant looked inspiring, so with no other recommendations than Yelp and on a whim, here we come! It was very crowded, which is always a good sign, we check in and are told it is a 15-30 min wait. Not bad for a weekend in Charlotte. We are asked for a phone number so they can text when our table is ready. We wait, and we wait, and we wait. Parties come and are seated and after a reasonable time, we approach the hostess... OH she says, somehow the communication with our phone number didn't work but we can be seated immediately! In honor of the World Series, Strike One! Server eventually gets to us, we communicate the mixup about being seated and how ravenous we are, and order everything (drinks and food) immediately. She put a rush on it - it all comes out within 5 minutes. That's a Double Hit! Barbecue flavor is good, I will return, but probably to a different location in Charlotte -- Single Hit. Cost of the meal -- here's the problem .....  Its a crying shame when a restaurant feels like their food is SO good they can charge OUTRAGEOUS prices, seat you at a table when you needle them to, impress you with how quickly they can serve you, and NEVER attempt to make it up to you any other way. Friends, that is an OUT! Hence, two stars and I may return --- one day.

kaPXkpmMgQ4c6oza9RgyPQ.text: Probably the best BBQ in Charlotte. I know that is not really saying much seeings that BBQ in Charlotte is known for being mediocre at best, but if you are craving BBQ, and you are in charlotte, this is the best spot period.  Service is always great, food always comes out quick, and the beer is always ice cold.   I suggest getting the bacon wrapped jalapenos. Matter fact order yourself two orders of 'em and thank me later. As for the cheerwine burnt ends, I think they miss the mark, but I know people who love them. I also don't much care for the mac and cheese here, reminds me of grade school when you got the rubbery over cooked underseasoned mac and cheese with the skin on it from the lunch lady who looked like Chris Farley in a hair net, but hey, maybe that's just me. I will say if you dump some of the BBQ sauce into the mac and cheese, it defiantly churches it up a bit and makes it palatable.   This maybe the best BBQ in Charlotte, but I don't believe they have the best sauces in my personal opinion but they are a close 2nd. I'll take good BBQ with an average sauce over bad BBQ with great sauce any day.

JLUDkDj5d-9DhWBePW7rcA.text: This place is awesome! My wife and I had an hour or two to kill in Charlotte so we stopped in for lunch. Great beer selection and a simple menu. I had the pulled pork plate with bacon wrapped jalapenos and I couldn't have been more happy.  I lived in Charlotte for about a year and was always fond of the Thomas st area. There is a lot going on here. I would definitely recommend stopping in here if you are up for some great wood smoked BBQ!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork plate with bacon covered jalapeños and pickled onions.

LmrW1S8kYlIj9S259I3GQg.text: This place is great, plan to wait, it's worth it! The pulled pork was tender, moist, and just enough bark for flavor. I recommend the house sauce, has an. Nice little smokey taste to it. BBQ beans were great too, another had the brisket, said it was great too. We left full and happy, it's a bit loud, but a great time had by all.

S-lebnynqgEptWhBKAqoTQ.text: Our first visit to Midwood ensured that it won't be our last! Guests from out-of-town wanted some "real Carolina BBQ". Since we wanted to show off our lovely city, we went to the Central Ave. location. We could smell how delicious dinner would be from the parking lot! Our server was helpful and friendly and attentive without hovering. Everything we ordered (and the table was groaning, I'm sure) was spot-on! Meats were tender and smoky, sides were all delicious, hush puppies were crunchy and delightful. We all left happily filled up and the one in our party who "was never really crazy about barbecue" is now absolutely converted and anxious to return. Definitely on our list of favorites now!

63OiWlVFYp08thZk-T3V2Q.text: I have had barbecue from many restaurants but this by far has got to be one of the best barbecue I've had around the barbecue was nice and smoked the sides were nice and big I had the french fries and baked beans baked beans are really good had a green and red peppers and I will definitely come again

QbwZF_sP1nfkbZw-C3dvxg.text: Amazing. Amazing, Amazing. Brisket is ridiculous. My wife had the smoked salmon, it was also great. From California, so we had to try N Carolina BBQ and I'd say they make their state proud. Great BBQ sauces, and their mustard sauce is mouth watering good. They sell their rub and sauces, which I purchased, making this place a must. Our waitress, won't say her name for privacy, blonde curly hair is amazing. Love this place.

RHZuBw8Qw9hjn_rYLOSC4w.text: This is another totally overrated BBQ place.  How is it that few in this town have experienced really succulent ribs with a dry rub?  I had a brisket sandwich...barely passable.  Maybe customers at Midwood should eat first, to really taste the food, then drink their spirits to help them forget they just overpaid for mediocre BBQ.  In case you think I'm wrong-take a drive up to Saluda, NC It just 90 minutes west of here-there's a place called Green River BBQ   Their brisket sandwich is as good as great sex!  It's a hole in the wall, been there for years, owned and operated by a woman who cares about the food, the service, the customer.

SfdbKSLKsiNK1lhiBDOGOQ.text: We just got our doors blown off fro this place - all the proteins are smoked to perfection. I think this place should be in some barbecue hall of fame!Try the combo and Pig Out!

-VCSMhK0NXsbysJMLMdyNg.text: Great BBQ! Went twice, first time I had the brisket, second time burnt ends. Made sure to order a large portion, so I could have some for lunch the day after as well. Definitely a place to go if you're visiting Charlotte.

G-vb3asUrN2ceVObbmKJ9w.text: Got the combo platter. I'd rate: 1. Fatty brisket 2. Smoked sausage 3/4 pork or chicken depending on my mood.  Try the bacon wrapped jalapenos.

IDlU0Sy-eegJ01MqPviljQ.text: Wow! thats all I can say...I've been to BBQ places up & down the east coast, and this ranks right up there with the best in terms of quality, value, and customer service.  I had the BBQ Chicken and chopped salad...both off the charts good!!  If you're reading this to decide whether to order here or not...don't deny yourself and TRY IT!!  100% amazeballs!!

KsrBYL448Vn5k70r_ZuFEQ.text: No place can beat this place when it comes to BBQ and ribs. When I come, I usually get the Well Fed combo platter (sometimes Pig Out when really hungry) and the 4 proteins I choose are Carolina chopped pork, Saint Louis style pork ribs, beef brisket, and pulled chicken BBQ. It comes with hushpuppies and two sides (I absolutely love their cream corn hands down). The BBQ sauce there is absolutely delicious and I can't get enough of it. Service is great and efficient. It doesn't take us long to order because we get the same thing and the wait is relatively short. I definitely recommend everyone to download their reservation app to reserve a table rather than driving there and waiting till your table is ready. Parking is very limited that sometimes you might have to park at the shopping village lot across the street if it's filled. Servers are very friendly and helpful. This place gets a lot of business, especially since it's not that far from uptown and everyone enjoys walking around the Plaza Midwood location.

aJYjR-SIYPyHc5eaetqkiQ.text: Just needed some good food so saw this had a lot of good reviews and was nearby.  Not a very large place and parking isn't plentiful in the immediate area, but don't let that detour you from stopping in.  You can start smelling the smoke doing its work before you even enter.  Walked in at 7:30 on a Wednesday and it was crowded but were able to get seated right away at a table but decided to sit at the bar instead.  Decent beer selection and heavy on the local breweries.  Split appetizer of the pimento cheese fries, no meat on it as we didn't want to fill up, but it was a lot and excellent.  Added a little hot sauce for a kick made these even better.  Split a 3 taco plate, one chicken and two pork BBQ, liked the pork but the chicken was outstanding.  Also shared a side of the smoked veggies and collards that were both very good.  They make their own pepper vinegar and it is good on everything, especially the greens.  Would recommend but it is a BBQ place, expect to walk out with a hint of that great smoke aroma with you so keep in mind what you are doing after.

OZh9Yv6CmvP-BRGwJAOqhw.text: AMAZING! We had the combo platter with 2 sides (Pig Out size). Split between 3 people and it was perfect! I dont live in NC, but if I'm ever back, I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo Platter

18hPWGj0deGUJXUJWfbuwQ.text: Great Barbecue spot! Fantastic BBQ chicken sandwich. The Midwood sauce is a nice spicy rich sauce. Good local craft beer options. Service was fast and friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

sTSqUCiGPcdiDORdeRj8BA.text: This place was legit.  The burnt ends required no additional sauce, and the side options were so impressive that I ordered a third.  The sweet tea was good, and we ended the meal with some banana pudding.  I also found the staff to be quite friendly.  I'll be back!

NSzbY1Z2-4GuG2FZtnQVkA.text: Can't go wrong with Midwood Snokehouse! There is often a wait but it is a nice atmosphere for waiting.  Food is excellent!  Service is great.  Atmosphere is fun!  Good value.  Give it a try!

DTPyY3nSHlHWPrLavUXt1g.text: When President Obama and Hillary Clinton made a a pit stop at Midwood Smokehouse, then it must be the one spot everyone may agree on. So when I had the chance to be in Charlotte, BBQ is what was for dinner. Who would want to miss out on this.   I sat at the bar and ordered the large Beef Brisket plate with two sides (Classic Mac & Cheese and Smoked Veggies) with hushpuppies & pickled onions.  Oh my Goodness. Very delicious and generous North Carolina barbecue for for under $20.   A meal at Midwood will never fill you with regret.  Five Yelps
