FMHElnpArKzCDu3jw1Jf1g.text: I can't say enough good things about this restaurant. We had Yolanda as our server, and her personality shined through as she served us. She is absolutely what the world needs today. We had the nachos and banana pudding. Both the brisket and the pork were probably the best bbq I've ever had. And that habanero sauce!! The banana pudding was an absolutely amazing texture. I don't ever write reviews, but this restaurant deserves only the highest stars for their hospitality and amazing flavor!

pjuZ8hqunb7sJqeHgEMxcA.text: We came here while at a scentsy event. We were sat immediately. Food was good and the service was great.

-_ebkP3oZ1IMKEKouM_Egg.text: I'm not the only one to say it, but this is the best bbq I've had. The fatty brisket is phenomenal. So tender, not blobs of fat. The ribs have a crispy char and fabulous taste. The pecan cobbler is chewy, crunchy and sweet. Fantastic.

PjCugDTjZYeXufo1OD-cXw.text: First let me say my waiter, BH, is awesome! He knows what I want every time! Lol ;) :*  .... Their Mac n Cheese hits the spots every time, seriously the best around Charlotte!!! And the quesadilla which I had for the first time last week, well, it was pretty delicious too!!! Hush puppies!! House margarita!! Both great things as well!   We all know I'll be going back!

zBHSLuc_pE3LqfO_S0MlIA.text: Great BBQ place in Charlotte. Very close to downtown, the location was convenient and in an up and coming area. I had the BBQ combo, chicken and St. Louis style ribs. Both were excellent. The ribs were done perfectly and had a great authentic smoked flavor. The mac and cheese was one of the best I've ever had, I would come back just for it.  There was a good beer selection, with several local options to try. Overall, great casual spot for BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs and chicken combo.

vusLZcmxDsIEO632zpiXeQ.text: The waiter wasn't good at giving information. We ended up paying $3 more for something we had no ideal would be added. And the manager wasn't the best. I had raw onions in my banana pudding and I'm allergic to raw onions. They are not as great as the reviews are saying.

-lNO2l3n-ZF0LkzpQKBkIg.text: I had the Hickory Salmon and collard greens with a Moscow Mule. It was magnificent. I thoroughly enjoy the atmosphere. Great experience!!!

g8tYUM6Jwv0XEzPrDHpDAA.text: This is probably my favorite BBQ restaurant that I've ever been to. I'm from Miami, so great BBQ spots are hard to come by. This was the 2nd time I went to Midwood, and both time they were fantastic! We were the first people to show up when they opened at 11, as we had to make the trek back to Asheville for our flight back to Miami. As I was the only one that had frequented before, i helped my group order and we all loved every item that came! I had the combo platter, which is essentially a bbq smorgasbord where you pick 4 protein items. I went with the bbq pulled pork, the st. Louis style ribs, the burnt ends and the brisket. You have the option to go lean, fatty, or somewhere in the middle. I went for the middle bc i wanted the full flavor of both! My wife had the cedar smoked salmon which had the best smokey flavor! My friends ordered the special of the day, the massive beef rib. It's exactly what the name implies: a MASSIVE RIB WITH TONS OF MEAT. It was delectable! Also, being sunday, they had $5 tito's bloody Mary's! Cant beat that!!!   Seriously top notch bbq, midwood is the reigning champ for me....until I visit dallas and Memphis this year.  Dont go anywhere else in Charlotte for Great bbq!!

unbQuwC8FQVNbdKAiQvrBw.text: Hands down the best BBQ I've had in recent memory. The fam and I were in the area for a graduation and stopped here prior to the drive back home. Everything was on point, indoor/outdoor seating with no wait, the service was pleasant/quick and the food was EXCELLENT! Started out with some bacon wrapped jalapenos, all nice size, plenty of bacon and cheese with just enough heat. I couldn't decide what I wanted so I ordered the 4 protein platter with burnt ends, smoked sausage, brisket and pulled pork. On the side some crinkle fries, baked beans and hush puppies. All the protein was cooked perfectly, moist with just enough smokeyness. The stand alone for me was the burnt ends, so damn good I didn't want it to end but it was all very good. The have some sauces available that aren't even necessary if u ask me but they were good one a more transitional and the other a vinegar based. I perfered tge vinegar based. The baked beans were some of the best ive had good consistency excellent taste. To wash it all down a seasonal smoked beer available for a limited time, to me tasted like a light lager went perfectly with the meal. Ending on a tastey bowl of delicious banana pudding that I wish i had gotten the larger size of. All in, a great experience. If am ever back in this area I will for sure return.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

yL7jsByU-RQ-pxoQphx4Rw.text: I'd say one of the best places to get BBQ around uptown Charlotte. I had the caramelized pork cubes and that was every bit of tasty! The staff is very friendly and helpful. I ate around 2:30 and it was fairly slow but my food came out fast! Will have to come back and try their Carolina pulled pork and banana pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

w6-uY9oEb6gpxMOdLIbd2Q.text: Best BBQ in Charlotte.....  Maybe.  4.5 star restaurant, not even close IMO.  I don't get the hype at all.  Better than Mac's and most of the well known competition in town, but that isn't saying much.  Charlotte is a desert for solid southern BBQ.  The jalapeno poppers are good.  I'm down whenever.  The wings are pretty good.  Although, I'd rather have McCoy's smoke house if that was the only reason I was going.  The combo options seem to be the best deal if you have more than 3 or so people.  Get the brisket, get the ribs and then whatever else suits your fancy.  Bottom line.  I'll be back.  But, it wouldn't be hard for another place to sway my vote for best BBQ in the queen city.

xVA9KNnhzjY3tYULJJTq4g.text: We love MidWood Smokehouse! It Is a great option for both dine in and take out. There is an option for everybody on the menu. Highly recommend!

0ksnD6p4g_2WydAZD-ytjA.text: Be forewarned, this place is usually packed, so calculate at least a 20 min wait into your dinner plans.  I've never had issues being sat, but I've also never seen this restaurant empty, so I recommend plan accordingly.  However, the food is great (I recommend the beef brisket with the fat or burnt ends) and the servers are amazing.  Everytime I've been in, our server has chatted us up, given us great advice as to places to check out, and is very timely with the drinks, meal, and check.  I've never had to wait or wondered where my server was.  The only reason I'm not giving this place a 5 star rating is because the food isn't consistently top-notch.  I've been in and have had the best burnt ends I've ever tasted, and I've been in and been really disappointed with my meal.  Like I said, it's always busy, so I'm not sure why it's inconsistent, but I'll go back nonetheless.

_FgiO0UjEYmxEDU5UDWlMA.text: This place makes me proud to be an American...  Good manhattans, great IPAs.  BBQ so good you'll want to slap your Grandma...  Hight level cleanliness.  Encountered staff in the restroom that did three cycle hand wash.  I thought he was getting ready for surgery...  Wait staff was very helpful in determining how to set up My first order to best experience the offering.    Try the cuban, ribs and wings.  You wont be disappointed!  A True piece of Americana...  love it

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs and wings!

zFkNBvXIHWq2qruYhQJf6w.text: Two words. Mac&Cheese. The photos on yelp perked my interest and I wasn't disappointed! The beef brisket was juicy, tender and made up for the fact that they didn't have pulled pork as an option. The fat melted in your mouth and I cleared the plate. The mac&cheese was so incredibly cheesy and gooey, and I will definitely be returning! The cream corn with jalapenos is an interesting twist that you won't regret. There are two different options of cole slaw, I got the bbq slaw, and it went great with the sweet sauce on my brisket. I'm picky when it comes to hushpuppies, and it was the first time I enjoyed someone else's other than mine. Great sauces, food and atmosphere. You get out of the car and smell smoked meats, you can't ask for anything better than that.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

zxDAUnbvMI1YNDjE5lTABQ.text: The best tging about Midwood Smokehouse is the service. You are always warmly invited in, and the bar staff is open and professional. Obama and Clinton passed tgrough these doors, and regardless of your affiliation, there is an air of history. Check out tge bathrooms and you're up for a treat. A pre-pc, transgender bathroom treat.   The Cuban Sandwich is one of the best in Charlotte but I usually go for the beef brisker served heavily marbled or lean.   The sauces come in tang, sweet, hot, sangy sweet and sour. Both vinegar and molasses based sauces are readily available.  I love this restaurant.

57XzsH8vSPm8_6_UH7XcIQ.text: This is top three barbeque spot in all of Charlotte. I have been here a few times and honestly the quality and quantity of food are always good here.  They actual have really good tasting drafts if you are into beer with daily specials too. We ordered the pimento cheese fries as this is how pimento cheese should taste ! I have had it with brisket before and that is good enough for a meal. I had the brisket sandwich and it is really good of course as you can tell they take time to prepare their meat.   My favorite along with just about everyone's are the burnt ends. Must try! If you need to google burnt ends please do... but you must try them here!  Be warned that the parking it limited here and you will probably wait to get into this place.   This BBQ is well worth the wait and maybe  possible do a uber or lyft here because you can walk to Workman's friend , Legion, Whiskey Warehouse , or wherever afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento cheese fries

w8V9I7LJbxUkauACkrOjFQ.text: It is a really good place, for their food and drink. There two reasons I gave them three stars. One is because the waiter at the front desk were not efficient even you already checked in with them. They asked me to wait for another 10-15 minutes even after I received the "table is ready" text. We waited for awhile (longer than 10-15 minutes) there was no one called us until I walked in and asked about the table again. Then she said "Oh! Actually the table is ready!" Then brought us to a table which I saw it was ready since we first stepped into the place. But our waiter of the night was pretty good. She cares about what we need. Just the waiter at the front desk wasn't that friendly. The other reason I gave them three stars is because THEY FORGOT OUR HASH PUPPIES!!! Me and my friend ordered a combo platter, pig-out, which is four kinds of meat of your choice with hushpuppies, pickle onions and other two sides of your choice. But THEY FORGOT THE HUSHPUPPIES. I have to say that it was also my mistake because I didn't realize that. I just felt that something was missing until I went back home and looked at the pictures I took for food, then I realized that THEY DID NOT GIVE US HUSHPUPPIES. This is kind of disappointed. But beyond these two reasons, their BBQ and drink are still pretty good! Also the appetizer, bacon wrapped jalapenos is really good! I'll definitely recommend that! Overall, I'll still recommend the place, just make sure they GIVE YOU YOUR HUSHPUPPIES!

spXt36HqzzMYI5JqqPjrtw.text: BBQ joints come in all sorts of technicolor glory, from the creaky houses of yore, where you leave smelling like you're wearing SIde of Beef cologne with a sprinkle of sauce for good measure, to the newer, more refined varieties, each with their own specialty, from which they dare not stray.   These are not issues for Midwood Smokehouse, which does a variety of items on it's menu very, very well (thankyouverymuch), and they're delighted if you'd like another, come to mention it. And more of the good stuff is the attitude you'd best enter with in this wonderland of juicy cuts. At this sitting, I swooped in after the South Carolina mustard sauce with some brown sugar bacon (natch) on the back end. And if you're after some stand-up brisket, these guys do that pretty well too.   They brought some slabs out that would stand up to the stoutest Texan brought up on beef BBQ. In all, they do a brisk biz here and I though I was a shade concerned by the corner strip center space, I needn't be. These guys had all the bases covered (except, oddly, for root beer, which may not mean much to locals but is sometimes a staple of BBQ joints I've hit. The waitress responded to its suggestion like it was a pleasant surprise).   In the end, there was so much good stuff going down here that I couldn't tackle all of it. But these are the fun challenges you best savor again and again, like I'm sure I will.

OgYluwggVA4V4vfz4aUt0w.text: Great NC pulled pork with warm vinegar sauce. Great BBQ coleslaw. Pimento cheese fries were very good. Good service. Highly recommended

LzLYDh8W_WL3Ublx_cIsgw.text: This place insists in disappointing us with their terrible service. It so Saturday at 8.30 PM. The waitress has the gall to tell us that it is "late" in a Saturday so they don't have either the drink I want (because they ran out of "one of the ingredients") or the food we all want. This place keeps tempting us with good food but pushes us away with consistently bad servers, consistent mismanagement of food inventory and a general feeling of carelessness.

4A8w0tmww7NJoyNrlQ96PA.text: After posting my review, Cory L. got in touch with me and wanted more information about my visit. She was very responsive and even asked my thoughts on things. This proves to me that I had a rare occurrence when I was there, as I thought may have been the case. Big thumbs up to customer service and Cory! Thank you for taking the time to respond. I look forward to my next visit there, I have been wanting more of that brisket and the bacon wrapped jalapenos!

hKuFbmFl4BasDF71Ul137w.text: Smells amazing when you walk in...tons of food, and very friendly staff!  I left completely stuffed, and content.  Staff is awesome!

TOvYu8UYh362oLiwuG3LhA.text: Got the Carolina pork with spicy BBQ. Liked it to the point where i would eat it again, but not enough to land it on my short list of eating destinations. i was really looking forward to the bacon jalapenos but they turned out to be not as great as i imagined. Mine actually weren't spicy at all. i actually enjoyed the hush puppies more. The banana pudding was pretty darn good and very well priced so don't forget to order it.

iSJ6cSdfMXFWAO1qvQqDBw.text: Best BBQ in Charlotte hands down. Very busy on nights and weekends so expect a wait. Pulled pork platter is my go to. But the best thing on the menu is the brisket queso...a must try for everyone.

bqB03f3PwNUIadnFIQ0svQ.text: Had an excellent meal here.  Went there for my Graduation from CPCC with family and all of the food choices we had were delicious.  My favorite would be the Bar-b-que queso.  We choose  to go with the pulled pork, but I am sure the brisket would have been good also.  My smoked turkey was moist and very thick sliced.  Friendly staff made for a great dining experience with our four year old.  I would recommend for both couples out for a drink and families with children also.   If there was one complaint is was that their small parking lot is full most of the time, but that doesn't seem like a problem at all now does it?

apDYTy3j0HTIijQE8m47bw.text: Good service and good basic BBQ but nothing out of this world.  I had burnt ends, which were good.  Good draft beer selection.

ccCPzEBK3Df4Vi5-p2QrAw.text: Bbq is everywhere in the Carolinas. However, what I tried at Midwood Smokehouse stood out! I recommend going with the sampler platter and trying it all with a partner. The best meats were the ribs and brisket. Normally ribs at restaurants are grey bland meat, but these ribs were full of flavor and very meaty. Good selection of beers and cocktails.

DhRHYrbuDL_3SdLEC6V_yw.text: I love the fun atmosphere of Midwood Smokehouse. The service has been good at the bar. This last time I ordered the roasted chicken, collards and vinegar slaw. I thought that the chicken was a bit dryer than I would like. The first time I ordered the chicken it was just right so maybe this was an anomaly. The collards and slaw were very fine. The take out packaging was good and the bartender checked everything before I left. The biggest negative is their wine offerings. Their beer selection is great but if you are not a beer drinker and prefer wine, it's pretty slim and just "OK" even though they serve the wine in very cool cafeteria milk glasses from my youth... Lets put forth a bit more effort on wine please.

oOxGgJlIB9uSKnqE37IlOg.text: Midwood Smokehouse is unbelievable! I've been here a few times when I was absolutely craving some nice NC bbq. I usually get the BBQ pork sandwich and add cheddar cheese--unusual but makes the sandwich so good. Their bbq baked beans are also incredible! Looking for great southern bbq in Noda? This is the place to go!

eXawHLqVAH8vRRfqFw_JAQ.text: I really wanted to like Midwood Smokehouse.  It's right down the road, they have good beer specials & I'm a big fan of bbq.  But the quality is just not there.    I liked the cuban sandwich, it wasn't amazing but it was certainly tasty & the mac & cheese is pretty decent,  but everything else there I've had has been seriously lacking.  I ordered a BBQ plate the second time we went there & the bbq was completely dry & their sauce did nothing to help it.  The third time I had a bbq sandwich & ended up with food poisoning.    A word of warning, the bacon jalapenos are no joke, they are absurdly spicy, too spicy for me even.

ZNSD4ThO0TGtWTh1yfA8hA.text: Best beef brisket sandwich I've ever had. Mac and cheese was pretty awesome. Great service and atmosphere.

rc14VkzEuubCgheKmSMjRA.text: Shared the combo plate with Mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos.  Brisket,  ribs, sausage, and pulled pork were all great.  Sauces excellent especially the spicy and eastern nc vinegar based.  Atmosphere is nice and service fine.

DOsWSo_zxrNjLcHl9cZEHQ.text: Decided to come by here after visiting the record shop nearby as I saw a lot of people dining here. Parking was an absolute hot mess but somehow found a spot in an alley. The place was really loud, had sort of a bar atmosphere. Could see this being a great place to catch a game. They had a happy hour special on shiner bock which was awesome. Service wasn't that slow considering how busy they were. I ended up getting the brisket and when it finally arrived I wasn't too impressed. It was a little overcooked for my taste. Such a disappointment. My date had the cheese fries and they were pretty good. Overall not a bad experience but not a place I foresee myself visiting anytime soon.

ywYDOgPlP-PbN3IOd3SIjg.text: Awesome.  This place has awesome BBQ.  It's really busy all the time so I recommend getting there early.  The portions are way to big but you get to try everything.  The pimento cheese fries rock and you don't need the meat on them unless you want to into a food coma before dinner.  I was surprised that the brisket was so well cooked.  They obviously take their time making it because it's really tender.  They have a large beer selection supporting the local Charlotte breweries among others.    Service was fast and they have a knowledgeable wait staff.  I also have ordered their bulk to-go food for parties and was not disappointed except for the kitchen manager who was kind of a jerk on the phone.

N_x2clFb-wbpbYS4Xvq1Xw.text: So last night I volunteered for the CF Foundation at the Brewer's Ball and was fortunate enough to meet some of the staff from Midwood Steakhouse  and indulge in delectable tastings.   The brisket was butter -- and that was the word floating about all night at the Brewer's Ball. So finally when I took a break I b-lined it over to their table.   The brisket was amazing, falling off your fork amazing.  The juices ran clear and the outside was perfectly seasoned. They also paired the brisket with a sweet vinegar and sweet onion mixture - wow that was truly amazing as well. Being on a carb free diet I left the bun behind and opted for a beer -- my carb cheat!   I'm truly excited to get my family into this establishment so that I can try their other offerings. And hopefully to see the staff again!   Hey Amy -- it was a pleasure meeting you last night!

jEMRMQ2Mz2Z5ZfwqKYUwmw.text: I had the Pimento Cheese Fries, Burnt Ends and fries. The pimento cheese was bland and didn't add anything to the fries. I honestly could've done without it. Burnt Ends were a different experience. I liked the idea of crispy brisket, but half of the cubes were partially fat and there didn't seem to be enough flavor in the BBQ Sauce. They were alright, but i don't think i would order them again. The beer specials were good and the service was excellent. No complaints there.

c9p-Bs-rBh7HElwbaueQ1g.text: Amazing every time! We love this place. By far the best BBQ in Charlotte. Try the brisket and the bacon wrapped jalapenos. Also, they have great beer selections!

EqOIDiyzlvf5SHHhR57t4g.text: When in the Carolinas one must find some legit BBQ! I'm glad we found this joint.  They have an extensive beer menu with every type of local beer your heart could desire. Also, a full bar with a variety of Moscow mules.   For an appetizer would ordered the bacon wrapped jalapenos... oh my my my!!! Four delicious jalapenos stuffed and wrapped with perfectly crisp bacon and served with a style ranch dipping sauce.. if I wasn't sitting with two other adults I easily could've inhaled all four of these!!    For our main course we ordered the pig out. It's a choice of four meats, two sides and hash puppies. Our meats were the beef brisket, dry ribs, pulled pork, and jalapeno cheddar sausage. Our sides were Mac n cheese and smoked veggies. I am assuming the star of the show is the meat because the portions of the sides included were small.. portioned for one person. We decided to ordered an extra side of Mac n cheese and sweet potato fries.   The meats- beef brisket was nice and juicy with a perfect ratio of meat and fat. The ribs were the star of the show for me.. literally the most meat I have ever had on a rib.. and the rub was perfect.. they didn't even need a sauce. The jalapeno cheddar sausage was not a let down either.. i loved that when I cut into them the cheddar came streaming out. Pulled pork is always good.. not too dry but you definitely have you pour some Carolina bbq to spice it up.   First time here.. won't be my last. See you next time smokehouse heaven!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Homemade Mac n cheese
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dry ribs
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked veggies

REFvfw9tk4e3GWl2-9Zx6g.text: Absolutely AMAZING!! From the service to the food, hands down this place was the best! My son has a fish allergy so I called prior to arrival to make sure they could accommodate us. However,  I was given the wrong information. Thankfully our server, Wayne, was not only knowledgeable with the ingredients used, he double checked with the chef on everything for my son. I was so appreciative of that alone. Wayne was phenomenal and such a pleasure to have as our server. I'm from Miami where people like him are rare. He made our last dinner in North Carolina a memorable one!   The food was so delicious that I already want to go back! Even though their sauces are amazing, the food had so much flavor that it wasn't even needed! If your around a Midwood Smokehouse, put it on your list. You wont be disappointed!

xmEESIukhxk_dPdf1DZ5oQ.text: This establishment right here saved our trip to Charlotte with probably the best BBQ in our the state. Not only did the food taste GREAT but the service was superb! Also received kudos from others that I have referred to this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

5nk9gFl0R-gfVWC0_thxRw.text: Off night at Midwood 8/1/2019, ordered at 6:56 ready at 7:40. Was told on the phone ribs wouldn't be ready for another hour, cool no biggie, I'll have my Well Fed with double fatty brisket. Y'all, I got three pieces of tough brisket. Four small pieces of burnt ends and very dry bacon wrapped jalapenos. Also, no spicy vinegar as requested for the flavorless collards. BUMMER. We were here last Saturday night and it was great.   BEWARE INCONSISTENCIES

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Well Fed

o8LYfvbes1-epKLvKJwABw.text: Wow, what a great place! Atmosphere is awesome, food is great, beer selection diverse, and a whiskey and Bourbon menu that seems endless.  We had a gourmet grilled cheese that my daughter couldn't stop raving about. The En Fuego Tacos were a crowd pleaser to my son and the wife and I split the Carolina Pork. I've had Carolina pork before, but never liked it (though never in-state). Their version of the vinegar sauce has to be the reason it has become a staple in the Tarheel state. We couldn't get enough. All the sides were delicious, from the jalapenos' wrapped in bacon, collard greens, and Mac and cheese.  This place is a must go!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

AllCU9kdWbZ6UPup6J9zaQ.text: We stopped here for lunch on the way to Atlanta. I really regret not taking pics!!! Everything here was amazing. I think between the 3 of us we had a good mixture of items and we were all satisfied. I had the beef brisket - this was the best I've ever had. Super yummy. Will definitely be back if ever in the area.

KzXhfwr1r6B8qMXJHQuUdA.text: This is an easy recommendation for a place that really doesn't need an introduction if you're a local. There might be lesser known barbeque places in Charlotte that are worth going to, but you can't go wrong here.  The ambience is that of a pretty typical restaurant bar. They do have an upstairs outdoor patio. Our service was fine for a group of four.  We tried the sampler with brisket, pulled pork, pulled chicken, a rack of ribs, and two sides (Mac and cheese and collared greens). The regular portion was enough to share for two people and the food was perfect. Unfortunately they were out of fatty brisket and burnt ends, which I would have loved to try, but when you go to a place an hour before closing that smokes their meats fresh daily, you're going to have that. They have the vinegary sauce and a more standard barbeque as well. Beer selection is mostly local crafts.  Carolina barbeque isn't my favorite regional style, but that's not a knock. If I'm being honest, I love them all, and I'm always looking for the local favorites when I'm on the road. You can get great food here.

K0EmBC8Wl8Job7wkDmv7cw.text: When visiting Charlotte from out of town, we decided to eat lunch at the restaurant with the most reviews on Yelp (which was easy to do with Yelp's search function). Midwood Smokehouse came up - at almost 1500 reviews, we had to see what all the fuss was about!  Midwood exceeded our expectations! We were seated right away and the server was very accommodating to us with a high chair and kids menu for our son. Glad to see that it is kid friendly, with a changing table in the restroom too. The rest of the visit went very smoothly despite seeming very busy for lunch.  Food wise, I ordered brisket based on the server's recommendation. I loved it! There was bbq sauce at the table but the meat didn't need any; it was so flavorful. Hungry husband had a 4 meat platter and loved his meal too. My favorite side was the bacon wrapped jalapenos. I only tried one as it was my husband's choice but they were very good. Prices were fair for the portions and quality.  The only negative was the parking. It was packed on a Friday afternoon (but no wait for a table, thankfully, using the Yelp option to reserve a table). We parked on the street and walked a short distance. We would definitely recommend this place to others and come back if we are in the area again!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside - kid friendly (high chairs, kid menu, and changing table in restroom)
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket, sweet potato fries, hush puppies
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 4 meat plate with collards and bacon wrapped jalapeños

7lwLdDalbv77vixPrLjSRA.text: My boyfriend and I are visiting from Minnesota / Tampa (long story) and were excited to try some BBQ. Upon finding Midwood on Yelp, we decided to see if it lived up to it's hype. While we decided that it did, it wasn't perfect. We ordered 10 Wings Half Crispy Half Smoked with Ranch and Blue Cheese for $9 and a Large Plate of Pulled Pork with Hushpuppies, Coleslaw, and Mac & Cheese for $12.50. With tip it came to a little less than $30 for the two of us which is a fine price and the service was fast. However, our mac & cheese was pretty bad. No taste, a bit cold, and tough. The pulled pork was good but not even close to the best I've had. I really enjoyed the wings, hush puppies, and coleslaw though. I'd recommend this restaurant if you're looking for BBQ in the Charlotte area.

iALEChwAOlv01tl4t1a0kg.text: I loveeeeeeee Midwood Smokehouse. Not only is the food Delicious, but I had to do a last minute catering order for a realtor open house. I called them a hour before the event was scheduled to take place & they got everything prepared & ready for pickup exactly at the time I requested. I was extremely impressed & will always support this wonderful business

zjXCHhlvmnLyUjswsDcFPQ.text: I have lived in Charlotte for several years and hear everyone rave about this place and finally tried it. Was not disappointed! The food was amazing!! Burnt ends on point and the Mac-n-cheese was the best I've ever had!

LxY0FTTj0J-a-jns9f2hyg.text: You can't beat this old fashioned smokehouse where all meats are cooked on a smoker. This is what the server told us. This location is has a nice section outside and two seating sections on the inside. The customer service was excellent the server was very knowledgeable and informed us about the many different options available. I like the old schoolness of the menu as they have large and small portion sizes of main plates. Also they have daily specials both food to drinks. The drink special I had was the Smokey Rita blood orange margarita. It was average, but they specialize in bbq. So I ordered the large Pulled bbq chicken. With Coleslaw sweet potato fries and hush puppies. The chicken was moist and ripe for their sauces. I tried all but the Carolina sauce, the spicy sauce was excellent but may be a little to spicy if you are not used to spicy. I'd say a 6 out of 10 on JJ spice scale. Unfortunately without the sauce the chicken was a little bland but still good. I also added some bread to my order, which I would recommend. Overall the service is great The food was good I would give it a 3.5 out of 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kids Macaroni and cheese with fruit
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Wings
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled chicken with coleslaw and sweet potato fries

WpuLyWohYeoxn5a-2_Il_g.text: Ordered delivery from Midwood via DoorDash while staying in Charlotte- definitely would recommend.   The pulled pork was tender, greens were seasoned and cooked perfectly, banana pudding was perfect.   Definitely planning to try them in house next time I'm in the area!

dKevdE2sauicuQjqkgnD_A.text: First time visitor and can't say enough about the experience and food. Waitress Mindy was fabulous as was the cornbread. But you have to pray the have since it is made in small batches.   Cornbread- 11 on a scale of 1 to 10 Tacos - awesome  Beef and pork burnt tips - awesome  Drinks - awesome  Mac n cheese side - awesome  Backed beans - awesome  Hush puppies- good (sorry but not awesome) Bacon wrapped Jalapeno - awesome   In a great area with other watering holes around. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef and pork tips
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taco

EGXM9h6oEDyj66sjzAAEjA.text: Well they have all the meats!! We loved the authentic barbecue flavors and more. We shared a platter which had so much food we were full the rest of the evening. The sides were okay, didn't really care for the jalapeno poppers, but that could be our preference. Service was nice and they explained everything we wanted to order. We will be back whenever we need our carnivorous desire met.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

55-ZLBch0uNsYb82RSuHPw.text: I grew up in the south with your standard backyard pulled pork barbecue, but if you're looking for somewhere with a little more class while still remaining authentic, this is a great place. The brisket is fantastic, as are the salads. The Kickin Mule is my favorite drink...it's a mule with jalapenos in it. Holy moly, is it amazing!

ce9PXFEyegg2PnNtHkpjWA.text: I could never give this place less than five stars!  I felt like it tonight but didn't only because of the service and food. We were seated outside in the enclosed patio and it was cramped to say the least but the worst part was the chairs. Every time someone moved they would drag across the concrete and make a loud scratching sound.  Other than that, I was happy as always and I'll keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs, burnt ends, sausage leftovers!!

wZaN1bXJPLU6lwmbXZiPJw.text: First, I'm from Lexington and it's hard for me to find a BBQ place I love outside of Lexington. Midwood is the exception, I love their Carolina pulled pork BBQ and I try and get there several times each year. Always busy and hoppin with customers, but always friendly staff and great food, well worth any wait. I also recommend their bacon wrapped jalapenos they are to die for :-) as well as the good local beers! I wish they would add a BBQ salad (very popular in Lexington) to their menu. I would be happy to be a beta tester/sampler of it if Midwood ever wants to try adding it to their menu. Highly highly recommend!!

1dRPkt-AxCRU_MD05eWO1A.text: Got away from the hotel - dealio in uptown for some good eats in/near the NODA area, and Midwood Smokehouse was excellent. Great brew & bourbon selection too.  Got the 4 protein platter, upgrading chopped chix to burnt ends, with mac & cheese and beans as my sides...all good.  Food was room temp at best, which wasn't all that bad. Flavor was good, and portions were decent...a lil' skimpy on the brisket and heavy on the pork. Also, pork was on the too-salty side. Would have preferred to eat somewhere other than the bar, since it's a busy bar, but limited seating for 1 which isn't unusual.  Prices are very reasonable. My meal with 2 IPA's was $45. I'd be inclined to try another BBQ place next time, just to compare.

hKp5Htuhfc9RxzizZTXktw.text: I was in Charlotte for work and wanted bbq. It was very busy on a Monday night, the wait for a table to myself was 25 minutes, so I decided to just sit at the bar. I ordered the Well-Fed combo platter with chopped pork, beef brisket, 1/2 rack of ribs, and pulled chicken. My sides were creamed corn and Mac & cheese. This was way too much food for myself and I did not even finish 1/4 of it. My favorite meat was the ribs--the bone slid right off the meat. I could have done without the pulled chicken, it was not my favorite. The creamed corn was delicious. My favorite sauce was their South Carolina Mustard.  The bartenders were very busy, but super friendly and attentive to the customers at the bar.

Vtip5jBSOtl51lQLhjAb_A.text: the ribs and the brisket were KILLER. my goodness, we had a variety plate and I wish I would have only ordered ribs. The sides were also flavorful, and I appreciated the variety in sauces available. The brisket fell apart en route from the platter to my plate...that is how tender it was. I was pleased with this stop and would come back again.

uiLW95XyB5VH0ZJdNWEfgQ.text: I did the  Beef Brisket, Chicken BBQ, Smoked Veggies and Crinkle Cut Fries. Of the two, the chicken was by far the better as the brisket was way to fatty. I mean, I like to have some fat on the meat, but when the fat to meat ratio is more fat, it seems like a waste. The smoked veggies, maybe it was because it was the end of the day, but I did not bother to eat them, they just tasted gross. Of course the fries were good!  Overall, I would come here to eat the chicken again and maybe try the burnt ends or the pulled pork,

Rzrsk5c3J_GMX5WbQGww-w.text: Visited this location yesterday 7/9/17 for my moms bday lunch. We were a group of 6 and though they were busy (1:30) we were seated within 5 minutes. Our server Michael was absolutely the best, he was very polite and also made a few recommendations since it was our 1st time there. Everyone ordered different foods and EVERYTHING was cooked to perfection..the smoked wings were juicy and of good size, the ribs were fall off the bone tender, the chicken that came with the rib combo was moist but the skin was good and crispy. Even the burger was juicy..our sides included collard greens, sweet potato fries, Cole slaw, creamed corn and fries everything was great! They give good portion sizes so you will not leave hungry. I will be back very soon and I hope I'm sitting in Michaels section.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

dzixJGrXiN-FP96cemBN3w.text: Staff is super friendly. You walk in here and instantly feel welcome. Great draft selection. The menu is completely "on point" with a great selection of appetizers and main courses. You'll probably be like me and want a little of everything. Guess what? They have a combo platter for that. 2 sizes, as well.   Because I am about to go to a festival, I limited my selection to the bacon wrapped jalapenos (to die for) and the pulled pork sandwich. These were everything great I could expect from a bbq joint. Great music and atmosphere and the food is truly superior to most bbq I've had. Sauces are completely on point.   I'll definitely be back. Time and time again.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great bourbon selection.

KEeuLURGJNIZqYOi_Huxrw.text: Fantastic food every time I come here! Very friendly staff and great service. I am a pescatarian, and the smoked salmon is the bomb.com . The food is always fresh and delicious.

g2iuyDQvwtuTttEwNUnOqw.text: Fantastic BBQ place. Real smoking, True to form. Maybe the best ribs I have ever had. Perfect service. Jess is on top of it. Can't wait to return.

-NWEfRe5ZiQHaN2rsq4siQ.text: Food:  Delicious without a doubt  Waitress service:  Impecable.  Laura was very tentative and friendly  Host/hostess:  Whoever was working the lunch shift needs to quit.  As my buddy and I walked into the restaurant, they just looked at us and didn't seem too friendly.  After finishing our meal, we walked towards the front doors, passing the host/hostess.  They didn't say a word to us as we walked by.  Talk about douchebags with no customer service skills.  Won't be going back to this "overhyped" place.

nw6HsLndQsKpc-H2nlsskw.text: Great BBQ place. Service was fast and food was delicious. I had the pork burnt ends and my husband had a philly cheese sandwich that he loved. Craft beer was yummy as well.

epbJj7l9Ta2d1y1Sxb8PHA.text: I wouldn't have changed a thing here. We had the combo and couldn't finish it! The brisket was moist, the sausage was homemade, and the hushpuppies had a great flavor! Also had sweet potato fries and bacon wrapped jalapenos. If there was anything less than perfect it was the pulled pork. Atmosphere is awesome and beer was cold.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo is more than enough for 2 people. Probably more appropriate for 3 or more people!! Not bad for $20.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo. Ribs (sauce on the side), brisket (fatty and lean mixed), sausage, pork, jalapeños and sweet potato fries.

X_5eZrgLL478cw19t8qQQg.text: This is a difficult review to leave, because most things about Midwood (especially the food) deserve 5 stars. The quality of the barbecue vies for 1st place in all of Charlotte every time I eat there, the local beer list is long, and the service is generally solid too.  However, over time, portions have steadily decreased. The last two times, I didn't get anything near what would reasonably be expected for the price I paid. I can go to any competitor at this point and get more food for less money, and the quality will be just as good.   Needless to say, I won't be heading back to Midwood any time soon. The quality of flavor alone isn't worth another sparse combo plate that maybe has 3/4 the amount of 'cue that it should, and only leaves me disappointed.

6Xh8ydfoeSXpecmT-yORaA.text: This place is amazing!!! This is my first time here and good lord! Nothing has disappointed me!! The brisket and Mac & cheese are soooooo good and the waitress has never let us see the bottom of our glass!! 10/10 would recommend!!

yEXJ3KPpdDmiHKI859DnhA.text: Always always always so good. I will completely go out of my way if I want good barbecue just to come here. You can't get good barbecue everywhere. I'm super picky. I don't even like most places because I'm so picky.  especially with good sauce. Their macaroni is perfect. Not too pricey either. They have a patio to sit on too.

JQqkWCZctrgQ-apcZIOHYA.text: My friends and I finally made it to Midwood and we were very pleased with our visit.   After a short wait we were seated and ordered some beers (they have excellent specials) while we checked out the menu. Everything sounded so delicious but I decided to go with the burnt ends and bacon wrapped jalapenos.  The burnt ends (chopped brisket) come doused in their signature home made fat tire sauce. They were delicious. The sauce was spicy and smokey! A truly great combination of flavors! And those damn Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos were outstanding. I mean any time you combine two of my personal faves it's got to be good, but the crispy bacon and stuffed jalapenos delighted my taste buds in so many ways! I only wish there were more on the plate!!!   There's so many things here I'm looking forward to try! The one downside is parking. It's just not enough here! But if you can find a parking spot, this place is definitely worth a visit! I know I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket and Burnt Ends
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends with bacon wrapped jalapeños

BV47Q_cPvbMQsDQ6ci8SAQ.text: Wow this place is phenomenal. Came here on a Saturday afternoon and was immediately seated. Chose to sit outside bc the weather was beautiful out. We ordered the smoked chicken wings for an appetizer which were awesome. So tender and full of flavor. I got the Carolina pulled pork with Mac and cheese, bf got the combo platter with ribs, brisket and bbq. Everything was amazing and fresh. Bbq was some of the best I've ever had and the sauce they give you (on the side) was awesome too. I put it all over my food. Mac and cheese was great too! Service was great, our waitress was very attentive and friendly. I can see why people rate this place so high, it deserves all of the great reviews and lived up to its hype. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo platter
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing bbq &amp; hushpuppies were sooooo good

nvsUB_rKPVlkSP7J77y8gg.text: I went with my brother on Christmas Eve close to the time they would close and that could have been the issue. All of the food was cold!  While I enjoyed the couple of bites that were lukewarm I will either try another location or not go close to closing time.  The smoked wings were blah at best.  For the entree we had a sampler plate with ribs, pulled chicken, brisket, burnt ends and pulled pork. My brother and I split the meal and ended up packing it up to go.  The pecan cobbler was tasty however just a pecan pie w less crust. I look forward to trying them again. The service was very pleasing. They were attentive at the bar area.

amv5qP8_-ER8-UlClGfXpQ.text: I am a 60 year-old BBQ aficionado. When I travel the southern half of the U.S. (which is often), I am always in search of the best BBQ. I have had spectacular BBQ in Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri, Kansas, and North Carolina... tiny mom & pop joints, chains, one-offs, the most famous, and unknowns. Midwood Smokehouse may be the best I've ever had, anywhere.   Though it's not my favorite, I do like good pulled pork. The pulled pork at Midwood is THE BEST I've ever eaten anywhere, hands-down. Doesn't even need sauce. Terrific smokey flavor, good char on the outside bits, just amazing.  The brisket is also maybe the best I've ever eaten. Tender, smokey... you can get it lean or juicy and more fatty... really incredible.  We tried their bacon-wrapped, deep-fried (!) rib appetizer and though a bit crispy and dry for my wife's taste (she's a Californian and I'm a southerner), I thought it was excellent.  Creamed corn was delicious... her grilled veggies were truly excellent. Servings were HUGE ("Are you SURE that's the 'small plate'?"  And big kudos to manager Natalie who went out of her way to welcome us, and even personally make some sandwiches (off menu) we could take on the plane for our flight back to CA. Every restaurant in America would do well to try to find someone like her!  Will definitely eat there any time we're in Charlotte. Have also eaten at the Ballantyne location... same excellent food.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

j6cirRyymgdT5VHEnOJOOg.text: Great place for BBQ and beers.  We received quick and friendly service both times we visited.  Our first time we got the combo plate to try all the meats.  Everything was great and we like the brisket and sausage the most.  The smoked wing appetizer is also highly recommended.

PgMY19zdI_Rel_9GOJBqTA.text: Our service was top notch!!! Beers were delicious as was the nachos and the pig out!!! Couldn't eat it all so we ordered desserts to go also..definitely will be back!! Damn good bbq for date night!!!

weAnxDw9c-lrOcKUGWNvpA.text: This is by far the best BBQ experience I have had next to Franklin's brisket in ATX! And from top to bottom it may surpassed it with its sides. The burnt ends is phenomenal, the pulled pork and pulled chicken are smoked to perfection where it's dry because of the smoke but flavorful and not dried out. The St. Louis Ribs are literally fall off the bone and the dry rub is so good it needs no sauce. The brisket is actually Texas style brisket and is better than some place in Texas. Their sauces are really good as well and I didn't do the vinegar sauce because I'm not a vinegar guy, but their house BBQ sauce and the Habanero version is good. Their BBQ beans are legit and has meat in it. Their other sides were delicious according to my colleagues. And our server Wil was very hospitable and provided great real recommendations and great service. But if you are in Charlotte and you are going to eat... EAT here!

NDBV6SmdN6UR9Oi1q8QGbg.text: THE SERVICE WAS GREAT, THE FOOD WAS EVEN BETTER, BUT THEY'RE A BUNCH OF SCAM ARTISTS  We're visiting Charlotte for a concert and we wanted to go to get some BBQ. This place had a good rating so we went. Our server was really nice friendly and helpful. And he gave us the hard sell on their "lunch special" which was smoked short rib. The food came out and it was big and tasty. We both loved the food however we were both struck with awe as we saw our bill. The lunch "special" was 29 FUCKING dollars. When we saw that this place was not to expensive and saw the menu. We thought the lunch special would be similar to the affordable prices of the rest of the menu.   What we were given was a bait and switch that ended up fucking us over in the end. I'll go back here but I'm definitely not going to fall for this scumbag move by our waiter again.

u9KgGaYJR5zAG5590daVFg.text: I've been in the Carolinas for almost 10 years now and just finally found my favorite BBQ place! Love the quality of the food here. The ribs are cooked perfectly, all the bbq sauces are not overpowering and I LOVE the cheese fries! This is the only place I will go now.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese fries with chopped brisket

h4jQDouM55fN_reIYx2xBw.text: The burnt ends are legendary. I had never heard of anything like it and I've lived in the South my entire life, but it's sooo good. The hush puppies are also amazing. Definitely a restaurant that you have to eat at if you live in Charlotte.

bVKWmV6yw2EVfGIdiSeiKA.text: I ordered the bacon wrapped jalapenos, beef brisket and Mac and cheese. EVERYTHING was excellent! This is definitely a place that will stay on my go to list. They provide a good quantity of food for the cost. I'm looking forward to my leftovers for lunch tomorrow.

A-GYwZbILqahOKUNOz0Bwg.text: Food is good if not great,  but the price is right and the service is decent.   For the price point it is a hell of a lot nicer than Applebee's, although if you are shopping for high quality regardless of cost.... keep shopping.

MskDOSyhjRlMj7O4GK5Txg.text: This is the real deal for barbeque.  Very nice beer selection as well.  I also thought our server did a great job and was very helpful, even though the place is very busy so it's not easy of the staff.

JwtrJzBpawEooPNOm5Sfog.text: There is probably nothing I can say that hasn't already been said about Midwood Smokehouse. Either I've been out of Texas too long, or this truly is good southern BBQ! Brisket, burnt ends, BBQ queso, bacon wrapped jalapenos, pimento cheese - everything I've tried is fantastic! Be prepared to wait because this place is always crowded.

2vVAz4DTRs8TVvoYauCn2A.text: I know the entire world LOVES this place. I promise you this is not a "bangwagon" review. I personally find myself not easily impressed by any of the "OMG it's the best blah blah blah" places people typically raved about.   Honestly I have no beef with Midwood Smokehouse, and I frequent enough to be "a fan." I should disclose the fact that I'm not a big BBQ person, thus this rarely is my 1st choice to dine at. With that being said, I suppose their foods are consistent and reasonably priced. I have my fav item here, which is their (not so) small salad with smoked salmon added. It's the most food you can get for $8, and semi healthy. Their Avocado Green Goddess is my dressing choice.   I do have to say service is hit & miss. Brian was great this last time, which was a welcomed change. One time we sat at the bar, and the bartender refused my request to leave my salmon whole (I am not a cat, I don't like shredded fish). I thought that was rude and un-restaurant of them to refuse my otherwise reasonable request. PLUS parking is a pain, especially with all the new housing built nearby.   If I can offer half star, this would be a solid 3.5-star place in my world. It's hump day, and I'll be nice and throw in the other half and made it a 4-star review.

qQc7DfGMC5sxoaJj0Jcvgg.text: This was fantastic. I had the burnt tips with mac n cheese as my choice side and my fiance had the pulled pork sandwich with bacon wrapped jalapenos. A few pieces of brisket were more like large chunks of your usual brisket, though most were exactly what I expected - caramelized flavors, chewy textured awesomeness. Mac and cheese was good but not amazing. The plate came wish hush puppies too. Those were small, but yummy. My fiance liked his sandwich but I wasn't as much of a fan. His jalapenos were good...but not amazing. Great craft beer selection. Definitely coming back! They had smoked salmon on the menu that sounded delish.

kHDVScsqN-cAeNn4iikJxw.text: This is the best place to eat BBQ in Charlotte hands down.  Bring your blind friend, and have them pick out your food by throwing darts at the menu--you cannot go wrong here.

0dP6TqDgSg1i9R6vDFUnmg.text: Yum!!  Clean, super friendly, food is delicious.  The Hot Mess burger is so good, even without the bun. Our server Brittany was awesome. We are from out of town but will definitely be back!

Z4-0xh9bt_UMiIVhalSVQA.text: Everything was really delicious!  Parking was a nightmare, but that's typical for Charlotte and Midwood.  I'd definitely go back!

BnufMPvYSM_bn3zUV0gOyQ.text: Visited here Sunday Night. Parking, as everyone says, is a challenge, but not that bad.   We had just come from spending the whole weekend hiking in Great Smokey Mountains NP, so we were HUNGRY.   Got seated right away, which was a pleasant surprise as they seemed to be very busy.   I got the sampler plate, small version, my wife got a large chicken. And let me just say the meat was excellent. The brisket was one of the best I have had, melting on the tongue, great spice without being too salty, Next time I come I will order like three plates of that. Not to say the pork wasn't excellent as well, I really liked the vinegar heavy NC style on the pork. The ribs, also quite nice. The sausage, well, a little salty, but the mustard dip made up for that in spades. I give this place A+ for food.  I would have liked to see a little more of the vinegar heavy NC style in the dishes. We had been out in Oklahoma for three years, and while the brisket was excellent, in NC I'd like to see it done NC style not Texas Style, and the ribs, were great St Louis style ribs, again, I'd like to see what they'd look like with the awesome NC vinegar marinate the pork used.  My wife's chicken was great as well. Again food fantastic.  Our service was brisk, and why I am not giving five stars. I've worked restaurants before and am pretty sure they were short staffed (despite getting seated right away it is clear they were turning and burning), and our server was a bartender that got a demotion to waitress for the night, and was a little unhappy about it. Service was crisp and efficient, but we got our check dropped before we had a chance to order desert. As we both ordered a lot of meat, I can understand that the server thought we wouldn't have room, but we had been hiking all weekend. The proper forms of service were performed, but it was a bit brisk, and we definitely got the impression that they wanted to turn the table.   Nothing wrong with that on a busy Sunday night, and I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone that asked. That brisket was worth coming back for. Though I just can't help but wonder what it would be like with the pork preparation or similar. It is a nine hour drive from Allentown PA, I'll drive down if you make a NC style brisket. JUST TO EAT THAT.  Great restaurant. Was a nice treat after a weekend of hiking. I figured we smelled like campfire smoke anyway, so a smokehouse was the place to go.

FhKUJhhAKNleVEJ1c43LQw.text: Totally legit Q! Great location, though parking can be a pain during peak hours  I recommend the fatty brisket or the pulled chicken BBQ.  Tell them to double you up on the pickled onions. They're like candy. Sweet, earthy candy!  Burnt ends plate is awesome, too. But I recommend you telling them to do the extra sauce on the side.  Their best house sauce (they're all house made, btw) is the sweet habanero sauce. Don't be scared of the habanero part. They did an awesome job of making it where the heat is just right.  Round it all out with the bacon-wrapped jalapenos and the mac&cheez, and you'll be set!  Wait staff is super chill, so that's always a plus.

XL0QMdSCjY0grRRIHMNK4g.text: Just HEAVEN!  I really wanted try the whole menu!  But this time I had the pulled pork and WOW was it good!  I can't wait to go back to try the brisket!

Fsr3cZ1t6SoIM1G_IOLwsg.text: Brought my family here because Of the good reviews, the food was amazing, I had the burnt ends, everyone's food was really good, the staff is super nice. This place is a must try!

hamoJtIpzo_AMg6YL14gLw.text: I loved the burnt ends! And the sweet tea is just right with my favorite crushed ice. Will definitely be returning. The only complaint was that the hostess wasn't very organized and began seating others that arrived after us while we still waited.

HdZi4f5t-z4VUWQOhrJt0w.text: My wife took me on my birthday for dinner. Much better than our last visit. Great service, food is always great. Had fatty brisket and my wife had tacos. Food never disappoints. We always ask to sit in booths near door, best seats in the house.

BEjh6M0ow5VTk2Co2OZmgA.text: The food was so great! Get the mac and cheese with BBQ on it! Great servers and staff as well! The night we went was really busy but service was timely!

Y46quDwVba2YisdzXFUgFw.text: Food is usually really good, but service isn't fantastic, especially if you're doing takeout. The hostesses here always seem to lack customer service skills, and will stand idly and chat after hastily pointing you in the direction of the bar if you have a takeout order. Then you have to stand at the crowded bar hoping to eventually get noticed so you can get your food, which usually takes around 10 minutes. The bartenders are too busy to be managing takeout orders on top of everything else, and it seems especially absurd when you keep looking back at two hostesses who aren't doing anything and aren't even paying attention to what's going on around them. Portions here also tend to be small for the price. All in, it's good BBQ, but I don't know if I'll keep going out of my way to come here - between the service and the portion sizes, you can probably find better value elsewhere in CLT.  PS: parking is generally a nightmare, just be prepared.

Asxo2Zq0Oc8ZwvNWYwEaAg.text: I have eaten here twice and food was really great. This place gets busy on the weekend so expect a little wait but the service was nice and very quick. We got a few appetizers and they were all good but the pimento cheese fries are awesome and highly recommend!! I got pulled pork and mac & cheese and both were awesome. Their bbq slaw is also different but good, has a sweet but tangy flavor to it.  I plan to go back again!

OIDQ7ITZ79o47L-F_lT4JA.text: Believe the HYPE!  The hardest thing about eating here is deciding what to get.  There are so many options on the menu and everything looked tasty (looking around at other's plates).  I got the brisket and it was out of this world delicious.   The service could have been a bit better, but it wasn't bad.  My drinks were refilled and an occasional stop by was made.  They just didn't make me feel welcomed.  But, I'm not a needy person so that's alright with me.  The food won me over and I will be back time and again.

B8I4Pw7-cKnaqDyV803_YA.text: The Banana pudding was so good I had to get two additional ones To go to give my sister. We tried the brisket, pulled PORK, ribs, beef ends I forgot what they were called and Mac n cheese with sweet potato fries.

aNfgHRq6Dpvf5toaCWeNIw.text: Another Scibelli restaurant where the food is good but mediocre to poor service is the norm. Most of the servers and staff act as if they are doing you a favor. Ugh. Also, their smokehouse is too small and they are almost always out of at least 2 items by 6pm every night. I have only tried the original location and my review is of the original. I have been coming here since the beginning and it has gotten worse not better with time. It would also be great if they took reservations.  Perhaps they could better plan ahead to accommodate the crowd. I enjoy the food but not the dining experience. I will likely continue to enjoy via takeout.

gZgLhNJUJqSs0wexQj_KlQ.text: That yummy fatty brisket gets my vote every time. Customer service is good.  The greens and mac & cheese are a delicious compliment to the brisket.  Best brisket I have ever had.

mpwOQd1FQleonlncHF442A.text: the food is good no excellent. But what is more remarkable is that they have gluten free options. No I can't eat everything but what I can eat is worth the wait.

dfUTe-c6bCHc08l67AqGmg.text: Was pretty excited to try this place since I heard good things but unfortunately I wasn't too impressed. The waiter was kind of rude, as if he seemed annoyed to be there. I ordered the brisket sandwich as did my friend. I ordered mine with pimento cheese and my friend ordered cheddar, however we both received blue cheese. I really do not like blue cheese and this blue cheese completely over powered the sandwich. I would of complained but our server wasn't even the one to bring us our food and we didn't even see him again til the check came.   I don't know if I'll be returning to give it another try.

oufA8kzeMtP0dcsFIjVg7g.text: Salmon might be one of the best salmons I've ever had.  This separates them by doing something unique in my opinion.  Everything is very good, and I place them tied with mac's for the two best bbq spots in Charlotte.  If you want ribs go to Mac's, burnt ends come to midwood.  Brisket at both locations is excellent, but prepared differently.  You won't go wrong coming here for excellent BBQ  I went here again with family in town and had the Pulled Pork Plate.  Nice portion of food for $10, but more importantly it was probably the best pulled pork I've eaten.  Tender, flavorful, perfectly smoked.  Pulled pork just put Midwood ahead of Mac's in my opinion.

CLMj1gyz3NcvU1R8SwTtfQ.text: Was finally able to stop in at Midwood today for lunch, and I was very impressed. Definitely the best BBQ I've found in Charlotte so far. I ordered the large plate of pulled chicken in mustard sauce with bacon wrapped jalapenos and pimiento cheese fries as my sides. The pulled chicken was very tender, and the mustard sauce was decent. I also got some of Midwood's habanero BBQ sauce on the side, and this put the chicken over the top to amazing! That sauce is the bomb! Not too spicy, not too vinegary, and not too sweet- just a perfect balance.  The bacon wrapped jalapenos were amazing. Extremely smoky, great bacon flavor, a little cheese to balance everything out, and spice from the jalapeno. I was able to have pimiento cheese fries as my other side for a $1 upcharge and they were good as well but not great. My girlfriend ordered sweet potato fries, and they were awesome! I would honestly rather have the plain sweet potato fries than the pimiento cheese fries (but I love sweet potato fries so I am biased). She also had the Cuban sandwich which was good but not amazing in my opinion. The hush puppies that came with the BBQ plate weren't bad but just average.  Our server was friendly, the atmosphere of the restaurant was pretty nice (although there is a slight smoky smell inside as any good BBQ place should have so keep that in mind), and the prices were great for the amount of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large pulled hickey plate + pimiento cheese fries as a side
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large Pulled Chicken Plate with Bacon Wrapped Jalapeños

eP8H90P0s5qd8BMreSFmkQ.text: Must go. Must eat everything you can.  The midwood chopped salad is fabulous. Get it tossed with the green goddess.  Go for the pimento cheese fries and you might as well throw some bbq on them :)  I always get the same thing...bbq pork plate with bbq slaw (vinegary and delicious) and bacon wrapped jalapenos.   They have platters too...which usually feeds me and my hubby and leaves us with plenty to take home.   Service is always great...although sometimes the servers are a bit aloof. I prefer to sit at the bar.

nAe6cMkWPNYFlmpzPqT9mQ.text: Ummm, Yes.   That about concludes it.   The last time I visited here I had the brisket queso, and my goodness was it amazing. I'm not even a fan of brisket and I couldn't get enough. I also tried the smoked wings - which are offered naked or sauced. Next time I know to go with naked. The wings alone were amazing, but the sauce just didn't do anything for my personal taste. It didn't taste like much of anything to be honest. I couldn't pinpoint it as spicy, it wasn't barbecue, couldn't find any taste of ketchup. So I could definitely do without. But otherwise I'll be back soon.   Location wise, I had to turn around 3 time's because I kept missing it. It's easy to drive right past since its connected with a larger office building, and not to mention the parking on weekends is impossible. But none the less, delicious food.

qYK8fOXPAv528kF9CGM08g.text: I would not say the best barbecue in Charlotte but definitely on the top of my list. Occasionally they run out of certain menu items but that is only because of how busy they are but no need to worry because they are fast and friendly. A very clean restaurant with two levels the upper level being an open patio and weirdly enough I have to mention the bathrooms because they were super clean and decorated amazingly almost better than the restaurant itself.

e3KBCWTLCMf7tu6zj7bagg.text: I had my first experience here a while ago to celebrate my Aunt's Birthday. The food was awesome. There were 27 of us and they seated us promptly, and everyone's food was delicious. The menu is extensive with something for everyone. The wait staff was so friendly!!! We'll be back.....and I can't wait. I've told everyone I know to try this restaurant if they haven't already. You can't go wrong here. Wish there was a location at Mountain Island where I live...it would make a killing!

h-ONMtNAtQ605CkFWSZtSA.text: So, I rave on and on about good BBQ because it's probably one of my favorite things to eat. And I can rave on and on about Midwood! The problem is, that it's so affordable, we can get too many sides and then end up being full before our wonderful, juicy, fall-off-the-bone MAN-MEAT portions arrive. (Make sure you try the fatty brisket! Uh-oh! Mouth's a-waterin'!) And then we have to be abolutely miserable to try and stuff down dessert. I mean, we do try...  This place is excellent. Service is a tad bit on the wonky side sometimes, and parking can be an adventure (as if the lot's full, you'll have to park across the street and play Frogger with the crazy Plaza-Midwood drivers), but I implore you...nay, I dare you to find better BBQ in Charlotte! (And if you do, please tell me all about it!)

cLTyyWsOD0qVzb0xRE-szA.text: Second time in town...and it was the first place we went to eat.  This time it was late night, we sat at the bar and the three of us enjoyed a sampler platter with Brisket, Ribs, pulled pork and pulled chicken...sides of fries and cole slaw.  Perfect for the three of us. Service was great too!

vrJo0bxLsNBu5TK2O70mnA.text: I came here recently with a large group during a 3 day conference being held downtown.  Despite being told by multiple cab drivers that Charlotte is not known for its BBQ, this place was surprisingly good (and I say this after a recent visit to Austin where all we did was eat BBQ the entire time).   We came with a party of 12 on a Friday night at 7:15 p.m. with no reservation.  The host was very friendly and kept us updated as to our remaining wait time.  We ended up waiting about 45 minutes - 1 hour; luckily we had drinks at the bar to entertain us.    I ordered the smoked half chicken Midwood style.  This dish was only $10 and came with hush puppies and two sides!!!  I got the baked beans, vinegar coleslaw, and collard greens.  The chicken was juicy and tender and the BBQ sauce had a nice spiciness to it without being to vinegary.  The baked beans were delicious and had a good amount of meat.  The collard greens and coleslaw were also solid.  I attempted to eat only half of the massive portion of food but somehow ended up finishing the entire plate.  Others in my group had the burnt ends, mac and cheese, ribs, etc. and all said they enjoyed their food.  One thing that could make this place better is if they offered biscuits or cornbread...all they have currently is Texas toast.   Our server was extremely attentive and friendly.  She didn't bat an eye when we requested separate checks even though I'm sure this was a supreme hassle.  Good atmosphere and food - I recommend coming here if you are in the mood for BBQ!

Ct8dmAPWFGC3R6vWNlDhnA.text: Live in Kansas City, and the Fat Tire BBQ sauce here is hands down my favorite!!! Casual, nice outside patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends in Fat Tire bbq sauce

WFpljySx2JqDC6F9uRuwUA.text: I am a huge barbeque fan. I've visited the location in Huntersville and Plaza Midwood. I didn't give 5 stars because sometimes their staff is hit or miss. Other than that, they have great food! Kinda pricey, but it's good.

sUrFoCdCzioX_qUPqpAq0Q.text: The second visit to Midwoods  confirmed that this is a great BBQ restaurant.  The combination of great food, beer,  service and atmosphere make it a fun place to  eat.  Between all of our party we managed to try all the meats in the menu and everything was perfect.  My personal favorite this time was the fatty brisket and the bacon wrapped Jalapenos.  Why have I never though of making this savory heat bombs before.  I will make sure that they become  a staple at all my home BBQ from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs,  pulled pork,  smoked sausage,  brisket,  smoked veggies, puppies,  and bacon wrapped Jalapeños.  Best combination ever.

viA_zVOieTnPaxBTke8rYA.text: Wonderful smoke house! The burnt brisket tips were amazing! Others in our party had smoked chicken, salmon, pork and sandwiches. Portions were good and don't forget the desserts!!

Edbs0_N6doBm1ECgOb1aww.text: I am far from an expert in BBQ, and so I present my opinion as a lover of BBQ sauce and lifelong carnivore. This is indeed the place to be, and the Midwood combo is one of the best ways for 2-3 people to taste a broad selection of Southern BBQ. Out of the 5 meats to choose from, I give my stamp of approval to the oh-so-juicy brisket and the tender and succulent ribs packed full of flavor. For sides, go for perhaps the BEST BAKED BEANS I've ever eaten!! (It's gotta be that molasses...) The mac and cheese was A-OK.  Tip: Ask for sauces! The BBQ sauces come with varying levels of spice and some meats come with their own sauces too.

WpE8L-hp-Wc0CjcJUesrjA.text: This is my favorite BBQ place! The wings are great and the salad is amazing. My favorite is the Texas toast grilled cheese with brisket! That is a must have.

6arVW7tLfDaPsIhB9HhwzQ.text: This place is one of the best bbq I've had.  Great service. Great food!    We had the sampler, chicken wings, and corn bread. Hmmmmm,  Will be back if I'm in Charlotte.

X-1elGbyTRJF2FYyMkmwQQ.text: So whether you plan on going to Midwood Smokehouse for the first time or fiftieth time, here's my take on a few things:  Parking - there's a larger lot in the back of Midwood. Hopefully, you luck up and are able to have ample spots to choose from. If not, street parking is available. Yup, parking sucks in this particular area of Plaza during peak hours, it is what is.  Food - you want to start off with some apps? Go for the pimento cheese fries (with brisket). Generally, I am not a fan of pimento cheese, but I will gobble these cheese fries right up. Also, order some bacon wrapped jalapenos simply because you must (personally, I'd ask for them to cook them just a little longer than normal).  -Midwood chopped salad (with pork or chicken). Yes, I go to a BBQ place and order a salad because it's really good. In fact, it's my favorite salad in all of Charlotte. The small portion is quite large enough for me.  -As for actual BBQ, go for the pulled pork and/or smoked wings. On a recent visit, I learned there's Midwood sauce so make sure you ask for some of that as well.  There are ample reasons why this place is consistently busy (I just listed a handful above) but they get right down to serving really good food in a friendly and fast manner.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Midwood chopped salad with pulled pork
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Close up of the pimento cheese fries topped with brisket

H-C3HWveo0M9xtw_RV9AeA.text: Midwood Smokehouse is a great place for BBQ. They have a number of BBQ options that will support both Eastern and Western Carolina 'Q' eaters.   In addition to barbecue they have a lot of options for food including sandwiches and salads. The appetizers are always good too.   The restaurant has a full bar and they are more than good at making specialty drinks.   Give it a try

zUglHWAgJ2imxWHKHgq3Fw.text: Holy s#|+!!! This was some of the best brisket I have ever had...period. Then you toss in delicious bacon wrapped jalapenos, hush puppies and sweet potato fries!!!   The reviews are all legit... this is a culinary destination worth your time and effort!

-Yk-61ino_SYUOA2o7CL5Q.text: We had been looking for a good BBQ place, and we had finally found it! We brought family here from out-of-town on our first visit here as well. Authentic and southern, and not "over-done." Atmosphere is inviting and excellent service! We were given an array of BBQ sauces to compliment our food, with detailed advice on what goes best with with.  Quality of the food is flawless. Hands-down, this is the best BBQ I've ever tried. The restaurant is located in an unassuming Midwood neighborhood. Prices are more than reasonable. Plenty of local beers on tap as well, and our server even made some pairing suggestions!  Definitely worth trying. We will be back soon. Our new "go to" BBQ place!

jlNDzkbFEQ89Tc03c8s3Eg.text: Was amazed by the Yelp check-in feature which saved us 30 minutes worth of standing in line!    I was SO looking forward to trying this place, as what girl doesn't like barbecue.   Yet, was sadly disappointed to hear the waitress tell us that they were out of ribs... Especially at 8 p.m on a Thursday evening.     Yet, to their defense the table beside us had a full rack and they looked delicious, so good I was ready to pay them double to steal them;) They also were packed so I'm sure they are a huge seller.   We ended up getting the waitresses recommendation burnt ends which were good but not as great as I'm sure the ribs would of been.   The Mac & cheese was okay but again not great.    Now the Old Fashion was fabulous just had to have the bartender add cherries.     Sadly we reside five hours away so we will not able to try this place and the RIBS again anytime soon.

h95N6NujT-YcIw4VvXlM5Q.text: Ok so this review is not based on the food itself. The food is awesome. I have never had a complaint. The meat is juicy and the sides are great. But this one instance involved a to-go order. I ordered via the app and the amount of time it took (yes it was lunch) to get my order was, I felt, was too long. The app gives you a completion time but even then it went over like 7-8 minutes. Yes that doesn't seem too long but when you have to be back to work, it can be. Will I go back...of course, the food is great. But will not order to go unless I have a decent amount of time to wait for it.

FpHnqfjgkHjSJdUyErVJ5g.text: Great little smokehouse serving more than standard NC BBQ however their pull pork is excellent too. Get the cambo platter and a desert. Shanita is a fantastic server who will make you feel welcome. Eat here folks, you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

6oeGLaHPnukozp0rY3ITWQ.text: Nice stop to grab some Carolina BBQ. This fees more like a chain restaurant as opposed to a mom and pop spot. Food was good, great selection of brews and Arnold Palmer was on point. Wait staff was very helpful and accommodating. Will definitely come again next time we r in town.
