AyDW7Bt5xhrq9HzwL7GhmA.text: Great place to bring the family. The portions are big but not sharable. They have a few vegan choices which is a place. Their sauces a delicious and they offer 2 types

Au7ZtHKTg5ZWekbix7oIxg.text: I gave this one star hoping management sees this.  Everything was great right up to the point the server started taking plates away as people finished their meals. Why wait staff don't know the basics, like you don't remove any plates until everyone is finished is sad.

IUFweueEyFFCt7HrMiatEw.text: Good service, good sauces, and good Carolina BBQ for a very reasonable price! Brisket covered fries with pimento cheese  Pulled pork sandwich and hush puppies  Homemade Mac and Cheese

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

ml_9Ci_mOErWm6yNVDJk5w.text: Best damned banana pudding I've ever had (and I'm kind of a connesieur at this stuff!)   Fast, friendly, and personalized service too . . . What's not to like?

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Uummmm, yaaaasssss!!!

U3yyxh4BLhSOwy_PUHypWg.text: I have been blown away with the quick response of the management team at this location. After my mishap, I have had two people from this business contact me to apologize for the little situation. I admire that as a customer I am being taken care and felt they care for me.  I will definitely be back!

kDv0qCvGhA6rZxk4MJ8X1g.text: We so thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant.  My family are visiting Charlotte for the night and wanted to try a "local" place; Yelp had like 1500 reviews and 4.5* so I figured it had to be a safe bet.  Yelp's "wait list" feature was active (I'd never tried it); it said there was a 10-20 minute wait and let me click through for "sign up" or whatever.  We grabbed a Lyft, and when we got to the restaurant there was definitely a line.  We checked in with the hostess, she thanked us for letting her know.  When I told her I was "checking in" she knew my name, so I guess this isn't a heavily-used feature.  Which is a shame because she seated us immediately.  Our server ("Ty") was awesome, and speedy.  We noticed a lot of staff, plus I assume two managers (not wearing aprons) all quick on their feet and always moving.  We had other waitstaff running our food, lots of people just stopping by to check on us or clean up some napkins or whatever.  Very good service.  The food: excellent.  We had two kids meals (chicken fingers & a pork sandwich), both went down quickly.  My wife and I split nachos and the burnt ends.  The nacho plate was crazy big, like easily a 3-4 person "appetizer."  A little overwhelming, but excellent.  A nice kick from jalapenos, offset with sweet corn and bbq sauce.  Very nice flavor mix.  The burnt ends were not really burnt at all, just very tender and flavorful.  It was served with hushpuppies, which were a little different from the "fried cornbread" I'm used to seeing but still really good.  Wife loved them.  All the sides were also great.  Two sauces: the typical NC vinegar stuff, which is the best NC sauce I've ever had.  Plus a more standard brown sugar / tomatoe-based sauce, also good.  They listed some other "SC-style" with the chicken, which I assume means mustard-base, but unless the nacho chicken had it, I didn't try any.  The nacho chicken tasted really good though, it definitely had something in there.  For dessert we had a "pecan cobbler."  This is NC, so we say "pee-can" here.  Weird, but you get used to it.  The cobbler was sorta like a turbo puh-cawn pie with extra nuts, and topped with a scoop of vanilla.  It was really good.  Unfortunately we were pretty stuffed and couldn't finish.  The portions were large, and overall pretty inexpensive.  The restaurant was PACKED but we got our food quickly and never had to wait for (or even ask for) anything.  We walked out for under $50 (before tip), and we loved it.  We will be back.  Next time we're gonna try the wings and maybe some smoked chicken.

ixreCEKAUpAR2DslRA6Srw.text: All the previous reviews are spot on. Not particularly a meat person because I'm trying to cut down, but the bbq is really good. Tender and with good flavor that isn't overly sweet and actually has depth. Fabulously courteous staff also. Great place to eat would definitely recommend.

9vpjp8Ros0CpzoG4UVKgYg.text: If you just came for the sausage it'll be totally worth it. A small plate comes out to about $19 for one meat and the sausage and hush puppies and one side. Kind of pricey imo but the service was great and quick. I sat at the bar and watched the constant flow of to go orders.  Let's go back to the sausage though- when you bite into that warm weenie the cheese exploded out ! I don't know if they change the flavors of their sausage but A+. Server said burnt ends and brisket was the most popular stuff. Brisket came lean, mixed and fatty. I got mixed- very tasty. I think it'll be more worth it if I got a plate with more meats. There seems to be a decent amount of street parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

H6PKOn9ThidXyCSoVkGonA.text: Bacon wrapped jalapenos. That's all you need to know. Carry on. I'll wait while you go order them.  By now you should know my rule of thumb when it comes to Charlotte: if Frank Scibelli's name is attached, it's going to be damn good. I love their smoked wings. Usually, I'll get those and a bunch of sides. We already addressed the BWJ. I'm also a huge fan of the smoked veggies and creamed corn. True story: they took the creamed corn off the menu for a hot second and so many people got upset that they had to bring it back. I don't ever order pulled pork anywhere I go, so for me my go to proteins are the ribs and brisket. I just had burnt ends for the first time last week and they were fabulous. This is going to sound random, but the grilled cheese is great here as well.   Pretty good beer selection. You can also order online for pickup. Parking is not great, but there is a lot behind the building as well. Just pay attention to the signs.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt Ends

FS4Twn5gBtHAgq-fg5c5Lg.text: I had a easier time finding a discount ticket to Disneyland after three tries at different locations we finally cracked the code and came in here on Wednesday evening. We tried all the meets. The brisket is served either fatty or non-fatty or combo. I'm still not sure which one is the best. The pork is better here, the ribs are better at Sauceman's but I'm not gonna go back to Sauceman's so I'll try Midwood again. My friend enjoyed collard greens. Service was pretty good. There are different locations and some take reservations.

Lz8RDRJvs0v71lOkPMoF_Q.text: I just did a review for the other Midwood smokehouse. I can give this one 5 stars because I feel that it's reasonably priced for what I'm getting. And the food is always great. The end. LOL  Just kidding... I wanted to add that I moved down here to Charlotte from DC and I was really surprised that in all the years that I lived in DC I never found any barbecue that was even remotely close to being as good as this place. We all have different taste buds so I'm sure that's relative.   I'm from Cali and I've had some hella good ass barbecue before. And I guess the places I've been to there set the barometer for everywhere else.

hYpc8lb0uTA1UjsmF0ohjw.text: Overall really good food and experience. Group of 6 enjoyed their version of a jalapeno and bacon app that was pretty good although I looked nothing like the pix on line but still pretty tasty.   A couple folks at the table enjoyed the burnt ends as recommended by our server who was a very good server. I wish I would have remembered his name ( bigger middle age guy who must be pumping the iron). He had the just right level of interaction and was very attentive without being over the top.   Being on a Keto plan I had the salmon salad which I thought was the star of the show!  The only thing I would consider on changing was the crinkle cut el cheap fry. I did not taste them due to Keto but noticed those that had them didn't eat many of them.   Highly recommend if you want some good que or a damn good salmon salad.

FFxz8LNX7zTTRIDF1gBDGA.text: This is the place to go if you are craving BBQ in Charlotte.   I would recommend getting the combo platter if you come here with a small group. This way you can get a variety of meats and get a good taste of what is offered here.   The parking situation might not be ideal though. Make sure you don't park in the plaza across from the restaurant.

GTTtm_C1j0Ilm8KddUTsmg.text: I really wanted to like this place, and I feel so guilty leaving such a low rating; however, I wasn't pleased at all. Came in with my sisters. They ordered a half rack of ribs with Mac and cheese, burnt ends with collards and Mac and cheese, and I got the nachos. Their Mac and cheese was cold and had to be reordered. My nachos were extremely salty and had to be sent back.By the time the nachos came out, I had to take them to go (I had to take it home and reheat in the oven). My reheated nachos were okay. The mule was only $9 and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salt
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nacho Nachos Libre
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nacho libre to go

KzI8aEoKaa2dKyJrnjIVAw.text: The craving I had for smoked wings almost made me drive to Asheville, where my favorite smoked wing spot is, for a fix mkay!! But, luckily my friend put the brakes on me and we ended up at Midwood Smokehouse which was roughly 13 minutes away. Saweeeeeeet!  The grub:  Smoked Wings-super tasty and smokey and almost tasted like bacon! I don't eat swine, so having something that brought me back to my bacon eating days gave me all types of life. My only gripe was that the skin was chewy and gooie as if the fat hadn't rendered out. However, I'll totally go back for these.  Burnt Ends-these were tasty as well. There were fatty pieces attached to brisket ends and covered in BBQ sauce. These didn't blow my mind, but they were tasty.  Hush puppies-delicious, we got more to go.  Coleslaw-this was more of a vinegar based coleslaw then mayonnaise based. I actually didn't mind it! It's a nice compliment and the vinegar helped but through the fatty foods.  Soooooo I didn't get any pics because the greedy hunger was real when the food arrived :). This place is worth giving a go!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area

Y-9G7f92feaj2WK73YBP0A.text: When someone told me that Midwood Smokehouse was THE BEST BBQ in CLT, I thought they were just fluffing it up, but actually it's THE BEST BBQ in N.C. You have never had anything less than amazing here. This place is located in the heart of Plaza Midwood with lots of things to do. I recommend coming here early because it gets really packed during dinner time.  Things to get: The Brisket 1930 Cheesesteak Burnt Ends Creamy Corn

RAqR0FNFh2oyA-1piwv48A.text: The wife and I took a little get-away to Charlotte, NC while there we visited Midwood Smokehouse BBQ, I found them on Yelp and their rating was good. We enter the restaurant and was greeted by friendly hostess with a warm smile, we were seated and our waitress arrived, she asked if this was our first time visiting and continue with explaining the menu. I wish I could stay for the Wednesday special consisting of Dino Bone Beef Ribs, anyway we ordered the Pig Out plater, this came with three proteins ours were pulled chicken, St. Louis Style Ribs and Brisket sling with two sides ok, the star was the brisket this was a very delicious smoked brisket what's unique is that you can order it with fat cap, lean or no fat of course got to have a little of that fat. The staff was out of site and decor was great. I would definitely recommend to friends and family for a great BBQ experience

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar Area
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dining Area

fahzB36EYI2WGzpphGqkEQ.text: Very nice setting... it was a cool night so we choose to sit outside which is ALOT quieter. We were greeted by our server as soon as we sat down. She was amazing with recommendations (drink/appetizers). Tonight I choose to go with a Pinot Nior (very rich and dry like I like). We got the bacon wrappped jalapenos as an appetizer (PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND ORDER). They were out right along with our drinks (I told you they were speedy). We order the Protein 4 combo and when I say it was AMAZING!!! (Ribs/brisket/jalapeno sausage/pulled chicken)... omg I will definitely be back!! It's really one of my fave go-to.

mVPnfZvc17eDKsGeM19buA.text: CHARLOTTE, NC 05/08/19 DINNER  +The vinegar-based barbecue sauce was excellent! +The sausage was very spicy and had a nice kick! -The smoked vegetables were pretty good.  -The meats did not really have a smokey flavor to it. -No loyalty rewards program.  Overall, I would check out other Carolina BBQ joints, since my trips out to Charlotte are limited.

cKitD64vLYILWoumo3lHvw.text: I was impressed by this place. I worried it was overhyped but I had a salad with salmon and my husband got one with pork and they were INSANE. I think it was the wood roasted veggies but wow, very good.  In general the place is cool too and the price point feels fair. We will be back and likely sit outside with our pup.

zE-OJJBLUQ-eew9Sn6LYdA.text: This place is a bbq lovers dream! When you walk in it looks like a run of the mill joint besides the walls of pictures of famous celebrities who have eaten here. We heard a lot of hype about this place from our friends but when I walked in I wasn't expecting much...boy was I wrong.         First the service was friendly and prompt. We came in with a party of 7 yet it felt like we got our food 5mins after ordering. I seriously don't know how they got it out so fast.          The food was hot, tasty, and the portions were huge. They had a lot of vegetarian options for a bbq  restaurant. I also loved the create your own salad (as in they create it for you not a salad bar) where you are able to choose up to 7 different ingredients to compose your salad. We ordered the small version for $6 and it was huge!!             The meat was tender and flavorful. They had interesting dressings and sauces to dip both your sides and meat in. Definitely will be visiting this place again. It's mid range in price but definitely worth it because you will be taking left overs home for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Pork Sandwich and Crinkle Cut Fries
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nachos Libre with Beef Brisket

h0CjhG9kSHe1FLbpYl7dMQ.text: We had dinner at the Midwood Smokehouse while I was visiting my friend in Charlotte. We came on  a Sunday evening and it was pretty busy. We were able to find a spot at the bar to eat. We started with the pimento cheese fries and the smoked wings. Both appetizers were done right. The wings had an amazing smoky flavor. The pimento fries were cheesy and the fries crispy. For my entree, I got the burnt ends platter with the grilled veggies, and creamed corn. The platters also come with onions and hush puppies. The burnt ends were super crispy and Smokey and had just the right amount of sauce on them. I can't wait to visit Charlotte again to come back to this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt Ends with grilled veggies and creamed corn

hLIElYCvue_9UNrxHsjr1Q.text: Stopped in with a couple friends only to get appetizers and it was hard not to order half the menu. Mac n cheese. Hush puppies. BURNT ENDS. Everything was remarkably flavorful. I don't live here yet but plan to move soon and when I do, I'll be a regular here.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

NkZ279ZZgMMVUbvbQ01Iaw.text: Oh my sweet baby Jesus this place is love. I'm visiting from Atlanta. I started with bacon wrapped jalapenos then I had the St Louis pork ribs with the collards and hush puppies. I raved so much about how every single things all the way down to the onions was so delicious that my husband started sending me text with him and his friends orders. What started out as a quick bite for one became a very expensive trip with a bunch of food. But its worth it. Portions are wonderful, service is awesome and the food came out fast, hot and beyond delicious. Sorry no pictures of my food when I dined on. It smelled so good I forgot to take any. I'll be back soon. Its worth the 4 hour drive. To go order: Hot mess, philly cheese steak, more greens, fries, and smoked wings (crispy) and another order of bacon wrapped jalapenos .

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

cjgKlpAIrqRKufInB3kxSg.text: YUM! YUM! YUM!!!  This was my first visit to the restaurant my work orders their food a lot for our large meetings and it is AWESOME!!  I love all that I have eaten from them.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants good food and BBQ you can order take out and is great or dine in and get served.  I will continue to eat here!  Thank you!

sw5ZIwc16KmNNhNCIE0w3A.text: This place hands down has been one of the best bbq place I've been to. Its gets crowded quick. Has that home feeling when you enter. Not only is the food great but the customer service is superb. Ask for Yolanda so will keep you laughing, and your glasses full. She knew the meal well and made you feel like you were her only customer. Food excellent go for the pig outs and split them among your party, you will have more than enough food. Can't go wrong with anything on the meal. The ribs would be my number one. You've got to the cornbread, you won't regret it. I plan to return to this spot when I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped jalapeno
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pigout
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped jalapeno and crispy wings

kLQ16_Bxm3vdFv-qiSTc3w.text: Amazing food. The fatty beef brisket is amazing. I ordered the 4 item share plate and everything on it was very good.  Service was great, atmosphere was great, beer was great.  Nothing at all bad to say at all. I just wish it was in Asheville.

2zDwBPxprF0CfSu-GxMQgQ.text: Alex waited on us and was super sweet. She was patient and efficient.  Since it was our first time there she explained all the goodies on the menu and made suggestions. The food was delicious and came out quickly.  The sauces were all different and each tasty.  The hush puppies were wonderful.  We ended our meal with the pecan cobbler, a twist on pecan pie and it was scrumptious!  Be sure to get it topped with ice cream!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love the peppers
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket plate

OAecmcrO-gkY9InVMSiVag.text: Went there for an early dinner and pigged out (no pun intended lol)! The server was amazing! We tried their Cast Iron Cornbread (make sure to drizzle the honey on top), Pimento Cheese Fries, the Philly Cheese and humongous Beef Rib. I really enjoyed their four sauces as well. Last bit, be sure to save room for their banana pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

7F5w_KhGJ226NVTx-ZeeGA.text: BBQ with a full bar!  Hell Yeah!  Quick Summary  - Ribs, pork and brisket are very good  - Sides are okay  - Place deserves its high Yelp rating  - Service was excellent  - Parking can be a bitch  - Full bar with local/regional beers on draft  - Highly recommend  Long Review The proteins on the menu here are pretty extensive.  Chopped pork, brisket, beef and pork burnt ends, chicken, ribs and salmon.  You can even order the brisket lean, fatty or a combo which I found pretty cool.  Four sauces served with the food.  Eastern NC vinegar, sweet tomato base, low country SC sauce (mustard base) and a spicy habanero.  I gravated to the spicy habanero.  The sides we ordered were okay.  I'm sure the other sides are better that what I tried (sweet potato and regular fries).  The service was fantastic.  Our waitress, Sydney, was excellent,  She explained the menu and offered recommendations.    This place is very popular and it only has a small parking area at the front and side.  If you can't swing it then you may be forced to find street parking.  FYI, there is a sign on the door warning not to park in the shopping center across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket w/ Sweet Potato Fries
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 Rack Ribs w/ Sweet Potato Fries

gaBdWBl_e6V1EY4cadSndA.text: go to mac's or lancasters! i had very high hopes for this place... couldent wait for it to open and try it out. ordered it to go. got home and half the order was missing, and very small portions. high priced for what it is. they were out of a few items also, so before  you get your heart set on something call! they do have an awesome beer menu. cant comment on the ambience because i got it to go.

2EHErZI1JKfh7cJADGlj2w.text: Run of the Mill... Perhaps I have been spoiled by North Carolina BBQ.  This place does not meet the standards.  The sauce was ok, but the sauce did not make the BBQ good.  I was not excited about the pulled pork!

pwxgjnoNrzyS30Ac8QTJWQ.text: Amazing BBQ.   My wife and I had moved from Memphis, TN and considered ourselves fairly good judges of BBQ from not only living in one of the towns known for great BBQ but also competing in competitions for many years.  It is hard to find a place that actually uses a smoker on site, most either cook off site an then reheat or steam their meat.  Smoke flavor is amazing, only knock is that the menu is a little limited and they don't have a "sampler" platter where you can get the brisket, pulled pork etc all on one plate.  Great addition to plaza midwood and will be going back for more!  Oh yea and a great beer selection.

Eutue2adTAfyt6KciJUl7w.text: food is better than macs but the space isnt as cool, its actually a little tight in there.  im sure when its cooler and peeps can sit outside its better but it was hot and rainy last night and we were packed in that place like sardines.  their mac'n'cheese is better than macs, AND SO IS THEIR BRISKET, the ribs are better than most in town...  they have a very good beer selection.  GREAT hushpuppies.  great sauces and the chicken was very good as well.  dont bother ordering the wings as they are nothing special, not bad but save your stomach space for other things.  we sat right down and had a very nice server.  i will def be back frequently to try some other stuff and wanted to try the cream cheese brownie but couldnt put another thing in my mouth.  very reasonably priced as well i got the combo "well-fed" the smaller one and when they brought it out to me i thought it was the big one that i had seen on other peoples tables, for $16 it was a heck of a deal.  im still going to hit macs up as its good and right down the street from me but this place may have the edge on the bbq hotspots in town...for now

B7ieFbUQRA8IHs0vstbrig.text: Best brisket in Charlotte.  Enough said.  Also, get the jalapeno poppers.  They are amazing!  Baked beans are out of this world too!

X-Sz-eT7JvBDZPgwRvDCKA.text: First time in Charlotte and found this place on Yelp.  I'm glad we did!  The food was great and our server Ashley was very helpful explaining what options we had.  My wife and I split the combo plate which included (moo, cluck and oink) brisket, pulled chicken, ribs and chopped pork.  We chose bbq beans and coleslaw for our sides.  We had plenty to eat and took the rest home for another meal all for $21!  The chicken with the mustard sauce was my favorite.

qXa6LAG6XjJ87bEkkFFOgA.text: Everything we had was solid if not spectacular. I had the burnt ends, queso with brisket, fried pickles, and hush puppies. Cool building and location. Worth a visit definitely....as BBQs goodness is largely in the eye of the beholder.

Yoen1JVTb3Kz0mbqevIwEg.text: Good bbq! The burnt ends were delicious and the coleslaw and hushpuppies were great. The ribs were a bit over cooked and dried out but still had great flavor. The bacon wrapped jalepanos were good but the bacon could have been cooked a bit longer. Mac and cheese was good too. Skipped the smoked vegetables - those were no good.

hAvJmAkQgk0U2BVLytBnyg.text: You'll find great BBQ here. I would definitely go back. My favorite was the Smoked Chicken Wings. I ordered them dry and then was able to try the 3 different sauces. These wings still make my mouth water.   I also ordered the Well-Fed Combo and that was more than enough food. I ordered the Brisket, pulled pork, pulled chicken and Pork Ribs. The Pulled Pork and Ribs are not to be missed, full of flavor and moist. The pulled chicken and brisket were both a little dry.   The sauces were also very good, especially the honey-mustard. I ordered the coleslaw and bacon-wrapped jalapenos, both were really good.   I'm a big fan!

9hAhCevqQ1VldnLcKThCSw.text: Cool for what it is, but it ain't all that. I'll have to give this place another try and have the wings since I hear they're really good. I came here on a Saturday night to order take out and the place was PACKED. Like, no room to move packed. Ordered the food and I think it took about 30-35 minutes. $35 bucks for the "Pig Out" platter was enough to feed 4 ppl. The meats had decent flavor and were pretty good, the sides were just ok. The pickled onions were good!

as_pKBskkXEyhMbsd5QtYg.text: It is very Yummy BBQ. Consitently good. Good Service. Great beer selection.  The first time I went in, the waiter 'got mad at me' for getting a light beer and 'made me' "get a real beer fit for a man who works everyday". That was some good banter you wont get at a lot of places. It stays packed so be ready. Good people watching, great beer. pretty good BBQ. It isn't hardcore BBQ but this is Charlotte and good luck to you if you are looking for the holy grail. This is a great weekend place, with good food, nice people, great beer. Really can't go wrong for the money, quality of food, and atmosphere.

AaCPdTNqaPQ5u1uYiczCaw.text: We had a good experience here. Our waitress was fantastic and the food was tasty. My only gripe was that I ordered the half slab of ribs with sweet potato fries and mac & Cheese, and the ribs were a little dry. Still good but I wanted them a little more tender. The mac & cheese noodles were a little under done, I would've liked them a little softer. Great beer menu and the sweet potato fries were delicious, fresh out the fryer like I like them. My husband had the burnt ends, he liked them. We would go back, next time I will try the brisket.

ml7J2tMEaYG7TLyvD6bq2Q.text: Went here for the first time last night (Tue).  They have 1/2 price martinis which was good because I needed me some vodka, and having it 1/2 price made it all the better!  Started with the queso with pulled pork.  I thought it was really good and the small was plentiful for 2 of us.  My other friend had the bruschetta and he seemed to enjoy it.  I went with brisket on the servers recommendation, and opted for lean with mac n cheese.  Brisket was good, but I wish I had gotten fatty, it seemed like it would have been a bit tastier.  The hushpuppies were awesome!!  I really loved them.  I liked the onions, they were nice and sweet.  Mac n cheese was okay, least favorite part of the meal.  Service was good, we were seated right away since it was early.  I really liked the interior of this place and they had a great 80s music station on which I loved!  I had no issue with saltiness with any of the food and I am someone who doesn't add salt to anything so I would have noticed right away.  All in all I liked it a lot and I would not hesitate to go back, its close to home too, so yay!!

-ZJ8Nr5Wz7-ClNo_0ViFXQ.text: I loved this place! I got the brisket which was perfect and the mac n cheese was so good! Probably my favorite bbq place in Charlotte. The atmosphere was very warm and our waitress was friendly!

QZYpFym-apusILkcOtGAag.text: There was no wait on a Wednesday night.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  Ribs, Smoked Chicken, collards and Mac & cheese.  The meats were all tender, ribs were the star, everything else was decent.

H9Z9Tlrs65eephh0IxaVyw.text: Had CJ as a waiter. He was great and helpful. The BBQ was smoky with great bark. Sides and sauces were unreal. Will be back each time we come to Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 4 meat platter. Brisket, smoked sausage, pulled pork, smoked turkey breast, smoked veggies and creamed corn.

MzQRlYi7_HSUtZov2I6XxA.text: When my husband and I moved to Charlotte in April 2014, this was one of the first places that we visited. In the last year, it has quickly become one of our favorite spots! The food and service is consistently good and it is the best BBQ that we have found in the Charlotte area. Try the burnt ends and the mac 'n cheese!  The parking and wait can sometimes but an issue but I can assure you that it is worth the wait. They offer a service that will text you when your table is ready so you can go across the street for a drink while you're waiting. Also, getting there early is definitely recommended in order to get decent parking.

SrHozKhDqrDNU6OcsvwDEw.text: Oh yea! BBQ at its finest! The burnt ends are worth the wait. I have been coming here long before Hilary and Obama came and I can honestly say they got it right every time! The wings, the salads, the sandwiches, and the sides make this a BBQ standard. Go, you won't be disappointed.

Ju-7rkdenetZsR9KXB4OBQ.text: Ate dinner here on Friday night and was extremely disappointed in the BBQ. I'm a native Charlottean and have had many types of BBQ and this is not a good Carolina-style BBQ. The sauce was terrible and the pork had an odd flavor. The BBQ Half Chicken was good, but the pulled pork was terrible. The Banana Pudding was incredible though.

za4ph7fGlokzT644LokRQA.text: First off if anyone thinks that Mac's speed shop is good BBQ, you don't know BBQ!!  The food was amazing, Ive been looking for some good BBQ in Charlotte for a while now. Tried a whole bunch of different places and this is by far the best! The only reason it only gets 4 out of 5 stars is strictly because I have only been here once and I need to try some more of their food.   I ordered the "Super Bird" let me just say one word, AMAZING!! It was so so good, I also had some brisket which again was AMAZING, fall off the bone just like it should be! You can never go wrong with fried pickles and they do it right. It is not pickles chips like most places have but actual pickle slices. What this does is make it have more pickle flavor without all of the breading which is very good.The waitstaff is friendly and very inviting. That in itself is hard to find. We had the waiter Zach and he was great. Made a bunch of good recommendations on the menu and even other restaurants in the area.   A whole lotta people try BBQ and not many people can succeed and let me tell you, they go it right!

5VwjSTWpZSQG1qewACkWlQ.text: Ever since I moved to Charlotte I have been searching for amazing brisket and hadn't found it until I went to Smokehouse! I ordered the brisket plate and got sweet cream corn and baked beans as my sides. Being that I have been consistently disappointed with the brisket around here I didn't keep my expectations high when ordering but when I say I think I went to heaven within the first few bites, I am not exaggerating. It was AMAZING! It was so juicy and just fell apart. The flavor was on point and they do give you yummy dipping sauce, but I didn't even use it because the brisket was so good it didn't need it. I wish I could have had just a plate plied high with brisket upon brisket. The sides were just as good and did not disappoint. I am so happy I found this place as this will be my go to spot for now and always.  The service was just as good as the food and you can tell that Smokehouse must have a good rapport because it was packed early on a Wednesday night. The owners or managers, not sure which, come by often making sure your dinning experience is going well, which I always appreciate and find very professional and caring. The place itself has a good vibe with a mix of different kinds of people and ages.   I will most definitely be back often and can't wait to try everything on the menu! But most likely I will always incorporate brisket into my meal any way I can! Cheers!

p8_xXg_phrEHB0ituVu29A.text: Came here with a few other Wounded Warriors for dinner and let me tell you it was delicious! Everything that was excellent! The waiters were extremely polite. The atmosphere was clean and friendly!  There is something about Southern BBQ food that I love, and this place has it going on.  I defiantly will be back to Midwood Smokehouse when I'm in the Charlotte area.

tJr78GqFOGyYGwYlRAFJ0w.text: Arrived just before the dinner rush apparently, although there were still quite a few people. Got sat, got our food in a very timely manner and the food was great. Great service and environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large brisket plate w/ crinkle fries and Mac &amp; cheese
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked ribs appetizer

bcpq0nAdFQxV_XSFWv8P1Q.text: Tasty mixed (fatty and lean) brisket with tangy sauce and PROPER IPAs on tap is all this humble Seattleite could hope for this far from home.

BZYkaZ6pk3EcHXGFyC-WkQ.text: A smokehouse doing everything right.  Definitely a favorite.  Fair prices, great services and overall great menu.

jFDhmlnrJI7sPj6J9LhtUw.text: This barbecue place is awesome! Great ribs that fall off the bone, great bourbon, atmosphere, and music. Can't be beat and highly recommend their bacon wrapped jalapenos.

4bBWs9Ko5TMzmdYjybe48Q.text: Finally got a chance to try this place out after passing by it so many times on the way to Plaza shopping and bars.  We split a large pulled pork plate and a small chopped salad.  The pulled pork comes with the vinegar based sauce, but we were lucky they forgot to pour it on top so they put it on the side, and since it was my first time there, I asked to try out their other sauces.  I preferred their Midwood signature, which was sweet and smokey, over the NC vinegar, but to each their own.  The pork itself was just ok, as I've had better and I've had worse.    Now to the sides.  We tried the bacon wrapped jalapenos and the bbq baked beans.  The jalapenos were good with cheese inside, but the bacon was just too fatty as it was all baked together and didn't cook enough.  I was also wary of the baked beans since I know many places who just open up a can and serve.  Theirs were cooked right with some pieces of meat in it, making it very tasty.  I would definitely recommend the beans to any barbecue fan.  Overall, the service was pretty good, as our server was keen to help us with the menu and seemed knowledgeable.  We came at an off-hour during the week, so I can't speak to the crowds here, but I can see an issue if the cramped parking lot that writhes around the building gets packed.  Will come back to try their other entrees and sandwiches!

4f-wzupf2VFK_2Zp2V8qrA.text: I am such a happy camper! Great food and even better service. The icing on the cake is the fact the mac & cheese is some of the best I've ever tasted. Compliments to the bartender as well. I'll definitely keep coming back.

VL1URoGYjfn2zdF_Tr9A_A.text: Great but can be inconsistent.  Had some great meals but also some pretty bad ones.  But always had great service.

90gnVzz--WI3CyBb5exkgA.text: This place scores a 3.5 out of 5 stars. Slightly above average but not great.  Decent but not amazing. Service friendly but not super attentive.  Again I hate asking for water and again I had to ask and for refills.  We started with fried pickles and bacon wrapped jalapenos. Fried pickles were great however a little greasy but solid 4.5/5 in my book.  Bacon wrapped jalapenos just average 3/5. It was missing spice and flavor. I mainly tasted bacon. My husband and I split a rack of ribs which included two sides.  More than enough to share. We didn't finish. Mac and cheese was good 3/5 but I prefer a different style.  Cole slaw was great full of flavor 5/5. We finished off the meal with the small banana pudding which was perfect for two to share.  Light and fluffy 5/5.  We had a decent time but nothing to pull me back to this place.  If you are in the area might be good to try but I wouldn't make a special trip.  Just another thing we were lucky we got seats at the bar otherwise party of two was at least a thirty minute wait at 9pm on a Friday night. Usually past my bedtime Update!!! 8/6/15 I love that midtown responded my review and it was NOT a generic response it was detailed to my review. That brought then up to four stars for sure!  It's nice to know they use fresh jalapenos therefore spice on the appetizer will very.  I look forward to going back and writing a five star review!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding small $2.50 5/5 perfect light and fluffy
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cole slaw 5/5 great flavor and texture
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and cheese side 3/5 decent nothing wow

s9DWUOSlH44ofANTp4BsbQ.text: Worst experience here EVER!! If you're ever in a rush or expect to get your food at a reasonable time, definitely don't come here. We were told our food would be ready in 15 mins and we waited well over 40mins. The manager eventually came out and said they ran out of chicken and that's why they had to restart our whole order. Worst experience ever and I'd highly suggest to not come here

0zfV82NyW8SCn5T_FDCARw.text: Good BBQ! I tried the salmon with creamed corn and also got a salad. All three of the items were great, and I would highly recommend any of those options. My boyfriend got the rib meal, and it was definitely a hearty portion and looked good. I am looking forward to trying the grilled cheese next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large pork plate with creamed corn, baked beans and hush puppies!

zdMtHKFwn5Ogp315FUGIJQ.text: Best BBQ place in Charlotte! I like the brisket! Also the bacan wrapped with jelepeno side is the must to try.

ji6KYt9-hvwBK6YEdtoqig.text: This place has excellent bbq. Everything I've had there is delicious and good. It tends to get crowded at times so be prepared to wait a bit

kfJ743N7N8xotcrqQU6Wlg.text: I've heard so many good things about mid wood and have been a couple times recently. Each time I have gotten the pulled pork sandwich, and while good, it didn't live up to the hype. I found the fries to be really salty both times.   This is definitely a great place for bbq! I wouldn't be opposed to returning. I might be getting the wrong thing, it just wasn't the best I've had in town. But everyone was else I was with loved it! So if you like bbq definitely give it a try!

QohUhd0TVHTVnJ01TJAzwQ.text: Subpar food but the service is the worst. Waited a hour and 10 on food I know it's a busy Friday night but they don't have it together at all

drgkFCLXNutQKiYeCFZmLw.text: Just want to start by saying that the service is excellent. Our waiter Matt was exceptional and knew what he was doing.  The food is great, the beef brisket being my favorite. The pork ribs are also tasty but the chicken is just okay. Jalapeno wrapped in bacon and the baked beans are the better sides.  Will be back for sure next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped jalapeños
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

pCa2k2WofWm1pjt8vf3n3w.text: I visited this comfortable restaurant today for lunch, and I'll definitely be coming back. A few of us split the queso, and the other side had the queso with brisket (which is a tad more delicious). I ordered the BBQ Chicken Sandwich, with the slaw on the side and a side of BBQ Baked Beans. Instead of getting the SC Mustard sauce that comes on the sandwich, I asked for a sweet sauce and they provided me with the Midwood House BBQ sauce. That was suuuch a great decision! The sandwich was wonderful; the pulled chicken was tender, and there was so much meat that I was able to take some home. The baked beans, which our server Kecia recommended, were delicious!! They had meat in them (for all the plant-based eaters) and they were sweet and soft. The cole slaw was also pretty delicious. I was at a table with 5 other ladies, and all of us got bags to go home. The sweet tea was just a tad bit strong, but good indeed. I'll be back soon to try the brisket.  Had to make a quick edit; I think the chicken messed with my stomach. It started hurting about 20 minutes after eating, and was sensitive for a good 2 days. I'd recommend the brisket and be careful with the chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

hhd3m5zBJwg9bY-Efsf5DQ.text: One of my fave places in Charlotte! The BBQ sammies, Mac and cheese, and pimento cheese fries? You can't go wrong!

3Diffdc-plh_--yS-F1JXg.text: Absolutely terrible take out experience. The lady that took our order entered it in incorrectly but we didn't know until we waited about 25 minutes for the food. The same lady then apologized for the mistake saying that the manager should have apologized (even though it was her error). We didn't want to wait any longer and ended up taking the incorrect meal with just an apology to show for it. We'll go to Saucemans next time

RkTfadHuNImm6l0PYGrlBw.text: Do yourself a favor and visit this place! Found it as a recommendation from the airport car rental agent. We had a long layover in Charlotte and took the kids downtown for the afternoon. Clint our waiter was awesome, the food was awesome, great environment, great experience. My oldest son had the smoked wings, tasted great.  My wife "built" her own salad and that was great. Cheesestake sandwich was very good as well.  Very reasonably priced.

5TNtOn5rkwqpemd_hb0bVA.text: Pro: big portions of food.  Con:  The location has the worst customer service inside and delivery. If I see one more worker at the bar eating while she is working. Really, that is unsanitary and bad customer service.

LMYTPyZmq-pHVPu41Y3DjQ.text: Great place to eat. I love the desserts! Intimate bar like atmosphere. You won't find better BBQ in that area!

l3K1rG_D4MEhl23lNDzTVA.text: Pimento cheese were awesome! Hush puppies were really delicious too with ketchup. I had the BBQ pork sandwich - it was very tasty but a little difficult to eat as the bread fell apart pretty quickly. My friends enjoyed the ribs, said the chicken was a tad dry. Overall great BBQ and good service.

JOpi4_BQPrS7Wdb1uI2oxA.text: Yummy! Had the beef brisket. It was amazing. The smoked veggies and the pecan cobbler were also delish. Service was good and the prices were reasonable. Only in Charlotte for a couple of days but we will likely reyurn to try some other things.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pecan cobbler
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Brisket
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. NC

LU2Uffatmqlsri_HaEQc1w.text: From the moment we walked in to the last drink....awesome experience! Michael crushed it! He shared the favorites, spoke to the changes on the menu and the adult beverage variety is fantastic...the BURNT ENDS were monstrous and packed full of flavor!!!  I'll fly back again!

BWB1V0O3eWoIkzd6u4nDzg.text: We ordered the "Well Fed" meal in which we chose: double Brisket, pulled pork, sausage, collard greens, slaw and added a side "Burnt Ends" for 5 dollars.  Drank local beer Cowboy Betty.  I really enjoyed the Pork barbeque although it is not traditional North Carolina BBQ.  It had a delicious sweet & smoky flavor that was able to hold its own without adding any sauce.  Very tender and tasted as if basted in drippings from the cook.  We asked for a bun or roll but it was not available.  We were offered Texas Toast but did not try it. 4.75 Stars  The sausage was also very good. 4 Stars  My friend John really enjoyed the brisket but I did not.  The texture was right and passed the pull test but my piece did not have the smoky flavor I was looking for.  It didn't have much flavor at all.  I gave John the rest of my brisket and he said that his was better.  Not sure if I was just unlucky.  It tasted better with the Midwood Sauce on it. 2.5 Stars  We were really excited to try the Burnt Ends based on the waiters description.  They were a bit dry and texture was a little tougher than I had imagined.  2.5 Stars   Collard greens 3.5 Stars Cowboy Betty:  Really nice wheat beer. 4.5 Stars Slaw: 2.5 Stars  Service was nice and waiter was well informed about the menu but he didn't seem to be focused on the floor.  Once food got out, employees seemed focused on conversations with each other and did not look back at the tables for longer than normal periods of time.   All in all we really enjoyed our meal.  The pulled pork, sausage and collard greens were excellent and we would highly recommend the restaurant if in the Charlotte, NC area.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket, BBQ, Burnt Ends, Collards greens and slaw

UJ9uc2Oit47K-8i3WAFQJg.text: Good but not e best. Ribs were my favorite even though everyone said to get the brisket. Service is excellent and supper friendly.  By all means go here, but not in my atop 3 list.

wQ9jqdwfw1KLxLEgLL0zog.text: Who can go to North Carolina and not get some BBQ? Unfortunately, Charlotte is not one of the main BBQ hubs in the state. Midwest Smokehouse, however, serves up some delicious BBQ.  The Smoked Wings ($8) is a pound of chicken wings that are smoked then finished on the grill. They were meaty, but still tender and had the right amount of smoke. My mouth is watering just thinking about them they were so good.  The Combo Platter (Well Fed $24) comes with your choice of 4 proteins. We chose pulled pork which was smoky and delicious; beef brisket which was tender and full of flavor with just the right amount of fat; burnt ends which had a nice char and a juicy fat cap; and some St. Louis style pork ribs which were fall off the bone tender. The platter comes with pickled onions and hush puppies, which were tender with a nice corn flavor. You also get 2 sides, in our case we got the mac & cheese which was rich and creamy, and the bacon wrapped jalapenos which didn't pack too much of a punch but had a great crispy bacon coating.  We got the bread pudding, which was soggy (I like it this way) studded with raisins. The ice cream helped to added another layer of richness and creaminess to the dish. Would get this again.  The Banana Pudding ($5.50) was a very large portion of vanilla pudding with loads of bananas and vanilla wafers. I think they folded in some whipped cream as the dish was actually somewhat light. Between the two desserts, this was the bigger hit.  Midwest Smokehouse puts out some good food which explains the lines and packed house. This is a solid choice to get your BBQ fix in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pudding
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Wings
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo Platter

W2kFRvgUL-xNZy56nDo87g.text: Simply the best BBQ in Charlotte.  I keep trying other places but I come back to Midwood over and over again.

3Qo9BVaeJZqzxhPoE4FCig.text: One of the better places for BBQ in town. I always try to visit when in town and take many a business associate to try the local offerings. The food is plenty, the service fast and attentive, the prices reasonable, and the BBQ is good. Even off BBQ items like Salmon, and Salads are very tasty.

INTHps8-oZ8GC59doUwLLA.text: Very much enjoyed this place. I asked my Airbnb host where I could find some real Carolina BBQ and she pointed me to Midwood. We ordered the brisket (both fatty and lean portions), bbq baked beans, cole slaw and pecan cobbler. The brisket was tasty but a tad bit tough, but the baked beans, cole slaw and pecan cobbler more than made up for anything lacking with the brisket. The place was slammed busy all night so I knew we were in the right place.

BYIjVDh9svcDxDGucqoHGw.text: Let me start off by saying we normally love midwood smoke house, so I'm going to give it 3 stars. We decided to stop by here for a large banana pudding on the way home. When we got home and took it out of the bag we were very disappointed. It was half full. That definitely wasn't worth $5.50. Come on midwood! You're better than that!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half full banana pudding!

f9Tea0FZU6_YR6bI5_wOOQ.text: Midwood Smokehouse, where do we begin?  Let's start with service, which, to my experience has always been great! Everyone's friendly and helpful, love it.  The sauce, well, the namesake BBQ sauce is pretty good! It's a little thinner than I'm used to, but I dig it.  The hush puppies, friggin amazing. Where I'm originally from, hush puppies aren't a thing. They should be ,though, as long as they're always as good as the ones you get here. Fantastic, best pups I've ever had!  Everything else is kind of average. I've had BBQ a lot of places (there is a pulled pork sandwich in my life that I get actually emotional about every time I have it). Most of the reviews would lead you to thinking the BBQ here is that good. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad, but I've had a lot better Q in my day.  This place gets insanely busy. Be prepared to have a backup plan if you're trying to come here at peak hours.  We've been a couple times now, if you're really craving BBQ this will do. I'm going to give some other places a shot for now.

HMHIf104yDmtfeSbcpnwpA.text: I'm a Lexington girl myself and thought I'd never find good barbecue in Charlotte. I was able to try the pulled pork and burnt ends. I would definitely order the brisket over the pork but they were both good and the barbecue sauce wasn't that bad either. I prefered the glaze on the brisket better both their sauces. They have a good selection and the staff was super helpful in making good choices. Although some of the sides were a miss, I can't wait to go back because overall barbecue is all about the meat.

nMxE7CjZmuMIFBhnW1J1zQ.text: A. was my waitress, she was menu-intellegent, friendly, responsive, and customer conscious. I had the small tossed salad (big and yummy) BBQ Chicken with smoked veggies (very yummy). I will definitely be back next visit, and would recommend.

NAjc_Ph4Ppftd5rMdXGScg.text: I recently stopped at Midwood Smokehouse to grab lunch, right before my flight back to Chicago. I was looking forward to try some Carolina bbq and this place delivered far beyond my expectations! My friends and I split a couple of "pig out" platters with pulled pork, brisket, St Louis ribs, sausage, and burnt ends...everything was delicious. The sides were super tasty as well: hushpuppies, mac n' cheese, baked beans (yum!), creamed corn, and the best smoked veggies I've ever had. The hosts were friendly and accommodating and Taylor, our server, was knowledgeable, attentive, and provided awesome local beer and bourbon recommendations. Midwood Smokehouse has  become a must-visit everytime I'm in the Charlotte area.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Piggin&#39; out!

_gT7d1T-FOgtCh1N7Z20VQ.text: Finally tried this place and everything others say is True.  Awesome BBQ, exceptional friendly service, and great selection of sauces and, oh yeah, draft beer specials and bourbons.  Can't see how you can go wrong here. Kudos.  2nd visit: Brisket is so delicious that it seems like a waste to change the flavor with sauce!  Order mixed brisket, it isn't fatty at all.  Don't care for the hush puppies, however; perhaps you can substitute something better.

NoDmST0Y9ml9PETwXPlEiQ.text: Yelpers seem to love this place, so in planning a trip to Charlotte I decided it was a must do. We walked in on a busy Sunday and were advised that a seat at the bar would be the fastest way to food. We were warmly greeted and ordered sweet tea as we browsed the menu. The tea was perfectly syrupy sweet and we received our meals shortly after ordering. I ordered the Carolina pork plate with bacon wrapped jalapenos, fries, and hush puppies. My boyfriend had the Cuban and the BBQ slaw. After we received our meal a refill was hard to find, which as I ate jalapenos was annoying. The food was good, I found I am just not a fan of "dressed" pulled pork. I prefer to add my level of sauce. Overall it was tasty and very reasonably priced. We'd visit again.

9YcPVvqWbK29TfekPqAdFg.text: Excellent Atmosphere. that is something i really adore. it's my first trip, so i had a small bbq briskette platter. was excellent. Corn as the side, was excellent.  Appreciate the quantity of the food as well. Hope to return soon. will hope to improve to a full 5 next time i  am there.

wEThGmVvfC4oH2syP8vw1g.text: Excellent service and food at a great price. We ordered the BBQ chicken and ribs, BBQ slaw, sweet potato fries , ice tea and some beers. Will def be back.

1U0KKDwsxGD2pgv5hlUuZQ.text: A-Ok.... Let me just say, I LOVE THEIR CUBAN Sandwich!!! to die for... the only reason why they are getting 3 stars is because some of their staff SUCKS!!!!  I think I have called in about 8 times in the past for pick up orders, each time I say PLEASE put some napkins and silverware in because I like to eat out in the park or somewhere outdoors, therefor I cannot get my own fork!, all 6 times I've ordered, they don't ive me any napkins or silverware! it is becoming super annoying , there were few times that the waiter had a bad attitude and I was just about to call the manager because that was the same person who did not put napkins and silverware, the only thing you are supposed to do!!!

BukDAQc5u_yqk-3xcDQWbw.text: Awesome BBQ & service!! This was our first stop after our 5 hour flight from the west coast, and our kids' first real southern BBQ experience. It definitely lived up to all our expectations. We shared a family platter and a beef rib (which they only serve on the weekends and looks like the Flintstones rib that tipped over their car) and it was plenty for our family of six! The BBQ was melt-in-your mouth good, and the hush puppies and collard greens were excellent. They serve the best sweet potato fries we've ever had. We also enjoyed a local hard cider (or two) with our meal. Even our hard-that-please teen & tween were impressed with this place. I'd give it 10 stars if I could.

Axwa1Rpv7dxG0ku2l1RqBA.text: The bbq chicken was moist tender, and oh-so-smoky.  Got the sampling platter and split it with my husband and it was almost too much for us.  BBQ beans were out of this world, the burnt ends are fantastic.  Ambiance was just perfect, the wait staff were friendly, fun, and on their toes.   Love this place!

BmUVinLMrOB5AOX8AMHM6A.text: Melt in your mouth barbecue and brisket. The mac & cheese and creamed corn are also delicious. Try everything!  Also, if you like Cheerwine they serve it in glass bottles. Delicious!

owjVUw8eW-NiEYbQZxuoMA.text: Ok so I heard about this place, saw the high score with a lot of reviews and I was super excited to visit. Arrived on a Saturday afternoon and they were really busy. Place my order at the bar. Service was good for takeout. Although I wasn't staying, the atmosphere seemed cool. I ordered the ribs (sauced) with mac and cheese and baked beans. Oh yeah, I also got an extra side of creamed corn. On my first visit to places, I like to get several options. My hope is that at least one is a winner that gives me that gotta go back feeling. Well this one was a bust. The creamed corn was awful. It seemed to be fresh whole kernel corn with some sort of cream base added to it. I'm a southern girl. Fresh corn cut off the cob there is a natural milk that can be scraped off the cob to get a cream base if you are somewhat of a cook. Lol. The Mac and cheese was baked but it was just a step above that kiddy cheesy Mac that are in the commercials. The only reason I know it was baked it because it had that brown baked cheese topped crust which can be sooo good. This one had a charred tasted. The baked beans were the best of the sides but just ok. I could taste a tomato base. I'm just not a fan of tomato based baked beans. And finally the ribs. They are definitely smoked and seem to be slow cooked since they had no problem coming off the bone. Not the best ribs that I've tasted but I did enjoy them. All in all it didn't leave me with the feeling that I had to get back there and get back there soon. 2.5 stars would have been better but not so good that I was willing to round up to 3, so I'm leaving it at 2 stars.

nsPJjN5KyXmoOU6Z9cYgkA.text: So, I don't love bbq maybe as much as I should.  It's good, don't get me wrong...but that much meat at once just isn't my thing.  That being said, if you do love bbq this place is 5 stars for sure!  We went a few weeks ago and after a short wait were seated.  My husband and our friend each ordered a beer that was reasonably priced, I stuck to soda.  We then promptly ordered the pimento cheese fries as an appetizer because we're fat kids and they sounded delicious.  They arrived and bonus! were topped with delicious pulled pork.  I could have eaten just this as my dinner.  We chose some sort of meat and sides extravaganza that was more than enough for 3.  We chose the bacon wrapped jalapenos and mac and cheese as sides, both were excellent.  The meats were great too and the mustard based bbq sauce was by far my favorite.  If you're in plaza midwood and craving bbq, definitely make a stop here!

6_0OtQ6G-M6NUzZcIE5XRQ.text: The pulled pork grilled cheese is flat out AMAZING. The wings are also very VERY good. I cannot talk about anything else because I cannot NOT order these every time I go. lol. They have small crinkle cut french fries which is a surprising treat.  Parking isn't the great

oXea-7qWUWZOZ0moCac0og.text: I haven't reviewed the New Smokehouse yet? What a bad yelper I have become. I originally went open weekend and was blown out of the water. Solid BBQ here! Go for the Brisket and Beer Specials!   So I've been twice, and if I cared not about my waste line it would probably be more. First of all you gotta start with the pimento cheese fries, why? two words: pulled pork. Yes they hook it up. I am actually really embarrassed that I ordered them because I am not a fry person. The roommate wanted them so I ordered them. A Must have!  As far as BBQ goes it is all smoked to perfection, unlike the other "M" place. Brisket is the best hands down, then ribs, chicken, pulled pork. It really is all good and the sauces aren't something you really need. The meat has such good flavor without it, but you know the mustard sauce is bang'n. Midwood has solid sides as well, tried them all.  I have never had a bad server and that bartender that looks like an all-growned-up Bobby Hill is so sweet! Great people all around. See you soon!

mLHmWfh3tQSz2IH1SCRfcA.text: I ordered the Cuban sandwich which was very good. The pork that was on the sandwich was smoked well and very tasty! There were a few things I was disappointed in, however, one of which being the habanero barbeque sauce they had. I am a fan of all things spicy, and I was expecting a pretty big kick from the sauce. I was disappointed that the sauce was actually extremely mild with hardly any spice at all. Also, the smoked vegetables were not really that flavorful and had kind of an odd taste to it. All in all, I will definitely come back because I had very few complaints about the place. The jalepenos were also delicious :)

9-KWgjUk8ulRCTwbtfajGw.text: I went to mid wood smokehouse on a Saturday night. That was a mistake; the wait for a table wasn't too bad - only 20 minutes but then it took an additional hour to actually get our food. It was extremely noisy and I was seated in the corner facing the wall which didn't help the perception of how long we waited. Moving on... We ordered the brisket and the smoked chicken. My partner said the sauce was just ok and the beans were terrible. I tried them to see if she was overly critical and have to agree. I don't know what they were thinking when they paired the flavors for the beans. This taste was definite not Texas BBQ. The smoked chicken was also just ok. It tasted as if it had been boiled and then smoked for a very short time. The "smoked" veggeis were grilled not smoked. Service was mediocre at best. Again IT WAS NOISEY!!! Suggestion: Get rid of the multiple TV screens (or turn the off) and turn off the canned music, and have some good live music to keep people entertained if you make them wait. And pay the musicians! All in all food just OK, service mediocre, atmosphere thumbs down!

wu3wO61FPHKf-6zMnu_4oQ.text: This place has some of the best Bar B Q!!  Love the brisket and the slaw is amazing!  I have only been there 3 times but every time is great!  Sometimes it's very busy on the weekend but worth the wait!  Great to sit outside and enjoy the view while enjoying great food.  All the sides are tasty!  I especially like the bacon wrapped jalapenos!  Yum!

lSCU2cocd8m-Fq71aqZ8QA.text: My initial visit to Midwood Smokehouse was shortly after they opened.  We were extremely excited to have a legit BBQ place open in the neighborhood and were eager to try it.  We loved the smoked meat and were not pleased with the sides.  I have since been back recently and they have not been stagnant, instead they have improved a lot of things.  The smoked meet is still great and the sides have vastly improved.  Being a Mac n Cheese fan, their's is definitely up there.  The most recent visit I had one of the most delicious sandwiches ever.  It was a burger made from ground smoked brisket, topped with pepper jack cheese and a healthy serving of pulled pork.  I actually can't stop thinking about how good it was.

99hqtQ4oawS5UGQ8pyCIMQ.text: The food is great but the atmosphere is lacking. The bar and the patio is appealing but the room to the right has cheesy decorations, no windows, and dark navy carpet. A redesign would benefit them well. The food is delicious and the service is great. However, on half price wine Thursday they do not have chillers to keep the white wine cold- but we drank it quick enough to not notice.

Sy4RLZ9YpPejscIOonpP5Q.text: HOLY HELL was this place good!   Now, I'm a guy born and raised in the deep South and I know my BBQ.   Midwood Smokehouse was RIGHT ON!    For my first visit to this place, I had to try the pulled pork plate.  I got a little of all 4 sauces to see which was my favorite.   All of 'em were good.  Mac and Chz and Collards were excellent too.  Lots and lots of Flavor.  Service was quick and efficient (although we went on a Monday...so things were at a little slower pace).    I most definitely recommend this restaurant for people who love BBQ.  I'm so glad they set up shop in my hood.  I'll be back....of that you can be sure!

QJWqdo5EvI3SjGyQzrJ4ZQ.text: Just the mention of Midwood makes me JIZZ in my pants. I always have the brisket with mac and cheese and it's godlike. I could smell my dessert (apple crisp) coming and at that moment knew I no longer needed a girlfriend...for i have MIDWOOD.

UzDH6zCnF_EL61WPIDAirg.text: Great bbq just outside the city.  Great atmosphere but they have very limited table seating and parties of 5 or more can only sit at the high top tables. (at least that's what we were told) I've dined at countless bbq restaurants and have made great bbq for 15 years and every place is different.  I will tell you this about Midwood:  it is True SMOKEY bbq.  If you like your bbq on the sweeter side and not as smokey, this place is NOT for you.  Personally, I appreciate most styles and tend to make my own this same way so I found it pretty tasty.  The Cuban sandwich was great also as were the sides.

DXO_5SF28A3zZUSieKUonA.text: I had a good experience at Midwood I just wasn't all that crazy about the food. It was good just not great. The menu was enticing and I'd like to come back and try a few other items.  I liked the atmosphere and the service was good - I snagged a picnic table outside and really enjoyed my dollar beers.   The queso was ok a little heavy but comes in a large portion and could feed quite a few people.

HFzr7aymx3iPJn2vvZ-lqg.text: Good service, pretty good BBQ.  Really enjoyed the crowd during a Panthers game.  If you're in the area, give it a try but it's not distinguishable enough from other smokehouses around Charlotte to travel out of your way here.

QSsjW33eLvyRsGh8_iOksw.text: If they had a 3.5 star this would be my review, I still think they're a lil' pricey/precious on their drinks, but MAN is the food good..even the salads are killer...and I thought MACS did the best beef brisket I'd ever had til I tried this brisket....seriously so tender you can cut w/some slight pressure with a fork....  oddly the meat i think is not great is their BBQ itself....it tastes like its been soaking in a bottle of Liquid Smoke, just WAY WAY too smokey/pungent...i know u want smokehouse flavor but this is overkill....but everything else is really really good

z7UWFbFGygcd9WtvDyfeHA.text: I can't believe I never tried this place when I lived in Charlotte! I'm so glad I bookmared Midwood to try out on a recent return visit to Queen City. My friend and I were visiting and I was showing her a True southern time.,, Meaning lots of BBQ of course. I thought this place would be a great fit to see the funky/cool plaza scene and eat some great food! Dannngggg (in True southern fashion)- this place is awesome!  We sat outside and enjoyed the afternoon, ordered some sweet tea. It's insanely sweet, I recommend getting half & half. (sweet and unsweetened). Our waiter was helpful and made some good recommendations. The pulled pork sandwich was southern goodness at it's finest. We also ordered the works- sweet potato fries, hush puppies, mac and cheese and grilled veggies! Everything was so delicious! The mac & cheese was out of this world. To make it even better, our meal averaged 10 bucks a person. Doesn't get better than that.... parking can be tough just fyi.

jRNA9eqwlT41Ydp7cFztlQ.text: Visited Charlotte on the spouse program (wife had a business meeting and I tag along.) I know Carolina BBQ means pork, but I opted for the brisket. It was the best brisket I have eaten. You can get lean, fatty, or mixed, mine was the mixed. It was very tender and had just the right amount of tasty fat!!! Mac and cheese as a side was baked, not just macaroni and cheese sauce. It was very good. There is a large beer list and many choices of bourbon if that's your thing. Definitely gets a return visit if I visit Charlotte again.

OHCggvSFglkofHNrPig6EA.text: Food was quite good. Burnt ends and Smoked Mac n cheese where outstanding Service was not great but I would return

7DJKh3_5A5rNVF_eRoqGrA.text: I always stumbled a bit when someone would ask me about my favorite place to go for BBQ in town, but I have to say Midwood unexpectedly has given me an answer.  The brisket is amazing (definitely for Charlotte, but even compared to all the Texas brisket I've consumed in my life), the mac n cheese is delish, and you can't go wrong with bacon wrapped jalaps and crispy hushpuppies. The staff steered me away from the pulled pork both times - so I went with the ribs on my second trip - pretty darn good. (I'm trying it next time, though) Lots of side options, but I remember them being a little light on the veg entree options. The Midwood bbq sauce is my current fave, but their mustard sauce is tasty as well. (I still have not come to love carolina vinegarness, so I didn't even try theirs)  Decent beers on tap, lots of whiskey options, and great patio space. The staff is super friendly, though the bartenders may have asked if we were okay a handful too many times. (A little hard to eat if every 30 seconds I have to respond to the question) Pretty speedy service at lunch, looking forward to returning.

ateK0_1aCm8ynV4mdV8DoA.text: Having reintroduced pork into my diet, I couldn't wait to try out Midwood Smokehouse. A couple of friends and I went over there on a Saturday night, and due to the lovely weather which allowed the patios (yes, there are two - one upstairs and one downstairs) to be open, we only had a 15 minute wait. We sat at the bar and discussed the food options with the bar tender. By the time we sat down we were all ready to order.  We started with a basket of hush puppies because this is a BBQ joint - you have to start with hush puppies. And they did not disappoint. Dipped in the delicious BBQ sauce with a nice outside crunch and soft interior. Delish.   I ordered the small pork platter with mac-and-cheese (once again because it's a BBQ joint and you've got to have some mac-and-cheese). Good thing I ordered the small! There was enough food on my plate to feed at least two, possibly three, people. And more hush puppies on the side. The pork was so delicious with the spicy BBQ sauce that I barely tapped into the mac-and-cheese and didn't even touch the extra hush puppies.   Service was quick and efficient, and we never got to the bottom of our drink glasses. Parking can be a bit tricky as the lot is small and the place seems to always be hopping, but that will not deter me. I will definitely be back for more, Midwood. And soon.

aZpXN9oqOteyqoja4d_iTQ.text: We wanted some southern BBQ, this place delivered and then some.  Gotta be the best in the area.

EQfZEqrNopsGTeZ-M8OYNg.text: Well, color me impressed. Midwood Smokehouse was really, really good! It's sitting at a 4.5 stars for me right now, but I imagine it will jump to 5 in no time.   Not that I'm surprised, frankly...because Frank Scibelli seems to have the magical touch when it comes to delicious and well-formulated restos in Charlotte. It's a great location (parking can be tricky) with wonderful, friendly service and tons of tasty items on the menu. Here are just a few things I tasted...  1) Pork platter: 4.5/5: Succulent, tender and delightful. This pork platter rivals Mac's, in my opinion. The meat is very smokey - due to the fabulous smoker they purchased for this establishment. But it's a good kind of smoke, no Liquid Smoke here.   2) Hush puppies: 4/5: Crispy outside, soft inside and damn good.   3) Sweet potato fries: 3/5: Good fries but paled in comparison to the other decadence on the table.   4) Bacon wrapped jalapenos: 4/5: Not nearly as hot as you'd think but a really flavorful starter. Make sure you eat one that has the bacon all crisped up. No one wants sad, soggy bacon.  5) Queso with barbecue: 4/5: Um, I love queso. I also love pork barbecue. Put them both together and voila! Instant amazing app.   6) Banana pudding: 5/5: Hell to the yeah. Homemade deliciousness. With vanilla wafers. This is the real deal and you must order it. I don't care how full you are.   I have a big ole smokey crush on Midwood Smokehouse. Looking forward to going back and checking out the patio!

vzIuZoaTMQ6WmsIIEWCluw.text: So sad to see this place going downhill.  Been going there since first opened few years ago, usually take out but often dine in.  I live 5 minutes away and order would be ready on arrival or very soon, even when busy.  Best BBQ in town by far.  Knew me by name. But as got busier they cared less.  Now new policy is  call-in orders go to bottom of priority list.  Took 50 minutes to prepare and serve my one dish I called in from road.  Meanwhile I watched guests arrive, wait for table, get seated, order and eat appetizers, get 2d round of drinks, order and get dinner.  Bar maid proud of anti-takeout policy.  Bragged been that way forever, but she seemed new.  Not ever going again.  Poor service and strange (greedy?) policy.

uM1nWEWrkhJvZZzVtGHkpA.text: The BBQ pork was incredible! I tasted my fiance's chicken, it was amazing too! We also enjoyed the bacon wrapped jalapenos! This is, by far, the best BBQ place in town! Plus, friendly staff and comfy atmosphere! Good beer selection! Definitely highly recommend this place, it's delicious food at a great price!

bFhrOS87RYs_Cq0nomGEhg.text: Smack yo momma in the mouth, come back for more then punch yo daddy in the mouth, delicious!!!

EqQpM32s7Gn7g-sqVlmNUw.text: Dare I say it? Midwood Smokehouse has the best barbecue I've had inside Charlotte's city limits.  I know, I know, that's not a bold claim to make, but the barbecue here is seriously good. This is four-star barbecue, my friends. The pulled pork is tender and juicy, although I think a lot of that juice comes from the vinegar sauce it's dunked in. In addition to a vinegar-based sauce, there's also a mustard-based sauce and a more traditional KC-style sauce, which are all pretty solid.  But as good as the barbecue is (and, trust me, it's pretty damn good), the real stars here are in the other parts of the menu. The smokehouse veggies are as good as veggies cooked for hours in a smoker should be. The macaroni and cheese is the real stuff with the crust on top and lots of cheesy goodness. And the chopped salad? Could be one of my favorite salads in Charlotte. Tons of fresh veggies including smoked corn cut off the cob. Let me say that again. SMOKED CORN CUT OFF THE COB.  But there are two things that bump this up from a four-star, solid barbecue joint review, into OH-EM-GEE, THIS IS WHAT DREAMS ARE MADE OF: The pimento cheese fries and the Kentucky Slush Puppy.  The pimento cheese fries are just what you'd expect -- crinkle-cut fries smothered with melted pimento cheese, a mound of pulled pork and just enough green onion for some bite. Yes, this will give me a heart attack, but it will be worth it.  And the Kentucky Slush Puppy is a grownup slurpee made with lemonade and bourbon. Yes, that's right. A bourbon slurpee. Thank you, Midwood Smokehouse.

DBRX-eB_2fPw0t-VuDsCOw.text: I was in Charlotte for work and being in NC, wanted to get some local BBQ. I was staying downtown and found this place on Yelp. Based off the reviews I checked it out (I had a rental car, you would definitely need to drive if you are staying in downtown). I got carry out as I was by myself but it looked like they had a lot of good local beers on tap I would have liked to try. I got the Carolina Pork and it was really good. The pork was tender and the sauce was just right - the vinegar wasn't too strong at all. The hushpuppies that came with it were REALLY yummy. The pork and those alone would have been enough for me I realized after I started eating but the small came with one side. I got the sweet potato fries and they gave me what seemed like a pound of them. They were good but I barely made a dent in them because the pork and hushpuppies were way too yummy. They have a place at the bar to order specifically for carry out but then didn't really have an area to sit and wait. The bar was full of patrons so I had to stand and wait for my food. I didn't have to wait too horribly long but it was still odd that they didn't have a  waiting spot.

JLNBC6ZDePtieQsaULCE0Q.text: Visiting Charlotte we were looking for good bbq.  Visited thus restaurant and we're not disappointed.  Best briscuit and chicken.  Appetizer of pimento fries with briscuit and bacon wrapped jalapenos.  Dessert was also very good...pecan cobbler.  Service was the best ever in a restaurant from the second we walked in the door until we left

pNxDJ_UDbDa22HlKLkzmFg.text: Food was delicious and the service was great as well. Turns out that I got a little food poisoning later in the night however. May have just been an unlucky batch of the Carolina pork.

rId_p2zxJDWC7wPdZDmQmA.text: I'm a foodie....hands down! Yes, I can be critical and discerning, but I like a great hot dog as well as a great steak.....so here we go.  Thumbs up: server Ev (short for Evan.....a young woman) was patient, pleasant and very helpful. Prices were in line with a BBQ joint.  Thumbs down: the food is mediocre so not sure where the high star reviews are coming from?? Perhaps, when you only have fast food to compare it to then this stuff seems like a night out on the town with the Mrs. Brisket lacked a defined smoke ring and flavor, pulled pork was bland, chicken dry and ribs were decent. All of the meats and rest of the food was salty. They have three sauces and only one was decent. The NC vinegar sauce and the mustard sauce were nasty. Sides were frozen crinkle cut french fries, small dry hush puppies, etc. The menu has too many off shoots from traditional BBQ, which should have been my first clue. Go to Little Miss BBQ in Phoenix, J Muellers or Franklins in Austin and you will see what real BBQ is. If you can't eat the meat without sauce and absolutely love it.....then it just sucks, plain and simple. Seems more like a bar than a real BBQ joint. Got sick from the food. Total waste of money taking a taxi to and from the airport during a layover for this!!! In fairness, I would say if you like bar food it is OK, but nothing special at all and certainly not worth a $40 round trip taxi fare.  Keep it simple and to the basics. If you can't make great BBQ then shut it down....please do not throw stuff on the menu like tacos, bacon wrapped jalapenos, etc. All you are doing is trying to mask your sub par meats (which should be the highlight. QUALITY ALWAYS WINS!!!!  And this ain't quality. It's BBQ Bar Food

UJ-6B1ZD6PdIrj5NoazS8g.text: I like their stuff. They have ribs and chop barbeque that I like. I know I will have a great meal whenever I go there. And neatless to say I go there about ones a week.

Pgnb4RZTdh7z-b_j3vKrnA.text: Great food and service.  The hush puppies were the best and they had a ton of side options!

YRK4ryAoi6t0KSoAJpmqqQ.text: Yum!  I had the delicious and creative tacos with brisket and pulled pork, while my husband split a massive platter with my dad (fortunately, I got to sample theirs too). The coleslaw was great with sweet hunks of fresh corn cut from the husk.  All was fantastic!

oomfkew61wQz5M1qvPoLVQ.text: First I have to admit that I often find the idea of eating ribs more exciting that the actual experience but that's me. I felt that I HAD to eat some ribs now that I live in NC, right?   This place was a drive but seeing the reviews it seemed like the best choice. Comfy hang out, good selection of beer, that's good.
