The bacon wrapped jalapenos were great, the smoked chicken and the mac and cheese were good but it was all downhill from there.   I had the $19 combo platter. The St Louis ribs tasted real good but they were dry. The pulled pork was dry too, which is unforgivable! Amend that even the cole slaw was dry, the worst slaw I ever had. The smoked sausage tasted funky to me and the Texas brisket was non descript and none too tender either.  Woopy-doo, if this is Charlotte's finest no more bbq for me

TUVaOgxot3F-QEto4cbGOQ.text: Here on tour. Pretty much perfect - get the combo platter, try all those great NC sauces. Baked beans were a nice surprise. Essential eating if you're in Charlotte

UqW1yiU1PRDurGP36PlXAw.text: This place serves it right when its gone its gone for the day.  This bbq comes straight from that days smoke as real as it can be.  You want ribs better be there before 7:00 they had 73 slabs when I ordered they were down to 18 for the day.  Now about the food ribs have a great bite, burnt ends tossed in a beer bbq sauce ununbelievably delicious. Jalapeno bacon wrapped poppers rock and the pecan cobler with vanilla is a sweet sensation.  Great selection of local and national crafted brew.  Come with family or friends the staff is great as much as the atmosphere.  Thanks Richie, Midwood will be a must and a goto landmark for Charlotte.

St6Gcc1S01wRJeT2oU60fA.text: Midwood Smokehouse is a real smokehouse. With smoke.  The place isn't huge, I'd say it seats around 50 with the bar. But that's just perfect for me when it comes to BBQ. I stopped in for lunch on a Saturday and by 12:15, there were just six seats at the bar left open. I started off with a regional craft beer, MW serves a good amount of regional stuff along with 1.50 PBR drafts on Saturday. Be sure to look at the board behind the bar for drink and food specials and if anything is 86'd.  I went with the brisket sandwich special w/ bleu cheese and red onions. I got a side of mac n cheese with it for 8 bucks. The sandwich comes on texas toast and is loaded up rather nicely. While I've had better brisket in Kansas City, I'm tipping my hat to Midwood on what looks to be a winning combination for a long time to come.   I'll be back to visit the food and friendly bar staff again!

gEOra4UBenNpVQfEAjC9rQ.text: My friends know that I WANT to like BBQ. It always looks and smells so good, then I have a bite and I'm over it...so as kind of a joke, I was taken to Midwood Smokehouse. Everything smelt so wonderful, and looked so tasty. Afraid of my past BBQ experiences, I played it safe and went for the smoked turkey plate: hickory smoked and dressed wtth cranberry apple relish, and a side of that creamy mac n cheese! It was AMAZING. The atmosphere was relaxed, the beer selection is fine, and the staff is friendly.  Since my first visit I have been back twice, and have tried variations of the BBQ. I found that I love the vinger style sauce on anything! The only reason I do not go back more often is the wait to be seated can be lengthy, and the wait to get your food and drink refills can also be lengthy. The last time we were there we saw our waitress three times, once to take our drink order, once to take our food order, and once to bring us our check. A food runner brought us our food and passerby employees who saw our drinks were empty would bring us more drinks. Every visit I have had, has been a long one. But when I leave my face is still smiling because my belly is happy.

-tmqhL_L-SIRZo7I82ksFA.text: Before you get mad at me for leaving only two stars, hear me out.  I'm grading on the one experience.  I'm a firm believer in 2nd and even 3rd chances for neighborhood foodie spots.  We live in Elizabeth so this was a nice walk and very convenient.  I was impressed with the resume of restaurants from the owners and have some favorite menu items at Paco's and Cantina... so I was eager to try this one.  Service gets an A.  Kimberly was tending bar and was on top of her game.  Bubbly personality and very attentive to all of the patrons at the bar.  My wife immediately was impressed and she had the wow factor that a good bartender needs.  Remembered names, what we were drinking and above all, extremely friendly.  The other gentleman at the bar was less on his game and seemed stressed by the job and was forgetful with requests from patrons on our half of the bar.  Draft beers were upwards of $5-$6 per pint and the liquor drinks were $7-$10 per drink.  A bit high but trending standard fare for the neighborhood bars these days.  We ordered the smoked wings which were okay... Not very meaty for wings but had good smokey flavor.  Sauce options were sides which was different but still good.  We had the South Carolina style BBQ sauce which was actually more like a honey mustard.    We each had two drinks and shared the wing app at the bar.  Total bill w/ 20% tip was right at $40.    I'm hoping the other reviews on right on the pork.  Our next round we will go with an entree.  We would tend to head to Mac's for this but we want to support the local Plaza Midwood area.

ZC6S7Acme-rtD_0LZnGbEg.text: Amazing BBQ with lots of delicious sides to choose from. Great date spot in Plaza Midwood.

V2Ya388QAf6My786r9dYIA.text: We had planned to eat dinner here last night. I asked my wife to call and make a reservation. When she found out they didn't take reservations she asked if the four of us would have difficulty getting a table at 7pm. They said there should be no problem getting seated right away. I had a hard time believing they wouldn't have a wait at 7pm on a Saturday night but that's what they told us so there we went. We walk in and are told there is a 45 minute to one hour wait and that it was pretty normal. I don't mind waiting for seating. I expect it on a Saturday night. But don't lie to me to get me to come there. We had plans for later so had to go somewhere else. If they will lie to a customer about a wait time what else will they lie about to get your money. I need to be able to trust someone who prepares my food. We won't be back.

nhIPlAPJ7U4R7ibvtCp35A.text: Really good southern food! They have a southern twist to Nachos (pimento cheese, sooooo good) and pork tacos! There Mac and cheese is my favorite! I don't think you should go there for chicken. It's not that good to me, i perder just BBQ, or pork items. But the staff is very sweet and upbeat!

nV5FjOg9KLN8UsM9ScDpPQ.text: This is where you wanna go for BBQ in the QC but go early though cause they run out fast. Just evidence of how good it is.

CpQqvJPots9nvXvZOp0t6g.text: I travel to Charlotte occasionally for work, and it had been about a year and a half since my visit last week. Every time I visit, I'm reminded of two things (1) Authentic southern food is incredibly underrated, and (2) the service in the south blows service I've had anywhere else out of the water. The place to remind me of both of those things on this visit was Midwood. I left borderline uncomfortably full but wondering whether I could have eaten even more without serious discomfort. The food here is that good.  I've had some tasty brisket in my life. However, my brisket evaluation scale is now irreversibly warped, with Midwood being a "10" and the next best maybe approaching a 6. The pulled pork, too, was so much better than any I'd ever had, including that from Revival (an acclaimed Southern-style restaurant in Minneapolis) that I consider to be top-notch. Both the brisket and pork are the perfect combination of tender, juicy, and flavorful. This place obviously takes a tremendous amount of pride in cooking and preparing pulled meats. Perhaps I'm just awestruck due to my lack of experience with delicious southern cuisine, but needless to say, I highly recommend it.  I was too distracted by the awesomeness of the brisket and the pulled pork that I really didn't pay much attention to the mac and cheese and baked beans I had as sides, but I remember them being excellent. Especially the baked beans.  As for service, the food did take a while, but our server was pleasant, charming, and checked back on us at the perfect frequency. She appeared to genuinely enjoy her job and made it her goal to ensure that we left with smiles on our faces. I really, really wish she could teach servers in Minneapolis how to treat patrons. I will be back the next time I'm in the CLT!

2e3vyr1ZyW807s8Ji5Py2A.text: Fantastic staff incredible food and amazing customer service. I would encourage anyone to visit any Midwood location. I grew up in the Dilworth / Myers Park area and love that we have a location in the neighborhood!

0icB3H-dMX2yogPT6K5P6Q.text: Last night I had made up my mind to try one of the 3 tacos. Frank Scibelli owns both Paco's and MW so tacos at MW have to be as good right?  Oh my goodness, YES!  It was a surprise to walk in thinking it was pork burnt ends night (it's Wednesday) to learn TUESDAY is Chef featured TACO night!  Fate! The tacos were deliciousness!  I couldn't finish them. Joe our server rocked too.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuesday night Chef features tacos.  My new favorite menu item.

aJ6mbH5YV_K03UcBsEw20g.text: Ordered take out once again for me, my wife and her sister, it was great we got all of our food and plenty of it! The nice take out lady double checked our order and realized something was off, so when I was sent on my way everyone enjoyed all there food and the smoked flavor is ALWAYS so amazing and it's unlike any other smokehouse I have visited in Charlotte

7dUJBZFyX6Enct9eSGZXvg.text: The nachos libre and Cuban sandwich were both great! The Spiced Boody Mary was perfect! Our service was great! Wish I had gone sooner.

HnQ-ICaYQ9g34kIKtfPJnQ.text: Just got take out from here and was very disappointed.  I ordered a large mixed brisket and once I got home I see that my brisket looked like scrap meat and fat cap. They literally served me 10 oz of fat.

vvXQCPWvI7PJRvsOBJ1zhA.text: By far the best BBQ I have ever had! First off, if you go request Amber. She's amazing! Great service! Being from Chicago, we weren't sure what to get! She made our whole order and it was absolutely amazing! Don't miss out on the hush puppies and the burnt ends! Yum! And I'm not a huge dessert fan, but Amber said the banana pudding was a must and she was correct! Perfect to cure that ultimate sweet tooth! We will for sure be back! If you're going do the nowait app, request Amber, and tell her Jennifer from Chicago said I must get the burnt ends! Have a great time!

c_kAJo_P1tFmAYHPt5TPKg.text: My wife and grabbed a quick dinner before a comedy show tonight. It was busy but we had a great server and got our drinks and food in a good amount of time. Most definitely will be back!

uhevr7J7ulsvgtIbZ9StCg.text: Such wonderful service here. The food however was just fine. The wings I got were VERY pink inside and I only ate a few because I wasn't sure if they were supposed to look like that. The hush puppies were ok. The BBQ was very dry. Wasn't a fan of the sauces. Everyone seems to love this place so maybe we just got an unlucky meal. Good sized portions for kids meals though.   Oh just a tip----the heated patio feels like you're being microwaved. Was nice and quiet out there but under the heat lamp my scalp felt like it was burning and I had to move seats.   Cool place but there's better BBQ around.

y5I3TzijI3W01hh3mwgPkQ.text: Best ribs in Charlotte BAR NONE, their reputation speaks for themselves but it's no contest hands down best ribs in Charlotte.

zFNZBTo9A4Bgve_INLkW6g.text: A few must try's are: 1930 cheesesteak, pimento fries (I had them with chopped brisket) smoked wings crispy !! Oh I haaaaaaaatttte coleslaw but I got it by accident & fell in love the customer service, which everyone knows I'm a stickler for is awesome as well !!  God Bless the cooks

xykoreJmDNoo6jjFpxXNyA.text: Very good burnt ends. It's a little trendy yes and it is a bit pricey but the food is worth it. Try going on a weekday as the weekends can be a bit chaotic.

OZgJMLfqyyej0tfjRp53Vg.text: The best BBQ I've ever had. The pulled chicken was a little salty but nothing unbearable or bad. The pork was delicious. We also ordered baked beans, mac and cheese, and fries for our sides and those were all amazing. I'm from SC and the bbq down here doesn't even come close to this place. Highly recommend to all. You have to stop here and eat! The service is pretty awesome too. We went during a non busy time so we probably spent an hour tops here. The parking lot isn't very big so I imagine parking might be a pain during busy hours but it's totally worth it! They also have a lot of local brews on tap

_3-Urziq7vk59swGlvAfBg.text: It's hard to give this Charlotte BBQ stalwart less than 5 stars based on their Burnt Ends alone. Perfectly moist with just the right amount of fat these tips are the Mecca if Burnt Ends! They recently changed the finishing sauce to a cola type which brings the sweet flavor to the smokey taste. I have to rate these BE as one of my all time favs! Also had the ribs which were smoked just right and had the competition quality pull from the bone along with the great taste. Do not miss these two meats when you go. We ordered 2 sides - Baked MAC n Cheese which literally melted in my mouth, along with collard greens. Both southern side staples.  If you like BBQ and are in Charlotte Midwood Smokehouse is a must stop!  FYI - parking is tight in all of Plaza Midwood so plan ahead.

_MIJ2Hm-LZm9VQRFuoXUeQ.text: Had a hankering for BBQ and was not motivated to go through the trouble of cooking it myself. It is allot of work!  Decided to check out Midwood's based on reviews and how far the drive would be.   My kiddos had the chicken fingers. I had the chicken and rib combo with a side of coleslaw and beans.  Chicken was very tender. Ribs were meh. The meat was a bit tough and quite salty. The coleslaw was very good. Chopped finely and not too overbearing on the vinegar taste. Baked beans were meaty and the bbq was strong in it.  The chicken tenders are good but overly breaded- according to the kids.  Pecan cobbler was excellent.  Decent dining with bar atmosphere. Perfect place to hangout or for drinks. Attentive waitstaff.  Not sure if I will come back for the ribs. Maybe to try the salmon or have another warm slice of pecan cobbler.

fDBqY3rud4QFXJtlqUHnyA.text: Really tasty bbq, friendly bartenders, and good drinks. Their house brand sauce is great!

w6W_Z9K-vf7HM6_JSiopiQ.text: Good portions. One of the best place for ribs in Charlotte. Good presentation. Fast and good service. Not too expensive

JOCKff7NLSi7s0a3ExrpNA.text: Absolutely loved this place ! Great service and amazing food. Bacon wrapped Jalepenos are crazy good, never had em like this, and fell in love !

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped Jalepeños with amazing ranch dressing . LOVE this place !
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Pulled pork sandwich, add pickle slices...amazing!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef brisket with cheddar cheese on Texas toast. So good!

h0Q5HPIf0h95mUaT91IYzg.text: I love beef ribs and this place did not disappoint. They actually exceeded my expectations. The beef ribs were the MOST tender and flavorful beef ribs! The smoke ring was visible; everything was wonderful. The beef burnt ends, mac-n-cheese, sweet potato fries...The staff was friendly and we were seated rather quick. I'd gladly make this a stop while in Charlotte.

eKEJx1RZtTXlsRpLvG1zgQ.text: God bless the South! Had the bbq sandwich with bbq slaw and mac'n'cheese, unsweet tea. Everything tasted just how you would want it to taste right down to the freshly made bun and the eastern NC sauce. The portion was just right for me so it might be on the small side for some. Other members of my party had the pulled chicken, crinkle cut fries which were fresh made, hush puppies, brisket and from scratch banana pudding. All were good. One person in my group enjoyed the Monday special of $3 pints of NC beer - he swears by OMB Copper Ale. Service was good - had Matt as our server - but we did go at 2:30 in the afternoon on a Monday.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bbq with bbq slaw and mac&#39;n&#39;cheese

PswVBEUa00Dj5-cUky1GEA.text: We came as a group of seven ordered together. 6 plates came out 1 plate came out after asking a couple of times after we all finished eating. Fries on a couple of plates were undercooked. Waitress said a manager would stop by but like the seventh plate she never made it to the table. Waitress was fantastic due to circumstances. Not a quick lunch stop.

8Q24_AtkTylSI19wB6kd9w.text: This place deserves 6 stars but that's not an option. Even the ice cubes are amazing!! They have the ball ice cubes.  We got the pimento fries with brisket which was probably the best thing I've ever eaten.  Then we got the combo plate with chicken, pork, brisket, and sausage. My favorite meat was the chicken, it comes in a great sauce. Our sides were the bacon wrapped jalepenos and Mac and cheese. To top it all off the service was probably the best service in a restaurant I've had in a long time. Everyone was so charming, especially our waitress Nickey.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The combo -- sausage, chicken, pork, brisket
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento fries with brisket!

Fskh-WZA5JDH87xL4vHaKw.text: The food is awesome but prices are increasing so quickly. I get the small midwood chopped salad with salmon which used to be $10 (less than a year ago). $10 for a delicious salmon salad is great for charlotte. I went today and it's $14. I was kind of shocked by a $4 price jump. Still a good salad but no longer the best bang for your buck in Charlotte.

9YLXgtl12AvN_pG72o_oqQ.text: I spent two weeks in Charlotte and during that time, I visited four BBQ joints (well, three plus Boardwalk Billy's, which is BBQ in name only). Midwood was definitely the winner.  Midwood had an extensive BBQ selection, including burnt ends. Here's a tip: If you go to a BBQ joint that offers burnt ends, you know you're at a legit smoke shop. I ordered the full rack of ribs and added a side of burnt ends. My ribs also came with BBQ slaw and bacon-wrapped jalapenos. The ribs were amazing. Perfect amount of smoke. The meat came off the bone with almost no effort, but they weren't "fall off the bone" (which is great because really, who wants their rib meat to fall off into their lap or onto the plate?). This place also caters to the gluten-free crowd with a dedicated gluten-free menu. Even the bacon-wrapped jalapenos were gluten free as they were not breaded!  The burnt ends were delicious. I treated them as an extra appetizer. They easily could have been a meal.  I can't imagine any BBQ restaurant in Charlotte being better than Midwood. The wait staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our waitress also gladly did individual checks for all 8 of us without adding a gratuity. It probably worked out to her advantage that there wasn't a mandatory 18% gratuity, as I know my table far exceeded that.  Hands down, the best meal I had during my two weeks in Charlotte

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

uZcIsQO3v1NXpbuHWCea0Q.text: It's no secret, Charlotte isn't know for the best BBQ in the South. Meanwhile, Midwood does a great job at raising the bar in the Queen City. It's the top BBQ joint in town, by a lot. Many will debate that. However, I'm sorry Mac's Speed Shop, while your portions are much larger than Midwood, the quality, sauces and flavor are a notch below Midwood. Midwood succeeds at providing more than just good BBQ. They dish out great service, in an upbeat atmosphere complete with TVs and a full bar. It's a great place to come for a work lunch, on a date, with friends or for a celebration. They have plenty of local beers on tap, too, which bodes well with good BBQ.  I travel for a living, eat out three times a day more than 300 days a year and have been to more than 300 BBQ restaurants in the country (it's probably more like 500) so I'm holding a high bar comparing Midwood to the country's best. It's very good. And, when we're in Charlotte it's where we take friends and family if the word "BBQ" is mentioned. Hands down, if you're from Charlotte and haven't eaten BBQ consistently elsewhere, you'll definitely be blown away here. Everything is done well. From the meats, to dessert and sides, there's nothing that disappoints. In fact, even the hush puppies impress, which is hard to do.   Nevertheless, to be a 5-star, it must be one of the best BBQ places in the US and while it's darn close, it's one notch away from reaching the amazing BBQ you'll get a the Pompous Pig in Anderson, Smokin Pig near Clemson, Melvin's in the Charleston area, Louella's in Asheville, etc. I believe it's slightly better than a known Southern chain such as Jim N Nicks and blows away places like Smokey Bones and Sticky Fingers. Don't even bring up Sonny's and Dickey's. Midwood owns those places. In short, you need to eat here. It'll become one of your favorite places in Charlotte.   Deciding what to order isn't a chore, as long as you choose a combo platter, where four meats wind up on your plate. I'm not a big rib guy, so we normally split the Well Fed (feeds 2) or the Pig Out (feeds 3) and opt for the brisket, Hickory Smoked Sausage, Carolina Chopped Pork and Chopped Chicken BBQ. Consider that you are splitting this with another or two others and it's a great deal. Don't be discouraged, the St Louis Style Pork Ribs are good. I took my friends on a BBQ tour through the Carolinas and they enjoyed these ribs almost as much as a few of the above mentioned places. Another thing to consider is they do daily specials, too, such as Pork Burnt Ends, yum.   The two sides can be a challenge to pick. All are good. But, we are partial to two: smoked veggies and bacon wrapped jalapenos. Damn, these are good! If you've been to the Smokin Pig, the sweet potato fries here aren't as good, but they are much better than any you'd order at a normal restaurant and the greens are top-notch.  Another thing I like about Midwood is the range of available sauces. Rather than solely vinegar, like many places in Carolina they offer an assortment, which keeps everyone happy. All their sauces, South Carolina Mustard, Eastern NC Vinegar, Midwood Signature & Spicy Habanero are tasty and done well.   As for dessert, we've only tried the banana pudding. If you can fit any in your stomach after the large portions you ate already, give it a try. While Alabama's Dreamland continues to serve the best banana pudding, theirs is memorable, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

DFl6nF3gqaKkRwNjlfP-lQ.text: Fantastic BBQ and fantastic service! Would definitely come back for the food (burnt ends, brisket, etc.) and the cocktails (try the tequila jalapeno one). The portions are huge, especially if you get the sampler.

mT0NtX1PzfU2TrWG33TlaA.text: This is my favorite restaurant in all of Charlotte.  The brisket can be cut with a plastic fork. The banana pudding Will make you lick the bowl . EVERYTHING is great here except the wait

lfIDw12c2yjEjcGeFVXrSA.text: Just within a few hours of my arrival to Charlotte, I received a few strong recommendations to try out Midwood Smokehouse, so obviously I had to check it out.   Pimento Cheese Fries: Large dish of fries piled high with a generous amount of melted cheese on top with pork. How can you possibly go wrong with ordering this dish? It was absolutely delicious and addictive, a dangerous combination. Highly recommend this dish.  Burnt Ends with side of bacon wrapped jalapenos, hushpuppies and pickled onions: Brisket was on the dry side and a bit difficult to chew. Did not have enough bbq sauce on it. The texture of the jalapenos were too soft/soggy and nothing special--just literally jalapenos wrapped with bacon with no seasoning or flavors that I tasted. Hushpuppies were good and the pickled onions were a necessity to balance out the meat. Not my first choice to recommend.  Half Rack of ribs with sauce: Again, the pork was dry, but it did taste good though.  I'm no bbq specialist, but I think I had my fair share of very good bbq. Overall, I found this place alright. The service was excellent.

Kjy3EVrq3mePQeBPLllkMQ.text: Meh...  I was very disappointed based on other reviews, and maybe I went in at bad time but the food was average at best.  Our server had a bad attitude, with all the other barbecue options in the area you can definitely do better.

fo0FNplq3umvjdkL5xeP9w.text: Can we say bacon wrapped jalapenos?????!!!! Delicious! I originally went here with my boss, of which he ordered these and I am now their biggest fan! The BBQ here is also delicious -- definitely one of the best, if not the best, that I have found in the Charlotte area!

lrmlv9sCu3eOFz8F8djvLw.text: Best southern food I have had in charlotte to date! I ordered the small plate brisket which includes the hush puppies, pickled onions (yummm) and one side- I ordered the BBQ Baked Beans & I also had the banana pudding. I had it delivered via postmates - it said the wait would be about an hour to have it delivered but I got the food within 35-40 mins. When I received the food, it was heavenly. The entire meal felt like it just came out of the kitchen & was the perfect temp. The meal was superb & omg the desert! It's delicious but very rich so make sure to share it with someone! I can't wait to visit in person the next time I am in the mood for some good southern cooking!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Brisket, BBQ BBQ Baked Beans, Hush Puppies &amp; Pickled Onions (yummmmmm)

QWc1ob_sk7OJed12y2WQ9g.text: NC BBQ is one of my favorite foods and this place has the best BBQ in Charlotte by far. The smoked wings with dry rub are amazing and the bloody mary is a 10/10.

yZwbWlIvuupXMSxBhxhRMQ.text: This is a very good restaurant, not much to say except they brought out our food very quickly, not to expensive and they did not have any areas of problem for me.

G8KIIlcUgFLw5UBbe6uhXQ.text: I have had carry-out only from this restaurant.  It was decent.  A little on the pricey side.  I am not a big fan of southern BBQ, so maybe I am the wrong person to ask.  There was definitely nothing wrong with my order.  It was made promptly to order.  The staff answering the phone and who greeted me upon arrival was very pleasant and efficient.

bWRZWvuY9iMB328WJ-Zq2w.text: Came here to get some chopped pork and collard greens. Sad to say the food is touch or go. Ordered the sampler which had ribs, pulled porked, pulled chicken and brisket. The ribs were really good seasoned to perfection. Didn't really care for the brisket as much but the pulled pork and chicken was good. They also have a unique mustard sauce that's out of this word. The Mac and cheese was half done and cold and the other sides were just okay. Five stars for the banana pudding very good!.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

5cxm-yUHSk_6uHBbwaurAg.text: The waitress gave us a very comfortable ordering experience. The Midwood signature sauce is perfect! The apple cider dressing with their wonderful salad is my favorite!!

IdUUXepwQozjILJL7WnH4A.text: Nothing special... Side items were good, but ribs were blah! I wouldn't make this a regular place..

xRrxYBqwzTtVAjuLL2JnMQ.text: We started out with the pulled pork queso which was friggin delicious. My wife had the pulled pork with baked beans and cream corn and I had the brisket and pimento cheese melt and mac n cheese. Kinda made me wanna move to NC. Monica the bartender was awesome. Couldn't be more blown away with the whole experience.

FIXP0qlB8omLMJRfZ3AV7g.text: Not much to say. Great barbecue and great atmosphere. The ribs and burnt ends are highly recommended but I haven't tried anything I don't like. I always walk out satisfied.

XLFNOsHQECaGPlmzzKbk2w.text: Maybe I went on a bad day, but the food was alright.  I ordered the wings and it was alright and we ordered the brisket, but it was absolutely dry.  We had to buy the lean one (which might be why it was dry), but the fatty one was out.  Until next time!

h1qDv2Kt97WJaoDJSXI3PA.text: The chicken BBQ sandwich is awesome.  There is a lot of flavor to the chicken and the SC Mustard sauce are a perfect combination.  As a side I had French Fries which were nice a crispy.

9fKnAC6wTQTGhQem-D7gSQ.text: Went to the Ballantyne location. Was disappointed there were very few healthy choices.  Only two salad options to pick from!  Seriously?  That's what is wrong with our country and why so many people are just plain fat! I asked for the side of veggies and received a greasy oily mess.  Not going back unless you re-think your menu. Not everyone wants to be 20 lbs overweight!!

orpCLiSWtL9aIKDIpt1VwQ.text: Move over Mac's this is my new FAV spot for Q!  I love the location and trendy bar.  There are several huge TV's to watch the game.  There are booths, hightops and regular tables as well as a really long bar with comfy seats.  A must-get is the bacon-wrapped jalapenos!!  VERY spicy, order your beer first, but for those of us that LOVE spicy food - this is for you!  They come out tender and the bacon is crispy and the cheese is the perfect amount of 'melty'.   I had the BBQ platter which I ordered with the BBQ Baked Beans.  The Q was super-smokey.  Totally done right, with sauce on the side.  The BBQ Baked Beans were a meal in themselves!  Very rich and the addition of peppers gives it a very full savory flavor.    Next time I am definitely going to get the brisket.  My boyfriend got it and i had to pull a 'look over there!  its Pam Anderson!' to snag a bit from his plate.  YUM.  It was so tender and flavorful - not too fatty which I love.    Definitely will head back - so glad we found this spot!  We owe it all to Yelp!  Thanks guys!  :-D

z3B7tRcQVoWPUI_C4jzA7Q.text: This is one of our favorites in the neighborhood! We have never had a bad meal here! I even ordered my thanksgiving dinner from here for my entire family last year! It was great! Better get here early for dinner! It fills up quickly!

SSON4qtC9-eHtDWpvv8uBw.text: This is a Plaza Midwood institution now. I've been 100 times and never been disappointed. Brisket and smoked jalapenos are must orders. Also Rachel Welch is in the bathroom. Can't be topped in CLT.

srUxhxTSl2dFgTvDzF7w4g.text: I've been to this restaurant three times now.... the first two were very good. However my last visit was not so good.   The waiter Brian was anything but attentive. The large version of the burnt ends arrived cold. I  finally was able to grab a manager to send it back to be heated as Brian was no where in site. I ordered coffee with cream and he never asked if I wanted a refill... nor did he ever bring the cream I asked him for three times. And he never checked on us or asked if everything was alright until the end of the meal.   The bottom line.... the food is always tasty (when hot) but the service on this trip was simply horrid. I'm not sure if I will go back.

vgdkz6gLFQNiFF8bkQm7pA.text: Damn. What a sweet place to get some BBQ. Today was my first visit. I ordered a chicken BBQ small plate with mustard sauce which comes with hushpups and one side, and I chose Bacon-wrapped Jalapenos, which r00led hard. Got myself the $3 beer of the month which was New Belgium Fat Tire. Yum. What a delicious meal.   My vegetarian lady friend got the Black bean burger and that tasted great plus creamed corn. Nom.   The meal was cooked extremely quickly so that was great.  Excellent food overall, I'll definitely be back to try something new.  Mac's has a run for its money.

Eyn3rFuCrXFv5yrMcPRuZg.text: Burned Ends were yummy, with just the right amount of fat and sauce on them. Service was a little slow. Parking can be difficult because of the small parking lot.

RlsW1EQ0h4f3I4lqpyQwHA.text: Yummers.  This place was recommended by a few people I know who have been to Charlotte so we decided to check it out during our visit and it did not disappoint.  Hubs got a pork BBQ sandwich with fries and BBQ beans. I got the pulled chicken sandwich with sweet fries. The chicken had a mustard BBQ sauce which went well with the chicken and the fries were perfectly crisp and warm.  Overall a solid BBQ joint with excellent prices and very personable staff and service.

ytp3A7I-NXnTZ2_zdjoXNw.text: Decent pork, good beans, crappy hush puppies. Not a bad place if you live in the neighborhood but I wouldn't tell people to travel here.

sepkEpNH5ODC5mQdvvTeKQ.text: This place is so consistently good, you have to try it. My favorite is the briquette and burnt ends.

mSwo4qF61rTCYYfIOrA-_w.text: Great BBQ (pork and chicken) friendly staff, great service. Get there early if you want a table, they stay packed during lunch!!!

cZOxNqh3g6CEpL9XeeH-3A.text: Got the combo platter and the ribs were the best I've tasted in the six years we have lived in the Charlotte area!  Sausage and brisket were pretty good, but coming from Texas it was not quite up to that five star level.  Will absolutely go back again for sure!

6rEBRPZK6zHwIMA8sxhbBg.text: Over the last three years, I've been to Charlotte four times. Everyone raves about the BBQ, but until my most recent trip I'd never had the pleasure of trying it. Luckily for me, a local took me to Midwood Smokehouse last month.  We walked in the door and the smells from the kitchen told me we were in the right place. The smokey sweetness of BBQ made it hard to look at the menu because I really just wanted to eat.  I ended up getting a pulled pork sandwich and some sides. Good, tasty stuff. Friendly service. Prices were amazing compared to what I would've paid for back home. And, the atmosphere was low-key and nice.  Go back? Sure, next time I'm in Charlotte I wouldn't mind at all. I'll suggest it.

DRbdn0TPjqvyld76fv7L1g.text: 1. Too much salt 2. The pulled pork saw more smoke than a Cheech & Chong film. It left the food just tasting like burnt wood...and salt, of course.  3. Great service. Everyone was attentive and very friendly.   Go here to make friends with the staff but not to eat.

_w-dr9_izcx8aAf-AuYJ5g.text: I ate here last Friday. Got in right at 12 and they were already packed! We were able to sit at the bar and the food was terrific. I ate the pulled chicken with mustard sauce, it was very messy but very very good. I will defiantly come again!

9X-whE2YOcm7LZKz5IK1pg.text: This is where I get my barbecue in Charlotte, hands down. I am a fanatical fan of pulled pork and have suffered through a lot of poor excuses for barbecue - which is inexcusable in NC. Midwood does pulled pork right and their N Carolina sauce and S Carolina sauces are spot on.   I could speak extensively about the hushpuppies, mac 'n' cheese, or fries, but instead I will say that I am most pleased by the pickled onion. Genius.  Their barbecue chicken is great too, and as much as I philosophically disagree with Texas brisket, they do that well too.   If you like barbecue, you can't do better in Charlotte than Midwood.

VKyRQkgVHr1edDksaffnUA.text: Omg I just tried this place for the first time today and it was amazing! I only had a few small bites before coming to the conclusion that this is some great BBQ!! I am so glad I found this little treasure! I will most definitely be back again, again and again!!

niX_M9kY-q5Vpi6ZD-_eEA.text: I guess I'm a snob, or spoiled, I'm not sure. Probably both. I don't understand what the fuss is about. First the BBQ pork my son has was good..not great, but good. I thought that mac and cheese was pasty and lacked flavor. It was warm, nit hot but tasted like glue. The hush puppy's were good, though. Now, the brisket... I'm not from Texas and love me some pork BBQ  (Lexington is the gold standard) but this brisket was weak... The "fall off the bone" tender actually was mushy. It tasted like it was boiled or steamed before it hit the smoker. It had NO smoke ring and the smoke flavor seemed to be artificial. I ordered mixed fatty and lean, as I know fatty is the way to go. It was actually greasy, not the luscious melted fat of a well smoked brisket. The "bark" was soggy and was overly salty. Again I think it had liquid smoke or smoked salt. or something. No spice or depth of flavor. Again the meat was "unnaturally" tender. steamed or boiled or maybe a "meat tenderizer" was added. A bright pink smoke ring should show on a brisket this thick, but none was apparent.  Needless to say, I was disappointed, especially at $10 for a small plate (1 side).  I'll give them another shot, but anyone how gives this place 3 stars or better doesn't know what they are talking about when it comes to Q! If it hadn't been or first visit I don't know if I would have given it 2 stars.  Oh, yea, service was good to excellent, no complaints there.

rRRoAi7hT1URTELvzshbEw.text: We started with the palmetto fries which were great. The beef brisket is the best I've had. We ordered a combination of the two both the pulled pork and brisket was very tender and flavorful with a large portion .  We'll be back! We need to try everything.

G7AckxZijbrIlMCNMu8l6g.text: I moved to Charlotte 3 months ago. I did the usual google searches for Carolina's best bbq, and i even told my friends, "yeah its overrated i havent had anything worth writing hom about" until today. I stumbled onto midwood smokehouse by accident.  The BBQ , sauce (not even needed the meat is so good), and sides were AWESOME!  Definitely going back!

uQbazWGDlmu8VYAYWoopEQ.text: I give Midwood Smokehouse a 4 star rating, up from a 3, because of the manager response to my previous review.  I was so impressed by their dedication to quality product and service that I think it deserves another chance.  I'll let you know in a couple of weeks!!!

embH7GdEoULbORWy_boKtw.text: Midwood smokehouse is a welcomed new addition to the neighborhood.  They have awesome beer specials every day during the week that go great with whatever 'cue you order.  I had the Texas style brisket yesterday and it was to die for.  No knife necessary, most tender brisket I've ever eaten at a barbecue joint.  The bacon wrapped jalepenos are delicious.  The first time I had them they were very spicy ad second time not as much. (I preferred the spicier version).  Smoked vegetable special was divine--portabellas, squash, onion, and more cooked in their custom made smoker to perfection.  The smoke flavor brought out the meatiness in the fresh veggies without overwhelming them.  Will definitely be visiting Midwood Smokehouse regularly.  Brisket is a must.

7pqYOA9HO9e3As_CDwQVvw.text: I got the pulled pork east carolina style bbq sandwich.....the vinegar based sauce was a little sweet which was nice to off set the saltiness of the sandwich.  I also tried the fried pickles which came out very fast even after the server informed me it takes a very long time.  When I got them they were so salty and soggy i threw the rest away.  The mac and cheese was good, but for 16.00 no drink included it was a rip off.   The location is cool for happy hour but the food was mediocre at best.

-dpVF-iDdhO15b0TH9E7Jg.text: This is the best BBQ I have had in my entire life.  I will be a regular customer from this day forward.

5Rk87d60Kd5fOWrU-qcuvg.text: Stopped here on our way through town headed north.....great food, nice sized portions, super sides ......definately a great find!!!

Z5ecO2R91X8OWTqRgJsnOQ.text: Wow, Excellent barbecue!  I had the sampler platter.  The meats were very nicely smoked.   I have had smoked barbeque all over the US, and there can be a wide variety among restaurants.  Midwood did an excellent job balancing the wood flavors in the preparation of their meat.  Carolina style barbecue is typically served in a vinegar sauce.  They chose to provide the vinegar sauce on the side, so I could choose to regulate the amount of vinegar flavor in my barbecue.  They also provided a slightly sweetened vinegar sauce, So I was not dipping my meat into pure vinegar.  I have been to many backwoods Carolina barbecue restaurants that just soak their meat in pure vinegar.  Terrible stuff.  Thankfully, Midwood does not do this.  They let the meat and the smoking process provide the flavor.  The vinegar sauce is not acidic and mild enough to enhance the flavor.  It is one of the best barbecue restaurants that I have visited in the US.

AFk0zRtJwXtys1sZs16aJQ.text: Went to midwood last night.  Very busy.  I had the beef brisket, beans and BBQ slaw.  Brisket and slaw was good but the beans let a lot to be desired.  My wife had the BBQ pork and greens.  She liked the greens a lot but the pork was way overlooked, dry and way to salty.  They could do a lot better job.  She wishes she had got a vegetable plate instead.

3QMpoR_MNqoB8VFGbjWRPg.text: Mmmmmmmmmmm good! Edges out Macs (also a fav). We've been here 3 times now and each time was fan-tas-tic!

VZ147Ygz0-LQCAqwleKfyw.text: We are big fans of Big Daddys burgers so when I heard that their owner opened a BBQ place, we were eager to try it.  In a nutshell, It was fantastic and reasonably priced.  Our kids loved the ribs, and sweet potato fries.  My wife thought her salad was amazing, and I loved the Half Chicken with the combination of sauces.  Finally, we have a great BBQ place in Charlotte!!

CG6GQTdewWfyN-jBNx2ouw.text: I love BBQ and am very critical of it.   I was in town for a short trip, and tried this place due to the reviews.   I have to concur, this is pretty good Q.  I tried the special that was written on the glass - stack of ribs - for 9$.   For that, I think I got 7 or 8 short meaty pork ribs with a honey glaze.  Not what I am used to as far as the sauce, but great flavor, cooked right,  and nicely presented (ribs were neatly stacked up).  Had collard greens and they were delicious.   The only negative, I wasn't hungry enough to try one of the combo plates (since there were plenty of warnings that it was a lot of food).   Nice place, nice atmosphere, and very good Q.  I rate 4 stars only because I wasn't able to sample enough of their foods.

sZQYI8hhcIljGQhZ89ikLQ.text: I'd heard mixed reviews about this place, but being a huge fan of BBQ, I figured I'd try it myself. The first thing that jumped out at me was the Bacon-wrapped Jalapenos. The same company does this app at Paco's Tacos and Tequila in South Park, the difference being that at Midwood, they remove the seeds, so that you may actually enjoy the flavor. The bacon was on the chewy side, but the flavor was right. Then again, it seems hard to mess up anything w/ Bacon, Cheese, and Jalapenos. Being of small frame, I thought it best to jump right into their "North Carolina BBQ" before I filled up on apps. I must say, it was very,very good. I opted for the vinegar based sauce, but there are other options. Honestly, it didn't need sauce, it was done properly. That is to say, it really is authentic, slow smoked BBQ. As far as ambiance, service, and all the other fixins, I'll just say, It's a BBQ joint, I didn't expect much, and was not disappointed. I have been back, and will go again.

Vrw2rLJZZVfAdo0DdY16mg.text: Best BBQ in Charlotte! Best pulled pork I've ever tasted...try the banana pudding, awesome atmosphere, quick service and good people!

8QtgpZgK_qnI6Pxap9Ul-A.text: i had pulled pork, it was pretty good but the burnt ends were the best! i also really loved the baked beans with bits of pulled pork in them. i'd definitely come back.

vojsOesGdG4Lsa8uuVBDvQ.text: Love the food. This is my new barbecue place- sorry Mac's. Usually the side items at any place are ok, but the beans, bacon wrapped jalepenos are awesome.

Qy0cw13seK_Iy2iN6v87pQ.text: New to Charlotte & searching for good BBQ, natch! Been to Mac's a few times & really enjoyed it! Thought we'd check out Midwood Smokehouse just for variety, and we so wished we hadn't! Decided to go the take-out route, our first mistake. The call-in for the order went smoothly, or so we thought. Were told our order would take 20-30 minutes. Got there with a bit of time to spare. My husband continued to get updates on its progress....'it's coming,' they said, the kitchen is just a little backed up.'  In the end, an hour plus later & we're still waiting, they confess the order was never being worked on because the ticket was lost or mishandled somehow. Not certain where the drop in communication is, on the part of the kitchen or the order-taker, but there appeared to be much confusion. So after approx 1 1/2 hours, they really started to put together our order, and here we are waiting again. Finally, my husband starts walking to the car, take-out bag in hand, only to have some guy wildly running after him & calling out 'wait, we gave you the wrong bag!' All I can say is wow. How inept. We were so hoping our minds would be changed with some scrumptious BBQ! No such luck! The food was a huge letdown. Collard greens tasted like washed out grass, no flavor, just plain nasty. The chicken - well, let's just say, I make lots better. BBQ sauce, not our favorite. My husband thought the ribs were OK. I will admit the smoked veggies were pretty yummy. One small bright spot. After dropping $50, they offered to buy my husband a beer & our dogs some water. I believe we should have been comped this dinner, but that offer never came. Looks like the best revenge is simply throwing our business elsewhere. Mac's will continue to get our patronage. Just heard some good things said about Rock Store BBQ in Stallings. Both spots are supposed to have gotten the nod from The Travel Channel.

tbGZcn9EGGzRb8UtqoIVZw.text: Best collard greens (don't tell my mom), crazy delicious brisket, ummm ummm good beer and EXCELLENT service, very nice people. This place has an easy vibe, very clean, be warned: you will be tempted to order everything on the menu!

OXGWCRP3wRDEFzGyNLMXgw.text: We arrived at 9 and they were out of ribs. The burnt ends were too tender. The salmon was good. The staff seemed more interested in closing than taking care of customers. My experience was not the best.

Vnqg8NG3WfGEkRIYvyAvjA.text: Great plz just wish I got a little more sweet potato fries and a little more crispy but other then that is was great food

ASzI3UllH-34-kVLWcicnQ.text: Came for final night in Charlotte, were there for job interviews. Convinced this city's culture and and night life is our new home as we are now moving there. And good thing cause this place has the best food! Amazing wings, was in heaven... the brisket and beans. I was sold. Can't wait to come back. And the beer selection I could sit there all day. Friendly staff open and treat you like family... thanks!

3UHkiinjezwHGSVShqHEIA.text: Always amazing food, service with a smile, and just a great place! Food is always consistent, portions are huge, and definitely something for everyone. I love going there for a lunch during work week, or with my family as they have great options for kids as well.

BbEZq6JbTvOOruTzZkC0ZQ.text: Love the convenience in the neighborhood. Smoked jalapenos and brisket all the way. Salads are huge! Wings are delicious.   We have really poor options for bbq in central Charlotte. My only complaint is that I can never get out of here and spend less than $20 and I almost never have leftovers as the portions are not huge (except salads). The bbq is worth it.

Qs8Go2tzjRMM2s9SXGbW5A.text: Solid spot for authentic bbq. One combo platter is enough to share for most couples unless you ordinarily eat a lot.  The chopped pork is okay. The sauces weren't mind blowing but relatively standard.  The ribs were good but also nothing mind blowing.  Service was nice and price was reasonable. Food comes out fast.  Not near the best bbq I've ever had but thought it was a good showing.

Ri9r7lxxUa2b1d0Q5Q2xiA.text: First dinner in Charlotte, NC and boy was it filling! Ordered the small burnt ends and the large beef brisket. Loved the burnt ends a bit more... please see my amazing photos ;)  Dessert: banana pudding (5/5)  The photo composition though.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

SkSOzHWholdnXq4_UkTvFg.text: Quick Summary:   Brisket is amazing.  Banana pudding is fabulous.  Attentive staff at both locations in Plaza Midwood and Park Road Shopping Center.   Midwood Smokehouse is basically a Charlotte staple.   GO!

-1J6XYeZ93oasJ_-2ZqP4A.text: Awesome pulled pork. The atmosphere was enjoyable and the wait is never long. Great customer service

s4J85MrQshfmrmxDN9xEUw.text: I'm not a local, so take my insight on their barbecue with a grain of salt - but boy, oh, boy was that meat delicious. Between a group I was able to try quite a few things, and everything but especially the ribs were so good. The hushpuppies left something to be desired and there was quite a wait - pro tip, you can get in line on Yelp! Highly recommended for next time.

SP-b00MQ5nVB_lmFpSzTtw.text: I've only been to this restaurant twice, tonight was my first time at this location. I ordered takeout and got the brisket sandwich and it was TERRIBLE. It was dry and salty. Where is the sauce? Where is the JUICY MEAT?? I had to add my own bbq sauce from my fridge just to make it palatable. I couldn't even finish the sandwich, it was just that bad. The Mac and cheese was pretty good but also very salty( and this is coming from someone who appreciates seasoned food). The only reason I gave 2 stars was because of the service from the bartender. Otherwise my money was wasted on terrible food.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

FeN0-lrmcJTPwenH1duDwg.text: Hands down. Come here and don't go anywhere else. If I could fly out here from California every single day for a full rack of ribs from this place I would do it.   Everything is just amazing. They're whole menu just looks delicious!!!   Seriously!!  come here when you're in Charlotte!!   5 stars!!!!   Also, if you guys aren't in Cali, please open up there because I'd be your number 1 customer (:

Z18yN_1gpn-TNGLS3DYAdA.text: Ordered the brisket and Mac and cheese and was not disappointed!! The brisket was melt in your mouth delicious and the Mac and cheese while slightly salty, hit the spot! I'm excited to explore the menu because I will definitely be back for more!

BcbAk97MfeNzp53phwtndw.text: God Bless traveling with my best friend because one thing I know for sure is we are (Eating BBQ). This time we happen to be in Charlotte so we hit our trusty Yelp App and landed at this BBQ gem. Getting a 5 Star from me is extremely hard, but this spot hit all the marks. The Carolinas are suppose to be known for their bbq so I figure it was be solid, but this blew me away. Exploring the menu, they didn't have just your typical meats like Ribs, Pork, Chicken, and Brisket. They had all of them plus some BBQ pitmaster specialities sure as Burnt ends for Pork and Beef, along with some pulled chicken, but the thing was surprising was they had smoked salmon. That is something you just don't see at BBQ and let me tell you, it was cooked perfectly and tasted incredible. So between us ordered the Brisket which was cut from the Point, some pork burnt ends, Salmon, and Pulled Chicken. All were awesome. The sides were standard- they compliment the meat. The mustard bbq sauce was one of the best I have tried recently. I used the Carolina vinegar sauce for my Collard.   All in all a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Salmon with Pulled Chicken. Baked beans and Hushpuppies
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mustard BBQ sauce, spicy bbq, and smoked veggies
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket point with some Pork Burnt Ends! Collard greens  and cream corn

EiuWUvO6Wi3DfJ6KqrBPcw.text: I've been waiting to try this place for awhile and finally did! Went on a Wednesday afternoon - not super busy. We got seated right away. We ordered the large plate of burnt ends with sides of Mac and cheese, hush puppies, pickled onions, and bacon wrapped jalapenos. The burnt ends and bacon wrapped jalapenos were really good. I think my favorite would be the hush puppies! (We even ordered another side of them) I didn't care too much for the Mac and cheese- pretty mediocre and I probably wouldn't order them again. Overall good experience and really great service as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

-wEkOdgoq9sBPiyJHdXsmw.text: I'm cutting back, way back, on meat but I have to have a little pork every now and then!  The smell of smoke, the good kind, hits you when you open your car door. You know you're in for a treat.   We were seated quickly, especially for prime time Sunday dinner and having a party of seven.   You HAVE to ask for Walter to be your server. He is THE best! And if you close your eyes, you'll swear you're listening to the radio. He has that kind of voice!  The food is amazing. I opted for chopped barbecue with creamed corn and greens. Food arrived super quickly and was hot...and delicious. We love Eastern NC style barbecue and they have "our" vinegar-based sauce to top your meat choice.   I wanted dessert but they didn't have wheelchairs. They have something called pecan cobbler that I will have to try on my next visit!

M_mwvORLAPenPp2hn061Yg.text: There was so many options, I didn't know which one to choose, but I finally ended up sharing brisket tacos with my mom. They were good and stuffed more than the typical street taco. I was full off of one! My daughter has the salmon which I thought was the best thing I tried. Hubby got a combo with 4 items, but I don't remember what they were. He LOVED everything he got, though. The best sauce the had was the vinegar-based sauce. I could drink it!!! I had a Smoked Bloody Mary which was yummy. He had a local brew that he was pleased with. We had some leftovers which came handy the next day.

_XZK8cORGTgnkn_zJMSJiQ.text: Midwood Smokehouse is great every single time I go. It's so consistent. It's the best BBQ in Charlotte. Their sauces are delish, their beer list is great, they always have great specials. Yum! This is my go to place for out of town guests.  Pro tip: They make everything fresh so they sell out quickly. Keep this in mind when ordering.

8OrNXg9c08XtwjagnfyRjg.text: I loved this place! The staff were all seriously amazing, so kind and helpful. The food is amazing as well. The brisket was tender and flavorful, and the portion was huge and the prices were surprisingly low for the amount of meat you're given. I would be a regular here if I lived in Charlotte, this place definitely deserves the high rating it has!

a18tDiP1_dtrJJ5v6hK1VA.text: Amazing!  From VA driving into town found this place on yelp... The bacon wrapped jalapenos were amazing,  the pulled pork so good,  the brisket was incredibly tender, juicy and the smoke ring says it all!  The sauces were wonderful and the sides are Great,  the baked beans were the best I've ever had! Will come back the next time I'm in town

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled por! Lrg plate with Mac n cheese baked beans and hush puppies

m0dGrnBDCMgOgjFfmRcG6w.text: This place is okay. As two people that grew up in the Texas Panhandle, my husband and I definitely know our barbecue.  I started off with a Bloody Mary, which was actually one of the best ones I've had! Like a classy lady, I licked off the entire glass's rim which was dipped in a delicious BBQ rub. We also shared the queso with pork - which was very good but we quickly ran out of chips. I'm a total brat when it comes to queso and chips when they don't give you enough chips to finish the appetizer.  The waitress was MIA for quite awhile, so we still had 3/4 left without chips and it went cold. That's a big no no in Texas.   I got the Carolina pork and Mac n cheese - which I would give 4 stars. It wasn't the best I had, but it was very good. My husband got the fatty brisket, which seemed "wet" versus moist - we both were NOT impressed. His potato fries weren't great either.

QjII502MbL54_RMyqaPcdQ.text: This place has awesome food! You always get a generous portion. Try the brisket. It is the best!

P8Xg4F5DsRF8YMl0sMH1sw.text: Edited: thank you Kathy K (Midwood BBQ Bartender) for sharing - made the Watermelon Fresca last night and they were a hit! Still a fan.... Customer service thing. Food is fantastic. I was at Midwood a couple weekends ago and they had a specialty drink cocktail - a Watermelon Fresca. I went back a few days later when family was in town, wanting to share one of our favorite places, and they didn't  have it anymore. I bought a watermelon hoping to make it at home but it just wasn't as good. Called Midwood and a very abrupt person on the phone said they don't give out recipes. Seriously?! It's a specialty cocktail you don't make all the time - it's not like I can come get one if I have the hankering - and you're not going to share? If you gave me the recipe, every time I make it for company, I'd likely say "I got it at midwood smokehouse and they were so awesome they shared the recipe."... like... "go there and eat... it's one of our favorite places." Poor showing, Midwood.

MbS-2_BkNVOji1GBsY9P2A.text: The food and service is pretty good. I've been to this place a few times. The place is nicely decorated, clean blah blah blah, you get it, it's nice. However, the BBQ is GOOD but NOT GREAT. I've definitely have had better BBQ but this place is pretty good. We've always order the Big BBQ ( I think that's what it's called) because its for a larger party but its great because you can sample pretty much all the meats on the menu. I just think I'm a bit critical because I have had better BBQ.Its great for big or small groups and the location is ideal. This is one of those places where you can go out to dinner and then check out Plaza Midwood by foot, perhaps go bar hopping (like I  have in that area).

gZUcDlxLNFOOkOZH55uIVA.text: I've been on a quest. It's been a long quest.  I do believe it just ended at Midwood Smokehouse in Charlotte, North Carolina.  I just tasted the best brisket of my life.  I don't know how Midwood's chefs took the meat and turned it into this perfect art that delectably melts in your mouth. You can also order a side of bacon-wrapped jalapenos, which are delicious and spicy!  Midwood also has a plethora of stuff on tap, including the local brews for those of you, like me, enjoy sampling the hometown fare.  The service and atmosphere was fantastic! Bright and warm to the point where you'll never want to leave.  You also have never tried pork until you've had their Carolina Pork. With locally made vinegar, that stuff is awesome!  Midwood is a BBQ must while you're in Charlotte!

mfHjRBVSd22YStkgNQcUvA.text: The service here is excellent, had an awesome drink (jalapeno mule), and the beef tips are to die for. Definitely worth a small wait.

lrJKzOqomg2gU8McmdgQtg.text: I was impressed with Midwood before I even arrived, their wide ranging menu features lots of options, including some unique items like pimento cheese fries and bacon wrapped jalapenos. The experience did not disappoint. Patrons are seated by the hostess and it's a full service dining experience. I was really hungry - I ordered the large Carolina pork plate and a pound of smoked wings. The plate was a good deal with generous portion size for $13+tax. The smoked wings didn't seem like quite as good of a value at $8+tax, but still an ok deal. Everything was served piping hot. The hushpuppies were a bit tough. The mac and cheese was spectacular, great flavor. I tried their smoked vegetables (squash, zucchini, peppers) which had good flavor/seasoning, and are a nice option to offer. The pulled pork was juicy with very little fat. The vinegar based sauce did not add much flavor to the meat, but I don't think it needed sauce to dress it up, seemed good as is. The wings were ok, the BBQ sauce on them seemed to be different from the sauce on the table, more tomato based and did have a slight bit of a peppery kick. I'd like to try them again with the ranch instead. I topped it off with the pecan cobbler with ice cream, which is probably a little overpriced at $5.50+tax. The pecans were a little over-cooked for my taste, it seemed like too much of a burnt flavor.   This place was hopping during the middle of dinner time on a weekday night. Their outdoor seating was comfortable given the pleasant temperature during my visit. I definitely want to come back and try out some of their other menu options.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1 pound smoked wings with large Carolina pork plate.

Z7sevzGbkdRK3J8FnbMOEQ.text: This is only to do with the food not the service - ribs were garbage. Bones breaking off in meat. Lots of fat not a lot of meat. Hard to eat because of bones and fat. From the BBQ I've tried in Nashville, Kansas City, Chicago, Houston / Austin / Dallas and other cities this was not a good showing for Charlotte.

v_8wvNRzaaInpBf6gYzxXA.text: Midwood is my FAVORITE BBQ place in Charlotte. From the jalapeno poppers to the fried mac and cheese brick and the chopped BBQ salad everything here is FAB!!! I can't say enough good things about this place. If you like BBQ you have to try this place.

3YhVO99eecTTgz9PSd3nfA.text: So, finally made it here to eat their famous barbeque.  There are limited choices for me because I have celiac disease. I wish they would work on their menu  for those of us. I did try the barbeque , and it was delicious. Great atmosphere and definitely go for the drinks !!

SixXnf9ILU9mAjxQf-ZUNQ.text: Been here twice now, both times food was great. I had burnt ends each time, and wasn't disappointed. Beer selection is solid, and their sides are good as well. Highly recommend if you're in the area.

aII95_YxJP28KlimFBYTSw.text: Awesome barbecue, probably the best in Charlotte. Tons of beer on tap (17 i think) including Red Oak which is awesome. Staff was friendly and good even when they were clearly in the weeds.

Vh0S3iM6m4VNQ3JFPh04bA.text: Sunday night at 8:00 pm and place was packed.  Good sign.   Great vibe. Reminds me of great joints in Austin. Nothing in KC has this kind of vibe. Good rock music. 70s 80s. Classic Sammy Haggar.  Manager was an awesome guy.   Very limited parking.   Great beer selection.   Good service. Beers promptly refilled.   Fatty brisket was amazing. Could pull it apart with a fork. Not a lot of flavor from the bark. Definitely not a salt /pepper rub.   Sausage was fantastic.  Hard to explain vs traditional BBQ joint sausage.  Amazing with the brown mustard.   Pulled chicken was amazing. Loads of flavor and very juicy and tender.  Pulled and dressed with the vinegar-based sauce.   Pork didn't overwhelm me.  That was the one thing I was expecting to be good.   They were out of the St. Louis style BBQ ribs. :(  I'm giving the food 3 stars and the atmosphere takes it to 4 stars.

T5_k6eoFSZfqn-Zl_TOIRQ.text: I love this place. I've come here a few times and it never disappoints. The service is awesome too, they're all attentive and personable without being overly attentive. Good portions for the price and it's seriously the best BBQ I've ever had. The hush puppies are amazing as well and the vinegar house sauce is sooooooo good. Will definitely be back soon!

waLK9J5LUixZQGMImUwegA.text: This is my most favorite BBQ place in the world.  Their ribs are amazing and you must order the Burnt Ends. One of the last places that actually smoke their own meats on premise.   And the chicken and smoked sausage is among my favorites too!

DRtnre29ZVmXB_6cS8q_bQ.text: Everything on the menu looked good! The brisket tacos were delicious. My mom ordered the burnt ends and brisket... both were outstanding! The pomegranate and knob creek drink was a wonderful finish!

KS-XnqkHsZf5yNTxZzmpog.text: The pork barbq plate with Midwood sauce was outstanding. Hub said the jalapeno bacon wrap side was excellent. Banana pudding was very good.

_HkOluzVFf0H-nIaMkVd3g.text: I was in Charlotte for business and decided to check out some Carolina BBQ. I selected Midwood based on the reviews. The restaurant was busy, but I was seated in about 15 minutes. The hostesses were nice, waitstaff was good. The actual BBQ, however... I tried the Carolina chopped pork. I don't know if it was a good dish done bad, or a bad dish done good, but I found it quite unappealing. I guess I've been spoiled on KC, StL and Texas BBQ all these years. However, the baked beans were a wonder, and almost deserving of an additional star themselves. The neighborhood seems quite trendy. I'm sure I can find some better eats in the area next time.

aq_zeWFgTjtL0-Jf2fraNA.text: Food is amazing But bring back the fried pickles... PLEASE

kUvIrww8sKbV1YaabS99Ww.text: This place is a nice walk from our house.  We sat outside, and, although it was a little warm, we cooled down nicely. My husband ordered the salmon platter.  I requested the grilled cheese with smoked vegetables as a side.  The server asked, "are you sure you don't want meat with that?  We are known for our meat."  To which I replied, "I am known for not liking meat."  I guess he was supposed to push the meat.  And also,  he mam'd me to death.  I don't enjoy being called ma'am, but it's everywhere.  Call me babe or hottie instead. The food took a while to arrive.  My husband thought that maybe his food sat for a while.  My vegetables needed salted and peppered, which was an easy fix.  The sandwich was a bit thin on the cheese, but I was so happy to have bread.  I never eat bread, and Texas Toast was a treat. We enjoyed the 80's playlist and had fun trying to guess the artists. It was a nice, ordinary evening.

Z5y94sN0Te0XW8JJPXYKbw.text: Amazing bbq our waiter Matt was one of the best waiters I've ever had.  Can't wait to come back

PwkiJBvfF4MtHrmlHpbKYQ.text: The bacon-wrapped jalopenos are UH-mazing. My life is now complete.  Seriously though, this place is awesome if you're looking for BBQ. My husband and I went there with our church one Sunday after service. We had a large party and would have had to wait quite a bit to be seated if we sat inside, so they took us out to the heated patio and sat us there instead. The weather wasn't bad, so it worked out well.   My husband was on a no-sugar diet at the time, so it was a bit difficult to find food that he could eat, but they were very accommodating, and our server made sure to double check that what he ordered was okay for him to eat. We did end up cheating a bit with the jalopenos but it was definitely worth it.   Whenever he can eat like a normal person again, we'll definitely revisit. Since going there, we've made our own version of bacon-wrapped jalopenos at home - but using goat cheese since he can't do cow's milk dairy - and they were pretty good. Nothing beats the app at Midwood though.

afOZX6qkNjZxkC3eydtZcw.text: Just visited this gem last night with my family and there's a 150% chance that we'll be back! My mom heard about Midwood on one of those cooking shows that she watches so she wanted to check it out. Needless to say, 2 years passed and we still hadn't even looked the place up yet. We finally committed to coming yesterday and were met with the most unimaginable aroma of woodchips and spices- we were outside waiting and I just couldn't wait to get my hand on some of this food!  We had the smoked wings for an appetizer and I have to say that those were the best wings I've had in Charlotte. We ordered our sauces on the side and I'm not very sure what all of them were but my favorite was the habanero. I had the Carolina pork plate with smoked vegetables and I honestly kicked myself for not ordering the large plate. The pork was so moist and seasoned to freaking perfection. The pickled onions paired with the meat perfectly and the hush puppies were fresh.  My mom ordered the rib special that's going on this week and she said that she wished she had ordered the whole rack instead of half! My father had the brisket and had no complaints (which is a VERY good thing).  My husband had the Cuban and he said it was really good. It was his first time having a Cuban so he didn't really have anything to gauge it on but it was really good from what I tasted. It's pretty safe to say that from a first experience this tasty, Midwood is definitely going to become a family staple for us.

M_KcasAN2F2bs1cnTXkaZw.text: 5 Stars for their Brisket and in comparison to all other BBQ joints in Charlotte (keeping it in perspective)  Having traveled and lived in so many places across our great country, I've had the forture (or misfortune, depending on the experience) of trying a lot of different types of BBQ....from Texas, to St. Louis, to Georgia, Mississippi, Memphis, Kansas City, and now the Carolinas. All are delicious yet all have differences as well.   I would say Midwood Smokehouse if BY FAR the BEST BBQ for quality in Charlotte. In my (humble) opinion, this to me isn't True Carolina BBQ.....when you try the Brisket, it reeks of TEXAS-style BBQ. BUT my friends, THAT is why is so darned good! That Brisket is some of the best I've had outside of Texas, and trust me, when it comes to Beef BBQ, Texas is KING! I'm pretty sure the owners will tell you that they tried to emulate a Texas style for flavor and texture. I've been here 4 times, and each time I always get at least one sampling of the Brisket, and each time it has been outrageously great! Perfect smoke, flavor, and melt-in-your-mouth goodness. I just cannot find that anywhere else here in Charlotte.  IF you know of any place here in Charlotte that serves better BBQ Brisket, PLEASE let me know! The closest I've found is Saucemans on West Blvd. They're pretty darned good too, but not as good as Midwood Smokehouse.  I've also tried their sausage, pork and chicken, and I thought all of them were pretty good. Not the best I've ever had, but pretty good. Certainly no where as good as the Brisket.  I do love their jalapeno poppers too! Wrapped in BACON. Come on, how could you NOT like that?  I haven't been here in a few months but wanted to provide my perspective on this restaurant given that I've seen some really negative postings here recently. I mean it's cool that we all have our own tastes and experiences. God knows I've ripped a few here lately myself. But overall, in comparision to what we have here in Charlotte, I still believe this place to be THE BEST in town.  I wish we could do a Bobby Flay BBQ Throw Down here!

57J7KW59NeQDrrYh8WSCRw.text: Fantastic lunch experience!!  Our server was outstanding too (wish I remembered her name so I could give her a shout out)!  The meal was scrumptious from the apps to dessert!  I think I may have found my go to BBQ spot and that's saying a LOT!  Brought leftovers home to my hubby and he was impressed as well.  Will return and soon!

2_I5zckRe8T3CA1G7ccYSA.text: BBQ and Hush puppies hush puppies.....Every combo comes with hush puppies and it was so good. We ordered the choose 4 combo that comes four meats we chose a double order of BBQ with brisket  and smoked sausage. Our sides were the mac and cheese and collard greens. I must say everything was outstanding and they have the best BBQ I have ever had. They give the restaurant 12-Bones a run for there money, I must say. I highly recommend this place if you love BBQ and comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket, BBQ, and smoked sausage. The sides are creamy corn and mac and cheese.

NWa4447dee6JnMr8QTnkng.text: Woo! I finally made it to Midwood!  I love massive amounts of protein and I love massive amounts of BBQ sauce so I really dont know how I put off going to Midwood for so many years.   Two of us split the Combo platter and at first glance, we were worried it wasn't enough for us but my gosh, it was enough and it was fantastic! The brisket is some of the best I've had in Charlotte at a BBQ place, the pulled pork was great, and the ribs were 'fall-off-the-bone-so-freaking-great' yum. We also got pork but it was covered in the mustard sauce that I don't like so I unfortunately didn't get to try it (I was a bit surprised that it came with sauce on it already and sad I missed out on it).   I really liked the hushpuppies and there are some things I am really looking forward to trying in the future, such as the BBQ Queso. That just sounds delicious.   I am happy I finally went and was very pleased. I can't wait to go back. Of my BBQ restaurants I've tried in Charlotte (and there's been a lot), this is top 3, maybe top 2!

_oBrSUIOq_Z020zd8y87vw.text: Just now getting to doing a review! Was in Charlotte for the day of meetings and managed to grab lunch. What a treat!!! Food and service were spot on. We had the bacon wrapped jalapenos ... Delicious! Followed by chicken/rib combo... So good. Will definitely be back when in Charlotte!

O2Wmhhe6Wf5RphoaBqEoIw.text: First, let me start this review with saying I am a MEAT man.  Walking through the front door my senses perked up with the very delicious smokehouse smell.  We arrived on a Friday around 11:15 AM to beat the lunch crowd and there were only a few tables seated.  Our waitress was great and helped us through the menu and local beer options (we told her that we were newbies).  Items that we ordered:  1) Bacon wrapped jalapenos - YUM and very spicy, nice kick and goes along with beer.  2) Pig Out - 4 meats - Turkey, Brisket, Ribs and Pulled Pork - WOW.  Simply amazing!  So much food we split it and brought the rest home for dinner.  One note the baked beans were probably the best ever (laced with meat).  Please check this place out if you have not tried it.  I found this restaurant on Yelp and appreciated the other reviews from the Yelp community.  You will not be disappointed and I look forward to going again!

KrzIyKRpY3Nz__16lGsMng.text: Great barbeque - pulled pork is good. Service was fab even though it was busy and our table was ready quicker than we had been told we would have to wait.

-bK8DTk3w6-slG49l8hshQ.text: Awesome burnt ends,  collards and baked beans.  Sweet tea was great and that dessert......wow.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pecan pie cobbler....
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The plate never had a chance
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The love...

syDOujDaRoc0jZEFomVkHA.text: Absolutely delicious food with huge servings! I split the four meats plate and we got brisket, BBQ, chicken, and ribs with mac and cheese and fries. K honestly don't know what my favorite part was! The atmosphere is really neat and so welcoming. I would absolutely recommend eating here!

amp8xiY64AAgl5ef5JqgNw.text: Disclaimer: I was born and bred on pure Kansas City BBQ, so I'm trying not to let that bias me. Too much, at least.  With that being said, I'm a huge fan of BBQ either way and HAD to try some Carolina 'cue while I was out here. After some debate, we went Midwood since neither Kenzie K. or I had been here. Burnt ends were a little dry, and I had much higher expectations for the Fat Tire sauce (which I could barely taste). The Carolina Pork sandwich wasn't bad, and I'm glad that we at least were able to get samples of all of their sauces to try with it. Echoing what Kenzie said, the sides were a bit disappointing, especially the dry mac and cheese, and bottles of sauce would have been nice/preferred.  I wish I'd been visiting longer so I could have had some more meals to really develop an opinion on Carolina BBQ beyond Midwood. I'm optimistic for my next trip back and subsequent BBQ trials...

nG3po06rsV-5zAAP5qRYOQ.text: I can die happy now. Probably the best BBQ place I've been to so far. A great menu with the most flavorful pork I've ever had. I started with the pimento cheese fries and fell in love. Just make sure you have at least 3 other people with you because this plate is huge. I'm definitely going back to try the rest of the menu here. Whatever you get, I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento cheese fries
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ plate

D8iufqrOD_mhJioe_IaJHw.text: Amazing brisket, definitely a must try if you are here. Hands down the best waiter I have had in a long time, Joe knows his stuff and made our first experience so much better than an average waiter would have! Great selection of bourbon that will bring us back here often!

uQtnEdnyzzWu9e-Lsmr77g.text: One of the top 3 BBQ experiences I've ever had.  That's right... Not a BBQ meal, but an EXPERIENCE!  I've lived in both Kansas City and Austin, two cities famous the world over for their BBQ...Midwood Smokehouse is world class.  You HAVE to get the pimento cheese fries with brisket. Wow.  The burnt ends are the best thing the menu.  Huge chunks of perfectly cooked meat drowning in a great Fat Tire beer-based sauce.  Their Mac and cheese is great too. Excellent service and nice atmosphere.  I'll be back every time I'm in charlotte.

qFeQ-x-MpyTiBGDxhJz2og.text: Our go-to BBQ in Charlotte. Tender, flavorful meat and great options for side dishes. The pecan pie is beyond AMAZING! Love love love this place. Soon they'll have to expand the seating, but thankfully they're grab-n-go service is high quality too!

bws3-GnfAn5nAaZuBuVVOg.text: Barbecue was great.  We had burnt ends, brisket, chicken and salmon.  Loved all of it, except for the chicken.   The hush puppies, sweet potato fries and mac and cheese were all great.  Coleslaw is so so.  Food prices seem mostly reasonable, with some  priced under $10.     Mixed drinks a little high.  Lots of beer choices.  Server was friendly, but not overly attentive.  The five stars is for the barbecue

SwIFVz4runJ1wjwwpXiHjA.text: After a poor experience in another Charlotte BBQ place earlier this week we tried Midwood Smokehouse. The sun was shining and we were seated at a table outside at our request.  Mary was a fantastic server and I had the ribs (dry), mac & cheese and bacon-wrapped jalapenos. Tried all of there sauces and preferred the house mix and the habanero mix. My only mistake was in ordering the full rack as I had no room for desert.  After the meal Mary arranged for the manager to give us a tour of their hickory-fired smoker.  All in all a great meal and a very nice time.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dry ribs, mac &amp; cheese, bacon-wrapped jalapeños and hush puppies !

qE-InquRhFNJw35g2P0cqg.text: While not my favorite style of BBQ, I can still recognize how good this place is. I lived in Houston for a couple of years and after tasting Midwood's brisket, I was immediately suspicious their might be a Texan in the kitchen - and I was right. Texas is not known for pulled pork and ribs - nope... it's all about the brisket and sausage. This place nails both and I love that they have an option of lean or fatty brisket.
