This place might have the best 'cue in Charlotte, although my pallet is better suited for Mac's....

AJf1-PUigsQ2XwPTY4F3Qw.text: Plain and Simple, You Must Eat Here!! Stopped in for a late dinner after traveling in from Buffalo NY. Just a short wait time, place was busy. Our waiter, the food, drinks and atmosphere were all top notch.

cNAU5-b-Wg2iPVNRCiEBsQ.text: this is on my top 5 bbq joints in charlotte. I like the rubs and sauce they provide. I haven't tried everything on the menu but enough to fall in love with it. pulled pork sandwich with slaw is my fav so far. Parking can be a hassle but thats plaza/midwood for yah.

ofjfYFElYcMjaNUwKwa1XA.text: This is the best brisket I've had in Charlotte.  I got a lean portion and it was juicy and flavorful and cooked to perfection.  My family was with me and said the pulled pork BBQ was the best they've ever had.  My Dad wanted to go there every night they were in town.  The sides were decent - I had potato salad and cole slaw.  The mac and cheese was supposedly pretty good.  The hush puppies were pretty awesome.  Table service was great.  We sat at a booth, which was comfortable.  They also had some high tops.  Four stars only because parking sucks.  The lot is way too small and you have to find another place to park if the lot is full.

D6EAxEoRWsIb4Xb1EuxF3Q.text: Service here has gone down hill in a big way.  They have started nickel and diming customers for items that were previously free.   Came in for dinner with my daughter, and the waitress got upset that I was sharing her drink - very strange. Seems she wanted to charge me for that too, but generously opted not to.   Good quality is still fine, but customer service is lacking.   Too many other great barbecue restaurants in Charlotte than to come back to this place.

RIOOdfDMnAWqBQRvu0mvGg.text: Wow...that was some meal!  My family and I stopped into Midwood for dinner one night while I was in town for the Democratic Nat'l Convention and boy did this place blow my mind.  First, the ambience is perfect.  There are lots of TVs in the dining room allowing you to keep up on all of the games.  As for the food, I ordred a full slab of ribs...the BBQ was awesome.  On the side, I enjoyed the sweet potato fries and collard greens.   The back porch tea was really tasty (sweet tea, Jack Daniels and muddled lemon) C.J. was our waiter...he was very attentive and friendly.  The only downer is its location.  I was staying in a hotel downtown and it took about 10 minutes to get there.  Nevertheless, I would take a plane, train or automobile to get back to Midwood!

4L665HoqbFXh74uBPXLmKQ.text: Great Great food!!!! Had the 1/2 rack of ribs.. Meat just fell of the bone... I recommend this spot to everyone.

yXpAvDc4Q7C2Gbh-Rmg_eg.text: Awesomely delicious!  My husband and I visit Midwood at least once a week, it is SOOO good!  We have taken all of our out of town guests here and had them cater our Christmas Eve dinner last year.   They smoke everything onsite andy ou can smell the meat cooking as soon as you step out of your car.  The bbq and brisket are fantastic and they have the best pulled chicken I've ever had.  They have a few sauces onhand so you can have thick, mustard or vinegar sauce to accompany your meal.   I love getting the Midwood Chopped Salad and I usually add the pulled chicken to it.  The salad is filled with grilled corn, black beans, avocado, cucumbers and freshly grated cheddar cheese. Another favorite meal to order are the tacos- you can mix and match so you can try bbq, pulled chicken and/or brisket at the same time.  The mac and cheese and creamed corn are out of this world.   Plan your visit now, you can't go wrong!

S5AJhlq2kKelyJUU9fKu9w.text: When I visited my cousin in Charlotte, I couldn't wait to have some real BBQ.  I'm down south for goodness sakes! How could I go wrong? I was told about the rave reviews received by this restaurant and was excited to eat here. I cannot explain how disappointed I was with this place.  The portions were tiny and the food had no flavor.   I ordered the pulled chicken. I received a scoop of meat that appeared to be barely the amount of a chicken thigh. It was pale and dry.   After I tried it, I told the waiter it was flavorless.  He said since the skin is pulled off, the flavor leaves with it.   First of all, you can season under the skin, as I do at home.   Secondly, if you let the chicken sit overnight after you've seasoned it, the meat picks up more flavor. Lastly, if you smoke it or BBQ it, the flavor permeates the meat.  Give me a break! What kind of BBQ spot is this? Dinosaur BBQ runs circles around this place! I will never, ever eat here again. Terrible!

fL7FkPaV7tCyMfGWQZYplQ.text: It has been a long time since I have been here, but they are remembered fondly.  We could not finish our meal so we got a to go box.  We forgot the box on the table and when we went back 5-10 minutes later they has tossed it.  They took the time to make us new food to take home.  That kind of service is not forgotten.

V1u8yxZ8Mkg2t0ogTGH-pw.text: The wait time was a terrible start. We waited about 30 minutes to get seated. The moment we were assisted we were given time to look over and place our order. I had the bbq chicken, I wasn't really impressed with it. I've definitely tasted better. Our server never refilled our drinks since we arrived. Not really worth the price I paid for my meal.

lG4s_VelmwsoOgGm_OPbIQ.text: Got to do the 3star review and i was so looking forward to it. Found the place ok. Bbq didn't remind me of the q i get in SC , it was dry. Everything just seemed greasy and overdone. The fiance got sick about an hour later. I'll try again because i know so many peeps have liked this place but it was too overdone for me.

Qez6DFjJxzFr38YNLZHobQ.text: This was rather hard to find and parking was limited, otherwise it would be 5 stars. Staff was friendly and all worked together to ensure you had what you needed. Sides were delish! As for BBQ, not bad but I have to say a wee bit dry for my likes. Try the crazy bacon wrapped jalapeno peppers, and amazing hush puppies. Creamed  corn was a favorite for our table.

QgHg_CJuEyRuEouK-8-ZtQ.text: I found this on Yelp. I've pasted this several times but never stopped until today. I ordered take-out. Based on the bartender recommendations, I ordered pulled pork plate with baked beans and collard greens. The pulled pork and baked beans were good. The collards were a little tougher than I like. However they were seasoned pretty good. The serving size is large. I could not eat it all in one sitting.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

5ZHuxHqtzEsgL949QwyBVQ.text: for the sake of Charlotte knowing whats out there...this is one of my top places.    Midwood Smokehouse will probably ruin all other BBQ in the city for you...not much compares.  If there is a wait, go for it anyways...they will take your number and text you so you can leave the area as long as you are back within 5 minutes of their call.  I personally love that.  The Pimento Cheese fries will ruin your dinner in the most glorious of ways, so good, so big!  (ADD PORK)  The burnt ends are delish - as is the creamed corn.  My go-to meal is the simple Pork BBQ sandwich, with coleslaw on the sandwich - how it should be done!  Get the vinegar sauce and pour it all on!....I do a side of hush-puppies and love to dip them in their spicy BBQ sauce.  Great dinner that always leaves me wanting to roll out the door.    Thursdays are Bring Your Own Mug night - they will fill anything up to 40oz.  Very fun time and you can get really creative!  And if you like spicy do check out their Bloody Mary's!  ($5 on Sundays!)  They are really great.  The last few sips will leave your mouth burning...in a "that was worth it" kinda way.  I have a small list of Charlotte spots I take out-of-towners when visiting.  MW-SH is the TOP spot on my list for great NC BBQ.

hkfekOap2lVf5nkzcfmVtA.text: nothing here is going to blow your mind, but there is nothing disappointing. This is always my go-to for quick and easy bbq to-go. There are some other places in town that are probably better on the yum-yum-scale, but this is in the neighborhood and it is so solid, love taking friends visiting from outta town here for good carolina barbeque.

Ch9R_oFQX951Vuf9aiDD9Q.text: Very good. So much food! I had the brisket, burnt ends, bacon wrapped jalapenos, and Mac and cheese. It was all really good!

d4Ci6godiNe3wBAdXze6PA.text: Best bbq in the city, love the burnt ends

0d1qCt_9GGGSgjE-gXZ0rQ.text: One of my favorite go to spots. Service is always great and friendly, the food and barbecue is delicious. I love the salmon salad. The location and atmosphere is pretty great too. Must try for charlotte BBQ

r9xru2TTYe3RpwHPftYHXA.text: The best BBQ I have had hands down. We use to live in the University area and we ate here all the time, but we moved to the other side of town and don't get here as often as we would like. So I was over here this week doing Father's Day shopping for my husband when I realize exactly where I was. I called my husband to get his order and made a quick beeline to the restaurant. Place our order and within 10-15 mins I was out the door. Now the hard part was driving from central ave to ballentyne with that great smelling flavor playing with my nose was the hardest part and often wanted to sneak in the bag and grab something out, but I didn't want anything unless I had the entire thing, so I waited.   Once I got home I don't remember taking the keys out the car because I was so excited about mid wood BBQ. When I took my first bit I almost slapped my husband because it was so good (joking) but it was good. It was just how remembered. On this round my husband got the wings app with Mac and cheese and collard, all that were great, and I got the pulled pork with collards, with was great.  I have had everything here and I recommend everything. Smoked sausage, wings brisket, pull pork everything is phenomenal.

9cz13jCJZZnS-zhSgeop_A.text: Midwood Smokehouse may be the best barbecue I have had in the Southeast.  This includes any place in Memphis, Fox Brothers in Atlanta and Martin's in Nashville.  Fantastic sauces and sides.  The ribs were perfectly cooked and the burnt ends were great.  This restaurant is essential to a trip to Charlotte if you love barbecue.

xxkrs0EzWTaHglAcFrm7mw.text: Since midwood was more convenient to my house I decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did the food was really good and wasn't as expensive as I thought. I got the bbq sandwich with bbq slaw and collard greens and added on a side of ribs which came up to 21.50! Not bad. The waiter was very helpful and nice and the atmosphere was pretty chill. The sandwich was good the bread was toasted and buttery just right! The collards were good The ribs were good but I've had better. The bbq sauce was really good. Overall I enjoyed and will definitely be back to try more things off the menu. You should try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding yum yum yum
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bbq sandwich with bbq slaw on the side and a side of collard greens. It was really good

-AyWJRO-EcjPq0dUhLtJCA.text: Ate here with friends while visiting Charlotte. The restaurant is nice and gives a homey feeling, the food smelled and tasted like you were in your buddy's backyard relaxing and grilling. Great food, good service, no complaints at all. A combo platter is more than enough food for one person, you'll be fine and have leftovers.  Good: -Good informative servers, will answer BBQ questions and even make recommendations if you ask -FRIED PICKLES, do it.  -If you're not sure what to get, pick a Combo Platter below is what I chose- -Carolina Chopped Pork -Beef Brisket (get it with medium fat, it has more flavor than the lean cut) -Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs (THE TASTIEST OF THE SELECTIONS..BY FAR) -The sides: Mac & Cheese (a must) -Collard Greens (had a little spice to it) -BBQ Baked Beans -The Pecan Cobbler with a scoop of ice cream if you have room -The sweet tea was just sweet enough and not heavy/syrupy  Bad: -Being picky, but I don't think there were enough hush-puppies served with the combo platter -The Chopped Chicken BBQ did not blow me away with flavor, you're not missing anything special, you come for the Ribs and Brisket

HkY3rny73wyxS2jg1OljmA.text: Stopped in based on reviews on Yelp. We shared a combo platter with 2 adults and a child with an additional order of hush puppies. It was 6oz of 4 different smoked meats plus 2 sides. Was more than enough for all of us. The ribs were my favorite.

IHtAfCJ3rUCK52jnphIyuw.text: Down home Carolina BBQ!  Carolina BBQ means pork. Pulled pork with a vinegar based sauce.  I'm a Texan, and I appreciate good BBQ. I seek it out. That's why I was so pleased to try Midwood Smokehouse. I was fairly clueless about Carolina style BBQ, and was excited when the waitress knew exactly what I should have when I said I wanted local style BBQ. They served me up two heaping spoonfuls of pulled pork, topped with onions, a side of hushpuppies, and bacon-wrapped jalapenos.  The bbq sauce was vinegar based, with spices and peppers sloshing around the bottom of the mix. I've never quite understood vinegar based sauces, but enjoyed the pickled pepper flavors  when mixed with the pork. Parts of the pulled pork had that char on it, or bark, which gave some pieces a smoky, crunchy quality.  The hushpuppies seemed like deep fried pieces of cornbread. They had a slight sweetness to the cornbread. Decent.  I wasn't wild about the bacon wrapped jalapenos. Being from San Antonio, we know our jalapenos, and these weren't the most primo peppers. On the small side, and overcooked so that they squish when you bite 'em. I was blown away by the beer list. They had a rare cask aged beer, and lots of local options for fine beer.  Unfortunately, they were out of a lot of items, so our selections were somewhat hampered.  The service was very friendly, and they made lots of great recommendations and carefully explained a little about everything we were eating. You could tell that they take pride in the BBQ here.

KJ_E5ifHPBWDadhq5avuMw.text: This is my go-to spot in Charlotte. Constantly in here for dinner or take/out. I am a big fan of their chicken and beef, never been crazy about their pork. Highly recommend the Dixie Chicken Salad with the chipotle ranch and also the Burnt ends with BBQ baked beans and mac and cheese.

5PhuSjRIO9-Z3IBnwC4ONA.text: Great BBQ!!!!! Perfect burnt ends and loved the bacon wrapped jalapenos.  We also had BBQ sandwich and brisket tacos, all of which were awesome.  On top of great entrees were amazing sides which separates the best from great.

-PjudZ-RcPuJAjQyN1-vbw.text: We got the combo platter with Carolina Chopped Pork, Beef Brisket, Saint Louis Ribs, and Smoked Sausage. All of the meats were good, with the brisket being the best and the ribs being only ok. The pickled onions were delicious as was the sweet creamed corn. I would also recommend their drinks I got a Jack's Beehive (Tennessee Honey, Lemonade and Ginger Ale) which was great, but all of their drinks looked awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. combo platter with Chopped Pork, Beef Brisket, Ribs, Smoked Sausage, pickled onions, hushpuppies, creamed corn, and mac and cheese.

oY2xzEBMSqGQaQzxq2CATg.text: Very good food, only compliant is the restaurant size is pretty small. You at times will feel like you're on top of other people.

XYWF6CHM8ktolhlotvp1nA.text: I've now been to Midwood Smokehouse three times, and the more I go, the more I like this place.  The first time I went here, it was during the middle of the week one day last summer, a little before noon.  I ordered the ribs and was not impressed.  They were full of smoky flavor, but they were tough and definitely NOT "fall off the bone".    The other two times I've had the chance to dine @ Midwood have been much more memorable and have both come within the past month.  In the two most recent times here, I ordered the half rack of the St. Louis style pork ribs ($13), the BBQ Pork Sandwich ($7.50), and the smoked wings ($8).  The ribs the second time around were much better and much more tender.  the BBQ pork sandwich, which I had Saturday, June 3rd, for lunch was nothing short of spectacular.  I asked for the slaw on the sandwich which added a nice, cool, crunchy texture.  The fries were above par as well.  On my most recent trip there, I ordered the wings as well.  The wings were awesome.  As a True wing lover and connoisseur, I have no hesitation in saying these are some of the tastiest, tender wings in Charlotte!  Every time I've been to Midwood the service has been great.  Every employee I've come in contact with while there, has been friendly, and polite.  I am not sure exactly where Midwood Smokehouse ranks in the pantheon of Charlotte BBQ establishments, but you have to put it somewhere in the top 5; behind Mac's, but waaay ahead of the likes of Old Hickory House.  Something tells me, this place is going to carve out a tradition of great BBQ and friendly service in the heart of the Plaza Midwood for years to come.  I am a growing fan of this spot and will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Try the wings! You won&#39;t be disappointed! They are full of smoky flavor and grilled tenderness!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Pork sandwich, up close and personal.  Pulled pork was excellent, slaw was cold and full of crunchy goodness, bread held up.

wHRi1ZZMjyR8AvoMLPMPaQ.text: I've sampled my fair share of barbeque from many different styles up and down the east coast and out west as well and Midwood Smokehouse can definitely compete with these guys.   This place was already filling up 11:45 am on a Friday morning. It was a beautiful day so we snagged a spot on the outdoor patio and immediately start gawking at all the delicious-looking plates around us.  I decided on the blue cheese brisket sandwiched served between two pieces of Texas toast and the boyfriend ordered the half rack f rib special but substituted the BBQ spaghetti with mac n cheese.  The sauces same out way ahead of time from the food which is a bit of a pet peeve of mine especially when you are really anxious for your meal. Of course I sampled each one alone and new exactly which combination of each I like. The mustard-based sauce and then Midwood sauce were my favorites. We were surprised how long we had to wait for our meals as barbeque usually comes out pretty quick, but to be fair, they were pretty busy.  Everything was pretty darn good. The sweet potato fries were most impressive to me (I'm very picky about my fries) and the brisket sandwich was very good as well. The ribs were not necessarily "fall off the bone" but the smoky rub was outstanding. The mac n' cheese was nothing to swoon over.  Next time I come back I'll definitely need to try a traditional pulled pork BBQ sandwich along with the delicious sweet potato fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half rib special with Mac n&#39; cheese and hush puppies
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sauces... Try the midwood and mustard base mixed!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket and blue cheese special with sweet potato fries

-T1-6gzVlm8c9XAgX2G1OQ.text: It breaks my heart that I had to come to N C all the way from California for this bbq the burnt end were fantastic and ribs were fall off the bone sausage, brisket, mac and cheese were all the best . I'm going home soon so I'm trying to eat here everyday. Truly the best. I wish they were open for breakfast as I have a am flight soon. Goodbye midwood till I return

YoJmz0GVG-LXbpEWoP3vcQ.text: I have eaten a lot off BBQ in a lot of places and this is amazing.  Nice smoke to it, seasoned perfect, now drowned out in sauce...you add the amount you want.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Such amazing food! Will have to come again next time I&#39;m out here. Glad i have some extras for the flight

iObTSnUioY0mFws4Bidfhg.text: This place is insanely good. This may be the best BBQ restaurant I've ever been to in my life. I have traveled around the nation and been to many. This place takes the top spot. I'm here for work and got the "well fed" you choose 4 meat and two sides. The ribs are tender and flavored to perfection. The burnt ends are a house favorite and they didn't disappoint. The sausage and the brisket were also incredible. Sometimes at other restaurants the brisket is dry or even too salty. This place does it very well. Lots of flavor without being too salty and it is not dry at all. The ribs were by far my favorite. For sides I got mac and cheese and jalapeno poppers. The mac and cheese is basic and didn't take my breath away but the jalapeno poppers were awesome! They take a huge one and wrap it with a full strip of bacon and I loved every bite! Come hungry for sure. The staff was incredible especially the lady at the bar. It was so good I came back again the next night. SOOOO GOOOD!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

R4K2AlSB6YKeIbAMeCb4Bg.text: So glad I chose Midwood as my one BBQ stop on my short trip to Charlotte. Cool vibe & real BBQ atmosphere; sat at the bar & had Matt as my server...he could not have been my gracious in helping with my selections & informing me of everything I needed to know about Midwood.  Had the 4 meats of ribs, burnt ends, pork & brisket. Though all were excellent, the brisket was incredible; perfect fatty/lean ratio, tender & the perfect char.    Sides were a unique option of bacon wrapped cheese stuffed jalapenos (very interesting & tasty) & quite honestly, one of the greatest things I've ever eaten in the baked beans. More like a chili, these beans were moan-worthy, seriously!  All four sauces were great; vinegar based Carolina style, my favorite was the traditional, watery base, followed by the mustard based.  For only a couple more bucks, Matt sold me on the banana pudding, which I ate after I got back to Atlanta for dessert...so creamy, light & yummy!  Thanks again to Matt & Preston at the bar, the assistant GM for checking in with me & the phenomenal pit master for a memorable BBQ experience in Charlotte.

cXUc0_CVzbDRjNCGJuaeBg.text: The food was average for the most part. The bacon wrapped Jalapeno's were awesome, as well as the smoked wings. Kid's menu is very limited, only 3 options. The meats that come with bbq sauce on them are smothered so you don't really taste the meat at all. The banana pudding was very good. Overall it was ok but I have had way better and for a lot less money.

Q1_JUwOmgkqItEr5_4xYtQ.text: BBQ was good and the service was top notch.  We didn't like the brisket as much as the other meats.  The cole slaw was on the warm side which is never attractive to a southerner.  Baked beans were ok.  Definitely worth a second try if we're in the area.

_xZKhl_EVrevzDFmL43RMw.text: Pork plate is always on point. The mac and cheese is waaaaay better than Mac's Speed Shop, probably my favorite in CLT. Smoked veggies are a treat, but I wish the portion were a little bigger. You have to ask for a sauce sampler plate if you want to try anything other than the basic vinegar sauce (which I find a little weak for my taste), but the hot, mustard and sweet are all solid.

WLWEXUY49cZ_wM2_xJLmqg.text: 100% better than Mac's Speedshop. The best option for two people or more are the feast platters. I would suggest the collard greens as well.

vKL53R2Vlnq38z8K85TNLQ.text: Hands Down BEST BARBECUE in NORTH CAROLINA !! Definitely the best I've ever had . Amanda and her crew were awesome ! GREAT SERVICE !! Thank you from Naples, Florida :)

25YzaMuyGsgkLAZQAVNL2Q.text: The brisket pretty good... nothing close to Austin, but the best I've had in NC. I was really surprised how much I loved the smoked veggies. The pickled stuff on the side is a great touch.

9pssaEZ7zcrHZMH3QWlRJw.text: As far as barbecue places go in Charlotte, Midwood barbecue by far THE best brisket in town.  In no way is this place fancy. In fact, they might even let you in with your pajamas. Service is always great and every staff member I've interacted with there has been friendly. Even the person managing the takeout orders is nice!  But let's get down to business. The food here is fantastic. They do a great Texas style brisket, which I highly recommend. If I'm feeling in a light mood, I will get the chopped salad and add brisket on top. It's delicious. Sides are great, and I would recommend the Mac and cheese. I know this is kind of random, but the sausage is really good too. It's one of those meets that comes as an afterthought to a lot of people, but put this at the top of the order next you go!  All in all, a great BBQ joint. Patio is nice in the spring and they turn tables fairly quickly so you do t have to wait too long. If I could leave you with one piece of advice, get the bacon wrapped jalapenos. You won't regret the taste and you can just ignore the calories.

N1O8Wu9fd_AV2kKSTok1GA.text: Sorry but nah. Everything I had was mediocre at best. If this is the best Carolina BBQ I don't care to try anymore. The brisket was ok but nothing special. Definitely get the fatty as lean is a no. The pulled pork was very dry and not that flavorful. Had to put both sauces on it. Came cause of the banana pudding comments but unfortunately that as well was just off. It seemed like just whip cream with wafers. I was really looking forward to it. But I like there to be a consistency difference between the pudding and whip cream. I seriously thought it was just whip cream. Taste was ok. Just left disappointed from start to finish. The only thing that was somewhat good was the bacon wrapped jalapenos but it could use a seed or two to give it a bite. The bartender was very polite and attentive though.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Too whippy. Not enough banana pudding and bananas.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. I liked the pickled onions and bacon. But I&#39;ve had way better BBQ lots of places

xRQIH9A3NQrXLJBK45Djqg.text: Not a lot to choose when you vegan it but god was good service was ok little tension was in the air but would come again for last min eat of grilled cheese

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

B6XbV_XVNeD8Uhw9u64rWA.text: I enjoyed a great plate of 1/2 a rack of pork ribs. Great sauces to enjoy on the side with hush puppies, however the sweet potato fries weren't all consistently cooked all the way through.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

McZBlk813qSd9d-VBOqBpg.text: Some of the menu items were definitely hit or miss. One of my biggest complaints when going to a restaurant (because I used to be a chef) is bringing out cold or just warm food. I would have given this restaurant a clean four stars for environment, food, and customer service. The bartenders were very friendly and attentive when it came to checking on us and meeting our needs and requests as customers. But the food (entire platter was lukewarm at best.)  Coming all the way from Baltimore to try charlotte's famous Carolina BBQ, serving warm meat at a BBQ spot is totally uncalled for. Regardless, neat location to dine grab a beer and watch football. It don't really have that BWW feel for a sports bar but it's a nice adjustment for decent BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

ke8kmh5Mz294kC32AlAiOw.text: Ripp off!!!!! This used to be one of my favorite places to eat. Not anymore. I parked across the street and got booted and forced to pay $125 fine. Total scam!! no less then 12 people got the same treatment while I was there. Looking up other reviews on this place, yes it's happened before. Now this may not be the fault of the restaurant, however they are not looking out for there customers. If my customers where getting this treatment would put up a sign do something. It goes along with serving your customers. I will never be back.

d7bJ2o2IVt_q0VutJ4hCPg.text: As you park your car and walk up the street... you smell the smoke, the deliciousness wafting through the air, greeting you with a big North Carolina hug.  The atmosphere is super chill, the menu expansive, the service excellent.  My daughter, Mackenzie, got the Pulled chicken and said it was the best she ever had, I got the half rack of ribs with Cole slaw.  They were without a doubt, some of the best ribs that I've ever had... perfect smoke, perfect spice, fall off the bone yet juicy, a hard to find combination but Midwood accomplices with ease... it made my 14 hour drive from New Hampshire worth every second.

BK9Vd6SrUIGyhiYI_STTIw.text: Great food! The wait time was not a big problem. And the use of Yelp to track the wait time was perfect. My husband was able to drink his stout beer and we could enjoy the lovely evening. The atmosphere was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

hF_MY7TL5vN7k70HywwsXw.text: Best BBQ I've had east of Texas!    I was visiting from Southern California, and I am sure glad I stopped by. Everything that we ordered was amazing, and the large selection of local breweries was also a great plus.  When I visit Charlotte again, I will make sure to stop by!

B7DVS0SFcWQF6Xb8Yufddg.text: On the night that I went,they were very busy. They asked me if I wanted to carry out or dine in. I told them take out because she said that the wait time would be 30 mins. For dining in. The wait was worth it!!! I had a brisket plate the sauce was married to the meat and it was very tender and savory!!!! The customer service was awesome as well!!

IcHE61xtI94G5wBDSS3YLQ.text: MEAT all the way.   Had the best rack of ribs. Service was awesome. The "burnt beef ends" was another delicacy.  Must try also includes the "pecan cobbler with vanilla scoop" from the dessert section.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pecan cobbler with Vanilla ice cream
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt beef ends with bacon wrapped jalapenos
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

rcTFBDeMWD2rexT8U64FoA.text: These where the best ribs I've ever had!! The flavor was perfect. Didn't even need to put any of their delicious sauce on them, and the sauce was just that, delicious. The Mac and cheese was great, but a tad under cooked. I would visit Charlotte just to eat here again!

fI_s_tPl9Z6QOHCyEGhrUQ.text: I've only been to this location once, but it was great.  I always get brisket when I try a new barbecue place, it's a good way to know if they are good at smoking meats. This place is incredibly good.  The fatty brisket was juicy and smoky. The bartender was friendly and helpful. He recommended a great single malt whiskey from Colorado, very smooth. I was there on a Sunday night in July so it wasn't very crowded. The bar was 75% empty. No waiting to be sat at a table either. I highly recommend this place!

013kauW0gJ-cryaxbQZx0w.text: I've been seeking a good spot for southern dishes and decided to give this place a go based on Yelp rating.  I got the Carolina pork platter with a side of mac n cheese and BBQ baked beans.  Very filling.  Probably would have tasted better if I ate right away.  The baked beans were my favorite.  Very flavorful although a tad salty.  Very much like a bushes baked beans but probably better.  The mustard bbq sauce reminded me so much of Maurice's BBQ Mustard that I grew up on when we had Sunday dinner but they have it spicy.  I may return but not floored.  Oh yeah pick up for orders are on the opposite side of the wall at the bar. How stupid to not even get acknowledged standing between the bar's doorway?...

B3lgif4jOOU7Jve-SXNbPg.text: Awesome BBQ, great atmosphere and service. I will definitely visit when in Charlotte again

IqY-2pGpILf96REab3cZYw.text: I'm from Texas and thought the brisket was really good. Moist, not dry. Sauce with it was good. Mac and cheese was also good. Wasn't a fan of the hush puppies but i don't have anything to compare them too, so maybe i just don't like hush puppies. I got my food to-go from the bar.

SRXVyWzQyuAcnWc06RgTNQ.text: I found this place via my trusty YELP app. Me and my buddy decide to come here after the Nascar race got rained out. We get there and the host told us that they are out of ribs and pulled pork. But thats what we came here for? But from what it looks like one of the owners said that those two items would be ready within 30 minutes. My buddy said lets just stay here only because it will probably take us that long to decide on where to go instead, then drive there, then sit, then order. SO we just said, lets just eat here.  We put our name down and asked for a booth, and they said there might be a wait, I said no problem because we had 30minutes to wait for the stuff we wanted anyways.  Our server, i forgot his name was really nice. We browse the menu and pretty much know what we wanted.  I ordered that plate that had a little bit of everything and my buddy just had the pulled pork.   We get our food fairly fast, it didn't even feel like we waited that long for anything. When I get my plate, everything looked amazing! The bacon wrapped jalepeno's was awesome. The baked beans was home made. the hush puppies i couldn't stop eating.  As for my meats. The thing i loved the most was the brisket. It was hands down the best brisket I have ever tried. My next favorite was the pulled pork, and the Ribs and sausage I did not care for. The ribs looked amazing but it fell flat for me in terms of flavor. The sausage was nothing really to write home about. Oh i forgot to mention i LOVED the pickled onions. Wish I got more on my plate.  But other then that, this place gets a solid 4 star in my book. I'll most defiantly be back when I'm in town again.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

5AcjM2fxrCYdCYCKz4Mskg.text: Oh my! I'm so impressive with this place. BF and I got a combo platter and a burnt end dish, we were beyond full and satisfied.   For the combo platter we got to ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. The ribs and brisket were delicious and tender. The pulled pork was decent but was out shadowed by the ribs and briskets. The sweet potato fries were so crisp, definitely the better side between that and the mac and cheese. Our other dish was the burnt ends with mac and cheese. The hype on the Burnt ends is real! It was the star of our meal! It was flavorful and tender. The two dishes were more than enough for us so don't order with your eyes.   Service was great, our server small talked with us and helped explaining the different meats.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo platter with brisket, ribs, chicken and pulled pork
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends and a combo platter

15bVPHv60kwLmDpfa-dFvA.text: Really average. I was really excited about this place being I live in LA and don't have many chances to eat bbq. I must say it was pretty disappointing. The service was ok and the food was...ok. We tried to order the beef ribs;however, they ran out. I ordered the coleslaw and it was pretty sour. My mom ordered the chicken and it was really dry. I must say the salmon was actually pretty good and my niece and nephews ate all of their food. It is a family friendly restaurant. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

3AJzkRq_bdkgYCZZwtBFkQ.text: We went last night finally after craving some barbeque for weeks.  Overall, our experience was awesome.  We had an awesome server, Cliff, who gave us his suggestions and was pretty entertaining.  We took Cliff's suggestion and got the Combo platter since we were newbs.  We ordered the brisket, ribs and doubled up on the pork bbq.  For our sides we got mac n cheese and fries.  Everything was really great.  The ribs were probably our least favorite, but they still tasted great.. just not as tender as we were hoping!  Pretty good beer selection and great service.  We'll be back!

REpsLIZJtmCjo79AEG1iIg.text: Went there on a very very busy Saturday night.  I had no issue parking, but that was more luck of the draw, the parking is tight.  I guess you can park across the street, but that's not convenient and I think it costs to park over there (it's the Bistro Le Bon parking lot).  The night didn't start off too good.  We waited, and waited and waited.  One of my friends got thirsty and attempted to go in and get a drink....and that was also slow.  There were only two bartenders on duty and one was slinking drinks with a busted hand.  Like legit, he was taking off his slink to work the tap.  Anyways, we finally go table inside.  The hostess was very apologetic.  She said it took so long b/c we had wanted a table inside and out of the heat.  The night immediately turned around once we were seated.  Our waitress was fab, as was the hostess.  Drinks were plentiful and cold.  The food.  It was really good.   Honestly I got carried away w /conversation and didn't ask my dinning companions how theirs was, but no one complained.  I had the salmon sammie.  It was perfectly cooked and the corn coleslaw on top was perfection.  The hushpuppies were just OK.  I don't like them served w/ BBQ sauce.  The greens and mac and cheese were yummy, but nothing special.  The lemon chess pie was also very good.  There's a lot more on the menu I wanna try.  I'm giving solidly 4 stars.  Yeah that was a well-cooked piece of fish.  LOL

H2EYYtLQjIx0oz6Qz3JQxw.text: Rainy Sunday lunch. Beer selection is good, adequate and cold enough.  Food was very good. Wife had tacos and preferred the Stockyard as it had a great unique flavor while the Red Neck was equally good but had that expected in a southern pull pork BBQ joint.  I had the pull pork sandwich was pretty dog gone good with the BBQ slaw on it. The vinegar based "sauce" was unique which should have pushed the ranking to 5 stars, but ... The "beef" I have with the place is the price. $7.50 for a sandwich and $10 for 2 tacos is steep which for those prices should have included a couple hush puppies - a staple of all southern BBQ joints.

Q-Cx9LxjyAeI383yPUX2kQ.text: Family Pulled Pork Sandwich and BBQ BEANS. Best BBQ EAST of Salt Lick and Sonny Bryan's so far

p0rLg97CjByEAkXUGFgADA.text: Cold beers, Fried pickles, burnt ends with hush puppies and smoked vegetables. Finished with banana pudding. Would do it again and again.

9-4r-iCVjfgTGt9tWCdDWg.text: One of my favorite BBQ places in the city. Great beers on tap, bacon wrapped jalapenos are delish, and friendly servers. One time I came with my family and they were closed for renovations but gave us two $5 gift cards so that we would come back.

8tnejTuFFfvQtZ9yBw_xlg.text: Disappointed. A reputable BBQ house should not try to pass off cubed brisket put under a salamander as "burnt ends". They were dry and certainly not authentic.  Ribs were on the dry side as well.

SzR-VqOKf3rFwI7ySSEKoA.text: We had such a delightful lunch as we were driving through Charlotte on our road trip. The staff were all so unbelievably friendly and accommodating (we were travelling with a dog). They kept bringing him bowls of water and treats, and he loved the attention. The human food was just as delicious as his treats! We got two barbecue plates- one with burnt ends, and one with ribs. We got macaroni and cheese, baked beans, and collard greens for sides. Each of the meals came with hush puppies as well. Literally, everything was just divine. Both the collards and the beans were loaded up with bits of meat, which seems so rare when restaurants usually want to skimp on the good stuff! The hushpuppies were just the slightest bit sweet and were perfect. Our waitress also brought us a variety of BBQ sauces and vinegars to try, and all of them were wonderful. Our waitress was particularly kind when my boyfriend couldn't make up his mind about what kind of beer to get- she brought him samples of a bunch of different types, and gave him recommendations and descriptions of each. We just had the best time ever here. It's a shame we won't be driving through Charlotte again any time soon, because this restaurant was just top notch.

-fWAg5-PKtNLrV-teON06g.text: Ease up on the salt!  Collard green, inedible due to salt.   Ribs, dried out and salty, inedible. Fried Pickles, overly salty and inedible.  Talked to the manager, they knew they were inedible because of a bad batch of pickles but served them anyway. Beans, soaked in fat and overcooked, inedible. Pulled Pork, okay Brisket, okay. Service, very good.  Over all extremely dissatisfied with the food.  Hope to find some real BBQ where I don't have to double up on my blood pressure medicine because of the salt content. Dismayed as to why people recommend this place.

W4F0gxqUGyC1ssESAQiVYQ.text: I always bring out-of-town guests here for great BBQ and a good selection of local craft brews, and this place never disappoints. I would rate Midwood Smokehouse as the 2nd best BBQ joint in town, behind Bill Spoon's BBQ, but I'm sure some Charlotteans would disagree. Besides the pork BBQ, I really like the collards and vinegar-based slaw, which is getting harder to find nowadays. If you're looking for a fun place to have a beer and some great BBQ, Midwood BBQ should be at the top of your list.

5bKHicTvP58FaIl8glJhjw.text: Might be my favorite bbq place in town. Great food and great service at both the mid-wood and Ballantyne locations. Definitely have the brisket, ribs or the beer can chicken. And try the poppers

VdCWFbXFOCTUkbFxk99pUw.text: Service is extremely kind here.  This was my first time trying NC bbq; I do live in KC, but don't have a marked preference for a certain kind of American BBQ.  I ordered the small plate of burnt ends + a side of pulled pork (I know, I know... a side of meat, but it's only 3 oz., and I really wanted to try it since pulled pork is one of my faves.  Good thing I ordered it because the burnt ends were not where it was at; burnt ends came out cold and chewy -- not fork tender and delicious.  Apparently the burnt ends were a weekly special (or something like that), and they were so popular they became a permanent staple on the menu.  They came with a fat tire bbq sauce that I didn't really care for.  The pulled pork, on the other hand was much, much better, and I also enjoyed the sharp vinegar-y flavors of the sauce.  I also tried the bacon-wrapped jalapenos (nice heat, and the bacon adds so much incredible flavor) which were the best things I ate at this spot.  The hush puppies were alright; they did come out hot, but not being from the south -- maybe I don't get hush puppies / don't know how they're supposed to taste; these particular ones were dense and chewy.  Not my favorite.   It feels kind of dirty in here... not the kind of dirty you'd notice immediately, but there are a lot of flies here and the place feels a little grimy... but this is a bar, after all.    All that being said, I want to circle back to how great the service was.  My server asked how the food was tasting, and when it comes to how tasty the food is, I don't mess around :), and I (gently) let her know that the burnt ends weren't up to par.  She offered to replace it with another type of meat, but I wasn't too eager to try anything else, so she actually just comped part of my meal, and I ended up paying for my iced tea and a couple of bucks for my pulled pork side.  After all of that, I'm just ambivalent about this place... if you do go, don't get the burnt ends, though.

ouBexUK4n-mFQt7OZswxvg.text: Talk about delicious food, this place has it! Midwood catered a work event I attended and man was the food good! They brought out the bbq, hot wings & the chipotle sauce, mac & cheese, bbq beans, grilled veggies & the banana pudding! Everyone was raving about it. A big shout out to Lisa! This girl knows how to promote a business. I tried everything, twice! Yes, it was that good. I heard that I needed to get over to their actual location to try a few other items. I look forward to that & will update my review!

dskUJxraN_Y73E_zu-ZTFw.text: The previous review took the words out of my mouth. I've been in Charlotte for a long time and love BBQ. There are a number of great BBQ restaurants here. What I love about Midtown Smokehouse was not only the food, It is incredible, but the service in the midst of packed place was PERFECT. I love it when I the appetizers vs. the entrees are timed perfectly. Meaning, when apps are requested they don't come out at the same time as the entree's. I know that may sound trite, but it really does show attention to detail. My complements to the Chef, Staff and Management.   For those who are visiting, you may wait for a table, but it's well worth it.   Mac's Speedway and Queen City BBQ, I love you very much. Ya'll are awesome. But you have some competition. :-)  Mean that with respect.

fT4ansSeZqb2u39BYTnz4g.text: It was my first time in Charlotte and I was starving - it was 3 PM and I hadn't ate anything the entire day due to an early flight at 6 AM. I was looking for food that represented the South - BBQ or Southern. I was choosing between a Southern restaurant and Midwood BBQ and I chose Midwood. And I am so glad I made that decision - you step inside and the delicious aroma of BBQ makes your mouth water. We were immediately seated and served and we started off the meal with some hushpuppies, and oh my- I don't know what hushpuppies are but they are delectable!!! For my entree I ordered the Chicken BBQ sandwich with a side of Mac and cheese. Let's just say my plate was licked clean - the meat was extremely tender and the BBQ sauce was perfect and the mac and cheese was creamy and not too heavy. We finished off the perfect meal with a perfect dessert - the pecan cobbler! It wasn't quite a religious experience, but it made me like pecans even though I usually don't! Let's just say we licked that plate clean too!   Overall the service was fast and the servers were very friendly and the food was unbelievable! I would recommend everybody and anybody to go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The BBQ chicken sandwich

hfqt2WMKN9SM4FqzuHF9ag.text: The Mac and cheese is amazing! Awesome service and everything is always fresh!!!!

IdWOsbfkmeXPhi-TeopaAg.text: The beef is great. Their Eastern NC sauce is good. The only gripe I had is that the people working here claim that their portions are big...they are not. So as a result it's slightly overpriced. The banana pudding is the best I've ever tasted, truly amazing.

p2HQftsp8zn-Cdz-FonRAw.text: I brought my parents here from out of town on my first visit.  Everyone seemed to enjoy it.  The menu was large and included a gluten-free menu (although the waiter couldn't locate it) for those who request it.  It was very busy on a Saturday night, so expect to wait for a table.  I did not have the BBQ meat but everyone said it was delicious.  I believe they had a decent drink menu/ liquor selection too!

FQHMboWHgeCbmBcMMQVoVA.text: I'm not big on BBQ but my boyfriend is and we both loved this place! Our server, Drew, was awesome.  He was incredibly helpful and friendly.   Agree with all of the other post that recommend the bacon wrapped jalapenos and also the brisket and ribs.  All of the meat we had was cooked perfectly and delicious. Highly suggest trying this place! Will definitely be back!

AnjXjfAEJISjGFhqklE2HA.text: The experience started out great with a queso with brisket. It was very good. The fried pickles were sliced very thin and they didn't have a lot of taste.  I would pass on them next time. I had the brisket sandwich. They added blue cheese and onions which over whelmed the brisket. I love brisket so it was disappointing to find that I had a blue cheese sandwich.  Overall I think they wanted to upscale the menu and lost sight of what makes a great brisket sandwich. Next time I'll try the sliced brisket to see how it tastes.

z_ErmFrHtGOHDvcAM4uVTg.text: Two words....burnt.ends. Cubed pieces of tender brisket vines eat like a luscious piece of braised short ribs. Perfect combination of texture from the crust, softer meat, fat and sauce.   Food: 8.75/10 Atmosphere: 8 Service 7.5  Overall 8/10

q9jgbcnsK7HcLAuQWPiWXg.text: One word comes to mind: miserable. As in "I am miserably full cause I couldn't stop eating!" First time eater and fully impressed. Tacos were excellent. Burnt ends were fairly insane. Bacon wrapped jalapeno gave me a new reason to live. And the pimento cheese fries were a delight. Service was attentive. Beer selection was ample. Not sure what else I can say. We are driving home complaining about how much our tummies hurt. Will be back.

Bs2viV9SESu1Vuhu_jRjOg.text: Atmosphere: B Food: A- Service: B+  Low key/casual, very good food, and good service pretty much captures the Midwood Smokehouse.    Both the setting and service were good, in fact, they complement each other well.  This is not an in-your-face place, which would be antithetical to what bbq is all about.  It takes time to smoke the meat, it should take time to savor and enjoy.  The hickory smokes wings were very good; no sauce and they didn't need them at all. The brisket was very good and the collard greens-likewise.  I appreciated that one of the staff had a pepper infused vinegar and promptly put that in front of me--definitely good flavor there without overpowering the greens.  I like pickled onions....a lot and seeing them on the menu and then on the plate was a pleasant contrast to the rich brisket.  Midwood offers well balanced plate between the meat, greens, onions and hush puppies.  I don't trust a bbq place that finds the need to smother everything in sauce, the True flavor is in the meat.  Yes, I know styles differ, but for me it is about the unadulterated flavor of the smoked meat.  Midwood does a very nice job.  I would come back and try more on the menu.  If the other offerings are as good as the first, I could see going to five stars; however, with only one visit under my belt four stars are the maximum.

VzRui-DRrNsd1uG9od3bAA.text: Great bbq, great local beers on tap, and great service. Went there on a Friday night and it was busy, but the wait was not bad at all. Just enough time to drink a beer outside on the patio. Cool atmosphere and a good neighborhood with plenty of places to grab some drinks after you eat. I'll be back again soon.

rugNPYVZgIpHTkqbAqoREg.text: Decided to add this place to our have tried list for BBQ  I personally think there flavor is a little to smokey for my liking ...the smokiest tasting anything I've ever tried ..I will say that they do have the BBQ nachos that are awesome ...cool divey  decor kinda biker bar ish cool place I thought ....

6dFcbfZAsUQeyHCTh0TaGA.text: Awful bar food.  I was hoping to get food made with love because this is a locally grown restaurant, but the food was on par with the last bowling alley bar I ate at.  I tried the fries topped with house made pimento cheese and brisket - the fries were frozen crinkle cut fries ala Orida grocery store style.  Brisket was dry and seemed to have been sitting under a heat lamp for a while.  This was one of those meals that I wish k had never eaten.

3KSXbJd-RsEV3Kw95Oo8gA.text: Hubby and I had a fantastic dinner at Midwood Smokehouse. Pulled pork, ribs, cole slaw, mac and cheese and hush puppies fulfilled our 'que cravings! Our waitress, Nickey, was a True pro and gave great recommendations on dishes. She took good care of us through the night, and we loved her sweet but a little sassy personality! :-)  The manager, Jen, stopped by to make sure we were doing OK and gave us some great recommendations on what to do while in the Charlotte area. We greatly appreciated her help. Classic smokehouse atmosphere with all the guests relaxed, talking, laughing, eating and having a great time. We will definitely be back!

G0hZk1sz5Y3UfUhGGfJw9w.text: I grew up near KC and am a brisket lover. This place was phenomenal to say the least. I actually made a noise of joy when I tried the baked beans!!  (No joke). The brisket and meal is easily the best BBQ in Charlotte. Great job team!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best brisket and baked beans I&#39;ve had in my 9 years in Charlotte!!  Nothing else is even remotely close!!!

Dvk9FDqy--d0f8P8qpvIPQ.text: WOW WOW WOW.  We travel a lot and we are huge fans of BBQ.  We frequently visit our local BBQ place in New York and I think we found one that takes the mark.  This place is a wonderful local place with excellent food and great service.  We went on a Sunday during church hours so we had no wait (go before 1pm for lunch).    I ordered the brisket plate which came with your choice of lean, fat, or both types of brisket.  Me being the meat lover, I went for both types.  The dish also included typical southern sides, and hush puppies.  The atmosphere was wonderful and the kitchen was pumping the smell into the dining room making you hungrier.  When the food came, I could not wait to sink my teeth into it.  The fat on the brisket melted in your mouth.  I used the back end of the knife and fell apart so beautifully.  Very attentive staff and wonderful food and prices definitely puts this place on the top of our list.  Only one caveat (they had no control over) was that parking was EXTREMLY limited.  They share a 30 car parking lot with 2 other businesses.  They also had street parking which was hard to find.

jGFDh71z72fGrdhSoM-wkg.text: This was just ok.  We really travel to authentic BBQ places and this fell short.  Burnt ends were not really burnt ends and the ribs although moist were just ok.  I had high hopes

aHJEyGQU4PrgUxyzBmydTw.text: Very good BBQ joint. I had the Carolina BBQ a chopped smoked pork with east Carolina BBQ sauce. I had never had the vinegar based BBQ sauce before but it was very good. The creamed corn was the best I have had. The bacon wrapped jalapenos were excellent, a tad warm but good. Finally the pecan cobbler. My expectation was great but the actual cobbler was mediocre. It was almost like a jelly inside and I wasn't a fan of it. Overall dinner was very good, service was good. Our waiter Tobias was very knowledgeable about everything on their menu, down to the alcohol content in the beers in tap.

rd3Is5YnbriCCxcmXKkeAA.text: Everything on the menu is delicious. Recommended to come here by the hotel guest service manager. Pulled Pork is to good for it's own good. Portions are good all around. Get the baked beans and the smoked wings. Come ready to eat here. Great service on top of the amazing food!

KVUYrCeI6iRnZfLxkhHJFQ.text: AMAZING BBQ! Glad my friend recommended this place. Got a few "pig outs" for our group and was not disappointed.  Better than a Chase Utley Home run in September. It's Cadillac time!

0gZ4qdkCL4F3kfk1plns8Q.text: Their homemade barbecue sauce is amazing and loved all of the sides.  You can order take out and it's just as good. I'm really glad I finally made it to Midwood and I'll definitely be coming back.

CwES3-TwhPL6mKeTZk4a_g.text: This is hands down my favorite spot for BBQ in Charlotte. So glad that there is now a second location in south Charlotte to choose from. We own a smoker and dabble, but when that is too much trouble, this is where we go!

9xgESR3ID98jR4I_82qFgQ.text: Just moved to Charlotte and had my second try at NC BBQ. Turns out Midwood smokehouse is in my backyard, which in turn happens to be extremely dangerous for a BBQ nut like myself. The food was incredible. The chili was smoky and not overpoweringly spicy. The wings (both the menu ones and a garlic buffalo special) were incredible. 2 very different flavors and textures, but 2 very successful, meaty sets of wings. Finally, the pulled pork was delicious. I'm from up north so the whole vinegar style sauce is new to me. This place made me a real fan of it!  On top of the food, the vibe and decor is fantastic. Everyone was extremely friendly and thanked us for stopping in. They made you feel like a part of the neighborhood and that we were doing them a favor...when in fact they did me and my stomach a huge favor! Can't wait to go back.

IQgcRzhjpVWzZ117PFlJUw.text: Enjoyed lunch with my family at this location. The service was great and the food very tasty.  Hubby and I ordered the well fed item to share which was enough for the two.  Kids had chicken tenders.  Impressed with the serving size of the kids portion.  Love best of all the hickory smoked sausage, baked beans which have been the best I ever had and the chopped Carolina pork.  We definitely will be visiting again soon.

XmWd7RfQKJbKrc-tVZUxdA.text: So I've been going to Midwood Smokehouse for a few months now. One night I decided to get some smoked wings to go. I get home and my wings are undercooked. Called the manager who have me a chemistry lesson on wings instead of saying "I'm sorry about that. Let's just get you some more wings." I literally live around the corner from this restaurant and would spend a pretty good amount there. Will never go back again.

byGwKop9fgonQAc1KGdWyg.text: Extremely good barbecue, particularly the pulled pork and the brisket. The smokiness of the meat was perfect - not overwhelming, but dominating the flavor at the same time. These people know what they are doing. Also highly recommended: the dry wings with sauce on the side. WOW. Some of the best wings I've ever had, served sizzling on a cast iron plate, amazing flavor and you can enjoy the meat separate from the sauce.   Also worth checking out: the bacon wrapped jalapenos (not at all spicy, my fiance through they were green peppers), the mac, and the collard greens

kpSWmbNdg6Ng3o9yCLE6Xw.text: First time having barbecue in North Carolina, and I loved it! I didn't have too much variety, but I do want to rave about what I ordered. I got the brisket plate, and boy was it delicious! My only regret is ordering a mix of lean and fatty, instead of just fatty brisket... the fatty stuff was far superior to the lean stuff! I loved that in every bite, I was getting all this delicious fat mixed in with the meat! The hushpuppies were pretty good, I'm always a fan of pickled onions, and the no frills coleslaw was really good!  If I'm ever back, I'll definitely try the other bbq, but at 10$ for my brisket plate, I'd always be OK ordering that

kS-NUW14Jg3MjgpCi80vFA.text: This is probably the best BBQ restaurant in Charlotte with great drinks!! Exceptional customer service.

-4pI9otaOfe4gKdQ-vslQA.text: I normally don't like BBQ/brisket but I had a small plate of their beef brisket (with a mix of fat and lean) and it was DELICIOUS!!  It was so good I had to pack the rest to go as I flew back to NY, haha.  So YAY to that!!!!  As for sides, I had the hushpuppies, pickled onions and mac n cheese.  I did like the pickled onions but the mac 'n cheese was quite dry and tasteless.  Ah well-our server was really awesome, though!

XTlR5HSeyo9BeqH9_Js23w.text: The portions were alright. I wouldn't say it's the best, everything has this tangy flavor that I didn't really appreciate. The large sizes are pretty pricey when you get just about the same size as the small. It's alright in general. Nothing major.

vfeaqvUNbg000Xb9t8a6Og.text: Some good old BBQ action.  This place has everything a BBQ place should, from the awesome menu options, to the decor, to the friendly staff.  I had the 4 meat plate with ribs, brisket, bbq chicken, pulled pork. Mac & Cheese for the side with collard greens. Yeah I was hungry, please don't judge me. All of the food was great and to my liking.    I also had me some sweet tea whiskey to wash it all down. A bit too sweet, but who cares, I was in the moment with the BBQ anyways.

pu-n1I7K0LkWUOowx0j5gw.text: The best barbecue in Charlotte (and I eat a lot of barbecue). I take all of my Charlotte visitors here. Get there early if you want the ribs - they sell out most nights! I personally prefer the classic pulled pork but you can't go wrong. Order your meat plain and ask for all the sauces on the side to try.

FdDoStlEIwtUwCxhwnXvaw.text: Always fabulous.   Best burnt ends. Best staff  always friendly and wonderful.        Can not recommend them enough

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

9Dfqk2yvOT3ZnY5NMF5Q4A.text: Best BBQ and sides in Charlotte. Hush puppies, Mac n cheese, bake beans. I had the pulled pork my girl had a delicious brisket sandwich

Eo7qIRwA0k_dVV9ejx_5vA.text: I definitely recommend visiting this restaurant. I came here on a friend's recommendation and I was not disappointed! The staff was friendly and helpful, and the food was great!  We started off with the Queso cheese appetizer and we added brisket to it. This was the first time I had meat with Queso and it was great! I ordered the large sized BBQ Pulled Chicken with BBQ coleslaw, and sweet potato fries, the meal comes with hush puppies and sweet onions on the side. The meal ready by the time we were through with our appetizers. I was definitely full by the time was done!  They have tv's throughout with ESPN on, so I'll definitely be back here for the games.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

u08S61Xsgf2U5LqWJnVEDA.text: My husband and I totally love this place and crave it constantly. I feel like it's a sin when ribs are dried out and Midwood has never committed this sin when I visited. Always tender ribs. And there are some Seriously fabulous combination platters.

lhz--l5xexxISE6UmhQMTw.text: Best  brisket east of Texas.   Have it wet with the habanero sauce and a side suasage sausage.  The burnt ends are hit or miss and the Cole slaw too finely chopped.

VfDfEHXbDYl4nfEJK81S_g.text: At a workshop around the corner and knew I had to have lunch here!  Got the brisket (mixed, both lean & fat), sweet potato fries, mac & cheese and finished with might the best banana pudding I have ever had!!  This is a cornerstone for BBQ in the Charlotte region!!

-fZCa05zSp2Jto5yFrmEYw.text: We checked out this place on a recent visit to Charlotte, based on Yelp reviews, and were very happy that we did.  I had the burnt ends with Mac & Cheese and greens, my daughter also had the burnt ends with Mac & Cheese and her boyfriend had the Carolina Pork (that he'd been craving, as he is from NC).  The food was excellent, the wait staff was very helpful.  If I'm back in Charlotte anytime soon, I will be back here checking out other menu options.

cTCjZG-XgqKMIUEXzgxHmA.text: Visiting, i had to come here....reading the reviews i was not let down.  i got the sampler.....GET THE SAMPLER  I was so full, i couldnt finish, but i wish i could go back just for this place...  i have had BBQ everywhere, this place is bomb diggity! Try it!

7j9VkRkmz1Sqj6Cz-nsoRw.text: Literally the best BBQ I have ever had. I had the burnt ends (delicious) and another person in my party had the brisket (also delicious). I recommend the fatty brisket, it was truly melt in your mouth. Service was also great! Need to go back and try the banana pudding.

137cilN1Hj-HYo3OX9757g.text: Food is not bad in The Smokehouse overpriced that's for sure the taste is good some days are not so hot on the taste that is sometimes the spare ribs is not good but sandwich that is cool brisket is delicious I have had a bad one but most of the time they're good not worth the price for a sandwich over $10 is a little expensive however they did have a sale for $8 and some change that was better I mean meet sampler platter they charging you against by the pound for sausage a piece of chicken and some brisket the price is ridiculously high do you think that you eating Prime cutting meat that came and poured it I would never spend $24.99 for a sample platter there's not nothing much enough for two but if you like to eat it's not enough for two one and a half person just saying that's just starting price $24.99 and up

fh28PKeaV06kIRC_ShHLVQ.text: Man oh man! Bit my fingers twice eating this loveliness! I went with a platter and was not disappointed. Everything was great, atmosphere, food, drinks and service.   I especially liked the non lean brisket and chicken wings. My daughter raved about the red neck tacos. I'd move from DC to Charlotte to sample this every week, 10 stars!!!

HWKqmFyDs1LynddX2020sA.text: Dude, this place is awesome!!!!! I got the beef brisket which is insane. But even better I was able to get a side of the Fat Tire BBQ SAUCE!!!  The sauce comes with one of their specials, but the bartender guy let me order it with my brisket on the side.   The bacon wrapped jalapenos are crazy good-I ordered the collared greens and was so satisfied.   They are super flexible with the menu and let you mix and match. Highly recommend!!!

r_zhfCtCu5gQZ3j4MjVZew.text: They have the best hush puppies. But the mains are faaaar too salty for me. And I'm not sensitive to salt or anything. Heck, I'm Filipino! I love salt! But the salt on the wings and the ribs were too much for me. Brisket is delicious though!

R1Yoa3t4NksKIRP75CX-1Q.text: This place used to be my favorite barbecue place in Charlotte. The one off of Central is better than the one in Ballantyne. The sausage is great. The burnt ends are delicious I was suggest burnt ends over the sausage. The crinkle fries are wonderful and the greens are delicious. The vibes on the central restaurant are great.

w4ClvXofp6SP16EVx5AEBg.text: We have eaten here many times before and the food is always excellent and the waitstaff is pretty much always on point. We will continue to come and recommend them others.

7XdqZvlaRPGWJImk1WuEOA.text: If you're wanting something close to Texas food (I said "close to it" because aint nothing like Texas! Lol), this is the place to go. My husband & I went & got the combo platter full-fed plate for both of us. It came with hush puppies, pickles onion, fries, cream corn, & 4 4-8 oz. of your protein ... we asked for 3 sides of lean brisket, & 1 of hickory smoked sausage.   Sausage has cheese inside so i personally didn't like it but my husband did.   The cream corn, the closest thing i can describe it to you is if you've ever been to Bill Millers Its Kinda the same as their sweet corn but it has a little twist to it because they put pieces of jalapenos here & the corn is also a little tooo soft. But still good.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

OG7ZqyYeWuHHyPBVNUFOPQ.text: Definitely some of my favorite BBQ in the Queen City.  As others have said, this is definitely a place that you would want to bring out of towners to.  Food I love:  *Brisket - combo of lean and fatty. Not too smokey, seasoned perfectly, tender and delicious. *Bacon wrapped jalapenos - these are the business and a must for me every time I eat here. The saltiness and smokiness from the bacon is a perfect combination with these jalapenos. Not fried and cooked to perfection. *Collards - seasoned very nice, tender and made in house.  *Smoked Wings - I read another review where it says they are pink in the middle but these are smoked wings and will be pinkish due to the cooking process. Do not let this deter you from their deliciousness. *Salmon - just as good as the brisket, ask for at least medium.  *Mac and cheese - won't make you slap your momma but don't sleep on it. It is quite cheesy and tasty.  I won't go anywhere else for brisket. Midwood has converted me.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. And because I can&#39;t stay away from the brisket here.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Some of our smoked wings. We kinda dove right in
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside of my favorite bacon wrapped jalapeño

a0_I_Y3TSL6Vi1UeBCohJw.text: Great food!! When busy parking is non-existent.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cornhole while waiting

kfzBJMGCp6Jo7O2xog9YEw.text: I brought a group of ten people here for dinner.  Due to a severe rain storm and flash flooding the majority of my group arrived later then 2 other people.  My ONLY issue is that they refused to seat them until we arrived.  These people were my guests and I wanted them to have a drink before we got there.  I didn't like that policy at all.    We ordered the Hogapeno Dip, a Queso Dip with Meat, a Queso Dip without meat, Fries with pimento cheese and the Bacon wrapped jalapenos to start with.  WE LOVED EVERYTHING.  My personal favorites were the Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos and the Hogapeno Dip.  OMG!!!  So good.  We ate every appetizer and everyone raved about how much they liked it.  I had the Carolina Pulled Pork with Creamed Corn and Cole Slaw.  PERFECTION.  Then I ordered a pig out platter for everyone to try all the meats.  The ribs were a huge hit and the brisket was amazing.  But those who ordered the burnt ends were in heaven with their choice.  They LOVED IT.  Since we had pigged out on the starters, we all ended up taking our items to go.  The Pecan Cobbler was so decadent and everyone loved it.  I had the strawberries and cream pie and it was delightful.  Our server was awesome and so polite (that southern charm is always appreciated).  He even took a group photo for me as well as one of himself.  LOL  A great night was had by all and I can't wait to come back EVERY SINGLE TIME I'm in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina pulled pork with creamed corn and coleslaw......YUM!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our waiter!  GREAT GUY!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Me and my chickadees having our first NC BBQ!

6oJ4jN2fgYqV6sc3gh7bkw.text: BBQ was ok, sides good, service fantastic!    Started with the queso app with pork.  Queso was good but pork was unnecessary.  The pork made the dish tougher to eat.  Then had the full Carolina pork with collard greens and mac and cheese. The portion of pork was substantial. It wasn't dried out but there was minimal amount of bark/smoke in it. The east Carolina vinegar sauce was really mild, not nearly as strong as others. Collard greens were best dish of the meal.  Mac and cheese was typical baked southern style.  Service was fantastic. Sat at the bar and was promptly served. Food came out as fast as possible.  Refilled drink regularly.  Overall not bad.

NJCyuv-mjG_5zc5xw0vdAw.text: Fantastic barbecue. This is a fun place to eat in and is also great for takeout to feed a crowd. Love the brisket.

vGBs2Rurd2994Qy6t0kebw.text: Whenever I come to the Carolinas this is the first stop after I get off the plane. The Burnt Ends are to die for. The friendly staff is always amazing especially Ty! Stop by this joint and grab a bite. You won't leave unhappy.

-IJr62t5YsM0dEywRTXeNQ.text: Midwood may be known for their BBQ but the smoked salmon is to die for!  I love the chopped salad topped with salmon.  Chipotle ranch to top it off!

uQ03FSOeADFRhZ_SR4IIPg.text: I visited Midwood with my teammates to select a bbq place to cater our company picnic.  We were able to sample a lot of things from the menu.  All was very very good.  The service was great in the restaurant and we were did not hesitate to agree that we wanted Midwood to cater for us. And 2 weeks later....we were at Freedom park and Midwood provided great food and service for our event.  The greatest thing that also prompted this 5 star rating is....the service we received from the person that delivered the food...and helped with setup and service.  Simply amazing.  Will get back to Midwood for another great lunch or dinner!!

Wm_MJCfsm9NtfKGy_aPg1g.text: Midwood Smokehouse is by far one of my favorite BBQ restaurants. The food is so delicious! My go to order is the Beef Brisket (lean) you can order it lean or fatty! The portion sizes are more than to satisfy you and have some to take home! The people are always nice and friendly

hhLR1g8RkYcvbLutGbFSpQ.text: I would like to thank the waiter at Midwood for not throwing me out of the restaurant when I was moaning because the food was so good.  Being from CA, we have many excellent food options, but we don't have BBQ like this.    The waiter was super helpful in guiding me through the options and recommending what to order.  I ended up ordering the burnt ends, brisket (lean), and sweet potato fries.  OMG.  The burnt ends were cooked to perfection, with a sweet BBQ glaze and simply melted in the mouth.  The brisket was out of this world, and when eaten with a few thinly sliced pieces of the white onion that is served with it, to die for.   I am very happy that I walked a mile and a half to the restaurant.  I ate so much that it hurt, and the walk helped justify to myself that it was the right thing to do.  I can't wait to return to Charlotte and eat here again.

a-ups4fDhuhCnZG1fZpJXA.text: Great food, great atmosphere, great service!  First time visiting and we definitely enjoyed the food. The burnt ends was awesome!

3OEZF65Q418bYrBuozWECw.text: Very flavorful BBQ with good service. The portions are large and beer flows! If wanting BBQ, probably one of the best in the city.

aU-e8vhlUbg7G5i0A4hVug.text: Great prices! I got a whole chicken dinner which was $10. The service was great and the food was good. Wish they had more of a variety of BBQ sauces but other than that, it was great! Great portions & tried a rib which was amazing!

We91Fz3l3zbhYuIW6b721g.text: There is an upstairs patio that you can order and go up there to eat if it gets too crowded downstairs   We had to order out but the ribs and the beef brisket were pretty good  Their spicy BBQ sauce was also pretty good
