Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

z-bQhKphn68swXAHO9gXSQ.text: Still the best bbq in charlotte! The original location in plaza is the only one I go to. I call it...loyalty. Jk, I'm sure all the other locations now are legit too. It's awesome they have opened more...BECAUSE it's sooooo good. Yes that good!   I've liked everything I've tried there. But these are my go to favs that you must try:  Carolina pulled pork - their Midwood sauce is the. Best.  Baked Mac & cheese - yes please! Sweet potato fries! - I only share if I really love you.  AND. jalapeno bacon wrapped poppers. Yes.   I've also tried their creamed corn, prob the best around here for that, if you like corn. Like how is everything there this good?   They have a good selection of whisky. Com'on it's a bbq place! Also full bar. And lots of local brews. They got it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Local beers.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sneak peek
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Good ice

52_ByB5xT-thw4rgzHuSEQ.text: We came here for dinner on a Thursday night before a show at Ovens Auditorium. We were promptly seated, and just as quickly greeted by our friendly server.  THis place is very cool. They have a great beer selection, and really every other kind of drink you could hope for. I had a delicious IPA, and hubby had sweet tea.   I ordered the brisket meal (small) - and got both fatty and lean. Now, I have had delicious fatty brisket before. Sadly, it wasn't here. The fatty was far too fatty and hadn't seemed to render down any. The lean however was really tasty. I got the mac & cheese side (yum) and loved the hush puppies.  My husband got a "large" plate of the burnt tips. They looked great, and tasted good (but not great). Here's why... more than half of them were dry, hard and chewy. There were a few tender pieces that saved the dish, so we'll say it was decent. The sauces were great, but the smoking just wasn't on par with our expectations today.  Overall, we give it a solid 3.5 stars - rounded up for great service and location. Definitely give the mac & cheese, beer list, and banana pudding a try! Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. For $1 you can upgrade any tap beer from 16 to 20 oz!

w-5rsKY7-pbq33B1yr9ocg.text: Best BBQ. Large brisket with bacon wrapped jalapenos.   It's our local spot and never let us down. Great beer selection as well.

nJ2NH31VVDx8IklXpRWCJQ.text: Very good BBQ! The beef rib special was cooked to perfection and fell right off the bone. The pulled pork was average, not great and not bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

fRjruufnR-ck248b4AjmVg.text: Omg when I say juicey I mean it was mouth watering and so on point, I ordered the ribeye which was medium and a side of broccoli, I should've asked if they had soup. The service was fast and they didn't leave you sitting around for hours. The restaurant was clean and spacious I didn't feel so close as to most places. I will eat here once again!

F40lVIAcsWgZTh2vnZp0xw.text: I've hear great things about Midwood and it took me a long time to finally to stop in. But I'm glad i finally did, because the food was great. The waiter we had was kind of unfriendly and in a rush, but other then that i was impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large brisket with bacon wrap japs and collard greens

JrtRaye1Xhqf-UKtAfjqUQ.text: Wow!!!so first time having southern bbq and it did not disappoint. Decided to come here after reading all the amazing reviews and ordered the smoked salmon dish and the bbq platter with brisket, tips, ribs and pulled pork. My friends ordered the beef ribs. All I can say was that everything was out of control good. The salmon was served on a bed of buttered corn and tomato and had great flavor. The bbq platter was amazing , with my favorite protein being the pulled pork. The collard greens and beans were my favorite sides. Now.. the beef ribs... you do not understand how good that was. This 10 hour smoked piece of beef  literally fell off the bone. Best thing I've eaten in a long time. If you aren't  intimidated by meat get this ! Have some texas toast with it as well. Also... protip: order the banana pudding as a side. It is this creamy beautiful dessert with vanilla cookies. Worth all the calories ! Also come right when they open to experience  no wait.  We showed up at 11 am on sunday and got seated immediately.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted chicken
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bbq platter

Mj_UdGV9Y0yU0U7RM9AYpg.text: Coming from NYC we wanted some authentic southern food. We was told to get food from midwood and so we did. I ordered it from door dash because we flew in at 10 and we was so tired so we ordered. The driver was so nice but the food was horrible . The Mac n cheese tasted like cardboard and the food just didn't exceed my expectations.

3qukr_rDFUpyOp_gdRkYhw.text: The food here was very good but the service I received during my time here was pretty terrible. Our waitress was very rude to us and made multiple smart comments. I didn't catch her name but she was a loud blonde. Yes I appreciate someone who is friendly and joking a bit but you are also suppose to have a level of professionalism. She also took forever to bring us drinks and refills. A wait is understandable but when I see you joking around at other tables and taking your sweet time, I get impatient.  The poor service here was unfortunate because this place is worthy of 5 stars. The drink selection was pretty good and included some local beers. I went with Wooden Robot's overachiever which was a nice fruity pale ale. For food we got the brisket queso dip which was yummy and I got the pulled pork with bacon wrapped jalepenos and hush puppiesbfor my entree. The pork was fresh and flavorful, just the way I like it. The sides were a nice compliment to the pork as well. My friends did complain that the ribs were dry and to me they did look pretty dry, which is a no go.  Again the food here was good but our server really hurt the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

HVx10G3yHtxW4z8B14mLoA.text: This place is legit! We were visiting from out of town and looking for a good bbq spot. We aren't fans of Eastern bbq and prefer a more Texas dry rub style and this looked like a good place when they offer dry ribs and choice of fatty or lean brisket, that's usually a good indication. My fiance said this is the BEST brisket he has ever had, and he has eaten it all over! I got the cheesesteak with shaved brisket and it's probably the best cheesesteak I've ever had as well. It takes a lot to impress us but our meals here definitely did. Lots of bbq places get the meat right but the sides aren't great and bland, this place does both very well. We had sides of Mac and cheese and baked beans which were excellent and flavorful. I feel like our brisket taste is now a little ruined because we will have to come back to Charlotte on our travels for our favorite again!

oAe5wkL6l2haelfyfGsgWA.text: Absolutely the best BBQ I have had in my life. We had ribs, sausage, brisket and pulled pork. They were all spot on tender, flavor was great. Recommend it everyday

GFqgp_zU_Lgd9JRaIMI7Vg.text: I like NC barbecue and Midwood is a good option. The portions are never large (despite the option "pig out") as they must weigh each portion. Our hostess this time really made the experience unpleasant with her distracted attitude and aloofness. We'll make the extra drive back up to Birkdale next time.

mKzYauqSUX9s7pf714K6JA.text: Great service and great food. Bacon wrapped jalapenos are to die for. Cheesesteak is fantastic as well are the pimento cheese fries. You can't go wrong with anything here.

YnUzfF_zVUJmNyjuP0WGcQ.text: The Midwood Chopped Salad is a win!! It's so delicious!! I had mine with the salmon and the salmon was cooked perfectly medium. When I'm not caring as much about my diet I love their cheese fries with the pulled pork on top, even then I get a side salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

vTlFCYBdVNB7PdxCq0CuUA.text: This. Place. Is. Awesome. Period. If you like smoked meats and plenty of spicy options then go here. If it's your first time...order the brisket. You're welcome! Honestly if the meat were raw and cold you could have put any of their sauces on it and it would have been great. Sauce!!

lvZahKF3Y5Dw0A9RaPWooA.text: Our server Donny was great!  I was in town for work and asked for his recommendation. He did not steer us wrong. Everything we tried was amazing!

hqNJQjiAFdePNsOxrwI7jw.text: YUM!! I was pleeeeasantly surprised with the taste of my food, and OVER THE TOP HAPPY that the lights were low. Being someone with very sensitive eyes, it's always difficult to choose a good seat in restaurants, these days. Seems everyone wants the super bright exposed bulbs, or the lighting fixture is directly above your head. THANKS MIDWOOD for giving not only a great dining experience, but being kind to my eyeballs. HA!   And Catherine did a fine job of waiting our table. Good service with a smile. Midwood is definitely a do-over for me.

uXVnSrlmXf7n5EvY_I8SUw.text: I was just in Charlotte this past weekend and I used Yelp to find a good bbq place. All I can say is Midwood is the best bbq I've ever had in my life! The ribs were perfect, the brisket was perfect, the Mac and cheese was perfect. I'm from NYC and we don't have anything comparable here, I was completely blown away! Keep up the good work guys!

TEyrC2DcRbVfMENSh2AcWg.text: Best NC BBQ in Charlotte good service and great menu including pork, beef, and grilled salmon.

tKYi_uHVp3GL2ewgsF59kQ.text: Went again today. Had the Roadhouse Burger with smoked veggies (mushrooms, zucchini, yellow squash, onions and peppers). Really good! I ate the whole thing and I'm petite. Of course, we had to get the smoked wings as well, which were delicious. For dessert, we had the peach pie. It was good but not what I expected of a peach pie. It was more of a deconstructed cobbler. Was good, will keep returning!

cnPvYFLqFOcxj1mTM0m6Ew.text: This was a place recommended to us by a friend who travels to the area frequently. We did not regret it one bit! Service was excellent- all the meat was really great- expertly smoked. Now my only "complaint" was the pimento cheese fries- I wish there was MORE brisket! I'm biased because I love it lol. I wasn't in love with the pimento cheese- I know it's a local delicacy but I guess I don't have the palate for it. I also got the pulled pork sandwich with hush puppies! All excellent ! So filling!

7mI5s26pNcOj7Kj3hpLzEg.text: Sat at bar at 6pm on a wet Monday and ate a wonderful, massive, caveman like  full slab. Barman was great. Does exactly what you want it to do.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great combo.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

EPmcxWNTPizKZHcMJ6Stmg.text: The brisket. Just get the damn brisket.  Actually, order anything. It is all delicious.

1r1JMT15piRscPXbRjYO8g.text: Probably one of the best barbecue we have had in Charlotte since moving here. The staff was so nice and was able to give recommendations. Any awesome environment. If you want to stay close to the city but want barbecue this is the place to go. I had the brisket (AMAZING) with the twiced baked potatoes and hush puppies! My family had the pork burnt ends and pulled chicken! Couldn't be happier with this choice and will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

Fcs6dz7F85gs8W9coNW8ow.text: Amazing meal! I had the tacos and Mac 'n cheese. Absolutely delicious and the bacon-wrapped jalapeno. . .yum. Nice wine selection, too. I sat outside on a beautiful night.

IEvi1viPkq8iSzKfVXuqvg.text: Midwood is one of our favorite BBQ places in Charlotte. Wether you are ordering some type of BBQ or one of their wonderful salads, you will not be disappointed. They have all types of meats and many different sauces to make what you choose a personal experience

ao96S6XwxDVrv4ZtbnlcpQ.text: Good quality meat and great service.  Our group had the brisket, salmon, st Louis style ribs, and burnt ends.  I was hoping for the burnt ends to be a bit more tender and juicy, but overall still a great meal. I loved the ribs and wish I got the full rack.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs! Bacon wrapped jalapeños were a great side. Only wish there was more
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon, brisket, burnt ends, ribs

NB2qPQGoDG2IDZjtGSYWtA.text: Overall Midwood gets 5 stars! Good BBQ and a great place. We left a lot fatter than when we walked in.   We were staying in Charlotte downtown and found this place on our way in. Our visit was on the 21st of July of 2017.   Food - I'd give 4 stars! The food was really great, but I've had better BBQ.   What we ordered: We ended up getting the combo with ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. Our sides were cream corn and beans.   The ribs were dang good, cooked perfectly with a nice amount of smoke. Lacked the flavor that I've had in other places...but real close to being amazing. Same with the brisket.   The pork, however, was outstanding. Some of the best flavor I've ever had on pulled pork, and it was perfectly juicy.   The cream corn was also outstanding! The beans were a bit of a runnier mix, also good. The beans worked really was a dipping sauce!  We also got some hush puppies, which were about average for hush puppies.   NO CORN BREAD!!! WHAT THE FRANK??? Why no cornbread? What does the chef have against cornbread? Why did they deprive me of this tasty side dish?  The ambience - I'd give 5 stars!  The place feels inviting and comfortable. Big tables for all the food you're going to order, comfy seating, good bar, TVs, nice outdoor seating, and clean bathrooms.   An added touch was the plates and dishes! They aren't boring and plain...feels like something you'd find at grandma's house.   The staff - I'd give 5 stars! The host was really friendly and paid close attention to us. Even let us move when a booth opened up.   The waiter was very helpful and patient with all of our questions. He genuinely wanted us to have a great experience.   We had no problems with our food arriving quickly and everything was perfect.   Conclusion This place has a great reputation for a reason and we couldn't have been more pleased. Unless the had corn bread!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our combo plate with ribs, Beef Brisket, pulled Carolina Chopped Pork, BBQ Baked Beans, and cream Creamed Corn!

EEnYsNoplKamcMhK-mdaAw.text: I love Midwood Smokehouse! Although I'm a native Carolinian and think eastern NC Barbecue is the best food on earth, Midwood's beef brisket is outstanding. I also love Thursdays when smoked turkey is on the menu. And don't over look their smoked bacon wrapped Jalapenos, salmon and wings. Those might be the very best things on the menu. I haven't had a bad thing to eat there and I love the atmosphere. If you've never tried Midwood, I encourage you to do so. And don't forget dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

btKIy7RY6zNKg0S1L_4VLQ.text: We went tonight with a group and everyone was really pleased. The server, Catherine bright out a sample of the pork and beef burnt ends for me to decide which one to order.  (I sometimes forget that beef brisket can be fatty so I get confused which I like). Honestly they both were tender and juicy.  But seriously, who does that?!?!  I chose pork but loved my husbands ribs just as much as my plate.  The point is: Meat was good. Get it here. Love my hood.

Js7NTbD7OPJmrO6cNZgPSQ.text: Presumably one of my most loved BBQ puts in the zone. The nourishment is delightful, the staff is well disposed and obliging, and the environment is heavenly. Couldn't prescribe more.

3ys1KTmoR-Uw5m5k8PJ99w.text: Meat. Mac n cheese. Hush puppies. I died and went to BBQ heaven. This place is tried and True for their tender, juicy meat and savory sides. They have a nice wine, beer and cocktail menu and so much yummy food.  Hubs and I went here on a date night. Expect a wait, because it's a popular place. But you can join the wait list on yelp prior to going ;) We waited about 25 minutes for a first available table, which wasn't too bad. We got a table inside, which is spacious and nice. Patio seating is more intimate. Hubs got their new featured drink called the French Canadian, a whiskey-based cocktail, and he really enjoyed it.   For food, we decided to split the 4 proteins, 2 sides meal and ordered ribs, pulled pork, pulled chicken, and brisket with sweet tater fires and mac n cheese. This shared option was the smaller of the two, but it was plenty of food for us! We both left so stuffed. The meals also come with delicious hush puppies and a spicy BBQ sauce and a vinegar sauce. Everything was really, really good and we will definitely be back.

BTc-pj8WrUquQhuAsFBJnQ.text: I came in December for an interview and back now in April. I knew I can to make another stop here and they didn't disappoint. Had the Carolina Pork this time and it was amazing. 4 stars because the hush puppies need to be bigger

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

r4XtXGszs9UT1gnmFfZwbw.text: Great food! I had the bacon wrapped jalapenos to start, pulled pork with Mac and cheese and their loaded potato soup and it was to die for. They have a rotating tap, and great whiskey selection too. Service was great! I'd definitely go back!

akUo0TLKFLPJ33_xmNgx7w.text: One of the best BBQ in Charlotte! Be sure to get the brisket and ribs and the bacon wrapped jalapenos.

AstuU2VnxnjGUxw0uMOQbQ.text: Probably my favorite BBQ spot in the NC, no disrespect to the hundreds of other BBQ joints in NC. I've been to a bunch of different other BBQ places here but if your looking for great BBQ friendly staff and if u watch food network of there BBQ joints they put on there channel this is the spot for you. I don't think this place has been on the Food Network channel but it should be. Go and give it a try.

11G4G_srDUpp1Ezz-GpfeA.text: This is the best BBQ in Charlotte.  Now, there's not a lot of great BBQ in Charlotte and I have no idea why, but this is the best.  I love their side options, like the stuffed jalapenos.  Their brisket is also pretty good.  I love their smoked chicken.  I recommend Midwood for BBQ in Charlotte.

8g5rWu6QCqq2b3T9JoGBdw.text: I really love midwood, they have great food. One thing I would recommend surprisingly enough is their salad topped with BBQ. It has tons of yummy toppings and its a really good price for the size and quality.

tBsA6wEozXj5XhSSMibpIQ.text: My sister and I were visiting from NJ and wanted to get some good barbeque while down south. We split the combo platter and it blew our taste buds (in a good way)! The brisket, ribs, and pulled pork were just melt-in-your flavorful, even without the sauces. Which, by the way, THE SAUCES: some sort of magical mustard, a sweetly vinegar-y NC style sauce, and the best classic BBQ sauce I've ever had. Add to that some delicious hushpuppies & great service (thanks Mindy!), and I'd say it was a meal I'll dream about!

tT9N3lCcGAEI1cjDjOcx7A.text: Gotta say, good stuff. Yes indeed the jalapeno bacon poppers are insanely good. My first bite I thought good then I started thinking about the tastes in my mouth and are most if the appetizer plate. Must have.   I tried the BBQ sandwich and it was delicious. Much smokier than typical eastern vinegar based. Loved it with cole slaw. (The creamy version not the BBQ slaw) yummy.  I has to sample my tables choices as will and the Mac and Cheese is worthy of every 8 year old, the baked beans had a great twist with some tomatoes and a tiny bit of pork and the sweetness was perfect. The curly fries were Fab too.  Add to that a great selection if on tap beer, friendly staff? Quick service and I will be back. Nice job Smokehouse.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs from heaven
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hush puppy hush
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy Mac n cheese

pA8zlf_gCqaC_bcHTbcxdg.text: YUM. So glad we stopped by while we were in town. I had the Texas style brisket sandwich with cheddar  and Mac and cheese and my PIC had the burnt ends with sweet potato fries. Both were delicious, great flavor, cooked perfectly, awesomeness. Great atmosphere too. Highly recommend.

foYoelnU2cdlIbiKq4J0JQ.text: This place was really nice bigger than I expected. They have an outside seating area a nice bar. The service was good and helpful appetizers really good. I would definitely come back its good bbq in a nice setting in uptown area can't go wrong.

FXhnfiI8Jh8KLzAFCYZ-OA.text: The best beef brisket I ever had! Service was awesome! It was my first time there. It certainly won't be my last!!! Awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The end result!!!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesomeness!! Thanks Laurie!

xlD2TShys5Upke5K1lU6fg.text: Very good BBQ our waiter Tyler was super nice!!  The best beef brisket I have had so far.  Very tender and the BBQ sauce on the table is so good.  I will be back soon!

WyVtDOUIDm-qVUCsqACSHg.text: BBQ for everyone...beginners and experts.  All types of BBQ--chicken, pig, cow, etc and plenty of sauces to complete the whole deal.  I'm not a BBQ expert but I truly feel this place accomplished the goal and it impressed my out of town guests so that is the most important thing!  Like others have stated, the atmosphere is "down home,"  the service is friendly, the prices are reasonable, etc.  Between the 7 of us we literally sampled the whole menu...pork bbq, chicken bbq, burnt ends, smoked turkey, ribs, etc.  We also tried the pimento cheese fries for an appetizer and they were nothing short of amazing!!!  The baked beans are a must for your side choice.  They are full of flavor and even have some bbq mixed in.  They are awesome.  Again, I'm not a huge BBQ person so is this the best place Charlotte has to offer?  No clue.  Does it showcase some pretty authentic Caroline BBQ?  I think so!  Good variety, good prices, good side orders, nice sized portions--yes, I'm a fan!

g8S4aSp2A4cbBxWILNciuQ.text: Charlotte's best BBQ joint serves up outstanding brisket, tasty pulled pork and one of the best beer selections in the city. The Mac & Cheese is second to none, and the fries crisp and delicious. The family-friendly atmosphere is wonderful, with spacious tables and booths, and service is always prompt and efficient.   There's a small patio for outdoor dining, ample parking in a private lot (or curbside), and a spacious bar for those dining alone. There's also a Ballantyne location for those prefer to stay in the friendly confines of South Charlotte, but for my money, nothing beats the original.

zq_-4PQi-cf44r4AeCqliQ.text: Ok. Not great. Ribs were not so meaty. Meal was warm not hot.  Great service. Wonderful service. Attentive manager.

LX5XaMKem0v73D2XE9R2mg.text: It was my guy's and I first time traveling through Charlotte, N.C. and Yelp helped us choose the barbecue joint we were going to patronize on our first night in town. I am really glad we chose Midwood Smokehouse.   We walked in and were seated immediately at one of the high-top tables. Our server greeted us right away and recommended a couple of North Carolina brews to try and both of us enjoyed the beer we received, which scores points for the place right off the bat.   After asking the server a few questions (which she politely and knowledgeably answered) we decided on the beef brisket and the smoked half-chicken. I thoroughly enjoyed the brisket which I felt had so much flavor that it did not need any additional sauce. The chicken was slightly dry but when paired with the sauces, both my partner and I thought was absolutely delicious. We did ask our server to bring a side of every sauce so we may try them. (I loved the spicy habanero.)  For side items I ordered for myself the bite-sized bacon-wrapped jalapenos which were rich and spicy all at once. We also shared the mac 'n' cheese and the BBQ baked beans. My bf fell in love with the mac 'n' cheese while I swooned over the beans which contained pieces of pulled-pork, adding a lot of flavor to that particular side dish.   All-in-all, Midwood's was the best BBQ place we had traveling through both North Carolina and Tennessee. I would definitely revisit if I'm ever back in the area. I'm still thinking about it a week later.   I recommend walking upstairs and enjoying a sweet view of the city after dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef brisket, smoked half-chicken, bacon-wrapped dates, mac &#39;n&#39; cheese, BBQ baked beans = happy stomach.

CnM-3ukmMLa26n1z6Qzeiw.text: Just an update to my previous review:  I'm not certain if they changed the brisket sandwich for good...but it's now on a toasted bread with much less blue cheese.  Very good!  I also feel the need to mention the Cuban.  I imagine that many people overlook something like a Cuban sandwich while at a barbecue joint.  I too, tend to be one of those people...until now.  I am truly thankful, that I can so easily step outside of my box. But...now I feel like I'm going to be stuck for a while.  The Cuban sandwich is SO good.  I mean...really, really good!  P.S.  Did I mention how good the Cuban is?  Try:  Really??  Avoid:  Not trying some sweet potato fries for your side...very nice

hVoE-QrJMyZkaQ5sKo0P9Q.text: My family checked out this place this past weekend and for the most part enjoyed our meal.  Our waiter was friendly, and quickly took our orders.  Just a few notes:  The BBQ Queso was so-so - there was nothing special about a bowl of tortilla chips and a bowl of melted cheese with a clump of BBQ in the middle of it.  I guess I wasn't sure what the expect, but it still seemed very basic.  As for the main meals, my son got a burger and wanted American cheese, but the waiter said they did not have any.  As in, ever.  And yet the menu clearly stated American cheese was used.  Despite this, my son just got a plain hamburger and ate the whole thing, so he had no complaints.  My daughter got Carolina BBQ with a side of baked beans.  She liked the BBQ but not the beans - she didn't really say why.  My husband got burnt ends and loved them, but said the mac & cheese was pretty pedestrian.  I got a sauced half-rack of Memphis ribs with sweet potato fries.  The fries were good, but the ribs were VERY salty.  It was almost as if they brined the ribs before they put them on the fire. They were that salty.  I ended up drinking 3-4 huge cups of water (their cups are about 26-28 fl oz) to compensate.  Would we go here again?  Probably not.  The prices were reasonable, and the space was decent (GREAT music playing over the speakers), but the food wasn't very "wow" for us.

HrKykiC1RC7sMUEg1JbymQ.text: Great BBQ not far from downtown Charlotte. Restored my faith in Charlotte area BBQ.   Ribs: perfect amount of bite through and not dry at all. Rub was well balanced and no sauce needed.  Brisket: very moist with good flavor. Carolina chopped pork: excellent, moist, and just enough bark for a slight crunch. No extra sauce needed. Sausage: Very good. Seemed to be made in house or at least fresh from local supplier.   Sides: Mac n cheese was good but not stand out. The bbq baked beans were good with the right amount of sweetness and kick.   Overall, this is a great spot for bbq and the prices are reasonable.

J-YyOqAWMk-iq6OzZUptmg.text: There is no questions about, THIS IS THE BEST BBQ IN CHARLOTTE!  We came over here for a family lunch and we have ordered the 4 meats plate with sides. Everything was absolutely fantastic! The ribs are probably the best ones I have ever had. I have ordered the hush puppies but they never came, so, I can't rate those.  Anyway, if this place wasn't too far from my home (I live at Lake Norman) I would come here a lot more often.

uqhG1R4cpj9LnmG-4oNCdw.text: This was my first stop in Charlotte .. The food was extremely tasty, but even better than that, the service was first rate. Our waitress (whose name I wish I remembered) was extremely prompt & courteous with a great sense of humour. Our drinks never got below half empty because she was always just close enough nearby to provide excellent service, without hovering. I highly recommend the "burnt ends" which are not burnt at all, but perfectly cooked to be nice and crispy on the outside whole being tender & juicy on the inside. This will definitely become part of my regular rotation of great barbecue joints in Charlotte. The hush puppies were also fantastic; very well done with just the right amount of crunchy while bursting with flavour. They offer many different regional styles of barbecue, so you're almost guaranteed to find something you'll love. Excellent portion sizes, also. I tried my darnedest, but could not clean my plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best bbq

P4UqOGDvuhUIq6FIYWGoAQ.text: Hubby and I had gotten a recommendation to check this place out, and so picked up some food to go while visiting Charlotte. We tried the pulled pork, burnt ends, and pork ribs (best dry rub I've ever tasted). For sides we loved the mac and cheese best. The hush puppies were phenomenal and knocked this review up to the 5th star. So tasty and with the perfect size and texture. Crispy on the outside and dense on the inside. Great meal.

AQjwqW23KNVTvw7kIK5fcg.text: On the never ending search for good BBQ, I stopped in at Midwood last night.  Me and my entourage of 7 were greeted promptly by a friendly server who was in the beginning stages of laryngitis, poor guy.    A few members of my party were from out of town and we wanted to try a bit of everything.  We got the pulled pork and smoked turkey plates with a sample of all of their sauces.  The pulled pork was good, and their sauces were decent.  My party preferred the Fat Tire BBQ Sauce which was a bit too peppery and thick IMO but it did in a pinch.  Smoked turkey was a bit lacking and was a little dry.    The service was great and accommodating.  We were there on a mission and they accommodated all of our special requests without a roll of the eyes.  I passed by the "smokehouse" on my way in from the parking lot, but didn't taste the smoke int he food which was disappointing.  Their mayo slaw was overly chopped but had good flavor.  BBQ Slaw is never my thing but there's was ok.  Midwood has decent cue, don't get me wrong and if I Was on that side of town again and in the mood for BBQ I'd go again.

ESdY44yV4-IygoXzUi10zA.text: I come to midwood fairly often, and have spoken highly of them to others. Their food had always been great to me, but the last couple times I've been less than impressed.   The food was still okay - I love their sauces, but the jalapeno poppers were over cooked and mushy, the meat portions seem to have gotten smaller, and the service has become spotty.   My last visit was the worst service I've had here. Our food came out, and our server dropped our check off before I'd even taken a bite of my sandwich. He seemed to want us to leave, and I immediately felt in a rush to do so. He refilled my cup but neglected to refill my partners. And we definitely weren't hanging around to try to get anything else from Paul and inconvenience him. So instead of ordering desert (our check was already on the table remember), and getting another drink... we ate our food in less than 20 minutes and left. We went somewhere else for desert and received better service.   I hope that Midwood returns to how it used to be, for now they've lost a fan.

BxfB2EVbv4YqkitWSucb0A.text: I picked up a large catering order yesterday before noon. The service was over the top and the food the same. I highly recommend Midwood Smokehouse.

UMCRX-WhiO1AbV0PMZWMzQ.text: Was looking for a place that served brisket in the area that had good reviews.  This place was a HOMERUN!!!!  Doc, the bartender was very kind, along with the rest of the staff working.  And the Brisket was right on point!!!  They even give you a choice of lean or fatty style! (you can go half and half too!).  Looking forward to going back with friends.  Well done Midwood!  Well done!

sjmeXi7WLR4FyIAkKbn9Mg.text: Out of all the places I've eaten in Charlotte, I've been here the most. So I think it's time I give Midwood Smokehouse its very well-deserved five stars. I'd give it six stars, but Yelp won't let me, so we'll just have to settle for a "Fuck yeah this place is awesome!"  In two words, burnt ends.   In many more words, the prices are very reasonable, the service is always fast and polite, there are awesome drink specials, and the vibe is casual, friendly and more than a little bit southern hipster.  As for the food, there is nothing here not to like. The only thing I'm a bit "meh" on is the smoked vegetables, but they're still pretty tasty. The chicken is so good, you can eat it "dry" (it's plenty moist) or with your choice of outstanding barbecue sauces. The brisket is incredibly delectable - as a friend of mine says, "Best brisket outside of Texas" - the fatty brisket especially deserves a freakin' medal. The sausage is a well-thought-out mix of savory and sweet, with a nice pop in the skin when you bite into it. But, the creme de la creme is the burnt ends. So sweet, so chewy, and with a caramelized flavor that is not of this earth.  Every meal comes with your choice of side(s). The bacon-wrapped jalapenos are sinfully masterful. The mac and cheese is delightfully cheesy. The collards are down-home. Everybody also gets some hush puppies and pickled onions - both are amazeballs (literally, in the case of the puppies).  Great local beer selection and some very tasty looking desserts, although I'm always too full to try them.

g-pM8FMKBgqeonUvL7NELA.text: This is a must try for the Barbecue lovers in Charlotte.. I lived in Charlotte for only a few months and I came here at the recommendation of a friend. Definitely am glad that I came here.  I remember coming here very late, must have been 10:00PM  - surprised that it was a full house. I got a pulled pork sandwich with macaroni and cheese and it was divine.  If you are a True barbecue lover or just in the mood for something new, you must come here! You certainly won't regret it. Enjoy!

-AGB4AnhUb02tYU02ohlzg.text: For a smokehouse, these prices are pretty good for what you get! We went around lunch time and our waiter was Tobias. He was super friendly and very knowledgeable on the menu. We had the pimento cheese fries as an app. If you love pimento cheese, this could be a dangerous new restaurant for you because they are soooo good. I ordered the brisket and my friend ordered the SC chciken plate. We both got large orders so we could try two of the sides. Neither of us could finish the portions we ordered so we had leftovers. The brisket was wonderful! Super tender and flavorful. The chicken was really good too! Both dishes came with pickled onion and hush puppies. (The hush puppies were really good) The jalapeno wrapped in bacon comes as a side and was the perfect amount of spicy. The coleslaw was a little underdressed and overchopped for our liking. The mac and cheese was pretty fair too. We will definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. PIMENTO CHEESE FRIES O. M. G.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket with hush puppies, mac, and bacon wrapped jalapeños.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. SC mustard base chicken with coleslaw and mac.

nCaqHSVzLAV7QX2RLUGovw.text: Beautiful day to grab lunch and finally get to sit on the patio. Monday's are $3 NC drafts! Already off to a great start. We received outstanding service from our server Lorilee friendly, knowledgeable, and overall had a great vibe with us and other tables. I had the roadhouse burger which was outstanding the fries are enough to share with at least three people. My girlfriend enjoyed the bbq pork sandwich which didn't take long to finish. My first visit and it definitely won't be my last!

7XLV--NapK_7pXZO45jigQ.text: This place met my southern expectations! I had the bbq pork sandwich with slaw and bacon wrapped jalapenos, my girlfriend had the roadhouse burger and fries! Plenty of fries to share for the both of us. Lorilee was our outstanding server, she was very attentive! Will definitely come back!

8qyEnRY3AaffQxky6FZJ2A.text: I was going to go with 4 stars for this place, because the food is really good, but the wait staff is also spectacular, so that pushed it over the top.  I first tried this place on a whim, and took my whole family for my Dad's birthday. That's seven adults who went, plus a baby and a four year old that can't sit still. Our waitress was patient and prompt, and light-hearted about the whole thing (sometimes the people I love can be difficult customers :) )  I got the whole mix of tacos, and every one was mouthwatering. The coleslaw and hush puppies were divine.   This is my go-to place for BBQ in Charlotte!

ERufsP6XsvaZN4MhacXNHA.text: I was never a huge fan of barbecue before coming here. Now I am. The sweet potato fries were forgettable but the small bbq plate I had was a generous portion, reasonable price, and the most tender, flavorful barbecue I have ever had. I Will most definitely be coming back here. Parking was an issue at lunch so maybe try to come at a less busy time,

pGYnOJXbwrpxXNdk8XITyw.text: I'm an official regular, someone help me I'm addicted to Midwood Smokehouse.   I'm a HUGE Fan of the brisket . I love the option of  a lean plate, fatty, or both. (Both is great!)  Give me some bacon wrapped jalapenos as a side and I'm good to go! Or try the greens that will make you wanna slap yo momma.  Look for your drink and food specials when you walk in, written on the large glass mirror behind the bar. They have mug nights here where you can bring in a 40oz and get it filled for $4-6!  Great service as always, fast, friendly and knowledgeable. I look forward to coming back very very very soon!

R8tqRdvuQk2Y2bx3AN8Riw.text: BBQ HEAVEN!!!! with a side of Mac and their amazing hush puppies and my belly is so happy.

-dQQfrFqQWa8wRciPbsSAw.text: This is a great low key place to go and enjoy awesome BBQ. All of the food is great. The staff is friendly, and the food always comes out fast!

O3tMXIM751tmDU75jnwXYA.text: Best brisket in town!!! My boyfriend and I go here every Sunday for brisket! They ALWAYS have great food, great service, and great drinks!

w2nNDwXt2mUx00nc0DbQjg.text: This is my favorite BBQ spot in Charlotte.   Being from SC I was happy that they offered a South Carolina mustard for their dishes as well.

egKvSqEASZFwNpXoCcFibw.text: IMHO this is the best barbecue in Charlotte. Love the smoked turkey plate with smoked bacon wrapped jalapenos and creamed corn. Try the brisket they can do lean, fatty, or both, doesn't matter it's all awesome. Try the well fed combo if you're unsure what to get, its big enough to feed 3-4! The beer selection is great here!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked sausage and bacon wrapped jalapeños.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. St. Louis style dry rubbed baby back ribs.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped jalapeños. Best ever!

0PLPzA3MD1n30LTlSol0WQ.text: Really good place second time I eat BBQ in Charlotte and. By far the best I had in long time everything was really tasty and full of flavor ribs chicken. Pulled pork. And the sides. Super good. We really enjoy it. Here nice hostess and. Our waiter it was amazing explaining about he sauces. Really good. Food. And atmosphere  really good guys. You are the best BBQ place in town

RVMX4J17xFNbk57Vs59j0Q.text: This place is quite good and worth traveling outside of uptwon Charlotte to locate (much better than the BBQ I tried in uptown).  They have a good menu selection of pulled pork, chicken and beef brisket, and a healthy choice of sides to choose from.  The problem I had was what to try, but my salvation was the taco plate.  Yeah, that seems like a strange offering in a BBQ place, but you could mix and match 2 or 3 tacos to try all meats (pork, chicken and brisket), and it comes with a choice of side too.  HINT:  The creamed corn, and bacon wrapped jalapenos are delicious.  The coleslaw comes on some of the tacos, so you got to try that too, and it was good.  We got fried pickles as an appetizer and a couple of local Carolina craft brews on draft made for an enjoyable meal.  Too full to try the cobbler for dessert, maybe next time.

EJ-3NqpIWOHsB4BH1gYFeg.text: This is going to be a fairly short review because simply put: my favorite BBQ in the city.   I regular here a few times a month and it's easily one of the most consistently delicious restaurants I've ever been to. The BBQ burnt tips are one of the best BBQ dishes I think I've ever had (including the infamous Rendezvous in Memphis!) and their sandwiches are always tender and hot.   Once and a while they'll have a Garlic Wing special. If you go and they have them you hit the lottery; they're incredible. The wait staff is always on point, fast but not quick to rush you out. It's always incredibly clean and the drink specials are usually pretty decent. I don't have a single negative thing to say about this place and I've eaten here literally dozens of times.

vEGPDwuZWobsx3A-atpZSg.text: We come to this place often and we enjoy there Bbq. My wife and I always order the hush puppies and they are great. I had the chopped pork which is good and the BBQ beans are great. My wife order the chopped salad with BBQ chicken on it. She enjoys that salad but says it was just ok this time. The large salad is very big so be ready to eat a lot if you order it.

M_KyYNlZa4NhXEV-gn-0qw.text: The brisket is the best we ever had.  Just the brisket itself would be 5 stars.  Parking: the parking lot is very small.  When we leave the parking lot, you have to drive to the back of the parking lot and exit onto the side street.  The side street has cars park on both sides and is only wide enough for one car to pass through.  When we were leaving, we nearly got hit by a car that was making a left turn onto the street.  Just be careful.  Service: great service. The hostess greeted us warmly.  Our waiter was very friendly and keep our drinks filled up.  Food: Other than the brisket, I only liked the sweet potato fries.  These were the other things we ordered: - Pimento cheese fries: Crinkle fries tasted like the frozen kind.  It was very cheesy.  My kids absolutely loved it.   - Smoked wings: too much smoke flavor for me - BBQ Pork Sandwich: It was pretty good.   - Combo platter (pig out): Three of us shared this platter and we still had left over.  We picked 2 portions of combined (fat + lean) brisket, sausage and ribs.  And the side items were mac n' cheese and sweet potato fries.  Everyone loved the brisket.  The sweet potato fries were one of the best ones I had.  I didn't like the hush puppies or the mac n' cheese at all.      Two days later, we stopped by and bought a pound of briskets (from the bulk order) to go.  The bulk order would need 24 hour advance notice.  We were lucky that they had enough for us to buy it that day.  By the time we got to our hotel, the brisket was cold.  It was still very good.  If we are in the area again, we will definitely stop by to get some brisket.

AiDIqBsWTrBbNj_rDB1G4w.text: My fav!! My big sister and I go just for apps!! Awsome.. love love love this place.. great service and amazing food!

jpwX_C6gS8yYZpJ0CiNbgQ.text: It's one of our go-to's.  Can be a madhouse on the weekends, with a wait, but the food is almost always a hit.  The servers are knowledgable about the food and drinks.  Nice open comfortable atmosphere.

PgIgCaSZ1x-PN4c65HChvA.text: BBQ doesn't get any better than this! I hit the jackpot when I found Midwood on Yelp during a work trip in Charlotte. I wanted some serious NC bbq eating and I got it here. I ordered the brisket platter and my colleague got the burnt ends. We ordered mac n cheese, collard greens, and hushpuppies. We went all out and ordered the chicken wings with midwood sauce. It was heavenly. These wings were cooked and smoked then covered with yummy sauce. I'm not sure why wings are always made this way. The main courses were perfect. So tender and the sauce was perfectly executed. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is really nice. Our waitress knew the menu front and back and was a real help.  I really need to go back to Charlotte just to eat at Midwood.

CiEUuNbaNScIxCN4ej0MYw.text: got the burnt tips which were awesome and the bacon wrapped jalapenos and lets be honest, anything wrapped in bacon is delicious.

g4kq6w_miqnweyNxaglmSw.text: Oh..... my.......dear..... lord.... This was..... amazing. This.... THIS is why I search out  good  Q it's just.... sublime. Ok let's see, I had the small platter... SMALL mind you and I couldn't finish it. It came with 4 meats. I got the pulled pork (really dang good, pour just a little of their vinegar based sauce on it to put it over the top) Brisket (they ask you how fatty you want it it was .... oh my god ... it was awesome) Sausage (it's sausage how could it be bad?) Ribs (OMG ribs they come with a dry rub DON'T YOU DARE POUR SAUCE ON THOSE RIBS ok you can put sauce of the ribs but try them without sauce the rub is really good) Sides I got the mac and cheese (if you're sensitive to salt you might think it's too salty I thought it was good) and the beans (they  were good with an interesting pork and peppery flavor). I've drug my poor mom to three BBQ places in as many days so she got a salad and was VERY happy with it (lots of different kinds of lettuce no iceberg, roasted corn etc etc). I tasted the shredded chicken on top and it was tasty and not at all dry.  We had some hushpuppies before the meal they were very good served with their signature tomato based sauce (which is GOOD I took a pint home with me). They have a great beer selections and they even have a few vegetarian options (something called a black bean burger?? and mom says they had three different salads. I dunnow I'm a carnivore) We asked because my sister is a vegetarian  and the waitress was right on top of what they had that was vegetarian so if you have a friend who prefers killing plants to animals and you can drag them in the door they won't starve. Service was fast and very friendly they totally kept on top of keeping me in drink. I'm going to try REAL hard to make it back before I leave town. So much more to try there. And guys.. (by that I mean men) use their bathroom.... just trust me on this.   If you're a local and you haven't been here  WHY ON EARTH HAVEN'T YOU BEEN HERE?   If you'e not a local and you're just passing through seriously give them a try.

AHqoY0fR_PD5dK2E7qPMMw.text: Upon arriving I was a little skeptical because I've lived in Charlotte for 30 years and have never eaten there, or even heard of the place until recently. My daughter had an appt nearby, and asked if I could meet her for dinner there, along with her sister. It was a lot bigger inside than I first thought. The hostess was very friendly and smiled when she greeted me. That instantly made me feel welcome. It smelled so good, and the atmosphere was more like a diner. They do serve beer here and our waitress was very friendly and did a great job keeping our drinks filled and getting fresh beers when we were ready. Their pricing was very reasonable, and my chicken bacon sandwich and sweet potato fries were perfect! Generous helping too, and I couldn't even finish it all! My only recommendation is that I think they could do a little more to update the decor a little, however I will definitely visit again and next time bring my hubby!

6ieaq3ralYyH5n8cXXk6Yg.text: Quality meat and good BBG.  The food and service are good but I still have not found that one BBG place that just makes you want to eat some great pork BBG and a few cold beers every day; and possibly for every meal. Don't knock a cold beer in the morning until you have been there.

9_9WmJHnUbrD7luHeqR7vg.text: Hey don't let the 3 stars get you wrong. This place was great. The service was attentive and helpful. The ambiance is amusing and the soundtrack was classic. I had the combo plater with brisket, smoked turkey, sausage and pulled pork with coleslaw and bacon wrapped poppers. Yes, I will be checking into the nearest hospital for the impending heart attack.  The sauces are served on the side in small dipping cups. I prefer squirt bottles to having to ask for more BBQ sauce (I like lots of BBQ). The turkey was great as well as the pork and sausage. Here is the 'but', the brisket was served with the grizzle still attached. Ok maybe that's just how they serve it here. The problem with this is the fat out weighed the beef. It broke away nicely but I barely was able to enjoy the tender meat before it was gone. Concluding, I had a good meal with only one gripe. Enjoy yourself here.

1tlhWfrl8zDD6ab4cLEVSw.text: Great food, great service.. got there late so they were out of some items but everything they did have was exceptional

gJNILq9EHFHMIKb6Ghw37Q.text: This place is good. The longer you live in NC the more of a bbq snob you become. Once you have convinced yourself that "'y'all" is an acceptable thing to say you have entered full on bbq snobbery. This place is good for the city life, its a comfortable setting, it was pretty good food but compared with all the other amazing bbq in NC, its just a pit stop between other bbq destinations outside of the city.

OHO2_ptNotzOBTtugWyqSw.text: Great brisket, excellent service!!! Went as family celebration.  Food was the best!  Service was excellent wish we had a restaurant near home.  Loved it!

OpBrPKRh0Hq1HkbfErhWqQ.text: My significant other and I have been here three times so far and this past time was the best. The ribs and the hushpuppies are delicious! Also having grown up in the south, I must say their sweet tea is one of the best I've  ever tasted. Service is always great and quick.

wRfQFsbEH_FM60W8O08LMw.text: Dining at Midwood is always a pleasure. I had the Brisket Rueben and it was killer. Pair it with some bacon wrapped jalapenos and you can't go wrong. Definitely will keep coming back!

La_c2MMYWpqyU3rqd2OV6g.text: I had the combination platter so I can say it with confidence: everything is good! The brisket is insanely juicy and the sausage has just the right spice. Everything has a strong, distinctive hickory flavor, just the way it's supposed to be. On top of that, they have a nice selection of local beer and Chad the barman knows his stuff. Will come back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combination platter

oIq9KX8opW-cEu9lIMiQ1w.text: Midwood Smokehouse is a welcome addition to the Charlotte BBQ scene. Located in the ever burgeoning Plaza-Midwood neighborhood, Midwood delivers on the 'Q while at the same time adding modern flair with dishes like smoked vegetable bruschetta, smoked turkey and sausage and a Cuban sandwich. The pork BBQ was smoky and delicious and I love that they have 4 sauce options to choose from. The mac & cheese was a standout side and the hush puppies were tasty too. I look forward to going back to try the ribs, the pimento cheese fries and the desserts.

4HPxgYCwAyIrI_1qNCfqcQ.text: Drove by and decided to have dinner there.  Ordered the regular size sampler and it was enough of meal for me and two ladies.  Excellent food!

5KQ_5Fq_lDbOmim5yGlT-Q.text: The bacon wrapped jalapeno, lean version of the brisket, and the St. Louis ribs were as good as all the reviews.  The staff was very courteous, so we felt appreciated.   Would certainly recommend this place to anyone.

hlOdsPPdGPxKOtpi68GjYA.text: The best brisket in Charlotte. Mac & cheese is good as well. The pulled pork is a tad over seasoned but still tasty.   The beer and bourbon selection is very good.

igSkFyahKEgOuiMs4TCxuA.text: This Kansas city native and recent Austin Texas transplant has high hopes when it comes to BBQ.....and man, Midwood delivered! Best brisket I've ever had. Great beer selection. Good collard greens. My fiance got the ribs and said they were great.  I got the grilled cheese sandwich and added pulled pork on it and was loving every bite. Can't wait to go back!

SRAHfAjwiMchrQUFhvWEpQ.text: I had the fried pickles, which were interesting.  The taco-trio with beef brisket, pulled pork, chicken and a bacon wrapped jalapeno.  Good, but not 4-star worthy.

VHWs_GToIOdeLnPXEX5blA.text: A ton of food for a super reasonable price! I had the BBQ pork with bacon wrapped jalapenos and sweet potato fries. It also came with coleslaw and hush puppies. The large plate filled my belly and left me enough meat to take home for another meal. I liked that they offered a couple different BBQ sauces in squeezable bottles so you could have as little or, (in my case) as much sauce as you wanted.  While I didn't have a drink that night, the beer/cocktail/liquor list looked extensive.  They work with the 'No Wait' app and it's busy every night of the week, so I'd take advantage of it!

dKSI2PNXqdiIkw0i4NC1pQ.text: Quick and friendly service, good prices, and truly amazing food! I had the Salmon Sammy with sweet potato fries... it was by FAR the best sandwich I've had, and I didn't realize that sweet potato fries could be so fresh! We really spoiled ourselves eating here!

WGFOgFDmbPB6YS3ngbYjpQ.text: Blowing my mind with the fatty brisket. The waitress was sweet and spacey so not great - but the food made up for it 10 fold. The waitress could slap me in the face with a ham and the food would make up for it. Please please please come here if you're considering. MIND. BLOWING.

aHb5QZhtZkWPlmvsTrvI_g.text: Awesome. I've been spoiled by the brisket in Austin, but this is fabulous!   The cream corn was super, and the hushpuppies were perfectly done. Great location and decor, and Mindy explained everything and made recommendations which were impeccable!  Thanks Mindy!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket and burnt pork tips

RWh4eC9xH04BYsOcW8OOiQ.text: Just had the worst experience ever with take out and management at Midwood. We placed an order and they gave us someone else's order. We had to drive back and they accused us of taking the wrong order.   Our food was then cold when they handed to us and they said nothing. I asked them if they were going to discount the order. He (Walter) said he would only give us banana pudding.   When he came back with the pudding I asked again would he discount the food. He then asked 'what, do you want free food'. He came back with a gift certificate. Like I would ever go back.

Zk30niuE1zfiQ9-i4SJcOQ.text: The midwood chopped salad is the best salad and best deal in town!

zj67Qnp6bll-r4c7qzwGzw.text: This is just another example of the poor BBQ that we have to suffer and experience in Charlotte. Stop it with the 4 & 5 star reviews. This place isn't even close...

WpNOgzReMDQbZSWk8PKUxg.text: A wide ranging menu from pulled meats, to "burnt ends" to ribs and chicken.  Overall, food was good and service was friendly and prompt; has a bit of a family feel to it from the vintage style dishes and the community atmosphere in the place.  Been here a few times and been pleased each time - the brisket is a favorite as it has the best flavor and texture; other cuts can be dry on occasion.

LBoitf6LKPk9k-Vpe47cyg.text: I tried this place last night, at the request of some friends visiting for the holidays. For one of them, it was their first NC BBQ experience and that makes me sad because this place leaves a lot to be desired.   First, they were out of three of the menu items we tried to order, one of which was ribs. How does that happen!? It was pretty busy, and this place seems to have a following, so maaaayyyyybe that's why. Still, it's a bummer to have your heart set on ribs when going to a smokehouse, only to find out they have none.  Second, since they were out of ribs, they offered to sub an item in their "well-fed" menu option FOR AN UP CHARGE. If you run out of an advertised item, and offer to substitute, don't follow that offer with a price tag.   Third, the food we ordered was bad. Plain and simple. The pulled pork and chicken were dry; the baked beans were more shredded meat than beans; the smoked veggies were flavorless and cold; and the coleslaw... well, that was actually pretty good. Our food also came with a side of hush puppies and "pickled" onions, both of which aren't even worth mentioning, really.   Fourth, the service was mixed. The hostess was super friendly, and we were seated fairly quick, despite a crowd. Or waiter wasn't exactly rude, but he also wasn't very good at his job. A few questions about their drink menu were answered with a very blunt "I have no idea" with absolutely zero effort to find an answer that was actually helpful. He checked in frequently enough, and was friendly-ish, so I guess that counts for something.   I walked out of this place feeling so confused. How can it be rated so high!? Did I catch them on an off night? Is it resting on its laurels vs it's actual abilities? Has no one who has eaten here ever eaten BBQ anywhere else, and therefore has no idea that this place is mediocre, at best? I really hate to give such a bad review to a Charlotte eatery, especially when I'm clearly in the minority by doing so. But I can't, in good-Yelping-faith, say otherwise.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Well-fed platter. The coleslaw was the highlight of the meal, which should tell you all you need to know.

yoz8nV5ci63Fce-yUmmLew.text: Oh my god. A carnivore's heaven and True southern BBQ jackpot not to be missed. It's places like this that make me certain I can never become a vegetarian. And I have no regrets.   Highlights:  Smoked wings (dry with sauces on the side) - they're sized like nuggets but are so tender and packed with flavors. Possibly one of the best tasting wings I've ever had - would come back just for these apps.   Pig Out platter - the bigger version of the combo platter that gives you 6oz each of 4 different proteins plus 2 sides. We had the mixed brisket (MUST GET), sausages (good but paled in comparison), ribs (delicious), and substituted our 4th protein with the burnt tips (YUM). Our favorites were definitely the briskets, which were incredibly flavored and so juicy and tender. I recommend getting the fatty ones (more marbling and tender). The baked beans were surprisingly tasty as well. Would've loved some sort of carbs to soak up all the sauces.   It doesn't look much, but the pig out platter is pure meat and enough to share among 3-4. Needless to say, we had more than half of it boxed to go.   Service was prompt and representative of southern hospitality. All in all a shack-less but amazing BBQ joint without pretense - a must stop.  Tip: Work out before coming if you're looking to make gains. It wasn't until near the end of the meal did I realize I had not consumed a single piece of greens throughout the meal. And I'm perfectly fine with that.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked wings (dry) are the bomb. &amp; the Pig Out platter with baked beans &amp; hushpuppies and subbed burnt ends for $2. AMAZING

-qsrOfVNrWtH-3A81j0HPg.text: We've had almost everything on the menu and like it all but the wings are probably our favorite. The brisket grilled cheese is a must try. The sausage is really good. Drinks are on point, esp the bloody Mary's. Brunch is great. Service is always great.

jv07xoGZAEe1sdfn2HFu7Q.text: Good BBQ but I can get better BBQ in LA.  That's embarrassing.  They were out of ribs but the employees were super nice and friendly.  Just sucks that the BBQ food here is mediocre and reminds me of a fast food chain.  Won't be back except for the collard greens maybe.

l1Yo8c1RWTCQ5xx3SLSn6Q.text: There are many BBQ places in the area, but what stood out to me was the burnt ends on the menu.  The beef burnt ends were so tender, with the right balance of salty and sweet.  My husband had the combo plate and said he has never had ribs so meaty.  This place is kid friendly, the waiter was so friendly and attentive.

F0m_JaQyiKR3XDp4dwpiXg.text: Loved it. Everything ordered at the table  was top notch   Personally, I got the Brisket Burger, and it was perfect.

K1-XgX0cZl13fDxyOzri8A.text: I got well fed which consisted of 4 proteins and 2 sides. I chose the ribs, chopped pork, chopped chicken, and pork burnt ends. The ribs were pretty good. They could have been more tender but not bad. The chopped pork and chopped chicken were awesome. The pork burnt ends were really good... For my 2 sides I chose the collard greens and bacon wrapped jalapenos.. The collard greens were ok. The jalapenos were good. My server Parker was amazing! He was on top of everything even though he had a larger party and other tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

IaVhgpBTE_YMg7au7YLKIg.text: Rarely do I give a place 5 stars. This place however, at 9:30 pm, still was serving amazing fresh food. I mean I deliberately asked for a salad and just to see how fresh everything was going to be, also asked for the beef brisket. Being that I have not eaten any red meat in about 6 months, this was breaking my own rules. But, I had to know. How was it you asked? Amazing! Simply succulent and as sweet as it could be. There are many places that give you this rushed and dried out barbecued meats... this place won't do that. They have somehow, perfected the art.

z-F6YmWjALTQomb1HszNgg.text: What can I say about Midwood Smokehouse? This place is awesome. It has good food great service and the atmosphere is just so relaxed. Sometimes the music is played a little loud but that is because of all the people that are there so if there was anything that I could change it would be the volume of the place. Great food overall definitely come back to this place time and time again.

rjxHA7gBzlyrHIx_O2PqVQ.text: I recently moved from Texas to North Carolina, and I have been on the hunt in Charlotte for a good barbecue spot. Midwood Smokehouse was almost unanimously recommended to me by everyone I asked. It took me awhile to visit, however, because my friend had a poor experience-- he had food poisoning following a visit to Midwood.    I finally decided to try it out when my parents came to visit last month, and we all loved it. Everything was great, and that is saying a lot because we are particular about our barbecue!   Great drinks, great food, fun atmosphere!   Needless to say, I was really looking forward to my second visit when my SO came into town. The second time around, Midwood was very packed. We waited an hour, and the meal ended up being very disappointing. The meat was dry and the service was lackluster. To top it off, the next day we were both sick!  So disappointing! Definitely won't be going out of my way to return.

aAgw5r5zL7_7Uv9MfJB_Rg.text: Delicious! While in town for a wedding, we went on a journey to find Charlotte's best NC style BBQ. Midwood came through in a big way! The hush puppies are spot-on and the bacon wrapped Jalapenos were perfect. I loved the ribs and liked the pulled pork. Burnt ends were incredible! They keep it simple and do it right.

Tn_wECVYrwRreqWzh4lCBA.text: As a North Carolina native and a lover for all things barbecue this place has to be my favorite in charlotte!  I am picky about my barbecue y'all but always willing to try somewhere new! This place did not disappoint!! First time I came I had the pulled pork platter with macaroni and cheese and the baked beans! It was perfect! Ya'll those beans are life, not some cheap stuff out of a can, it has pulled pork in it! Yes please. The barbecue didn't even need any sauce(though their selection of sauces were great!). Also, the plates come with a little bit of onions on the side...EAT THESE! I am not an onion girl, but these were made from a flavor God!  They have specials on certain days that might run out so be aware of that( we got the last dinosaur size rib one day and jumped for joy). Definitely a place a bring all my none NC family and friends when they come in town.

mBSOKDZTrBAVTiQ86R_xOw.text: Super local barbecue joint. Great selection of local beers and bourbon. Food was out of this world. I had the burnt ends which were awesome. My friends had the brisket and smoked sausage and all raved about their meals. Service was relaxed but attentive. We even got a tour of the smokers. Not a white linen place but it was friendly and relaxed place to hangout, enjoy great food and a beer/bourbon or two!

2GF89yWW79aYqdmsHkK0vg.text: DISCLAIMER: I'm from Texas, where BBQ is a religion. This heavily influences my review.    The BBQ here is actually quite good.  I ordered burnt ends, which I haven't found yet at any BBQ joint. They were quite good, but came six to an order, with a side and a few hush puppies for $12.50.  I'd estimate, you are getting 6 oz. of brisket for that price, which is insane.  I could buy 6 oz. of filet minion for less.   BBQ naturally uses cheaper cuts of meat..which is why they long cooking process. It should be cheap and quick and plentiful.  This was none of that.  I waited for nearly a half hour, which was made a bearable thanks to a large selection of draft beer.   Since many of the N. Carolina BBQ restaurants I've been to offer signature Mac-n-cheese, I ordered that as my side.  Just like every other N. Carolina BBQ restaurant whose Mac-n-cheese I've eaten, this is nothing special.   Hush puppies here are actually better than anywhere else I've had them in N. Carolina.  In Texas, you only get hush puppies with sea food, but here they are served with everything.  Generally, they are bland and frozen...but I think these are fresh.  I don't know why more places don't make their hush puppies fresh, since corn bread batter is probably the cheapest and easiest thing to fry.  Another big plus for offering one of my favorite things in the entire world, bacon-wrapped jalapeno.  Where I come from, these are a staple of any cookout, but rare to find in a restaurant.    I will go back to Midwood Smokehouse, but I doubt I become a regular.

hvPojDPa6vFlf5U-QLoDXg.text: Was awesome, pork was perfectly cooked, tasty, loved the wings nice and smoked and the chicken was perfect inside. Great beers on tap , classic !

EYjUS7AU_4-iE8tKC-okcA.text: I have previously reviewed this place, but I returned again and I tried the Pecan Cobbler.    It was a religious experience... the Pecan Cobbler is the kind of thing that wars could be fought over.   It was perhaps the BEST dessert that I have EVER had in my life.  I don't want to over play it, but it was served warm with a scoop of really good ice cream.     GET THE PECAN COBBLER!   What helps is that you eat all of this salty BBQ food and then finish it with a sweet cobbler.   Epic experience.

lqOCA-wUtToFOlgeT17BMg.text: Excellent food, great staff!  Was disappointed with a meal at another area BBQ restaurant. Midtown more than made up for it!  Sausage was decent. Pulled pork was flavorful and moist. I enjoyed the collard greens, although being a Northerner, I'm never really sure what these should taste like.   Baked beans were fantastic. (I am a literal baked bean expert, so I do not say such things lightly.). Beans were cooked properly, not soft or mushy, and tasted great in the spicy sauce.   Ribs were excellent. Tender and sweetly sauced.   Brisket was melt in your mouth tender. Server even asked if I wanted the lean or marbled portion. I took the marbled, and it tasted great. Bark was very spicy, which suited me fine, but may be a bit much for some.   Doubt I'll ever be in Charlotte again, but if I am, I'll be coming back here!

3upribZHg2JKboYk448Q9Q.text: Huffington Post wrote an article of 15 reasons why Charlotte is the weirdest and #13 was the city's reaction to Michelle Obama's compliment to their BBQ. Charlotte said, "Our BBQ is just okay". And that's exactly how I felt about my pulled pork. Not much flavor, it just existed. I didn't see any big deal for the hush puppies either, are they supposed to be dry? The winners of the night were definitely the collard greens and bacon wrapped jalapenos. Our server was friendly and the ambience was chill, we sat outside in their covered space.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. If you&#39;re gonna order something, this better be it. Bacon wrapped jalapeños!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork, collard greens, and a few hush puppies.

6s9gk0gO5YUWfGb6xZlY8Q.text: Holy cow. Burnt ends and BBQ baked beans will absolutely set you free. Only giving 4 stars because some of the meat was a little dry. But overall, this is some DELICIOUS food. I'm here on business, and will absolutely come here again the next time in town. Keisha was my server, and she was the bomb! So friendly and helpful.  Go here y'all!

H4gx9tC404qfgOKPwpUzOg.text: Pretty good BBQ, I enjoy the brisket.

BYAb_bdsn3MXhuG7G7DMug.text: Food coma abound!  I did not eat in the restaurant as it was packed when I had visited. But I got the combo platter and tried all the smoked meats minus the chicken. I got collard greens and fries as the sides. I didn't touch the fries since I had been too full.  The sausage, ribs, and briskets were delicious. I liked the carolina pulled pork, but slightly more salty for my taste.  I would love to return and try other things on the menu, but alas....this NYCer gotta eat as much BBQs as possible during his short time in Charlotte.

F24aN0uwmY3Id0VZ4C-t4A.text: Incredible food. Got the burnt ends with bacon wrapped jalapeno and it was some of the best bbq I've ever had. My only regret is getting small instead of large.

gmozO9qvSF9JQ0e7SVW5NA.text: Visited Charlotte back in June, my favorite meal of the weekend and I had some pretty good ones. The brisket entree I had was fantastic

IYvDHnxD5HQZzSfB4i9aCw.text: Heard a lot about this place. When.you walk in the smell is heavenly. The brisket is good try the moist or the burnt ends. The sides collards and Mac n cheese very good. Hush puppies were great! The beer tap was not working out of CO2  that night.  But they carry several local beers to chose from. Good food overall.

8JRpsniSna-3qAKJ9tnApg.text: recommended by a True bbq lover, we stopped in for dinner recently on a tuesday night. they were so nice, offered us a tour of their smoker when we finished dining, clearly realizing that we werent from the area. we came and had the brisket, burnt ends, sausage, ribs, chicken, avocado salad - and were not disappointed. they were so hospitable the entire time, checking in on us occassioally. we opted to dine out right by the entrance since it was a really nice evening. started to regret it as the meal ended as we all started to feel like we were being attacked by mosquitoes, although we didnt actually see any. definitely glad we chose to come here versus the bbq near our hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. ribs!

AdhQZmXphoUWUxmyvWwPuQ.text: Honestly not as good as the stars say. The atmosphere is okay. Loud and a long wait. I got the brisket with both fatty and lean pieces but I swear there wasn't much meat, mostly fat. Mac and cheese was thick and nothing special. Its safe to say the hush puppies were my favorite part of the meal.

NS6DcICAacSBF_e9jQgi3A.text: YESSSSSSSS SIR'EEEEE!  This place is fantastic. Our server, Doc, was great. He gave some really good recommendations and was chill but attentive.   There is a great selection of local brews that we enjoyed. He tried the smoked chicken wings with the fat tire sauce and ranch (such good sauces!) and it was sooo good. Meat was so tender, juicy and flavorful. We were about to get the queso with the pulled pork because it sounded also delicious, but the waiter recommended this because it was more of a speciality.   I got the pulled pork sandwich so I could try some genuine Carolina BBQ, and the waiter suggested the creamed corn saying it was the best he's ever had. Well of course I had to try it! It was definitely delicious. I will say it is more on the liquidy side as opposed to being creamy per say, but I don't want to say "watery" because that implies a lack of flavor, which it definitely not the case.   My husband got the cheeseburger that had the pulled pork on it, and it was also very delicious. Some SERIOUSLY GOOD EATS!!   Plus they have corn hole to play outside, neat decor, and awesome murals in the back of the restaurant building!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Got the pulled pork sammich, yummy creamed corn and delish apple/coleslaw that&#39;s vinegar based-- mmmhmmm!

0904F-5ttL8Pl37cTniRgg.text: OMG!!!! I can NOT believe what I just witnessed at this location. I was waiting for my take out order to be completed and I happened to look over and witness one of their server's take a shot of whiskey or tequila which ok none of my business but apparently that wasn't enough for her alcoholic ass  so she proceeds to open up a straw and stick it in her table's drink and pull it out to taste, now luckily she did not go back in for seconds, but nonetheless, she was blatantly stealing from the restaurant which btw ends up costing you and I because that loss has to be made up. But this was at their bar counter on the backside in plain site so my deepest concern is what is she doing in the back as she goes back there to grab our food. I'm going to go out on a limb and say she's taste tested some of our food along with our drinks. The most troublesome thing is not knowing whether she has hepatitis or herpes, or anything we as customers can contract from her nasty habits. It is of the upmost importance that we all done in a safe and clean establishment and are not put at risk because Erik the manager felt a warning would be sufficient with dealing with, theft since she didn't pay for the drink and if she did why is she drinking on the job? I'm sure ABC would like to know how they are working within the limits of the law when it comes to drinking on the job.

OcLqal-3MeGy5pmT9sf_gQ.text: Outstanding!  The pulled chicken is AMAZING!!!!   They have numerous sides to choose from, but you can't go wrong with the Mac & Cheese.  My fiance loved the pulled pork and ribs.  The best option is to get the choose four platter so that you can get a little taste of all their meats.  Make sure you save some room for dessert....the banana pudding was one of the best I have ever tasted, I literally ate it all with 2-3 minutes.  Reasonably priced and I will definitely be back soon.
